paragraph: Oxygen (O2) is the most common monomer form of oxygen, accounting for about 21% of the body mass in air, is gaseous under standard conditions, is not soluble in water, has a slightly higher density than air, and has a density of 1.429 g/L. Non-flammable, flammable. Oxygen was first discovered by Carl Wilhelm Scheler, and was later successfully discovered by Joseph Priestley, but because of Joseph Priestley's first paper, many people still believe that oxygen was Joseph Priestley's first discovery.

The asteroid belt is a dense region of asteroids in the Solar System between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter. Of the 120,437 asteroids that have been numbered, 98.5% have been found here. Asteroids are small bodies composed of rock or metal that orbit the Sun. As this is the most densely populated region of asteroids in the Solar System, estimated to be as many as 500,000, this region is called the main asteroid belt, or "main belt". The asteroid belt is formed by a group of stars in the primordial solar nebula—the forerunner of planets smaller than Jupiter. Jupiter's massive gravity blocks these stars from forming planets, causing high-energy collisions between many of them, causing many debris and fragments. The asteroid's orbit around the Sun continues to be perturbed by Jupiter, forming an orbital resonance with Jupiter. At these orbital distances (i.e. the Kirkwood Gap), asteroids are quickly swept into other orbits.

After the Second Guangdong-Guangxi War, the Guangdong army was defeated, and Li's command was taken over by Chen Jiongming:109. In October 1923, Li joined the Kuomintang with Huang Shaoxing and Bai Mystery, former students of the former province. On May 23, 1924, Li issued the Declaration of Unification of Guangxi, adopting the strategy of collusion and tyranny. The merger of the Guangdong and Jiangsu armies was called the Jiangsu-Guangdong Joint Force, with Li as commander-in-chief, Huang Shaoxing as deputy commander-in-chief, Bai Mystery as chief of staff, Huang Xu as first deputy chief of staff (112-113). In the summer of 1925, it defeated Lu Yongting, Shen Hongying, and unified Guangxi. During the war between Li and the province's last strongest enemy, Shen Hongying, Sun Yat-sen fell ill in Beijing. The Yunnan warlord Tang Jiyao flew to contact the Guangdong warlords Chen Jiongming, Deng Ben Yin, Liu Zhenhua, and other attempts to enter Guangdong in the east, eliminating the newly formed Kuomintang. Tang offered Li a loan of seven million yuan, but Li rejected it.

A hatnote (or footnote) is a short annotation placed at the top of a page, usually to provide a link to a similarly named topic or to a disclaimer page. For more information on how to write a disclaimer, see Wikipedia:Disclaimer. In most cases, a hatnote should be created using as many standard disclaimer templates as possible (as shown below). This allows the form and structure of the annotation to change consistently over time. When using a template, the horizontal separator does not need to be placed at the bottom of a particular annotation, or at the end of a list of annotations. Some hatnote disclaimer templates include a section summarizing the topic of the article, while some do not. For example, in a Honey article, you can use the {{about}} template: Both styles are acceptable, the style used in the article depends on the choice of the editor, and whether it is clearer and easier for the reader.

On her way back to England, Pandora ran aground on the Great Barrier Reef, killing 31 sailors and four prisoners from Bondi. The ten surviving prisoners arrived in Britain in June 1792. They were tried by military courts: four were acquitted, three were pardoned, and three were hanged. It was not until 1808 that the American ship Topaz landed in the Pitcairn Islands that Christian and others were discovered accidentally, with only one mutineer, John Adams, still alive, and other sympathizers (including Christian) killed either by one another or by their Polynesian companions.

In May of the following year, the Faculty of Philosophy, Chinese Literature, Oriental Languages (including Russian, Japanese and Korean three groups), English, French, German, History, Geography, Newspapers, Art, Music, Drama, Sports, Domestic Policy, Architecture and Urban Design were established. In September, four departments such as Night Administration, Social Work, Public Communication and Commerce were established and enrolled, hence the name "China Culture College." In 1980, the university was reorganized. After the founder of the Faculty of Philosophy, the original name of the university was changed to "East China University." Later, President Chiang Kai-shek considered "East China" to be the geographical view of Europe and America, and suggested that the name of the university be changed to "China Culture."

Scholars of Islam and the Byzantine Empire added Western doctrines, and their accumulation of ancient Greek and Roman texts fuelled the Renaissance. Peter the Great of Russia brought the idea of the West back to Russia in France, making Russia part of the West. Today, Western modern usage includes societies in Western and Central Europe, as well as their closely related genealogies, languages and philosophical descendants, especially those countries that derive their ethnic identity and mainstream culture from European culture. "The Western world" cannot be regarded as an objectively unified aggregate. Moreover, the so-called "Western world" by any definition also varies over time. The narrow definition of Western civilized nations includes at least most of the member states of the European Union and NATO, as well as Australia and New Zealand in Oceania, and the three South American cone countries (Argentina, Chile and Uruguay).

Shaanxi Longshan culture, also known as Qingzhou Zhuang II culture, is mainly distributed in the Jinhe and Weihe river basins of Shaanxi. The type of Longshan culture pottery temple, represented by the site of Xiangfen pottery temple in Shanxi, is mainly distributed in the southwestern part of Jin. Black pottery is an outstanding feature of Longshan culture, is a fundamental characteristic of Yangshao culture. Black pottery of Longshan culture is a pottery making technique that emerged after the colored pottery of Yangshao culture. Black pottery originated from people's living utensils, and later because it is too thin, easy to be insecure and fractured gradually out of everyday life. Today, black pottery is appreciated as an artwork. Black pottery of Longshan culture is particularly famous, its style is black shining pottery lacquer, the walls are thin as an eggshell, it is said that some of the mouthpieces are only 0.2 mm thin, so it is also called eggshell black pottery. Economic life is mainly based on agriculture, there is a relatively developed livestock farming. At the same time, divination and other witchcraft activities are more prevalent.

Crystallography, also known as crystallography, is an experimental science aimed at determining the arrangement of atoms (or ions) in a solid. "The term 'crystallography' originally referred only to the study of the properties of various crystals, but its meaning has been greatly expanded as understanding of the microscopic scale has deepened. Prior to the introduction of X-ray diffraction crystallography (discussed below), the study of crystals was mainly focused on the geometry of the dot matrix of crystals, including the measurement of the angles between each surface and the theoretical reference coordinate system (crystal coordinate axis) and the establishment of symmetrical relationships between the crystals. The measurement of the angles is accomplished by an angler. The positions of each surface in three-dimensional space are represented by their projection points (generally referred to as projection poles) on a three-dimensional sphere coordinate 'network'. The coordinate nets are also divided into Wolff nets and Lambert nets according to different approaches.

Albert Coady Wedemeyer (July 9, 1897 – December 17, 1989) was an American soldier who served in East Asia during World War II. In late 1944, he was appointed Chief of Staff of the Allied Chinese Theater of Operations and Commander of the U.S. Army in China; he served until March 1946. In 1947, he was appointed Special Envoy to China for Investigations. During the Cold War, Wedemeyer was a major supporter of Berlin Air Transport. He was born on July 9, 1897, in Omaha, Nebraska. He was of German descent, and his grandfather immigrated to the United States in 1830. His father was General Stanley Dunbar Embick.

"Song Book and State County Chronicle" also says only: "Shangcheng Decree, the former Han no, the latter Han have ".The same as the "Research of Literature".Old Zhi Jigon County began in the sixth year of Jian'an, do not know what is the basis?When re-examined. "This year's Shuzhi examined this issue, according to "the former Han no, the latter Han have", "the latter Han Book and County Chronicle" the domain was limited to Yonghe five years (AD 140), when the seven counties of Nanhai County already had Shangcheng County, participated in the study of the history, geographical experts believe: Shangcheng Jian County is the latest to Yonghe five years. Jin and Southern Dynasties Song, Zhijiang, Shangcheng County belongs to Guangzhou Nanhai County. Song Yuan Jia, Shangcheng Sui Fu River basin and the west area of Suining County, Liang Dynasty also re-annexed to Shangcheng County. Liang and Chen two dynasties moved Dongguan County to Shangcheng. Sui Jian nine years (AD 589) to withdraw county change state, Shangcheng County belongs to Guangzhou. Renshou Year (AD 601) Guangzhou changed name Banzhou, Shangcheng County belongs to Banzhou.

In early September 1958, the Beijing Planning Bureau made a plan for the site of the People's Congress Hall, and determined that the People's Congress Hall and the Museum of Revolutionary History would be located on both sides of Tiananmen Square. At the same time, designers from all over the country were invited to Beijing to participate in the design work of the Ten Great Buildings. After the multi-wheeled plan was carried out, concerning the layout of Tiananmen Square, the Communist Party of China's Beijing Municipal Committee convened a meeting to determine the width of Tiananmen Square from east to west of 500 meters, and the height of the hall could exceed the Tiananmen Square in accordance with the principle of "Under the rule of the people."

Taiwan, also known as Formosa in the West, is an island in East Asia and the Pacific Northwest, located between the Ryukyu Islands and the Philippines Islands, the Taiwan Strait is separated from mainland China, and the surrounding area is surrounded by the Pacific Ocean (Philippine Sea), the Bay of Biscay, the South China Sea, the Taiwan Strait, and the East Sea in clockwise order from 3 o'clock in the direction of the clock. It is the archipelago that surrounds the East Asian islands. The area of about 36,000 square kilometers, it is the 38th largest island in the world, seven of which are mountains and hills, the flat principle is mainly concentrated in the western coast, the topography varies greatly. Because the North Tropical Line penetrates, the climate is between tropical and subtropical zones, the North Tropical Line to the north is subtropical monsoon climate, to the south is tropical monsoon climate, the natural landscape and ecosystem resources are quite rich and diverse.

In 1898, when the American China Development Company was undertaking the construction of Cantonese Railway, it was discovered that the area along the line from Guangzhou to Sanshui was flat, located in the Pearl River Delta village of Uomi, and the investment in the construction of the railway was small and profitable, so it proposed the proposal to build the Cantonese Railway Province Foshan Road first, with the support of the Manchurian government, was the predecessor of the Cantonese Railway. The line from the southern shore of the Pearl River, Guangdong Shek Wai Tong, through Sanshui Bridge, Foshan, Xiaotang to Sanshui, was built in two sections before and after. In December 1901, the construction of the Guangzhou Shek Wai Tong to Foshan section of the Cantonese Railway Province Foshan Road began, 16.5 km long, was the earliest double-track railway in China, this was the beginning of the construction of railways in Guangdong and Guangzhou.

On August 3, 2005, the Presidential Guard declared the establishment of a "Democracy and Justice Military Commission" while President Taya was absent from the country. On June 25, 2006, Mauritania held a referendum on amending the constitutional provisions to ensure the smooth transition of the country's regime. On August 6, 2008, a military coup occurred in Mauritania, in which President Abdullahi and Prime Minister Wahid were detained west of the Atlantic Ocean, east of the border with Mali, south of the border with Senegal, north of the border with Morocco, and east of the border with Algeria. Mauritania was originally a French colony with an area of 103 million square kilometres. In 1988, Mauritania declared 12 nautical miles of territorial waters and 200 nautical miles of exclusive economic zones.

The Ramsar Convention on Wetlands (also known as the Convention of Wetlands of International Importance Especially as Waterfowl Habitats) is a global intergovernmental convention for the protection of wetlands. The purpose of the Convention is to protect and rationally use wetlands through national action and international cooperation. The Convention was signed in Ramsar, Iran, on 2 February 1971, by 18 signatory states. The Convention entered into force on 21 December 1975.

In 1957, the Education Department of the provincial government decided to reorganize the branch into the "Taipei Five Provinces Central Taoyuan Joint Branch" and look for a new location. At that time, Mr. Pan Zhenwu, the headmaster of the successful secondary school, sent Mr. Zhang Lianfeng to Taoyuan to oversee the construction of the new school district, and assumed Mr. Pan Zhenwu as the chairman of the construction committee. After some consultations, it was decided to build six classrooms totaling 12 rooms, one office totaling 21 rooms, a single dormitory, and family quarters on the site of today's Wuling, with the assistance of $5 million from the Education Department, Taoyuan County Government, and Taoyuan Town Hall.

National Changhua Senior High School (CHSH) is a public secondary school in Taiwan. It was founded on April 27, 1942 as a four-year integrated system, with Taiwanese students as the majority. It was the first to borrow classrooms from the Futian Branch School of the Changhua City Asahi Public School (now the Peace National Primary School). It was reorganized as a full secondary school under the "three-three system". It was implemented in 1968 in conjunction with nine years of national education, and the junior high school division was closed each year, and in 1970 it was reorganized as the "Taiwan Provincial Changhua Senior High School".

The Second Sudanese Civil War broke out in 1983, until the signing of the Comprehensive Peace Treaty in 2005, which established the Southern Autonomous Government of Sudan. In 2011, the independence referendum of South Sudan was passed by 98.83 percent, the Republic of South Sudan declared independence on 9 July 2011 at 0 a.m., 30 heads of state or government representatives attended the independence ceremony of the Republic of South Sudan, United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon also attended the inauguration ceremony. On 14 July 2011, the Republic of South Sudan formally joined the United Nations as a member of the United Nations. Currently, it is also a member of the African Union, the East African Community and other organizations. In July 2012, the Geneva Convention was signed. After independence, there are still fierce internal conflicts in South Sudan, and since 2014, the rating on the Vulnerable Countries Index (formerly known as the Failed Countries Index) has been the highest in the world.

National Highway 3 runs from the north to the south, in sequence through Keelung City, New Taipei City, Taipei City, Taoyuan City, Hsinchu City, Hsinchu, Miaoli County, Taichung City, Changhua City, Nantou County, Yunlin County, Chiayi County, Chiayi City, Taichung City, Kaohsiung City, and Pingtung County. Due to the problem of land acquisition at the time of construction of the section, between Taichung City and Changhua City, National Highway 3, which was originally supposed to run north-south, is exceptionally oriented east-west, from the south to the north first through Changhua Fenyuan Village. Compared to Zhongshan Heights, the original plan was to link the major cities on the west coast of Taiwan, taking into account the balance of regional development, the cost of land acquisition and avoiding the blockage caused by short commuter traffic near the city, the selection of National Highway 3 deliberately avoids some densely populated metropolitan areas and passes through many formerly low-developed rural areas. From the north, National Highway 3 intersects with National Highway 1 (Zhongshan Expressway), Shioding System Interchange Road (Shioding District, New Taipei City), Hsinchu System Interchange Road (Hsinchu Baoshan Village) and Changhua System Interchange Road (Chanhua City) respectively, where the Shioding to Hsinchu section runs through more inland mountainous villages, Hsinchu to Changhua is through the Binhai area, and the section south of Changhua runs along the mountains, until the southern edge of the forest is taken parallel to Zhongshan Heights. Compared to the originally straight-line plan, National Highway 3, due to its adaptation to the terrain and avoiding the already very dense population of the city, the route detour is more obvious, the route crosses uneven terrain in the way of a large number of overhead bridges and tunnels along the way, the engineering difficulty is much higher than National Highway 1, the total length of the entire route is 15 tunnels, nine of which are clustered in the mountains south of the Taipei Basin, the longest tunnel along the route is 1,875 meters long wooden stockade tunnel.

On the other hand, in the Diary of Chiang Kai-shek, he denied that he was the illegitimate son of his deceased friend Wang Jichun, and claimed that he was the illegitimate son of Wang Jichun and his younger brother, Zhang Yao, who only took care of the descendants of Wang Jichun. Zhang Yao died in August 1942, and was presumably murdered. Zhang Yao's younger brother, Zhang Yao, and his wife, Kichen, adopted Zhang Yao. Zhang Yao's uncle and aunt were registered in official documents as the birth parents of the two brothers. During the Chinese Civil War, the two brothers moved to Hsinchu, Taiwan with their maternal grandmother, Zhou Jinhua. Zhang Yao's maternal grandmother, Zhang Yao's uncle (Zhang Yao), and Zhang Yao's maternal aunt (Zhang Xianfeng) continued to adopt Zhang Yao. Zhang Yao graduated from Taiwan Provincial Hsinchu Secondary School (now National Hsinchu Senior Secondary School) in 1960, and was a fellow student of Xu Xinliang Secondary School in 1959. Later, the two brothers attended Dongwu University at the same time. At the end of 1960, at the age of 18, the two brothers learned that their grandfather was Chiang Kai-shek and Chiang Kai-shek was their father.

In 1960, he was elected President of the United States, becoming the first Catholic President of the United States. Major events in his tenure included: attempts to abolish the Federal Reserve System, the Gulf of Pigs incident, the Cuban Missile Crisis, the establishment of the Berlin Wall, the Space Race, the Vietnam War, and the African-American People's Rights Movement. Due to the subdued response during the height of the Cuban Missile Crisis, and the full support for the Space Race after the Soviets entered space, his policies later led the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to successfully achieve the Apollo moon project.

Guangzhou is located in southern China, southeastern Guangdong Province, the northern edge of the Pearl River Delta, is the confluence of the West River, the North River, the East River and the Three Rivers, bordering the South China Sea. Guangzhou Donglian Dongguan City and Huizhou City Boro, Longmen two counties, the west adjacent to Foshan City Sanshui, the South China Sea and Shunde three districts, the north adjacent to the urban areas of Qingyuan City and Fugang County and Shaoguan City Xinfeng County, the south adjacent to Zhongshan City, adjacent to Hong Kong and Macau Special Administrative Region. Guangzhou is a central city in the Pan-Pearl River Delta Economic Zone and Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Great Bay Area, as well as a hub city of the Belt and Road Initiative, renowned as China's "South Gate" to the world. Guangzhou has been ranked as an Alpha-level world first-line city by GaWC's International List of Large Cities, ranked 5th in the Greater China Region in 2018, ranked 27th globally. According to the United Nations' 2016 Report on Sustainable Development of Chinese Cities, Guangzhou's Human Development Index ranks first among 35 major cities on the Chinese mainland.

In principle, the emperor is the supreme ruler of the empire, and the empress is the head of all the emperor's wives and concubines, the head of the imperial palace, has the power to control and administer all the royal and noble women, even the representation of maternity and women's customs in the empire. The emperor does not necessarily appoint the empress, for example, several emperors in the middle to late Tang Dynasty did not appoint the empress, only the queen was chased after death as the empress, or became the queen consort after the death of her husband. The queen, first in China's Xia Dynasty, was the name of the pre-existing monarch, such as Hou Yi, Hou Ji, etc., the monarch changed to the name of the emperor after death; as for the royal consort to be called the queen, the kanji began to be used only in the Zhou Dynasty. From the beginning of the Shang Dynasty, the monarch called the king before his birth, the emperor after his death, the original queen was transferred to the name of the royal consort, called the queen, and the queen was also transferred to the name of the royal consort.

National Penghu University of Science and Technology (NPUT) is the first university of science and technology in remote areas of Taiwan. It is located in Ma Kung City, Penghu County, Taiwan. It was renamed National Penghu University of Science and Technology (NPUT) in 2005. It is the first university of science and technology in Taiwan to have a wind turbine park, and established an international small and medium-sized wind turbine test center. It cooperates with government agencies such as the Ministry of Education and many industries to test wind farms. Its solar and wind power generation accounts for about 10% of the total school's electricity consumption. The goal is to create a green school. In 1984, it was commissioned by the Republic of China's art teacher, Mr. Lam Su-gen, to design the NPIT in round and English characters.

Capitalism is an economic system based on the private ownership of the means of production and the act of seeking profit. The names often used to refer to capitalism include: In Latin, capital is derived from the sale and occupation of animals; capitalis is derived from the Proto-Indo-European kaput—meaning "head"; "head" was a way of measuring wealth in ancient Europe: the more "head" a person has, the richer the person is. "chattel" (meaning commodity, animal or slave) and "cattle" (meaning cattle) are also derived from kaput. By the 12th and 13th centuries, the word "capital" began to be used to describe funds, inventories, quantities of money, or the profits from money.

The life expectancy of wild dolphins ranges from 8 to 10 years. Dolphins are herbivorous, but sometimes solitary. Generally, dolphin populations range from 10 to 20, of which two to four are adult males, four to seven are adult females, and the remainder are pups. Dolphins are generally noisy and socialize through vocal communication. Dolphins reach sexual maturity at 1.5 years of age and weigh between 30 and 40 kilograms (66 and 88 pounds). The gestation period lasts between 130 and 150 days, and generally produces less than four pups, with actual numbers fluctuating between one and eight. On land, dolphins can run at a speed comparable to that of horses, are flexible in the water, and are excellent swimmers. To avoid predators, they can stay underwater for up to five minutes. Dolphins are not a threatened species. Dolphins have been the object of extensive human hunting.

He served as Prime Minister from 1975 to 1982. Following Ahtisaari's sudden resignation in 1982, he took over as President. From 1983 to 1984, he consolidated his presidential position in the power struggle. In the 1980s, he carried out some political reforms within the one-party system. In the early 1990s, under pressure, he accepted a multi-party system. In 1992, he barely won the presidential elections. He was re-elected in 1997, 2004, 2011 and 2018, respectively, with an absolute majority. Domestic opposition and Western countries claimed that illegal and fraudulent voting took place in these elections. His government, led by Cameroon, maintains good relations with Cameroon's former ruling power, France. Despite his active efforts at political reform, his government continues to face criticism of authoritarianism.

Italian (Italiano), also known as Italian or Italian for short, is an Indo-European language belonging to the Romance language family. It is spoken by 70 million people on a daily basis, most of whom live in Italy. Italian is spoken in 28 other countries, four of which have made it an official language. Standard Italian is derived from the Florentine dialect of Tuscany, spoken in the north-central part of Italy. Standard sounds have recently been added to the accents of the more economically developed Milan region. In the field of composition, it is also used as a number of Italian words. Italian, like Latin, has long consonants. Other Romance languages, such as Spanish and French, no longer have long consonants. Italian is the official language of Italy, San Marino, and one of the official languages of Switzerland, mainly concentrated in Ticino and Graubünden.

Taking the 1988 Olympic Games as an opportunity, the Lu Tai-Hu government actively pursued northern foreign policy, established diplomatic relations with Eastern Europe, the Soviet Union, China and other socialist-aligned countries, and improved relations with North Korea. South Korea is the founding country of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC). With the active support of the Lu Tai-Hu government, the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) was established in November 1989 in Canberra, Australia. In November 1995, during the reign of Kim Il-sung, Lu Tai-Hu was sentenced to life imprisonment for exposing hundreds of billions of Korean won secret funds, then sentenced to 17 years' imprisonment and a fine of 262.8 billion Korean won; on December 20, 1997, he was pardoned by Kim Il-sung on the recommendation of Kim Dae-jung. Lu Tai-Hu was born on December 4, 1932, to a peasant family in Xinlongri, the western village at the foot of the eight hills of Dacheong-gun, North Korea.

On April 12, 1927, Chiang Kai-shek launched the Fourteenth and Twelfth Incidents and began to crack down hard on the leftists and communists within the party. A large number of Communist Party leaders were arrested, imprisoned and executed. The Communist Party of China suffered a devastating blow to the party organization in the major cities of China, especially Shanghai. With the official dissolution of the Communist Party of China, the first cooperation with the Communist Party of China came to an end. In order to oppose Chiang Kai-shek, the Communist Party of China launched the Nanchang Uprising on August 1, 1927, and fired the first shots of armed resistance against the Kuomintang in 194922. As a result, an army under the direct control of the Communist Party of China was established. Subsequently, this army joined forces with those established in the Autumn Harvest Rebellion, etc., to establish bases. Since the forces of the Kuomintang were still completing the Northern Expeditionary War, and did not have time to take into account the military strength of the region, especially the south, the forces of the Communist Party of China were strengthened. At that time, Mao Zedong, who was the former secretary of the Hunan Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China, carried out the land revolution, confiscating the landlords' rights in exchange for the support of the peasants.

The Department of Chinese Language and Literature was established in 1955 when Taiwan Provincial Normal University was reorganized. The Department of Chinese Language and Literature was one of the five departments of the Department of Chinese Language and Literature. Initially, the Department of Chinese Language and Literature, apart from the University Department, had a specialized department of Chinese Language and Literature, a specialized department of Chinese Language and Literature at night, etc., and in 1971, the Department of Chinese Language and Literature was completely discontinued. In 1956, the Department of Chinese Language and Literature was established as a master's course of the Institute of Chinese Language and Literature, and in 1957, the Department of Chinese Language and Literature was established as a doctoral course of the Institute of Chinese Language and Literature. In 1991, due to the policy of the Taiwan Ministry of Education, the Department of Chinese Language and Literature was integrated with the Institute of Chinese Language and Literature. In the early days of the Department of Chinese Language and Literature, the academic direction of Chinese language and literature in Taiwan was spearheaded by acoustician Lin Yun and others. At that time, Lu Jianxiang, Gao Ming and others were appointed to teach in the Department of Chinese Language and Literature. Chen Xinxiang, Xu Xuhui, Qi Xusheng and others were all from the Department of Chinese Language and Literature.

Due to the development of aircraft, long-haul passenger regular shipping has been replaced by air transport. Short-haul and short-sea passenger regular shipping still exists. Freighters of a few shipping companies still carry out long-haul passenger services, but the living environment and time are often limited by vessels. Non-regular shipping is compared to regular shipping. Non-regular shipping is mainly used to transport bulk dry goods or oil, and has no fixed schedule or route. It differs from regular shipping in that it is determined on the basis of the needs of freight logistics movements. The use of waterways for international trade is subject to certain conditions. The environmental impact of shipping includes emissions of greenhouse gases, human noise disturbances to the environment and pollution caused by oil spills, etc. In 2020, according to the latest data from the French shipping consultancy Alphaliner, the top three global shipping companies are APM-Maersk, MSC and COSCO Group.

Walmart Inc. is an American multinational retailer and the world's largest retailer, headquartered in Bentonville, Arkansas, with more than two million employees. Walmart is a family-owned company, with the Walton family holding 48% of the company. Founded by Sam Walton in 1962, Walmart was incorporated on October 31, 1969. It was listed on the New York Stock Exchange in 1972. Walmart is also the largest food retailer in the United States. Net income in 2009 was $25.8 billion. Walmart has 8,500 stores in 15 countries around the world. Walmart operates in 50 states in the United States and in Puerto Rico. Walmex operates in Mexico, Asda operates in the United Kingdom, Seymour stores (including unbranded goods) in Japan, Massmart operates in several countries in Africa, and a joint venture with Bharti, India, for Best Price Modern Wholesale.

In addition, some untreated urban runoff leads pollutants into streams, causing problems with water quality. Nimrod is a computer specially developed for playing the Nimrod game, designed and manufactured by British engineering company and computer developer Fellini, and exhibited at the 1951 British Festival. Nimrod is 3.7 metres wide, 2.7 metres deep, and 1.5 metres high, designed by John MacPhail Bennett, engineer Raymond Stewart-Williams. The player has to press a button on the control panel, and the corresponding light bulb will light up on the machine, and then rotate to the computer. Calculation results of the machine will also be displayed by the light bulb.

On November 3, he wrote, "In life, you must be honest and generous, and you must serve the people, and you must not disgust them." On March 17, he wrote, "When I first came to Taiwan, everything was new." On August 26, he wrote, "Early in the morning and late in the afternoon, I read letters, and almost all of them asked for a job. When I left, several workers knelt on the ground, all of them workers at the Wuxi Railway Station, and asked me to solve their problems for them.

In 1978, the Constitution restored the provisions of the 1954 Constitution, but the 1982 Constitution remained unchanged. Although the 1954 Constitution and the 1978 Constitution provided for the Secretary-General, they did not provide for his functions and powers. In 1982, the Fifth Session of the Fifth National People's Congress adopted the amended Constitution of the People's Republic of China, which for the first time provided for the Secretary-General's functions and powers in the Constitution. Article 17 of the Organization Law of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China of 1954 provides that: "The Chairman, Deputy Chairman, Secretary-General and members of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress shall be elected by each session of the National People's Congress at its first session." Article 13 of the Organization Law of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China of 1982 provides that: "The nominees for the Chairman, Deputy Chairman, Secretary-General and members of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress shall be nominated by the Bureau, and after consultation with the delegations, the Bureau shall determine the official list of candidates on the basis of the opinion of the majority of the deputies."

On September 21, Mao Zedong delivered the opening speech: "We unite to overthrow the internal and external oppressors with the People's Liberation War and the People's Revolution, and proclaim the founding of the People's Republic of China." "The Chinese people, who make up a quarter of humanity, stand up from here." On September 22, the People's Daily published an editorial entitled "Old China is extinct, New China is born." On September 27, the General Assembly adopted the Law on the Organization of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference and the Law on the Organization of the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China. On September 27, the General Assembly adopted the Resolution on the Capital of the People's Republic of China, the Year of China, the National Anthem and the National Flag of the People's Republic of China. On September 29, the General Assembly adopted the Joint Programme of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference equivalent to the Provisional Constitution.

In the Constitution, he expanded executive and legislative powers, and he also wanted to expand control over the judiciary. Only at his request could the courts exercise unconstitutional review powers. His party, the Cameroon People's Democratic Movement, continues to dominate parliament by an absolute majority (153 out of 163 seats in the July 2007 parliamentary elections), laying the groundwork for passing laws that complied with his will. In 2009, Parade magazine ranked him 19th among the "Top 20 Dictatorships in the World" (archived at the Internet Archive). In November 2010, Cameroon writer Bertrand Teyou published a book chronicling his wife Chantal Biya's path from a poor civilian to the country's first lady.

The Republic of Cuba (Spanish: República de Cuba), commonly known as Cuba, is an island nation in the northern Caribbean Sea of the Americas, located between latitudes 19° and 24° N and longitudes 74° and 85° W. Located at the entrance to the Gulf of Mexico, it is separated from the Yucatán Strait to the west, from the Mexican Yucatán Peninsula to the south, from the Jamaican and Cayman Islands to the south, from the Republic of Haiti and the Dominican Republic to the east, from the Bahamas to the northeast, from the Strait of Florida to the United States, and the shortest land distance of about 145 km from the southernmost tip of Florida, Key West.

The Caribbean Sea (Spanish: Mar Caribe, French: Mer des Caraïbes, Dutch: Caraïbische Zee) is an area of the western tropical Atlantic Ocean, the western and southwestern portions of the Yucatán Peninsula of Mexico and Central America, the northern portions of the Greater Antilles, including Cuba, the eastern portions of the Lesser Antilles, and the southern portions of South America.

After the declaration of independence in 1809, after 16 years of war, the Republic was founded on August 6, 1825, named after the Latin American revolutionary Simon Bolivar. Bolivia has been plagued by dictatorship, political instability and poor economy. Bolivia was conquered by Spain at the end of the 15th century, and belonged to the Spanish Governorate of La Plata. During the Latin American War of Independence in the 19th century, Bolivia, at the time called "Up Peru", was liberated by Bolivar, a national hero from Caracas, Venezuela, and became independent in 1809, and was named Bolivia in honor of him. In 1825, it formally gained independence from Spain; since then, wars with neighboring countries have frequently occurred, thus losing nearly half of its territory, including: the Andes Mountains and coastal regions of present-day northern Chile, southern Brazil and northern Paraguay.

In 1811, Sir John Cradock, 1st Baron Howden, was appointed governor of the Cape Colony, when the Zulu prairie region was in turmoil and many white farmers began to abandon their farms. At the end of the 19th century, the British Kaffraria area between the Rivers Uo and Kei was ceded to the Bantu, hence the name Siske. Unlike other British colonies, the ownership of land by the Bantu remained unclear after the formation of the Confederation of South Africa in 1910.

Ji Yongping (Chinese: 連戰; pinyin: Yáng Ping; born August 27, 1936) is a Taiwanese politician who is a member of the Nationalist Party of China (NPC). He was born and raised in Xi'an City, Fujian Province. His grandfather is a Taiwanese historian Lian Yong, and his father is Lian Zhendong. He graduated from the University of Chicago with a Ph.D. and holds the following positions: Director of the Political Department of the National Taiwan University, Minister of Transportation of the Republic of China, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of China, Ambassador to El Salvador, Chairman of the Taiwan Provincial Government, Chairman of the Executive Council, Vice President of the Republic of China and Chairman of the Nationalist Party of China. He was the second Taiwanese person to hold the position of the Chairman of the Nationalist Party. He ran for the presidency on behalf of the Nationalist Party twice in 2000 and 2004, both times losing to Chen Shui-bian of the Democratic Progressive Party. Prior to his term in office, he was a professor of international politics at the Department of Politics at the University of Wisconsin and the Department of Politics at the University of Connecticut.

Radial velocity is the rate of change in the distance of an object from a given point. That is, radial velocity is a quantity of velocity in the direction of the line of sight, which points in the direction of the point and the radius of the object. In astronomy, a given point is usually regarded as an observer on Earth, so radial velocity indicates the speed at which the object leaves Earth (positive) or approaches Earth (negative). In astronomy, radial velocity is usually measured by means of a Doppler spectrometer. The amount obtained by this method can be called protocentric radial velocity or spectral radial velocity. The radial velocity of a star can be accurately measured by high-resolution spectroscopy and compared to known spectral wavelengths measured in a laboratory. Typically, a positive radial velocity indicates that the object is retreating, and a negative one indicates that the object is approaching.

A series of policies and arguments during his tenure as Prime Minister have been termed "Chaicherism". Chaicher studied chemistry at the University of Oxford's Summerville College and later became a barrister at the University of London's School of Urban Law. In 1959, she was elected to the House of Commons (Finchley constituency). She was appointed Minister of Education and Science by Edward Heath when he formed the government in 1970. In 1975, she defeated Heath in the 1975 Conservative Party leadership election and became the first woman to lead a major party in British history. In the 1979 general election, Chaicher was elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, becoming the first woman Prime Minister in British history.

It is a massive binary system with an estimated total mass of nearly 100 suns. There are two super-Earth exoplanets in the constellation: Koro 7b detected by the COROT satellite program and Koro 7c found by the ground-based HARPS. Both planets were discovered in 2009. Prior to the publication of Kepler-10b in January 2011, Koro 7b, which is only 1.58 times the diameter of Earth, was the smallest exoplanet in diameter (about 3.95 times the volume of Earth). Koro 7b contains many clusters and nebulae, the most notable of which are: Compared to other constellations, Koro 7b is a modern constellation. Its appearance is based on the globe created by the Dutch cartographer Plancius in 1612 or 1613.

The school was founded in 1906 by the Qing Dynasty government in Jiangning Prefecture (now Nanjing City, Jiangsu Province). In the 32nd year of the Qing Dynasty, when the new government of Gungzi was coming to power, the governor of the two rivers, Danfang, after returning to the country from the European constitutional review, asked the emperor to allow "foreigners from all the islands of the South Sea, Honshu, San Francisco, and other overseas" to study in Nanjing, in order to "experience Chinese culture overseas." After that, a specialized school was established at the former site of Myoshoan, Xuejia Lane, south of the Drum Tower in Nanjing, and named after "Shangshu Ugong" "Eastwards from the sea, west from the sand, Shandong Jiangsu, vocalism to the four seas", means to spread the moral standards and cultural education of the Chinese people to all over the South Sea and other overseas places.

On June 14, 2017, the Guangzhou Transportation Commission launched a tender for the right to operate a new bus and tram line in Guangzhou. The tender consisted of six bidders, the first bid was for the right to operate a new bus and tram line in Guangzhou Central District; the second bid was for the right to operate a new bus and tram line in Guangzhou Central District and Panyu District; the third bid was for the right to operate a new bus and tram line in Guangzhou Central District and Nansha District; the fourth bid was for the right to operate a new bus and tram line in Guangzhou Central District and Huadu District; the fifth bid was for the right to operate a new bus and tram line in Guangzhou Central District and Xincheng District; and the sixth bid was for the right to operate a new bus and tram line in Guangzhou Central District and Zhenhua District.

The orbital velocity of an object, usually a planet, a natural or man-made satellite, or a star in a cluster system, refers to the mass of the system around it, usually a large mass object. It can be used to indicate the average orbital velocity at which an object completes its orbital cycle, or to indicate its instantaneous orbital velocity, i.e., the velocity at which it moves at a particular point. The velocity at which an object moves at any point in its orbit can be calculated from the distance between that point and the central object; whereas the orbital energy of an object is independent of its location, and the orbital energy is equal to the sum of kinetic energy and momentum. Thus, in an ideal state, the orbital velocity v {\displaystyle v\,} is: among which: it should be noted that determining the orbital velocity is the length of the semi-long axis, not the eccentricity. In the case of radial motion of an object: based on the conservation of angular momentum law or Kepler's second law, the orbital velocity is inversely proportional to the distance between the moving object and the central object, i.e., regardless of whether the object moves to any point in its orbit, the area of the orbital surface swept by an imaginary line connecting the moving object and the central object is constant over a specified period of time.

Emperor Guangxu (August 14, 1871 – November 14, 1908) (Chinese: 光緒帝; pinyin: ᠠ ᠠ; pinyin: Dzai Tiyan) was the 11th emperor of the Qing Dynasty, the ninth emperor since the Qing Dynasty, and the last emperor in China to have an official emperor and an official mausoleum. He reigned from February 25, 1875 to November 14, 1908, the year "Guangxu." Guangxu was the second son of Prince Al Xian, the grandson of Emperor Doguang, niece of Emperor Xianfeng, cousin of Emperor Tongzhi, and nephew of Empress Jiao. After the death of Emperor Tongzhi, he was succeeded by Empress Jiao, so at the age of three he succeeded to Emperor Xianfeng and Empress Jiao, and thus succeeded to the throne successfully.

Founded in 1996 by Alexa founder Brewster Carly, the Internet Archive is a non-profit digital library that provides access to archives of multimedia information on the Internet. Its mission is "universal access to all knowledge."

California is the third-largest U.S. state by area, with a population of 39.3 million. Its capital is Sacramento. The state is diverse in geography, geography, products, and population composition. California is also known as The Golden State, a postal abbreviation for CA, and is nicknamed Cali. The Greater Los Angeles Area and San Francisco Bay Area are the second and fifth-largest metropolitan areas in the United States, with a population of 18.7 million and 8.8 million, respectively. Los Angeles is the largest city in the state, and the second-largest city in the United States, after New York City.

After 1850, the German states rapidly achieved industrialization, particularly in the fields of coal, steel, chemicals and transportation. Germany was founded in 1871 with a population of 41 million. Between 1871 and 1890, the first Emperor of the German Empire, Wilhelm I, delegated almost all state affairs to Bismarck, who remains Germany's longest-serving prime minister. At home, Bismarck adopted a "Great Prussian Policy" for the whole of Germany, assimilated other states with a militaristic culture, strengthened the privileges of the Junkers and Protestants, and expelled Catholics and socialists. In 1890, the second German Emperor, Wilhelm II, succeeded Bismarck, resigned Bismarck because of disagreements, and Germany entered the Wilhelm era through his own reign. At home, William II modified the historical textbooks introducing Prussia as the center, unified the official German languages of Germany and Austro-Hungary, bound the two countries ideologically, and created the image of William II as "the leader of the entire German nation".

In the early days of the Qing Dynasty, Taiwan was known as "Tang-sì-kak" (Taiwan Hakka: 大埔腔:dung+ shiˋ gog^; Taiwanese: Tang-sì-kak) because of the traces of the development of the Han people (present-day Toyohara District running eastwards from Ishioka District to the far east).During the period of Japanese rule in Taiwan, in 1895, the Taiwan Civil Affairs Branch (the following year, it was renamed Taichung County), in 1897, the Taichung Hall Hou Lu Dun Administration Department, in 1901, the Taichung Hall "Tang-sì-kak" branch office, in December 1913, anti-Japanese Luo Fuxing instigated the Miaoli Uprising, Lai Lai also responded to the incident in the east, and after the death of several police officers, was also killed by the Japanese police, historically known as the "Tang-sì-kak" incident.In 1920, the Taiwan Governor's Office changed Taiwan into the five provinces three hall system, re-constituted the "Tang-sì-zhuang" county of Taichung Province, and upgraded it to "Tang-sì-zhuang Street" in 1933.

By 1928, production of industrial and agricultural products in Russia had successfully recovered to pre-World War I levels (1913). However, the implementation of the new economic policy also spawned a large number of "Nepman" and "New Rich Farmers" in Soviet society. These groups, as the new bourgeoisie, became increasingly dissatisfied with the new economic policy, demanding that the Bolsheviks continue to "retreat" on economic issues; without "success", the new bourgeoisie began to use negative resistance against the economic operations of state control, hoarding grain and refusing to sell it because they were dissatisfied with the low price of grain, ultimately leading to the crisis of grain acquisition throughout the Soviet Union in 1927.

In 1698, the Kingdom of Scotland attempted to colonize Panama, and the Scottish army finally landed in Panama in the Second Operation, which was quickly surrounded by the Spanish because of its small numbers. In 1821, Panama gained independence and joined the Greater Colombian Republic established by Simon Bolivar. In 1830, the Greater Colombian Republic split and Panama became a province of the Republic of Colombia. In 1880, the Frenchman Ferdinand de Reseve began to work on the Panama Canal connecting the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt attempted to take over the canal. In 1903, after the United States defeated Britain and France, the Congress of Colombia refused to ratify the treaty with the Colombian government that the U.S. built and leased the canal. On November 3, 1903, the U.S. troops landed in Panama, fought for the independence of Batavia from Colombia, and formed the Republic of Panama.

Later, Ma Yuanliang, Executive Standing Committee of Jiangsu Provincial Party Department, proposed to change the name of the National Central University to "National Central University," because the two letters "Central" crown the splendor, not only can indicate the location of the capital abroad, but also is sufficient to highlight and form the center of national education and culture. In November 1946, the school was moved back to Nanjing. At that time, the Chinese University of Commerce had seven faculties of science, medicine, law, teacher training, engineering, literature, agriculture, in the horizontal sense has the largest number of departments in the country; and in the horizontal sense, the Chinese University of Commerce from kindergarten, elementary school, secondary school, university to research institute, can be said to be a complete, self-sustaining system.

Reuters is the world's third-largest multi-media news agency, providing news and financial data in 128 countries. Reuters provides news coverage to newspapers, television and other media, and has long earned an international reputation for speed and accuracy. In addition, Reuters provides tools and platforms, such as stock prices and foreign exchange rates, to enable traders to analyze financial data and manage trading risks. At the same time, Reuters's system allows customers to complete transactions over the Internet, replacing the telephone or the trading halls of the New York Stock Exchange. Its electronic trading services link the financial community. Reuters' services are divided into four parts: trading and trading, research and asset management, enterprises and the media.

In addition to Gibraltar and Egypt, Egypt was conquered by Napoleon in the early nineteenth century before it became a British protectorate, following the French rule of right-handedness, which remained unchanged after the British occupation of Egypt. On the contrary, although the Dutch mainland was conquered by Napoleon in the early nineteenth century and adopted the right-handedness rule, its overseas colonies — the Dutch East Indies (now Indonesia) and the Dutch Guiana (now Suriname) — still maintained the habit of left-handedness.

New Taipei Municipal Taishan Senior High School (TSSH) is a high school located in Taishan Mountains, New Taipei City. The Taishan Senior High School basketball team is a breeding ground for high school basketball league (HBL) players such as Zhou Yixiang and Chen Shun-man. In the 103rd year, Taishan Senior High School won the second place in the qualifying tournament. In the 105th year, it lost to Gaoyuan Industrial and Commerce in the eighth round, and finished sixth. In the 106th year, it faced two extended tournaments of the championship of the previous year. Among them, it played with Nanshan Senior High School, and finished fifth. In the 107th year, Kaohsiung's doubles against Guangfu Senior High School failed, and against Nanhu Senior High School failed 57:74. In the 108th year, it won the second round of the qualifying tournament with a 2–0 defeat.

The United States of America (U.S.A.) is a federal republic in North America and the only superpower in the world today. Europeans began to colonize North America in the 16th century, and the present United States began with the 13 British American colonies on the east coast. Since the 19th century, the United States has moved westwards and outwards from the British colony states of independence. The U.S. federal government acquired almost all of the land south of the 49th parallel and north of the middle of the Grand River from the Russian Empire through two land purchases in 1803 and 1819, negotiations with the British colonies, defeating Mexico and massacring and forcibly relocating indigenous peoples, and purchasing Alaska from the Russian Empire.

Mars is now known to have two moons, Mars I and Mars II.After extensive research, the American astronomer Asaph Hall confirmed the existence of Mars I and Mars II in 1877, although scientists had previously speculated on the existence of Mars moons.Scientists have long speculated on the existence of Mars moons, the German astronomer Johannes Kepler has even succeeded in predicting the number of Mars moons, although on the basis of erroneous logical inferences: he believed that Jupiter had four moons and the Earth had one, so Mars should have two moons.

The Spanish government declared that Huda and Melilla are an important part of Spain, and that the control of the Strait of Gibraltar should belong to them, not to the United Kingdom. Melilla has a Mediterranean climate, because of its proximity to the sea, it has cooler summers and more rainfall than inland Africa. Melilla's climate is very similar to that of the southern coast of Spain on the European continent, and the temperature difference between the different seasons is very small. Due to its special geographical location, Melilla can act as a springboard for African refugees fleeing to Europe. However, in practice, it is quite difficult for them to enter Melilla as part of the European Union, as the border is severely blocked by a six-metre-high fence and a lookout tower, and many refugees have been arrested by Spanish police and repatriated to their countries of origin on the grounds of illegal immigration. Spanish police strengthened the border security of Melilla with barbed wire, tear gas ejection devices, radar and a 24-hour blockade system.

This heavy element is believed to have been formed during the nuclear synthesis of supernovae during the collision of two neutron stars, and to have existed in the dust before the formation of the Solar System. Since the Earth was still in a molten state at the beginning of its formation, almost all of the gold on early Earth has been deposited in the nucleus. As a result, much of the gold on the Earth's crust and mantle today is due to asteroid impacts that occurred later in the Late Heavy Bombardment Period (about 4 billion years ago). Gold can withstand the erosion of single acids, but can also be dissolved in hydrogen peroxide. This mixture of acids and gold produces tetrachloroalloy root ions. Gold can also be dissolved in alkaline cyanide solutions, which is the principle of its extraction and plating. Nitric acid, which is capable of dissolving silver and base metals, cannot dissolve gold.

In the 16th century, after the German Reformation led by Martin Luther, Western theologians revolted against the authority of the Holy See, such as Martin Luther (Lutheranism), John Calvin (Orthodoxism), Ulrich Zwingli (which influenced many later denominations, such as the Protestant Reformation) and King Henry VIII of England ( Anglicanism, Anglicanism, Anglicanism) to secede from Catholicism and to form their own monastic denominations, which later became known as Protestantism.

The Excellence Long-Established University Consortium of Taiwan (ELECT), also known as the Excellence Long-Established University Consortium of Taiwan, is a Taiwanese university consortium with 12 participating universities. Established on September 28, 2012 by Dongwu University, the consortium comprises seven private universities in the northern part of Taiwan, which can exchange and cooperate with each other and share resources such as faculty fees, books and other resources. Later, Datong University joined the consortium in 2014; Taipei Medical University joined the consortium in 2016, and the "Uleague" was officially established. In December 2017, the consortium extended its cooperation to cities outside the Taipei metropolitan area, and in Taoyuan City, Chuyuan University and Taichung City's Fengjia University, Shiyi University and other three schools joined the consortium in succession, and the consortium was renamed the "Excellent Long-Established University Consortium of Taiwan".

In April 2009, the Reserve Bank Governor and the Finance Minister disagreed over fears of a global recession in the country, with the former calling it a technical recession and the latter predicting quarterly economic growth. Nobel Prize-winning economist Joseph Stiglitz warned South Africa that inflation targets were only a minor issue during the 2007-2009 global financial crisis. Unlike other emerging markets, South Africa overcame the recession of the late 2000s, growth in private and public consumption was the main factor in the economic recovery, while exports and private investment had yet to recover fully, below the global growth rate of 3.1% for the same period.

On January 2, the Somali Youth Party dispatched troops to Western Yemen in support of their brother Yemeni rebels. On the evening of July 11, the Somali Youth Party attacked a restaurant and a football club in the capital of the African nation of Uganda, killing 76 people. In 2011, Kenyan and African Union troops deployed to Somalia and began pursuing a crackdown on the Somali Youth Party. The Somali Youth Party did not oppose the allied forces, and was forced to shift its strategy and withdraw from the Somali capital, Mogadishu. In 2012, the Somali Youth Party again declared its allegiance to Al Qaeda. In the same year, the U.S. government announced a $7 million bounty to buy the head of the Somali Youth Party leader, Mr. Ghotane. On September 21, the Somali Youth Party staged a terrorist attack at a shopping mall in Nairobi, Kenya, killing 67 people and injuring 187, including a woman of Chinese nationality and her son.

Coordinates: 23°07′23′′N 120°12′12′′E / 23.122933°N 120.203427°E / 23.122933; 120.203427 Sai-káng-khu District (Chinese: 西港區; pinyin: 西港區) is located in the western part of south-eastern Taiwan, adjacent to Jiari District, Silian Seven Units District, Stable District, Annan District, and Azu District in the northeastern part of Taiwan. Sai-kang-khu is located on the north bank of Zeng Wenxi River, at an altitude of 5 meters. It used to be called Taijiang Inland Port, but due to the siltation of the Taijiang Inland Sea, it lost its port function and became a nearby agricultural trade center.

In addition, there are many languages with millions of speakers. The Bantu language (Narrow Bantu, 521) As early as 1659 Giacinto Brusciotto published a Latin work on the grammar of the Congolese language. William Blake first described class nouns in the Bantu language in 1856, and he was the first to introduce the name. Carl Meinhof made the first comparative grammatical analysis of the language in 1901. Malcolm Guthrie classified the Bantu language in 1948 and divided it into 16 regions between 1967 and 1971. He also designed the original Bantu language, the ancestral language of all the Bantu languages today. Joseph Harold Greenberg classified the Bantu language as a branch of the Niger-Congo language family.

Social science is the study of the phenomena of human society in a scientific manner. narrowly defined, "social science" is the positivist science of describing, explaining, and predicting the organization, structure, and activities of human society, such as sociology of contemporary human society, political science of politics, policy, and related activities, and economics of resource allocation. broadly defined, "social science", as the counterpart of natural science (with nature as the object of study), is the unification of all empirical and interdisciplinary research and the humanities. The concept of "social science" originated in the Encyclopaedia of the Social Sciences, published in 1930, which contains a discipline of psychology, linguistics, criminology, education, law, politics, economics and business, sociology and social work, geography, management, and other disciplines related to the overview of the social sciences.

Liu Yuqian (Chinese: 劉體乾; 1880–1940) is a Chinese military general and politician from Lujiang, Anhui Province. Born in 1880, Liu Yuqian graduated from Jiangnan Military Academy. After the Xinhai Revolution, he was successively supervised by the Suzhou Customs and General Manager of the Jinling Machinery Manufacturing Bureau. In September 1914, he was appointed to the post of Dongchuan Road in Sichuan Province. In May 1916, he was appointed by the Beijing Government to act as the Deputy Governor of Sichuan Province. In 1920, he was appointed as a second-ranking staff officer and a councilor in the Ministry of the Army of the Beijing Government. In 1926, he joined the Northern Expeditionary Army and was appointed as the Chief of Staff of the General Command of the Fifth Route Army of the National Revolutionary Army. The rest of the roads are dangerous by the mountains or by the sea. The campus is located in Dong Yi Jushan, west of Taiwan Strait, south of Kaohsiung Port, and north of Shiba Mountain. There are a large number of macaques in the campus, including Taiwan macaques, red-headed parrots, red-bellied squirrels, and mountain goats, which can be seen eating macaques on a daily basis, hence the name "Momotaro University." Located in the Saigo Bay Tunnel, it was excavated in 1927 by the Japanese Kaino Sanshiro (Japanese: 海野三郎), and the following year it was completed and opened to the public, hence the name "Jushan Cave." The Cave has four entrances and eight exits, an independent hydroelectric power station, a lavatory guard bath and an accommodation area. During the Japanese occupation, the Cave served as an important command center for the Japanese military, and later as the office of the Kaohsiung Port Affairs Bureau. It was opened to the public for the first time on November 11, 2017. National Sun Yat-sen University Dongsha International Marine Research Station, located in the Dongsha Islands in the South China Sea, is an atoll. Departing from Kaohsiung Port near the Saigo Bay Campus, the journey takes about 400 kilometers. To reach the island, you must apply to the school or Dongsha Atoll National Park.

Mariner 10 is the 10th and last of a series of overflight-based planetary exploration missions undertaken by the Space Shuttle program. Mariner 10 was the first spacecraft to fly over Mercury to explore Mercury and Venus. Subsequently, the USS Messenger, launched in 2004, arrived on Mercury in 2011. Mariner 10 was launched about two years later, on November 3, 1973. Its main mission included the exploration of the environment, atmosphere, surface and planet characteristics of Mercury and Venus. Mariner 10 was also the first spacecraft to use planetary gravity to simultaneously explore two planets, i.e. to accelerate in a gravity assist trajectory, enter the gravitational influence zone of Venus, and then to eject the spacecraft into another orbit by the gravity of Venus to approach Mercury.

When the core of a star continues to contract to the density and temperature conditions necessary to ignite the 3 helium process, helium fusion is initiated. The helium nuclei of stars with masses less than 2.5 times the mass of the Sun use electron decomposition pressure to confront gravity until they become decayed matter resembling "white dwarfs". The ignition temperature of the helium fusion is ~ 100 million degrees, the energy of the helium fusion is trapped in the decay state, triggering the thermal uncontrolled helium flash: within about a minute, most of the helium nuclei are fused into carbon nuclei (and subsequent oxygen nuclei), and transfer huge amounts of energy to the outer layer, causing the star to suddenly glow for a while. After the helium flash, the core no longer produces energy, and the outer layer of hydrogen continues to fuse into helium in a more complex way at a shallower location. The star's core slowly accumulates helium again, and for a longer period of time, the helium flash occurs in the helium envelope outside the oxygen-rich carbon nuclei.

Laos' economy is based on agriculture and its industrial base is weak. The mainstay of Laos's industrial economy is hydroelectric power generation, and it establishes economic and trade links with neighbouring countries through transmission of electricity and rail transportation. Laos or Lao (Lao pronunciation: ; French: Laos) came into being as an official country name in 1893, when the French named the country after the Lao people who formed the Lao Protectorate at its birthplace in Lancang. "Lao (Lao)" and "Lao" actually have the same meaning in Laos. It is believed to be the first name of Dongtai language, and the same root as "僚" in Zhuang, "佬族", "古僚人," and the ancient book-deprecating "獠" clan, are all related to this. Laos's Chinese translation of the country names varies, with mainland China, Hong Kong and Macao referring to Laos, Taiwan, Malaysia and Singapore referring to Laos. In Chinese ancient records, Laos has been referred to as Nanzhuang, Lanzhang, Lancang, Cable, Laos, Lao Chua, Lao La, Shangcha, etc.

Due to factors such as the Second Sino-Japanese War and the establishment of the People's Republic of China in Beijing, this election was the only presidential election held simultaneously on both sides of the Taiwan Strait to date. In 1936, the government of the Republic of China initially completed the draft constitution, called the "Five-Five Draft Constitution," but soon after the outbreak of war, the constitutional work stopped. After the victory in the war in 1945, the two parties of the Communist Party of China held negotiations and political consultations in Chongqing on the peaceful establishment of the country, but after the failure of negotiations between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China, the national government only declared itself to convene a "Constitutional National Assembly" at the end of 1946 to formulate the constitution. On December 25, 1946, the Constitution of the Republic of China was passed on three readings, promulgated on January 1, 1947, and formally implemented on December 25, the Republic of China officially entered the constitutional era.

The spotted hyena is the most widespread predator in sub-Saharan Africa (due to its strong adaptive capacity and opportunism), inhabiting the African prairies. The interaction of the spotted hyena with humans has a long history, with human depictions of it first appearing in the late Paleolithic, including paintings and sculptures of the Lascaux Caves and Shawnee Caves. The spotted hyena has a bad reputation in both Western culture and traditional African religions. In the former, the spotted hyena is considered to be an ugly and cowardly animal; in the latter, it is considered to be a greedy, gluttonous, stupid but also powerful and potentially dangerous animal. Western impressions of the hyena are mostly derived from the writings of Aristotle and Pliny the Elder, although the descriptions of the two do not carry much criticism.

South Africa's only annual championship is the Rugby World Cup (formerly known as the Tri Nations), which has been held in Australia and New Zealand since 1996. In 2012, Argentina joined the competition and the Tri Nations were renamed the Rugby World Cup. South Africa has won the Rugby World Cup four times, in 1998, 2004, 2009, and 2019.

In the 13th and 14th centuries, the area belonged to the eastern Mandingo Empire, and at the same time to the Jolof Empire. In the middle of the 15th century, the Portuguese invaded and came to Senegal. In 1659, France established a colony in Port-au-Prince, and after the Battles of Diubold and Lebar Bridge, it became a French colony in 1864. In 1909, it was incorporated into French West Africa, eventually occupying the area. In January 1959, Senegal and the French colony, the French Sultanate of Mali, formed a federation. On 4 April 1960, Senegal signed a power transfer agreement with France, and on 20 June 1960, it became fully independent. However, due to domestic political difficulties, the federation dissolved on 20 August. Senegal and the Sudan (renamed the Republic of Mali) declared independence respectively.

National Kaohsiung University of Hospitality, also known as Kaohsiung University of Hospitality or Kaohsiung University of Hospitality, is the only National Kaohsiung University of Hospitality in Taiwan and the highest university of Taiwan Hospitality School. It is famous for its overseas visits (it has been discontinued since the 109th academic year), hard work education, overseas internships and uniform requirements. It has four technical university faculties, two technical university faculties, five-year specialized faculties and research institutes. In the global university hotel management and tourism management research influence ranking (filed on the Internet Archive), National Kaohsiung University of Hospitality ranked 46th in the world, 6th in Asia universities, 1st in Taiwan universities. National Kaohsiung University of Hospitality full-time student autonomous organization is called "National Kaohsiung Hospitality Student Association". According to the "Student Autonomous Group Establishment and Counseling Methods" of the school; institute, department, degree course and department level, establishment of student autonomous groups, also commonly called "departmental societies".

The Research Center for Development of the State Council is a public institution under the State Council of the People's Republic of China responsible for policy research and advisory services.The Research Center for Development of the State Council is currently a policy research and advisory institution under the State Council.It is mainly responsible for studying the global, strategic, forward-looking, long-term and hotspot and difficult issues in China's national economy, social development and reform and opening-up, carrying out independent assessment and objective interpretation of major policies, and providing policy recommendations and advisory opinions to the CPC Central Committee and the State Council.The predecessor of the Research Center for Development of the State Council was the Research Center for Economic Research of the State Council (established in July 1980) and the Research Center for Technical Economic Research of the State Council (established in May 1981 and formally renamed the Research Center for Development of the State Council in January 1990).

Joseph Vissarionovich Stalin (Russian: Ио́сиф Виссарио́нович Ста́лин, Russian: Iosif Vissarionovich Stalin, pronounced (listen); 18 December 1878 – 5 March 1953) was a Georgian Marxist-Leninist, proletarian revolutionary, politician, military commander, strategist, activist of the international communist movement, leader of the Soviet Union and the Party of Soviet Socialists.

After the formation of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, the Nazi Party in Germany and the Fascist Party in Italy respectively formed the party system, which became an indicator of the party system in the early 20th century. The emergence of the party system in China began with Sun Yat-sen's proposal for political unification and reform after China's transition from imperialism to republic, when the country was confronted with the subordination of the military power. Following the success of the Revolution of 1911, the Republic of China was established in 1912, the North Sea government held power.
