In September 1912, Zhang Zhang and others invested 120,000 yuan to buy the property of the Declaration. On October 20, 1912, Zhang Zhang officially transferred ownership of the Declaration to himself as General Manager. Three years later, all of the partners withdrew, and the Declaration was owned by one of them. In October 1919, the World Press Congress was held in Honolulu, and he was elected Vice President of the Congress. In 1929, he successively acquired a majority stake in the News and Jiji Xinhua newspapers, making a leap into the Shanghai newspaper industry giant. After the outbreak of the November Revolution, he opposed the civil war between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China, and advocated anti-Japan. At the time of the January Revolution, the Shanghai Civic Local Maintenance Association was founded. He was elected president, actively raised funds, supported the 19th Route Army in the fight against the war. After the dissolution of the Maintenance Association, he was elected president of the Shanghai Local Association, chairman of the Shanghai Senate, and presided over many local affairs in Shanghai. At the same time, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the publication of the Declaration, he invited democrats Huang Yanpei, Tao Yingchi, Go Guozhen, etc. to enter the newspaper to reform the Declaration.

Coordinates: 21°N 57°E / 21°N 57°E / 21; 57The Sultanate of Oman (Arabic:سلطنة عُمان ), also known as Oman (عُمان ), is a country on the south-eastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula, bordering the United Arab Emirates in the north, Saudi Arabia in the west, and Yemen in the south-west. Its coastline faces the Arabian Sea in the south and east, and the Gulf of Oman in the north-east. In ancient times, the region of Oman was known as the "Maghreb". In the 20th century, Oman gradually became a British protectorate. Historically, the capital of Oman, Muscat, was the main trading port in the Persian Gulf and the Indian Ocean. Oman is a monarchy, and Oman's oil reserves rank the 25th largest in the world. Oman and Yemen are neighbors, but the two countries have strong contrasts in terms of both economic construction and political situation.

The Asian elephant (Elephas maximus) is a species of elephant. It is an endangered species on the IUCN Red List and a protected species at the national level in China. Asian elephants are smaller than African elephants, and the easiest way to distinguish them is to look at their ears. Asian elephants can grow to 2-4 meters tall and weigh up to 3,000-5,000 kilograms. They are the largest terrestrial mammals in Asia, and female elephants are smaller than males. Male Asian elephants have ivory teeth, and females are not as prominent even if they have ivory teeth. A certain proportion of male Asian elephants do not have ivory teeth, which may be related to the hunting pressure they have undergone in the past. Asian elephants have smaller, rounder ears, five toes in the forefoot, four toes in the hindfoot, 19 pairs of ribs (including 20 pairs of Sumatran elephants, one pair more than African elephants), two protrusions of the skull, and an arched back.

Encouraged by many post-Roman states and rulers to imitate the Arc de Triomphe, there are buildings all over the world imitating the ancient Roman Arc de Triomphe. The most famous are the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, the Arc de Triomphe in St. Petersburg and the Arc de Wellington in London. The Arc de Triomphe itself has a propaganda function to celebrate military success, so it should not be confused with the Memorial Gate, the Arc de Triomphe and the City Gate, such as the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin, the Arc de Triomphe in Washington Square in New York City, or the Indian Gate in New Delhi. Or buildings constructed to commemorate an event (e.g. national independence, war casualties). The Arc de Triomphe is also the name given to the arch above the entrance to the altar of a medieval church, where a cross can be laid. The creation and development of the Arc de Triomphe is generally regarded as part of ancient Roman architecture. Just as passageways, bridges, circular theatres and domes were built during the Roman period, the Arc de Triomphe was also constructed using arch principle techniques.

Yugoslavia is a multi-ethnic country, the government adheres to the federal system, is governed by the Union of Communists of Yugoslavia. Due to the inheritance of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia known as "First Yugoslavia", it is also called "Second Yugoslavia". The country originated in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia, which was destroyed by the armed aggression of the Axis powers during World War II. During the occupation of Germany, Italy, Hungary and Bulgaria, the former Yugoslavia emerged as a rebel force, one of which was a communist guerrilla group led by Joseph Broz Tito. After the surrender of Italy in 1943, the Western Allies recognized it as an ally leading the fight against Yugoslavia: 97, began a large military reinforcement, Tito's communist regime became one of the representatives of the government. In March 1945, Yugoslavia formed a joint government with the then exiled government and the "National Liberation Committee" led by Tito, on 29 November of the same year, Tito eliminated and reformed other political parties, established a complete communist one-party regime, and renamed the country "People's Republic of Yugoslavia", on 7 April 1963, the new constitution entered into force, and renamed it "Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia".

The normal nipple is symmetrical on both sides and has a pink or brown surface. Most of the males are black and hairy. The females have a cylindrical part that is usually 0.8-1.5 centimeters in diameter and about 1.5-2 centimeters above the diaphragm plane. Abnormally developed convex and tubular protrusions are called excessive nipples. The number of nipples is related to fertility (the number of babies born), and is often even, ranging from 2 to 18. For example, primates, sheep, and horses have two nipples; cattle have four; cats have eight. However, North American rats have 13 nipples, 12 of which are surrounded by a circle and one in between. If a person has three or four nipples, it is called polydactylosis. The convex surface around the nipple is somewhat like a vegetable blossom, and the females have six to nine mammary openings carrying milk and an unequal number of sebaceous openings, and the number of sebaceous openings usually does not exceed 20.

At the same time, crocodilians such as Dinosaurus and Titusuchus were found in Cretaceous freshwater; mammals, lizards, and frogs in caves, canyons, plains, and rainforests also exhibited explosive growth unprecedented in the Jurassic. Although dinosaurs remained the absolute dominant species on land, the lower and middle ecosystems crowded in more small predators, many of whom survived to the present day. In the oceans, the top predators of the Jurassic sea, Ursaeopteryx and Ursaeopteryx, thrived in the early Middle Cretaceous, and rapidly declined to extinction in the Late Cretaceous; the same family of Ursaeopteryx as Ursaeopteryx and Ursaeopteryx continued to thrive throughout the Cretaceous. At the end of the Cretaceous, the Cangryopteryx family of Ursaeopteryx rose within a short time to become a new generation of kings of the sea, and even crowded crocodiles in many freshwater basins.

The Christian doctrine believes in the one and only God, the Lord, named YHWH/YHVH (New Testament and Synoptic Yahweh, Catholic Synoptic Yahweh), or Yahweh, the God of eternity, omnipotence, goodness, and eternity, the creator and sustainer of this world. As a result of the First Council of Constantinople, He is the God of the Trinity: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. He created man, and saved those who sinned and fell; He appointed His only begotten Son, Jesus Christ, to redeem mankind, and to save all who believed in Him. The four-letter name (Hebrew: יהוה, translated YHVH/YHWH) is the unique name given to the revelation of God, as recorded in the Book of Exodus, when the Israelites were slaves in Egypt, God called Moses to lead the Israelites out of Egypt.

On March 22, 2019, eight countries, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru and Guyana, signed the Declaration of San Diego, declaring the establishment of the South American Forum for Progress and Development, with the intention of replacing the Union of South American Nations. In the absence of the leaders of Uruguay, Bolivia and Suriname, the name "Union of the South American Family" survived. On March 10, 2020, Uruguay announced its withdrawal from the Union of South American Nations. At the Third South American Summit, held on December 8, 2004, the Presidents or representatives of the 12 participating countries of South America signed the Declaration of Cusco, declaring the establishment of the Community of South American Nations. Panama participated as an observer in the signing ceremony.

International law (French: Le droit international; English: international law, originally known as Universal Law:3) differs from national legal systems in that it is primarily applied to states, not citizens, and regulates the rules of relations between governmental organizations, sometimes including legal persons, natural persons, etc. In the absence of an effective system of sanctioning illegal states, international law is less able to bind states and to ensure the smooth functioning of their legal systems. The early Western world did not recognize the existence of international law, the 19th century British jurist John Austin believed that the law was only a real morality, not a legally binding force. Currently, countries recognize the legal status of international law, and trade disputes between countries are often invoked to settle international law, so the legal status of international law has been recognized by most countries, but the international community does not have the power to sanction illegal states.

The Smith & Wesson Model 10, also known as the Smith & Wesson Hand Ejector Model of 1899, the Smith & Wesson Military & Police Model, and the Smith & Wesson Victory Model, was a revolver introduced by the Smith & Wesson Company in 1899.

The ionized hydrogen region (H II region) is a cloud of luminous gas and plasma, sometimes hundreds of light-years in diameter, that is the birthplace of stars. The young, hot blue stars that are born from these gases emit large amounts of ultraviolet radiation, freeing the surrounding gas from the nebula. H II region may give rise to thousands of stars over millions of years. Finally, supernova explosions and strong stellar winds from the stars with the largest masses in the cluster will scatter the H II region's gas, leaving behind clusters such as the Pleiades. H II region is named for the large number of hydrogen atoms that are freed, the region of neutral hydrogen is also called the HI region, and H2 is called molecular hydrogen. H II regions can still be measured in the distant universe, and observations of other galaxies in the H II region are important for determining their distance and chemical composition.

Many near-Earth objects have Earth-like orbits, making them easy targets for spacecraft, but because of their low mass, their surface gravity is also very low. Near-Earth objects are defined scientifically and conventionally as Solar System asteroids whose orbits around the Sun are partly located between 0.983 and 1.3 AU from the Sun, and their orbital relationships with the Earth are more complicated. When a near-Earth object is detected, its position and luminosity, like all Solar System asteroids, are submitted to the International Astronomical Union (IAU) Minor Planet Center (MPC) for cataloguing. The Asteroid Center establishes and maintains a separate list of confirmed near-Earth objects and potentially threatening objects. Currently, the definition of a potentially threatening asteroid (PHAs) is based on parameters related to its proximity to the Earth and the likelihood of its impact, as well as an estimate of the likely consequences.

LITE-ON Technology Co., Ltd.(LITE-ON Technology) is Taiwan's first listed electronics company, simply referred to as LITE-ON Technology. LITE-ON Electronics Co., Ltd. was founded by several employees who had served Texas Instruments, founded by Song Kyung-yuan, Lin Yuan-sheng and Wu An-feng, then headquartered in Chunghe City, Taipei Prefecture (New Taipei City's Central and Eastern District), a small apartment next to Wontong Zen Temple, initially with LED as the main product, later began to manufacture computer power supplies, LED, semiconductor, computer shells, imaging products, motherboards, DVD and disc equipment, solid state hard drives, and other electronic spare parts, with the vision of "optical power saving, smart technology best partner". LITE-ON Technology is also the parent company of LITE Group. LITE-ON Technology is currently promoting the Bright Smart City, will focus on the construction of smart city infrastructure, including the establishment of wireless communication network industry, various kinds of smart sensors, security monitoring equipment to the development of intelligent street lighting systems, etc.

Gravity is the act of gravitation between massive objects and the source of their mass. Together with electromagnetism, weak interactions, and strong interactions, gravity forms the four fundamental interactions of nature. Of these four fundamental interactions, gravity is the weakest, but also the most long-lasting and effective. In modern physics, gravitational phenomena are generally accurately described by general relativity, which holds that gravity reflects the inertia of an object as it bends in the air. Newton's law of universal gravitation in classical mechanics is an excellent approximation of gravity under normal physical conditions. On Earth, the Earth's universal gravitation on objects near the Earth gives an object its weight and causes it to fall to the ground. In the universe, gravity causes matter to aggregate to form celestial bodies, and also causes them to gravitate between them, forming celestial systems in orbit.

When at such a high pressure, because there is no surplus space left for the particles, each particle's position is clearly defined. This is because of the Heisenberg uncertainty principle, ΔpΔx ≥ ħ/2, where Δp is the particle's uncertain momentum, and Δx is the uncertain position. Δx is smaller, which means that Δp is larger, i.e. the particle's momentum is extremely uncertain under extreme compression. Therefore, even if the temperature of the plasma is low enough, the average velocity at which these particles move is still very fast. This leads to the conclusion that even if the object has been compressed to a very small space, it still takes a great deal of force to control the particle's momentum. Unlike the classical ideal gas where pressure is proportional to temperature (P = nkT/V, where P is pressure, V is volume, n is the number of particles - a typical atom or molecule, k is the Boltzmann constant, and T is temperature), the relationship between pressure and temperature of degenerate matter is very weak, in particular, the pressure has not yet reached zero, or even is already at absolute zero.

As of August 2021, there are 20 names of current heads of state or government, of which 157 are full-time heads of state and 66 are prime ministers. The titles of heads of state vary from country to country. At the end of the Qing Dynasty, the "premier" position of head of state appeared in China for the first time—the prime minister of the cabinet. Since the establishment of the Republic of China, successive governments have used it to this day. In Chinese translation, the title of head of state of a republic is generally translated as prime minister (e.g. German prime minister), head of government (e.g. President of the Russian Federation), etc. The title of head of state of a monarchy is generally translated as prime minister (e.g. British prime minister), or prime minister of the cabinet (e.g. Japanese prime minister). The effective temperature of the solar photosphere is about 5780 K, it is the innermost part of the solar atmosphere, the density is about 2×10-4 K cubic meters−3, the particle number density is 1023/m3, it is about 1% of the density of the Earth's atmosphere near the sea level; the photospheres of other stars can be hotter or colder. The thickness of the solar photosphere is only 500 km, it is composed of convection cells called rice grains, each of which consists of gas about 1,000 km in diameter, the hot gas rises from the center, and the cooled gas sinks from a narrow gap between them. Each rice grain has a lifetime of about 8 minutes, resulting in a continuous boiling transfer pattern.

South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands (SGSSI) is an overseas territory of the United Kingdom in the southern Atlantic Ocean. It consists of a series of remote and desolate islands, including South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands. South Georgia is the largest island of the group, located in the northwest of the group, with an area of approximately 3,592 square kilometres. It has no permanent population. The current population consists of British government officials, scientists and logistics staff of the British Antarctic Survey, postal workers and museum staff, and all of them live in South Georgia. Although the South Sandwich Islands are currently uninhabited, Argentina established a scientific research station there between 1976 and 1982.

Chiang Wan-an (Chinese: 蒋萬安; born December 26, 1978) is a Taiwanese politician. Chiang Wan-an graduated from Taipei Jianguo Senior High School, National University of Political Science with a Bachelor of Arts in Diplomacy and a Master of Laws in Law, and from the University of Pennsylvania with a Doctor of Laws (J.D.) and a Master of Laws. Chiang Wan-an was admitted to practice law in California on December 11, 2007. Chiang Wan-an announced in March 2015 that he would run for the 9th Legislative Council of the Nationalist Party of China's Taipei City Third Constituency. In April 2015, Legislative Councillor Luo Shu-ray led Chiang Wan-an and Wang Hung-wei by less than 5% in the first round of the first round, and was confirmed to run for the second round of the first round. In May 2015, Chiang Wan-an won the second round of the first round with an average of 55.376% of the vote and 44.624% of the vote, winning the 9th Legislative Council of the Nationalist Party of China's Taipei City Third Constituency nomination by the Nationalist Party Standing Committee.

Researchers do not know how the boy came into contact with the Ibola virus. Approximately eight months ago, a two-year-old boy, known to the medical community as "Patient Zero," reportedly developed fever, excreted black feces and vomited. The boy died on December 6, 2013, four days after the onset of the disease. After the boy's death, the child's mother developed hemorrhagic symptoms and died on December 13. The boy's three-year-old sister died on December 29. The boy's grandmother later developed the same symptoms and died on January 1, 2014. Two of the grandmother's funeral attendants brought the virus back to the village (a traditional West African ceremony involves washing, touching and kissing bodies). One of the health workers brought the virus to another village and died, and the doctor who treated the health workers also died. The health workers and the doctor transmitted the virus to relatives from other villages.

Chung Hua University (CHU) is a private university located in Xiangshan Mountain, Hsinchu City, Taiwan. It is a member of the Asia-Pacific Association of Colleges and Universities (AACSB) and the Xuanhua-Yuan Alliance, which is formed with the neighboring Xuan Zang University and Yuan Pei Medical Science and Technology University. The name of the university is derived from the Chinese Institute of Technology, which was named at the time of the founding of the university in 1990. After graduation in 1997, the name of the university was changed to the University of China. The mascot and symbol is "horse", which is the origin of the school's portrait in 1990, staff and students also created various mascots. The emblem of the school is a white horse, the 15 stars represent 15 donors co-founded the school. At the beginning of the school, the main axis is the engineering college, hence the "ring", representing the academic foundation of the school.

Yuan Ze University (YZU) is a private university located in Taoyuan City, Taiwan. Formerly Yuan Ze Institute of Technology, founded in 1989, and upgraded to a university in 1997. Founded by Mr. Xu Yue-dong, founder of Far East Group, and currently chaired by Mr. Xu Xu Xudong, chairman of its subsidiary Far East Corporation. Although the campus is located in Zhongli District, but the campus is mostly located within the Eight Degrees District, the campus buildings are mostly constructed using Shimizu Architectural Engineering. Yuan Ze Softball Major League Softball (YZU_MLSB) is a softball league within Yuan Ze University. Founded in 2009, Yuan Ze University students voluntarily organized.

The Kenyan shilling (ISO 4217 code KES) is the currency in circulation in Kenya. The Kenyan shilling replaced the East African shilling in 1966. One shilling is divided into 100 cents. On 11 December 2018, the Central Bank of Kenya issued new denominations of 1, 5, 10 and 20 shillings. All coins bear the national emblem of Kenya on the obverse and an image of African animals on the reverse. On 14 September 1966, the Kenyan shilling replaced the East African shilling at a rate of 1 to 1, which was not abolished until 1969. The Central Bank of Kenya issued notes of 5, 10, 20, 50 and 100 shillings, respectively. All banknotes bear the portrait of the first Prime Minister and President of Kenya, Jomo Kenyatta, on the obverse, and display diversified economic activities on the reverse.

Kaohsiung County is an administrative division of the Republic of China, which has been abolished, located in the southwestern part of Taiwan, adjacent to Tainan County, Tainan City, Kaohsiung City, Pingtung County, Taidong County, Hualien County, Nantou County, Chiayi County. The northern edge of the Jiangnan Plain, West Bank Taiwan Strait, the southeastern edge is bordered by Gao Pingxi and Pingtung County. On June 23, 2009, the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Republic of China examined through the "Merger of Kaohsiung City and Municipality and Reorganization of the Municipality with Direct Jurisdiction", Kaohsiung County was incorporated into the newly established Kaohsiung City on December 25, 2010. The topography of Kaohsiung County is high in the northeast and low in the southwest, the highest point is located in the northeast and Nantou County, at the intersection of Chiayi County, the main peak of the Jade Mountain, the height of 3,952 meters. The mountains in the northeast are located in the middle reaches of Nanzusenxi and the east of the middle reaches of Luonoxi, roughly subdivided into the Central Mountains and Jade Mountains, the total area of which accounts for about one-half of the total area of Kaohsiung County.

The Turks came here in the 8th and 9th centuries. After the Mongol conquest of Kharkiv in 1219-1221, Turkmenistan belonged to the Kazakhstan Khanate. It was not until 1370-1506, during the Timurid Empire, that the Turkmen people basically formed. From the 16th to the 17th centuries, it belonged to the Khiva and Bukhara Khanates. In the 1960s and 70s, it was annexed by the Russian Empire. At the end of 1917, the main territory was annexed by the Turkmen Soviet Socialist Autonomous Republic, which belonged to the Russian Federation. In October 1924, the Turkmen Soviet Socialist Republic was established as a republic of the Soviet Union. The Communist Party of Turkmenistan exercised one-party rule. On October 27, 1991, it declared independence and changed its name to "Turkmenistan". On December 21, 1991, it joined the Union of Independent States.

Coordinates: 24°51′55′′N 121°33′02′′E / 24.865296°N 121.550531°E / 24.865296; 121.550531Ulay District is the southernmost district of New Taipei City, Taiwan, with the largest area and the lowest population density in New Taipei City, and the northernmost mountainous indigenous district in Taiwan.Ulay District is directly under the jurisdiction of the City of Taipei.Ulay District is a local self-government organization with the status of a public corporation.

Since his return to Vietnam in 2004, Nguyen has been regarded by Vietnam as a symbol of national reconciliation. In September 1951, he was commissioned into the army as a member of the Vietnamese National Action Force. Nguyen participated in the 1963 coup d'état in South Vietnam. He became prime minister in 1965 and vice president in 1967. After the defeat of North Vietnam in 1975, on the day of the fall of Saigon, Nguyen fled to the United States on the command ship of the US Navy Blue Ridge, settled in Westminster, California, where he ran a small winery. Nguyen wrote two autobiographies, entitled How We Lost the Vietnam War. In 2004, Nguyen visited Vietnam, becoming the first former South Vietnamese government leader to visit Vietnam since the end of the Vietnam War. He and his wife visited Vietnam again in early 2005, at a reception hosted by the government and overseas bridges, expressing interest in returning to Vietnam to settle down, and pledged to do his utmost to attract more investment to Vietnam.

Astronomy is one of the oldest natural sciences. Early civilizations in history made systematic observations of the night sky. These include Babylonian astronomy, Greek astronomy, Indian astronomy, Egyptian astronomy, Chinese astronomy, Maya civilization and many ancient Native American astronomy. Astronomy comprises a variety of disciplines, such as astrometry, astrophysics, astronomical navigation, observational astronomy, calendar and astrophysics. Today, professional astronomy is usually equated with astrophysics. Professional astronomy is divided into two branches: observational and theoretical. The focus of observational astronomy is on obtaining data from observations of objects and then analyzing these data using the fundamental principles of physics.

Enping City, formerly known as Enzhou, is located in southern China, is a county-level city under the administration of Jiangmen City, Guangdong Province, belongs to the Guangdong-Macau-Dawan District, is a modern industrial base on the west bank of the Pearl River Delta and a hot spring tourism and leisure resort located in Guangdong Province, is a Chinese microphone industry industrial base, a Chinese performing arts and equipment industry base, a hot spring town in China, a geothermal national geological park, a winter shelter in China. Enping is located in the southwest of the Pearl River Delta, the western part of Jiangmen City, the eastern border with Kaiping, Taishan, the southern border with Yangtze River, the western border with Yangchun, the northern border with Yunfu. Enping was founded in the 25th year of the founding of Donghan Jian'an 220 years ago, is a millennium-old town in southern Guangdong, one of the 20 counties in Guangdong Province with the longest county-building period, there is a famous Chinese historical and cultural village Shima Lifting Village, the former site of the Guangdong People's Liberation Army Command, is the "father of China's space" Feng Yongli. Enping dialect, Guangzhou dialect is spoken in Cantonese throughout the city.

Lufeng City is a county-level city under the jurisdiction of Shantou City, Guangdong Province, China. It is located on the banks of Yaseok Bay, north of Luhe County, Puning City, east of Huilai County, west of Haifeng County and Shantou City District. Lufeng City is bordered on the north by Luhe County and Puning City; on the east by Shantou City's Overseas Territories and Huilai County; on the west by Haifeng County and Shantou City District; on the south by the South China Sea, adjacent to Hong Kong and Macao, between Shenzhen and Shantou two special economic zones. The total land area of the city is 1681 square kilometers, the coastline is 116.5 km long, the sea area is 12.56 million square kilometers. It has a long north-south orientation, a short east-west orientation, and a total circumference of 372 km. The coastline is winding, there are many ports, there are five ports: Ukan, Koshi, Yaseok, Hudong, and Jinguan. In April of Qing Yongzheng 9, Kaihai (May 12, 1731) was separated from Haifeng County, and placed in Lufeng County. It belonged to Huizhou Prefecture, the national period to Chaosheng Road, in 1958 to Shantou Region, in 1983 to Huiyang Region, and in 1988 to Shantou City.

On November 11, 2022, the first train of Line 13 of the Shenzhen Metro will run underground in Jiangmen City. This line will be located in Phase 2, and will be the only line without a carriageway after the first phase of Phase 4 of the Shenzhen Metro. Phase 2 will have a carriageway, will recommend the Guangming carriageway, and will select the Guangming North carriageway. This line will be located at the northeast of Shenzhen Bay Port Station, at the northwest of the junction of Dongbin Road and Shahe West Road, and under the Nehu Park, at Talent Park Station. On February 25, 2019, the Shenzhen Municipal Development and Reform Commission conducted an environmental assessment announcement, and the line will be extended to the south and north. The south extension will connect the planned Shenzhen Opera House, and the north extension will connect the Guangming New District, and finally at Guangming North Station and Dongguan Railway Line 5. In December 2019, in the latest announcement document, Line 13 will be extended to the south to Dongguan Head and Line 2.

Former Deputy Prime Minister of the State Council and a part-time professor at the Graduate School of Economic Management, Tsinghua University. After graduating from high school in 1969, he was sent to work in Fengzhuang commune in Yan'an, Shaanxi for two years, while Xi Jinping was sent to work in Liangjiahe River, 65.8 kilometers from Fengzhuang commune in Kangping village, Yan'an County, and the two became good friends. Wang Qishan and Yao Yilin (the Standing Committee of the 13th Politburo of the Communist Party of China, Deputy Prime Minister of the State Council), the only son Yao Mingwei, were high school students, and Wang Qishan was able to fall in love with Yao Ming's great sister Yao Mingshan. Yao Mingshan joined Wang Qishan in Fengzhuang commune in Yan'an, Shaanxi for two years, and later became a couple. In 1971, Wang Qishan entered the Shaanxi Provincial Museum to work; In 1973, Wang Qishan was recommended to enter the Normal Class of the University of History of Northwestern University in Xi'an City, Shaanxi Province as a student of the workers and peasants. In 1973-1976, Wang Qishan worked in the University of History of Northwestern University for three years. After graduating from the University of History, Wang Qishan continued to work in the Shaanxi Provincial Museum in 1976, and worked around eight years.

On 16 May 1916, the British Middle East expert Mark Sykes and the French diplomat François Picot signed the Sykes-Picot Agreement in an attempt to gain the support of the French military forces in the Middle East. Until the end of World War I in 1917, the British Foreign Secretary Bermuda issued the Bermuda Declaration: "His Majesty's Government is in favour of the establishment of a Jewish national homeland in Palestine, and will do its utmost to promote its realization."

Antarctica is the southernmost continent of the world, located in the Antarctic Circle of the Southern Hemisphere, and the geographical location of Antarctica. Most of Antarctica is within the Antarctic Circle, surrounded by the Southern Ocean. Antarctica is the fifth largest continent in the world, with an area of about 14 million square kilometres, accounting for one-tenth of the Earth's land area, and is twice the size of Oceania, after Asia, Africa, North America and South America. In addition to parts of the northernmost tip of the Antarctic Peninsula, about 98% of the entire continent is covered by an average ice sheet 1.9 km thick. Antarctica is the coldest, driest, windiest continent on Earth, and the only continent that crosses all the meridians.

He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1978 for signing the Camp David Accord with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak. He was re-elected Prime Minister in 1981 after the victory of the Likud group. He resigned in 1983 for reasons including his wife's death, the economic crisis, the war in Lebanon, and health. He died in Tel Aviv on March 9, 1992, at the age of 78. Menachem Begin was born on August 16, 1913, to a Polish Jewish family in the Russian Empire's Brest region (now part of Belarus), the youngest of three children, and his birth attendant was the grandmother of Ariel Sharon. His mother came from a prominent local rabbinical family, and his father was a timber merchant, a local community leader and fanatic supporter of Zionism, and an admirer of Theodor Herzl.

Military training is a system that has emerged in the Republic of China (Taiwan), its official official name is Military Industrial Training Reserve Officers, misleadingly referred to as the Military Service, but in fact the system has no legislative source and does not belong to the categories prescribed by the Military Service Law, the system is only implemented by the Ministry of Defense according to the internal administrative order "Military Industrial Training Reserve Officers Reserve Officers Selection Work Points", so the term Military Service is incorrect. Military training personnel only have the status of serving soldiers at the time of enlistment training; at the end of the training is a reserve soldier, and companies or institutions participate in the development program. Since 2008, the implementation of the Military Training System has been replaced by the Development Substitute Officers. The Taiwanese government is actively developing the defense industry and the effective use of talent, combining private forces, boosting the development capability of the defense industry and related technology industries with the overall competitiveness of the country, implementing independent and autonomous defense construction.

In accordance with the current state of affairs, the Constitution of the Republic of China has been amended seven times.According to the current state of affairs of the Constitutional Government of the Republic of China, even if the Legislative Yuan cannot change the legal provisions of the Constitution at will, it can only propose "Constitution Amendments", which are passed by the Legislative Committee and then re-submitted to the referendum, and become effective.The core values of the Constitution of the Republic of China and its amended articles are: democracy, rule of law, freedom and human rights protection, governmental institutions balancing each other, caring for women and disadvantaged and minority groups, ecological environment protection, social welfare and relief, implementation of compulsory education, agriculture and science and technology, and economic development.

In August 1939, the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany signed the Treaty of Non-Aggression with the aim of gaining time and space to respond to possible future German military operations. Under this treaty, the Soviet Union regained territory it had controlled during the Soviet era after the German invasion of Poland. On June 22, 1941, Germany tore up the Treaty of Non-Aggression and launched Operation Barbarossa, a full-scale invasion of the Soviet Union. Because Stalin did not believe that Germany would attack the Soviet Union immediately after the end of the war in Western Europe, the Soviet Union suffered a disastrous defeat in the early stages of the war, and German forces even attacked the outskirts of Moscow once. But depending on a series of key battles and aid from Britain and the United States during this period, the Soviet Union eventually defeated Nazi Germany with other allies and won the victory of World War II.

The Voyager 1 probe was originally part of the Voyager program, and was named Voyager 11. However, due to budget cuts, NASA created an independent program: the Jupiter-Saturn Voyager program, which was simultaneously reduced to a smaller version of the Voyager program. This program was later renamed the Voyager program because astronomers believed that the probes were designed to far outperform the Voyager probes, so they deserved an independent name. Voyager 1 was built by the Jet Propulsion Laboratory. The Voyager 1 radio communications system was designed to reach and exceed the limits of the Solar System. The communications system includes a 3.7-metre (12 ft) parabolic surface antenna, a high-gain antenna, and transmits and receives radio waves through three deep-sky network stations on Earth.

The fifth army of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA) is one of the flagships of the Chinese National Revolutionary Army (NRA), which has been used on several branches of the army. The first to use the flagship of the NRA was the original "Fortune Army". After the beginning of the war in 1939, the Fifth Army, which was founded with 200 divisions as the backbone, became a distinguished unit in the war, and was incorporated into the Burmese army to enter the war in Burma. After the victory in the war, the Fifth Army was one of the five main components of the NRA. It was annihilated in the Battle of Huaihai in 1949 (i.e. the Qiu Qingquan Corps). It was rebuilt and withdrawn to Kinmen. Originally used as the "Fortune Army" of the NRA, this flagship was for the "Fortune Army" of Li Fulin, mainly a "Green Forest Unit", established in the Henan area of Guangzhou after the Xinhai Revolution, mainly active in the Pearl River Basin, the army was originally formed by local bandits and militias. Li Fulin supported Long Jiguang during the second revolution, so although he was inclined to the NRA, he was not disbanded.

This episode is the director's debut for Eric Clapke, the creator of Evil Power, and was written by Rael Tucker. Mary Winchester and Jessica Moore reprised their roles in the episode. Tucker won a Constellation Award for her writing. Hurricane Stilt was a large-scale tropical cyclone that caused severe flooding in Mexico and throughout Central America in September 1993. It originated from a tropical wave over the Southwest Caribbean Sea on September 14. It made landfall from Nicaragua the next day, passed through Honduras, and re-entered the Gulf of Honduras on September 17, but weakened to a tropical depression the next day as it passed over Belize. After crossing the Yucatán Peninsula, it strengthened into a Category 2 hurricane on September 20, and made landfall in Mexico near Tucson, Veracruz. It degenerated into a tropical depression on September 21 as it entered the Pacific Ocean from Nayarit, and dissipated over open waters five days later.

This constellation has two Messier objects: M44 located near the constellation Delta Canis Majoris; M67 located west of Alpha Canis Majoris. Both are open clusters. Gamma and δ stars mean donkey, originally when the Titan giants such as Kronos fought against Zeus, the wine god Dionysus, the fire god Herpestos and the donkey-riders joined the battle group, because the Titan giants had not heard the donkey, they thought it was a monster's cry, so Dionysus lifted the donkey to the sky, to commemorate.

Current projects undertaken by ESO include the Atacama Large Millimeter Array and the European Polar Telescope. ALMA, the largest ground-based astronomical project in the next decade, will become the main new instrument for observations in the millimeter and submillimeter wave scales. Its construction is underway and is expected to be completed in 2013. The ALMA project is an international cooperation project between European countries, Asia, North America and Chile. European executive authority is exercised by ESO on behalf of and also oversees the ALMA Regional Centre. The E-ELT, a 40-metre telescope, is currently in the fine design stages and will be the world's largest eye for observing the sky. The European Polar Telescope, which will greatly advance knowledge of astronomical physics, will be able to study in depth objects, including planets orbiting other stars, the first objects in the universe, supermassive black holes, and the natural nature and distribution of dark matter and dark energy that dominate the universe.

The ancient name of the Tunisian region was "Africa" (or Ifriqiya), which is the origin of the current name of Africa. afri is a common name of the Semites near Carthage (near present-day Tunisia), which derives from the Phoenician word afar, meaning "grey soil". Thus, ancient Rome adopted "Africa", which evolved from the word afar, to refer to the land of the Carthaginians. This ancient name has been in use until modern times. Tunisia was the birthplace of Carthage and the center of the country. This North African country ruled the sparsely populated regions of Spain, North Africa, and the Mediterranean coast, becoming the most prosperous country in the Mediterranean at the time, and thus became a strong enemy of Rome afterwards. Carthage's name referred to the land that Hannibal once invaded the capital of Rome.

Note that the Gini coefficient calculates only for a certain period of time, such as one year's income, and does not count assets, so it cannot reflect the distribution of the total accumulated wealth of the population. If the area between the real income distribution curve (red line) and the absolute income distribution curve (green line) is A, and the area between the real income distribution curve (red line) and the absolute income distribution curve (blue line) is B, then the Gini coefficient representing the ratio of income to population is AA+B. If A is zero, the Gini coefficient is 0, indicating complete equality of income distribution (red line and green line overlap); if B is zero, the coefficient is 1, indicating absolute inequality of income distribution (red line and blue line overlap). The coefficient can take any value between 0 and 1.

Track power is one of the forms of electrical power provided by electrified railways. It differs from railway transport in that it reduces the use of space above the track and on both sides of the track, and is common in closed rail transport, such as subway lines or urban transport systems, as well as in some intercity rail networks. Track power is a form of railway power supply. The concept of railway power is that, apart from the two tracks on which the train travels, plus one or two conductor tracks, the conductor tracks are usually located between or outside the two tracks; at the same time, electrical collectors are installed on the locomotive assembly or machinery to contact the conductor tracks and glide. Such collectors are known as "shoes" because of their shoe-like shape.

With the abolition of the policy of collecting surplus grain, the peasants no longer feared the unpaid collection of surplus grain, the abolition of the semi-feudal land system, an unprecedented increase in their work enthusiasm, and a significant increase in grain production above pre-revolutionary levels. While agriculture was developing rapidly, the state-owned heavy industry continued to make slow progress due to a lack of policy. In order to raise industry income, factories began to raise the selling price of industrial products, the resulting increase in the cost of manufactured products forced the peasants to produce more agricultural products to buy consumer products.

After the 1995 elections, the party formed a coalition government with the Right Way Party, which remained in power for only three months. In 1997, the Prosperity Party was strongly opposed by the military because of its strong Islamic religious leanings and its tendency to change the secular system of the country, and collapsed under military pressure. The party formed a minority cabinet for the third time. On 25 November 1998, the opposition party submitted a motion of no confidence to the Turkish Grand National Assembly on the alleged corruption of certain ministers and deputies of the ruling party and passed the bill by a 314-vote majority. The government resigned and became a caretaker government. Deputy Prime Minister of the Democratic Left Party, Mr. Birent Ejewitt, formed a coalition government with the Motherland Party and the Nationalist Action Party, and Mr. Yelmadz became deputy prime minister. Liren Business Co., Ltd., or simply Liren, is a Taiwanese company that sells organic products as its main business, and was established in February 1998.In June 1995, Liren Corporation's predecessor, the "Trustful Mutual Purchasing Organization" (Trustful Mutual Purchasing) was formed, and began promoting pesticide-free, fertilizer-free fruits and vegetables.In May 1997, "Trustful Mutual Purchasing" was established and implemented the grading system for fruits and vegetables and processed foods.In January 1998, the first Liren store was established in Keelung City; in February, Liren Business Co., Ltd. was established; in June, the first domestic organic "black beauty" watermelon was placed on the shelves in Liren, although its appearance is pale and tastes not sweet, but Liren encouraged the development of organic agriculture, and purchased all of it on the shelves for sale; in December, "Trustful, Mutual, Gratitude" was determined as the core value of Liren business.

Early theories suggested that the lowest-mass stars and hydrogen-burning stars had a limit of 0.07 M☉ in the first family of stars, 0.09 M☉ in the second family of stars, and did not undergo a normal stellar evolutionary process to become a dense star. In the late 1980s, deuterium burning reduced the lower limit to 0.012 M☉, and dust formed in the low-temperature atmospheres of brown dwarfs, raising questions about these theories. However, because they emit little visible light, it was difficult to find such objects. These objects radiate the strongest spectra mainly in the infrared, and infrared instruments on the ground were not yet sufficiently sophisticated to distinguish any brown dwarf easily. Since then, numerous searches by various methods have been conducted to find such objects.

Coordinates: 1°N 32°E / 1°N 32°E / 1; 32The Republic of Uganda (Swahili: Jamhuri ya Uganda), commonly known as Uganda, is a landlocked country in East Africa. It is a member of the Organization of the Islamic Conference (OIC). Uganda has a pleasant climate, fertile land, rich in copper, tin, tungsten and vanadium mineral resources, and during the British colonial period it was known as the "Pearl of Africa". During the second half of the 20th century, the country's economy suffered greatly due to years of civil war and misguided policies. It is also a member of the East African Community along with five countries: Kenya, Tanzania, Burundi, Rwanda and South Sudan. In recent years, six countries have sought to merge into the Union of East African States. Although human activity in Uganda dates back to 1000 BC, little is known about the history of people from other continents before entering the land.

In general, the functions of the people's government of the municipal district are less than those of the county people's government or the people's government of a county-level city, because many government functions are transferred to the municipal level. For example, the sub-bureaus of public security of the municipal districts can be administered by the public security bureau under the vertical leadership of the public security bureau. In particular, the traffic police battalions of the municipal districts are basically administered under the vertical leadership of the traffic police sub-units of the public security bureau, in order to unify the powers and responsibilities of traffic management in the urban areas. In addition, land resources, planning, industry and commerce, quality control, tobacco monopoly, inspection and quarantine, etc. are often also directly administered by the municipal bureaus.

Liu Zhaoxuan was fascinated with martial arts when he was young. It is said that he earned enough money to provide the three authors with further study abroad. During his six-year tenure, the academic status of Tsinghua University significantly improved, from an original university dominated by science and engineering to a comprehensive university that combined the life sciences and the humanities and social sciences.

China's earliest literature compiled books, poetry collections and poems, also describes the Xia, Shang and Zhou Dynasties some military theory fragments and strategy thoughts and the situation of war. On July 31, 1968, with the support of the Soviet Union, military leaders Marian Ngouabi and Ambrose Noumazalaye launched the "July 31 Movement" to overthrow the increasingly right-wing Masamba Deba. On August 5, 1968, the National Revolutionary Committee was established as the supreme organ of state, with Ngouabi as president. In December of the same year, Ngouabi became president of the Republic. On December 31, 1969, Ngouabi founded the Congo Labour Party, becoming the ruling party of the Congo and the only legal party. Ngouabi served as chairman of the Central Committee of the Congo Labour Party, president of the Republic, head of state and chairman of the State Council. At the same time, it was announced that the country would be renamed the "Congo People's Republic".

The Cairo Conference, also known as the Six-Party Conference:2, was held in Cairo, Egypt, from 22 to 26 November 1943, by the United Kingdom, China, and the United States, with the participation of British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, President of the People's Government of China and Chairman of the Military Committee of the People's Government Chiang Kai-shek, and President Roosevelt of the United States, to discuss strategies for counter-attacking Japan and the post-war international situation, to formulate a strategy for allied cooperation against Burma and a plan of assistance to China, and to promulgate the Cairo Declaration, demanding the unconditional surrender of Japan, the return of all occupied lands, and the shaping of a new situation in post-war East Asia.

On August 21, 1935, the Ministry of Education issued Decree No. 11400, officially announcing the first batch of simplified Chinese characters. The number of simplified Chinese characters introduced was 324. On January 15, 1936, the fifth political conference of the Kuomintang Central Committee was convened, and the Kuomintang Central Committee member and examination director Dai Jitao presented proposals for simplified Chinese characters, and the first batch of simplified Chinese characters was provisionally implemented. In 1956, the Government of the People's Republic of China promulgated the Chinese Simplification Program, hoping to gradually achieve the goal of eradicating illiteracy throughout the country by simplifying Chinese characters.

Estimates drawn by independent research often differ greatly from official statistics provided by the government, leading to controversy. According to data collected in 1999, the government estimates that the total suicide rate is 13.9 per 100,000 people. Recently, data provided by the Chinese government are broadly consistent with external estimates. Between 2009 and 2011, 44% of suicides occurred among people aged 65 and over, and 79% among rural residents. The number of women committing suicide in China is slightly higher than that of men each year. China is one of the few countries in the world where the suicide rate of women is higher than that of men. A study conducted in 2008 (based on data from the 1990s) found that: at that time, the suicide rate of women and men was 3:1; the suicide rate of rural and urban areas was 3:1; at the same time, there was a significant increase in suicides among young adults and the elderly; it was clear that at that time, China's suicide rate was two to three times the global average; and among suicides, mental illnesses, especially severe depression, were rare.

The main rock layer of this hill belongs to the Joran Formation of the Early Miocene, generally composed of sandstone, powder sandstone and shale, mudstone, etc., among which the mudstone layer has poor corrosion resistance, so in the area of the intersection of the Inner Gate, Tianliao, Qishan, Yan Ness and other administrative districts with thick-layered mudstone in the Nijinxi River basin, it is easy to be eroded and cut by rivers, heavy rains, forming a ditch valley ridge, poor vegetation, shaped like the surface of the moon, often referred to as the "moon world." The southwestern plain area starts from the Taiwan Strait in the west, ends in the east in the Great and Xiaogang Mountains, north to Nijinxi, south to Gaopingxi, the ridge is a triangle slightly north-wide and narrow, the altitude is less than 100 meters, generally referred to as the Kaohsiung Plain. In conjunction with Kaohsiung City, the north-south length is about 50 kilometers, east-west width is about 10 to 20 kilometers, the area is about 800 square kilometers.

Uranium is highly radioactive, the most stable isotope being 227Ac, which undergoes beta decay with a half-life of 21.772 years. Due to the lack of long-lived isotopes, only trace amounts of it occur in nature in uranium ores, predominantly 227Ac, as a decay product of 235U. Each tonne of uranium ores contains about 0.2 milligrams of the element. As the chemical and physical properties of uranium and lanthanum are too close, it is unrealistic to separate the element from the ores. Scientists have produced it in nuclear reactors by neutron irradiation with radium-226. Uranium is rare, expensive, and highly radioactive, so it has little industrial use. Currently, it is used as a neutron source, and as a radiation source in radiation therapy. The French chemist André-Louis Debierne announced the discovery of the new element in 1899.

In astronomy, Pluto or Plutino-like objects are extrasolar planets with an average motion resonance of 2:3 with Neptune. Pluto was named after Pluto, using the Italian word for small additional -ino, meaning a small object trapped in a resonance orbit like Pluto. The name refers only to orbital resonance, does not refer to other physical properties, and was originally used to describe resonance objects smaller than Pluto, but now includes Pluto itself. Pluto is distributed in the inner part of the Kuiper belt, about a quarter of the known Kuiper belt objects are Pluto.

The route runs along Yanling Road to the northeast, passes through the South China Botanical Garden and the Trans-China Rapid Elevator Bridge. It then continues east along Guangshan Road, passes through the Forestry School, Kok Kok Village and Tianhe Software Garden, passes the Tai Guan intersection and enters the Wong Po District (former Luogang District). The route turns southeast through the Wong Po Village, turns east along Kai Cheong Avenue through the Siagang District, goes down the Northern Ring Expressway, and ends at the Lai Hong intersection at Xiang Xue Station. The first phase of the station will be located in the southwest of Xiang Xue Station (north of Wanko Shihua City, Foshan City), and the two stations will be separated by a small hill. The control centre will also be located in the Xiang Xue Station parking lot. The second phase of the additional Luogang section will be located in the southeast of Xiang Xue Station. In the 1997 Guangzhou City Rapid Track Traffic Network Planning Study (Final Report), the direction of Line 7 at that time was roughly the same as Line 6 at that time, the middle section will run roughly along the north shore of the Pearl River, and after passing through the Yellow Sands to the west, it will cross the river directly to the Kau Kaukou of Fang Village, and then again to the west, at the end of the Three Eye Bridge.

Chun-I Senior High School (Chinese: 君毅高級中學, abbreviated as CISH) is a private high school in Miaoli County, Taiwan. It was founded in 1929 in Shanghai (at that time Taiwan was still under Japanese rule) by Mr. Huang Zuoying, Mr. Zhou Zhiyuan and others. It was originally established to commemorate the martyrs of Zhang Jun-yi, hence the name of the school. After the relocation of the school, in 1959, the government chose to reopen the school at No. 25, Jiari Kogyo Road, Zhonggang Creek, Zhongnan Township, Miaoli County, Taiwan (the site was called "Zhongnan Palace Former National School Shan Jia Branch School" during the Japanese rule). In 1947, the school was relocated to Guangfu Road, today's Zhongnan Township, Miaoli County, Zhongnan National Primary School, and the founder Mr. Huang Zuoying was the first principal after the reopening. It is now a private comprehensive secondary school. On July 4, 1927, Zhang Jun-yi, then secretary of the Ministry of Industry and Agriculture of Shanghai Workers' Union, who was still studying at Shanghai Jiaotong University, was killed during the Qing Party of the Kuomintang.

Under the leadership of Chiang Kai-shek, the Committee for the Promotion of Academic Publication established a number of specialized institutions and committees, such as the Committee for the Promotion of Academic Publication, which is responsible for editing and publishing ancient thought texts, disseminating the academic essence to the younger generation, and publishing a large number of ancient Chinese books, such as Zhou Yi, Laozi, Poems, Mencius, The History of Chinese Literature, and The History of Chinese Literature, etc., in order to make the texts clear and easy to understand and make them comprehensible to ordinary people. A large number of ancient Chinese texts have been printed and published, contributing to the preservation of the achievements of Chinese civilization.

CPM (Chinese: 司徒志仁; 13 November 1923 – 6 December 1990) was the first Chinese officer of the Royal Hong Kong Police to be promoted to Assistant Commissioner of Police from 1977 to 1978. He was educated at the Royal Hong Kong Academy of Sciences, joined the Police as a police translator in 1946, became Deputy Inspector in 1948, and was promoted to Assistant Commissioner of Police, Commissioner of Police and Commissioner of Police in 1957, 1960 and 1967, Deputy Commissioner of Police for Planning, Deputy Commissioner of Police for Criminal Investigation and Deputy Commissioner of Police for Operations, respectively. He was one of the few Chinese officers of the Royal Hong Kong Police to be promoted to Assistant Commissioner of Police. In 1953 and 1961, he was sent by the Police to the United Kingdom for training and preparation for promotion to a higher position. In 1971, he was promoted to Chief Constable, Deputy Commander of the New Territories, Hong Kong Islands and Kowloon Districts, and several times served as Deputy Commander of the Hong Kong Islands and Kowloon Districts as Assistant Commissioner of Police. He was the first Chinese officer of the Royal Hong Kong Police to be promoted to Assistant Commissioner of Police.

In addition, minority languages such as Miao, Tujia, Dong, and Min (one of the main languages of the Yao people) are spoken in minority settlement areas in western and southern Hunan. Hunan was the site of three Miao, Bapu, and Yanget (Baet) in primitive society. Archaeological excavations in Ningxiang County, Anxiang County, Tsuen City, Lili County, Tao County, and Pingjiang County have proved that there was human activity in Hunan 400,000 years ago during the Paleolithic period, rice was cultivated more than 10,000 years ago, and the indigenous people of Hunan began to settle as early as 5,000 years ago during the Neolithic period. Since the 19th century, Hunan has had a profound influence on the modern history of China. In 1852, the Tsing Dynasty was ordered to form the Xiang army in Hengzhou to suppress the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom. In 1898, Hunan was the only province that supported the Wuzhi Reform Law. In 1899 and 1904, Yueyang and Changsha were opened as commercial ports, and Changde and Xiangtan were added as "ports".

On October 27, 2016, the Communist Party of China’s Sixth Plenary Meeting of the Eighteenth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, for the first time, merged the “supervisory organ” with the organs of power (the People’s Congress and its Standing Committee), the administrative organs (the People’s Government), and the judicial organs (the People’s Court and the People’s Procuratorate), and upgraded them from the constituent departments of the people’s government to parallel state institutions. To this end, the CPC Central Committee decided to establish a lead group for the pilot work of deepening the state supervisory system reform, with Wang Qishan, the secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, serving as the head of the group. On November 7, 2016, the General Office of the CPC Central Committee issued the “Pilot Program for the Development of the State Supervisory System Reform in Beijing, Shanxi and Zhejiang Provinces,” which defined the thinking behind the supervisory system reform.

At the beginning of December of the same year, Yaohan Brotherhood's first assembly hall - Shinfuku-in Temple was established, and on December 16, after the first assembly of the first assembly members were dressed, the assembly hall was officially proclaimed. The assembly was dedicated to St. John the Baptist, originally Yaohan Brotherhood named it "John's Church", and in 1933 Fr. Lei Mingyuan translated "John" into "Yaohan" as the assembly name, which means "Restoration of the Chinese Nation". At the outbreak of the Great Wall War in 1933, more than 20 monks and more than 300 religious friends formed a medical corps under Fr. Lei's organization to care for Chinese wounded soldiers. After the war, Fr. Lei also changed the assembly farm in Beiping Qinghe Town to a rehabilitation center for disabled soldiers. After the Suidong War in 1936 and the outbreak of the 7/7 Incident in 1937, the monks of the assembly also frequently assisted the Chinese army in medical care. However, Fr. Lei Mingyuan of the assembly was also arrested during the war by the Eighth Route Army, mistakenly thought to be a spy, and after torture was released in concert with the National Government. However, not long afterwards, on June 24, 1940, due to illness, the Association Hall was moved to the outskirts of Beijing City in 1942. Subsequently, due to the establishment of the People's Republic of China in 1949 and the relocation of the National Government, part of the assembly moved to Hong Kong Chongqing Ridge, founded Meiyuan Middle School, and carried out missionary and social welfare work.

Before 1986, soldiers and officers who were discharged from the armed forces were the main ones, seeing the hopelessness of the counter-attack on the mainland, demanded compensation from the government, a large number of honorable citizens demanded the government to solve the problem of granting land certificates, the next year the struggle became more and more fierce. In 1990, the Legislative Yuan passed the "Order on the Treatment of War Veterans' Land Certificates," then President of the Republic of China Li Tenghui announced on April 23, 1990. The compensation money was issued on January 3, 1990, 50,000 allowances per grade were issued, veterans and officers could receive 50,000 to 500,000 compensation money, to recover the land certificates. The total budget of the Ministry of Defense of the Republic of China for the compensation money for war veterans' land certificates was 8.8 billion, was allocated to the amount of 75.2 billion in 2002, then the unpaid budget was returned to the Treasury, then due to the decreasing number of recipients each year, the amount was not high, instead of the annual budget adjusted, currently there are 10 to 20 applicants each year.

In the 1980s, Wang Yongchang, Tsai Zhao Zhang and the representative of the National Assembly of the Kuomintang, Lin Zemin, invited students to donate money for the establishment of the first private university in Hsinchu, and obtained the approval of the Ministry of Education to establish a "private Chinese Institute of Technology." These 14 donors are now considered to be the founders of the University of China. The organization was founded in 1987 at a fishpond on Lake Yaolong Mountain, in March 1988, approved the application for the establishment of the Chinese Institute of Technology, then purchased the East Xiangli Yaolong section of the campus to build a school. In 1990, the Chinese Institute of Technology began enrollment, the first establishment of five departments such as electrical engineering, information engineering, industrial management, civil engineering and architecture and urban planning, and became the first high schools established before and after Taiwan's independence. In 1994, the Chinese Institute of Technology submitted an application to the Ministry of Education to change the name of the university.

In 1992, astronomers Alexander Waltzson and Dale Frail announced their discovery of multiple planets in the galaxy of pulsar PSR 1257+12. In 2000, astronomers discovered that pulsar PSR B1620-26 had a ring-orbiting planet (PSR B1620-26c), orbiting pulsar and white dwarf PSR B1620-26. The planet is the oldest planet ever discovered by man, at 12.6 billion years old. In 2006, a protoplanetary disk was discovered at a distance of 13,000 light years from Earth, called 4U 0142+61. The discovery team, led by MIT's Deepto Chakrabarty, used the Spitzer Space Telescope to observe the planet.

The M1903 Springfield rifle is a rotary recoilless magazine bolt-action rifle, designated in 1903 as the "0.30 caliber M1903 rifle" because it was developed by Springfield Arsenal. It is a manufactured rifle mounted by the U.S. Army during World War I and World War II. During the Mexican–American War of 1898, the U.S. Army recognized that the performance of the Mauser rifles mounted by the Spanish Army was better than the ".30 caliber Krag–Jørgensen rifles" mounted by the U.S. Army, especially in the Battle of San Juan Mountain, which caused heavy casualties among U.S. soldiers and prompted the U.S. Army to replace new rifles. The U.S. Ordnance Bureau will provide the Springfield Arsenal with the Mauser rifles, including the German Gewehr 98 rifle, for research and reference.

Eusociality is the most highly organized animal sociality. The term "Eusocial" was coined in 1966 by Suzanne Batra: Earlier only some invertebrates were classified as true social animals, while the currently known species that fit the definition of true sociality were distributed among several species of insects, a family of reptiles, and a small number of rodents, respectively. Known true social species do not originate from the same origin, even though various true social animals of the same evolutionary lineage are distributed among different evolutionary branches.

The financial system of the People's Republic of China is highly regulated by the government. With the economic and monetary policy of mainland China, the banks lend more and more money to enterprises and the government, which makes the government of the People's Republic of China have a more severe tendency to regulate the financial system. However, at the same time, in recent years, 12 free trade zones have been established in all provinces and cities. In the free trade zones, financial regulations have been relaxed, especially for the operation of legal entities. The overall financial system has been generally tightened, but the special zones have been relaxed. Before the reform and opening-up, the People's Republic of China implemented a single tax system. As the tax is not linked to the economic activities of enterprises, this system lacks dynamism. In 1981, the government began to levy taxes on Sino-foreign joint ventures and foreign sole proprietorship enterprises, and began the first step of tax reform. In 1983 and 1984, two reforms of the "benefit tax" have been carried out, at the same time, tax rules for foreign enterprises have been gradually established.

The European Southern Observatory (ESO) is an intergovernmental research institute for the study of astronomy in the Southern Hemisphere, an astronomical research organization composed of and supported by 15 countries. Established in 1962, it aims to provide European astronomers with advanced facilities and shortcuts to study the southern sky. Headquartered in Kaching, near Munich, Germany, the organization employs approximately 730 staff and receives annual funding of approximately €131 million from member states. The European Southern Observatory builds and operates some of the largest and most technologically advanced telescopes known, including the first new technology telescopes with active optical technology, and the very large telescopes consisting of four 8-metre telescopes and four 1.8-metre auxiliary telescopes.

Tai Po County is located in the eastern part of Meizhou City, Guangdong Province, China. Its northern and eastern borders are with Yongding District, Longyan City, Fujian Province, and Heian County, Zhangzhou City. Its southern borders are with Fengshun County and Raping County, Chaozhou City. Its western borders are with Mei County District and Meijiang District. It is an unpolluted mountainous area. Its beautiful natural environment has been hailed as the "Shangri-La of the Hakka World." The seat of the county government is Wulai Town (formerly in Chayang Town, transferred in the spring of 1961 to No. 191 Tongren Road, Wulai Town), the total area of the county is 2,470 square kilometers, the county population is 530,000 (2002). Tai Po County was established in the year 413 AD in the Eastern Jin Dynasty. According to the Tai Po County Zhi, "Tai Po, Gao Zhuang, is a flat plateau, only Xuan fruit and vegetable growers call it Tai Po; from the foot of Chashan Mountain (former county governor), Mai Wang Plain, counting hundreds of hectares, it is called Tai Po." At the time of Qin and Han Dynasties, it belonged to the territory of Jieyang County.

The Northeast Invasion of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA) was a military-level unit of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA) at the junction of Shaanxi and Shaanxi Provinces in Suiyuan Province between 1937 and 1946. After the outbreak of the Seven-Day War, Mazanshan left Tianjin for Nanjing with his former subordinates Zhu Zhongfu, Du Haishan, and Zhang Hechuan, and asked Chiang Kai-shek to go to the front to fight. On August 7, Mazanshan was ordered by Chiang Kai-shek to go to Jinbei Datong to establish the "Northeast Invasion Pre-deployment Army," and to take charge of the evacuation of the four northeastern provinces. Liu Gui's 5th Division of the 6th Cavalry Division of the 2nd Army of the Northeast and Liu Dachao, Deputy Commander of the National Army of Suiyuan Province, were transferred to Suiyuan as the basic cadres of the Invasion. On August 19, Liu Gui's 5th Division of the 6th Cavalry Division arrived in Datong. On August 24, Mazanshan arrived in Datong. His former subordinates Zhu Binshan, Cheng Dejun, and others who fought against the Jiangqiao River Bridge served directly in the army and organs; in Taiyuan, the Northern Bureau of the Communist Party of China dispatched Du Shiyuan, Kurita Wen, Xu Shouxuan, Zou Dapeng, Li Shilian, and others to Datong with a radio station, all of which were re-used by Mazanshan.
