The Eighty-third Army of the National Revolutionary Army has been formed three times in history. In October 1937, the 154th and 156th Divisions of the Eighth Route Army of the Cantonese Army were combined to form the 83rd Army, which belonged to the 12th Army Group. They left Guangdong for Shanghai to participate in the Battle of Songhua and the Battle of Nanjing. On October 12, 1938, the Japanese forces landed at Tai Ya Bay, Minoru Shan, Otou and Xia Chung (the Battle of Guangzhou), and some of the officers and men of the Mobu garrison left for Guangzhou. On the evening of that day, the Japanese forces captured Freshwater. On the 13th, the Japanese attacked Huizhou from Freshwater, Otou and Minoru Shan on Route 3.

Perpetual Help High School (Chinese: 永年高級中學; pinyin: Yīnnyūn-hīn-hīn) is a full-time secondary school located in Toku Town, Yunlin County, Taiwan. It was founded in 1961 by Father Yu Xuan De, a priest of the Eternity Diocese of Hebei Province, and became the first Catholic high school in the county. The name "Eternity" was coined to commemorate the donations of the Eternity Diocese priests and friends. It was founded in 1978 by Chiayi Diocese and is still in operation today. It currently has a junior high school and a senior high school. The original purpose of the Eternity High School was to raise the level of local knowledge and cultivate technical personnel, so the primary focus of the school was on junior high school and mechanical engineering. The mechanical engineering department was headed by Professor Reinhard Imohl, a former Guangdong engineer, and succeeded in inventing and assembling Taiwan's first early childcare device, and filed a patent, passing through all major hospitals in Taiwan.

San Min Book (Chinese: 三民書局) is a Taiwanese publisher and bookstore headquartered in Taiwan, founded in 1953 by Liu Zhenqiang, Ke Junchin, Fan Shuren and others, with the aim of "disseminating academic ideas, continuing cultural development," early publishing law and politics (law and politics), university books, San Min Library, Ancient Books Now Annotated New Translation Series, Dictionary, and later also publishing dictionaries and children's and teenagers reading, transforming into a comprehensive publishing organization. In 1953, Liu Zhenqiang, Ke Junchin, Fan Shuren jointly invested a new Taiwanese currency of 5,000 yuan, named "Three Little People" to establish "San Min Book", independently operated by Liu Zhenqiang. Subsequently, Fan and Ke left because of different intentions afterwards. San Min Book's earliest business location is located at 46 Hengyang Road, Taipei City Central District, Hongqiao Bookstore, stationery stand, opposite Daman Shopping Mall, storefront only 20 square meters, mainly to publish legal books.

He was assisted by the British Army officer, Sir David Henderson, who was the Union's Director-General. This move, led by the American Red Cross, went beyond the strict mandate of the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), and broadened the scope of the International Red Cross movement to include emergency response to non-armed conflicts (such as man-made or natural disasters). The experience of the American Red Cross in major disaster relief goes back to its inception. The formation of the Union has led to a series of controversies. The ICRC is reasonably concerned to some extent about possible competition between the two organizations. The formation of the Union is seen as an attempt to undermine the leadership of the ICRC in the international Red Cross movement, and to gradually transfer its mandate and powers to multilateral bodies.

Qian'an is a county-level city in Hebei Province of the People's Republic of China, administered by Tangshan City, located in northern Shandong Province. Qian'an is one of the more powerful county-level cities, and has been approved as a "National Health City", "National Ecological Demonstration Area", "National Greening Model County (city)," National Sustainable Development Experiment Area" and "National Garden City" respectively. Area: 1208 square kilometers, population: 72.8 million (2010). Han Jingling County, belongs to Liaoxi County, Yuzhou; Liao Tianzhan 2 years (923), Jiding Province's Anhui County prisoners of war resettled in the present Qian'an land, called Anhui County; Jindaeding Seven Years (1167), changed to Qian'an County, belongs to Zhongdu Road Pingzhou; in October 1996, it was upgraded to Qian'an City. Qian'an City is located at the southern foot of Yanshan Mountain, on the banks of Luan River, with an east-west crossing of 39 kilometers, a north-south longitude of 45 kilometers.

As of 2021, China and Montenegro have not signed bilateral investment protection agreements. According to the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China, China's direct investment flows to Montenegro in 2020 amounted to $67.25 million, and by the end of 2020, China's total direct investment to Montenegro reached $153 million. Among them, the priority projects of the North-South highway (A-1 motorway), the Mozura wind power project, the first ecological rehabilitation project of the Prafulla thermal power station and the vegetable growing base in Danilovgrad, invested by the Chinese-owned enterprise IETC Organic Vegetable Development Co., Ltd., are four projects that are the main cooperation projects of Chinese and Montenegrin investments. In 2018, it was reported that Montenegro built the A-1 motorway with a loan from the Chinese Export and Import Bank, but the Montenegrin government's poor management and corruption problems led to a spike in debt.

(Chinese) Higher education should, according to ability, in all appropriate ways, and especially should gradually adopt a free education system, ensuring equal opportunities for all. Higher education is the education of various types provided by institutions such as universities, colleges of arts and sciences, colleges of science and technology and schools of instruction, including specialized education, undergraduate education and postgraduate education. Its basic admission conditions are completion of secondary education, and the award of a degree, diploma or certificate after completion of a course, as a proof of completion of higher education. Higher education has various forms, full-time and part-time, face-to-face and non-face-to-face, school-based and non-school-based. The degrees, diplomas and certificates awarded by higher education: Higher education as an educational method, is a stage in the way of human existence, in time terms, is a stage of lifelong learning choice in the course of human existence, in space terms, it is the last place of preparation for human entry into full social life.

Sailor 10's instrumentation and experiments included: In the first week of launch, scientists tested the camera's capabilities by taking pictures of Mars from the Earth and the Moon on November 5 and 6, respectively. Scientists obtained photographs of the Moon's Arctic region, which was less well known in previous exploration activities. These photographs also served as a reference for cartographers to update the lunar map and improve the lunar coordinate system. Sailor 10 made orbital adjustments on November 13, 1973, to enable the spacecraft to observe Venus. Sailor 10 also made ultraviolet observations of Comet Kohoutek in January 1974, and made a moderate orbital adjustment on January 21. Sailor 10 passed Venus on February 5, 1974, at 17:01 UTC, the closest distance to Venus being 5,768 km.

In 1924, he took the entrance examination in Luoyang, but failed. Du Fu's father was Yanzhou Shima, and he went to Yanzhou Provincial Prince, and began the Qi Zhao Tour. This tour was a joyous and pleasant time, mainly for hunting and singing: "In the middle of Qi Zhao, Jo Ma was quite mad. On the spring song stage, in the winter hunting by the blue hill." The Qi Zhao Tour. At that time, when the Kaiyuan was in full bloom, a faction was rising everywhere, Du Fu's emotions during this period, brave and proud, fierce and vigorous, bright and open. This is a characteristic of Du Fu's early poetry art. Tianbo Six-character, Xuanzong proclaimed the world "one who knows all the arts" to Chang'an, Du Fu also took the examination. Because the provincial minister Li Linfu conducted a farce called "None left a legacy", all the officers who took the examination were defeated.

After Zhou's departure, Ho joined the 10th Independent Division of Daedong, which belonged to Chen Shui-jin's division, as the first division of the army, to supplement Zhou's division. He also appointed Wang Dongyuan's division of the Third Tang Dynasty Military Instruction Corps as the instructor of the thirty-fifth army. In May 1928, Cheng Qian was captured by Li Zongren, and Ho Jian flew a plane to bring the 6th Cheng Qian's division together as the 17th and 19th Independent Divisions, with Zhou Xiwu and Zhang Qixiang as their instructors. The commander of the thirty-fifth army, Ho Jian, also served as the commander of Hunan Qingxiang Association, vice commander of Liu Jianxu, shared the command of six divisions, and at the end of 1928, the army was reduced to the 19th Division. After the defeat of Yan Xishan in the Sino-Japanese War in 1930, Fu Zunyi's 10th Jin army retreated from Suiyuan, and fell under the command. In January 1931, the vice commander of the Army of the Sea and the commander-in-chief of the Northeast Frontier Army, Zhang Xue Liang, reorganized Fu Zunyi's division into the 7th Northeast Frontier Army. On June 17, 1931, the Jin Sui army was reorganized into four armies: the 32nd Army (Shang Zhen), the 33rd Army (Shu Yongchang), the 34th Army (Yang Aiyuan), and the 35th Army of the National Revolutionary Army (Fu Zunyi).

William Herschel observed the Orion Nebula in 1774, describing it as "an unformed hot, thin mist that could become the chaotic material of the Sun in the future."When William Harkins (his wife Mary Harkins was his assistant) compared its spectrometer to different nebulae, he concluded that this hypothesis would have to wait hundreds of years to be confirmed.Some nebulae, such as the Great Aries Nebula, have spectra similar to those of stars, and deduced that galaxies might be a collection of hundreds of millions of individual stars.Others looked very different, either with strong continuous lines and superimposed absorption lines, or with a few emission lines, such as the Orion Nebula and some similar objects.The brightest was the 500.7 nanometer line, but no chemical element known at the time emitted a line corresponding to it.

The peculiarities of main-belt comets are that their orbits are flat (in the plane of the planet's orbit), near-circular (low eccentricity), asteroid-like, and not elongated, while all other comet orbits are often inclined. Because (118401) Linnell can produce comets (boiling steam that leaves the comet), it must be a frozen asteroid. When a typical comet approaches the Sun, ice is heated (directly from ice to gas), leaking gas and dust into space, creating a tail and blurring the appearance of the object. When away from the Sun, sublimation stops, the remaining ice freezes again, until the comet next approaches the Sun again. By contrast, objects on the asteroid belt essentially have near-circular orbits, and are confined to the interior of the Solar System, presumably most of the ice has been baked.

The Albanian flag depicts a black two-headed hawk, followed by the seal of Skanderbeg, the leader of the resistance to the Ottoman invasion in the 15th century. The hawk is the symbol of the national hero Skanderbeg, hence the name "Land of the Mountain hawks". The word Albania is the medieval Latin name of the country. It may have originated from the Albanian Illyria tribe (Albanët), recorded by the geographer and astronomer Claudius Ptolemy of Alexandria, who in 150 AD drew a map showing the city of Albanopolis in northeastern Dallas.

In May 1924, the English word "humor" was translated into "humour," and some people say that this was the first time that the Chinese word "humor" appeared, but it is not true, it is only the first time that the English word "humor" was translated into "humor" in Chinese. In the 1930s, the Enlightenment English textbook compiled by Linsheng Tong, and the first high school geography and physics textbook compiled by Zhang Qiyi and Dai Yun-hoo, became universal textbooks for all schools in the country. After 1935, he wrote works in English in the United States such as "My Country and My People" (1935), "Moment in Beijing" (1939), "Wind and Crane" (1941). "My Country and My People" introduces and translates Chinese traditional thought, philosophy and cultural art, describes the development of Chinese society and the character and spirit of the Chinese people, and is an important work for contemporary European and American people to understand Chinese culture.

Taiwan Highway 20 (Taiwan Highway 20) is a provincial highway that runs through the southern part of Taiwan. Because it runs through the southern part of Taiwan, it is commonly referred to as the South Highway. Starting from the west, it runs through the Zhongshan Road section of Yude Zhang Memorial Park in the central and western districts of the southern part of Taiwan. It runs east to Guanshan Township, Xizhuang, in Taitung County, and connects with Provincial Highway Route 9 near Degang Luqiao Bridge. The main line is 203.982 kilometers long, and there are two branch lines A and B. After entering the mountains from the end of City Road 178A, the boundary of Shantou District and Left Township District starts to the east, the Taiwan Highway 20 becomes the so-called South Highway. It crosses the Xinhua Hills, Jade Mountains, Central Mountains, and crosses the three cities of Tainan, Kaohsiung, and Taidong, which makes the Taiwan Highway 20 the longest provincial highway in the highway system organized by the Highways Bureau of the Ministry of Transportation. Currently, the Meishankou to Tianchi Road section (former Taiwan Highway 20 105.17K to 130.2K) and the Tianchi to Taitung County Haibang Rural Xiangyang Road section (130.2K to 153K) in Taoyuan District of Kaohsiung City have conditional access.

The Military Officers' School, also known as the Military Officers' School, is an educational institution for the training of serving officers of the Imperial Japanese Army. It was founded during the Meiji Restoration in 1868 and was formally established in 1874 as the "Kyoto Military School". It was immediately abolished after World War II and served as an intermediate base for the U.S. military. The main auditorium of the school became the International Military Tribunal for the Far East, which tried war criminals after World War II. It is also the only surviving building of the Japanese Military Officers' School in the base. The Tokyo campus of the school is located near the present-day Sasakusa-ji Temple. However, after the defeat of the Japanese in 1945, the school was demolished by Allied commander MacArthur as a World War II military facility. It is a well-known school, and its graduates are the backbone of the modern Japanese army. Almost all of the army officers were trained at the school.

Lianping County is located in the northern part of Guangdong Province, China, and is under the jurisdiction of Heyuan City. It is adjacent to Ping County in the east, Dongyuan County in the south, Xinfeng County in the west, Ongyuan County in the north, Longnan County and Quannan County in Jiangxi Province, and covers an area of 2365 square kilometers. It has a population of 39.65 million in 2021. There are 13 towns under the jurisdiction of Lianping County: Yuanzen Town, Sheepping Town, Neguan Town, Pitou Town, Xishan Town, Longjie Town, Tianyuan Town, Yauxi Town, Chungxin Town, Gaoguan Town, Dahu Town, Delta Town and Xiu Sai Town. During the Spring and Autumn Warring States period, Lianping belonged to the territory of Baietsu Province. After the establishment of Qin Shi Huangping in South Vietnam, Lianping belonged to the territory of Longchuan County in Nankai County. Since the establishment of the People's Republic of China, it has been under the jurisdiction of Huiyang Special District since 1963, it was briefly merged with its neighboring Ping County between 1959 and 1961, and it was under the jurisdiction of Heyuan City in 1988.

Most of the.su domain names are registered in Russia and the United States. It is reported that there are many Internet crime-related websites on the.su domain name. This is due to the loose, outdated terms of use of the domain name and the low level of interest in the domain name (registration is only 2% for another domain name.ru in its main use area). The remaining regular satellites are located outside ring A, inside ring G, and between the orbits of Saturn I and Saturn II, respectively. By convention, regular satellites are named after the Greek mythological god Titan or other gods associated with Saturn. The remaining 59 small satellites, with an average diameter of between 4 and 213 km, are commonly referred to as "irregular satellites" because their orbits are further away from Saturn and have a higher inclination, either in ascending or in descending order. These satellites are likely to be micro-planets captured by gravity, or fragments of micro-planets that have been captured and decayed to form collision families. Irregular satellites can be divided into the group of Inuit satellites, the group of Norris satellites, and the group of Gaul satellites, the names of which are derived from the corresponding mythology. Saturn IX, discovered in the late 19th century, is the largest irregular satellite in terms of volume.

The term "male" is used to refer to the biological sex distribution, officially only to refer to humans, but sometimes also to other organisms, and also to refer to cultural gender roles. Like most mammals, the male genome contains an X chromosome from the mother and a Y chromosome from the father. Compared to female embryos, male embryos secrete more oestrogen and less estrogen. The relative difference in the amount of steroids between the sexes is the main cause of the physiological differences between men and women. In adolescence, hormones stimulate the body to secrete oestrogen, leading to the development of a second sex characteristic, so that the two sexes have more pronounced differences. However, these differences may not occur in transgender or bisexual men.

The new Guangzhou Gymnasium, also known as the New Guangzhou Gymnasium, is located at 783 Baiyun Avenue South, Baiyun District, Guangzhou, in the former Baiyun Nursery Area, and is a comprehensive multi-functional sports facility, to replace the former Guangzhou Gymnasium, which was demolished on May 18, 2001 at the intersection of Jiefang North Road and Liuhua Road, near Yuxiu Park. Designed by the famous French architect Paul Andrew, the New Guangzhou Gymnasium occupies an area of 240,000 square meters, with a construction area of nearly 100,000 square meters, the main buildings include: Stadium No. 1 (Competition Hall), Stadium No. 2 (Training Hall), Stadium No. 3 (Mass Activity Center), three stadiums and administrative buildings, energy center, sports village, parking lot and commercial facilities, etc.

In general, ancient elephants are similar in tooth structure to other near- hoofed animals, such as the extinct Greater Scaup or the early representatives of the hippopotamus, but their teeth are more special. The reconstructed mandibular rows (from two left-hand fragments) constitute the complete sequence of mammalian primitive teeth: three molars, one canine tooth, four premaxillary teeth and three molars. The rows are closed, with no gaps between the canine teeth of the front and back teeth. These primitive mammalian rows are unique among long-nosed animals. The molars are usually bidentate (i.e., with small enamel tips on the bearing structure of the bite surface). Between these protrusions a horizontal strip is formed on the first two molars and the last one, which is typical of molars. The premaxillary tooth has only one ( mandible) or two ( maxillary) tips. The first tooth is relatively large and asymmetric, showing signs of shrinking.

In early 1882, he was selected as a candidate for the Jiaojin of Tianjin, and in May of the same year, he was elected as a Jiaojin of Hanlin Temple. In 1897, when Yuan Shikai was training at a small military base, Xu was also appointed as the General Director of the New Army Staff Office, and was one of Yuan Shikai's officers. He was subsequently promoted. In 1905, Yuan Shikai created a new-style police administration, appointed Xu Shichang as the Chief of the Police Department, and was responsible for the security of the Beijing Division. He was one of the five ministers who visited overseas. On January 9, 1906, the Qing court appointed Xu Shichang and Tei Liang as the Minister of Military and Aviation. On January 11, 1907, the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce appointed Xu Shichang and the Ministry of Civil Affairs appointed Xu Shichang to report on the situation in the three eastern provinces, the northern and southern parts of Changchun were divided into Japan and the Russian sphere of influence: 94. Xu Shichang took a number of measures, such as opening a trading port, borrowing state debts, linking with the state, repairing the railway, and implementing a new policy in the northeast, in order to resist Japanese and Russian control of northeastern China.

Plateau (French: Plateau) refers to a high and flat terrain, higher than the plateau. Plateaus of shorter age are generally flat, while those of longer age are steeper because of long-term indigenous erosion, and look like mountains. The western end of the Appalachian Mountains in eastern North America is actually such a mountain-like plateau. Plateau refers to an area with an elevation of more than 2,000 m, a large area, a wide terrain, bordered by a distinct steep slope, and a relatively complete large area of uplift. The world's highest plateau is the Tibetan Plateau in China, the largest plateau is the Antarctic Plateau in Antarctica, but the Antarctic Plateau is in dispute, and the Brazilian Plateau is also the world's largest plateau in individual countries. Examples: Note: The Indian Deccan Plateau, the Labrador Plateau in North America, with an elevation of less than 1,000 m, is therefore classified as a plateau.

He was the second secretary of the Shanghai Communist Party Committee (1967; participated in the seizure of power in Shanghai), a member of the nine to tenth Politburo of the Communist Party of China and a member of the propaganda group. He was the editor-in-chief of the magazine Red Flag and head of ideology (1970; succeeded the fallen Chen Berda); he participated in organizing political movements such as "Bailing Lin, Bailing Confucius, and Criticizing the Margin of Water," "Bailing Deng, Countering the Right-wing Overthrow Project" and so on. He was the head of "Ike Heng" and so on. He hardly wrote any articles in the Cultural Revolution, but published only "On the Social Foundation of the Lin Biao Anti-Party Group." On October 6, 1976, Yao Wenyuan was arrested after the Tiananmen Square Incident and was isolated from the CPC Central Committee. In July 1977, the resolution on Wang Hongwen, Zhang Chunqiao, Jiang Qing, Yao Wenyuan Anti-Party Group adopted by the Third Plenary Session of the 10th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China decided to permanently dismiss Yao Wenyuan from his party membership and to remove him from all positions within and outside the party.

At the end of 1996, the first Congolese war broke out because of popular dissatisfaction with the authoritarian corruption of the regime and the floods of refugees and economic burdens caused by the Rwandan genocide. On 16 May 1997, forces of the Alliance of Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Congo, led by Kabila, invaded the capital, Kinshasa. Mr. Mobutu renounced his presidential power and fled to the Moroccan capital, Rabat, where he died shortly afterwards. On 17 May 1997, the rebels took full control of the capital, Kinshasa. Mr. Kabila assumed the new presidency and renamed the country the Democratic Republic of the Congo, thus making the Republic of Zaire history. After the military coup d'état of November 1965, the political situation began to stabilize and the economy gradually recovered. GDP grew at an average annual rate of 5.2% between 1969 and 1974.

Born in Ishitang, Yin County, Zhejiang Province (now Ishitang Village, Takahashi Town, Kaishu District, Ningbo City) in 1971, Mr. Wang was born into a gentle merchant family. He passed the provincial examination at the age of 13 in 1902. He was admitted to the Shanghai Zhendan Normal School in 1906 (pre-university nature), passed the Zhejiang Provincial Government Scholarship Examination in 1908, went to Europe in October 1908, and arrived in Brussels in November. He received his doctorate in geology from the Catholic University of Leuven in Belgium in 1913. He returned to China in December 1913, and arrived in Shanghai in January 1914. At that time, he had also returned from abroad to study geology. Mr. Zhang Hongzhao of the University of Tokyo was the director of the Geological Institute under the Department of Agriculture and Commerce of the Government of the North Sea (actually a three-year geological school), and Mr. Dingwen Jiang of the University of Glasgow was the director of the Geological Survey. He was appointed to the Department of Agriculture and Commerce of the Government of the North Sea, and was a lecturer, chief professor, teacher of rocks and deposits, and director of the Minerals Division of the Geological Survey.

On average, each overseas post had 25,000 employees and 12,000 sailors. Due to the high cost of incense obtained from the merchants of Venice, Spain, Portugal, the United Kingdom, Denmark, Sweden and the Netherlands embarked on maritime adventures, established the spice trade, Portugal was the pioneer of the Age of the Great Navigation, commanded by the Portuguese Vasco da Gama, on the orders of King Manuel I of Portugal, set sail in search of the Eastern monarchs of the Christian faith, and went to India to obtain incense. Da Gama controlled the waters of the Indian Ocean by overwhelming force. In the 16th century, Portugal established trading posts and fortresses in East India, which included Southeast Asia (Malagasy), India (Guri, Goa, Blighd, Cochin, Colombo), the Arabian Peninsula (Mascat, Homs), Africa (Marindi, Mombasa, Kilwa Kiswani, Mozambique), and had commercial development, mainly in spice.

In the second year of marriage, Hu Jintao was born and had two daughters, Hu Jin Rong and Hu Jin Lai. After Hu Jintao entered school, Hu Jintao first attended Wuxiang Primary School, then transferred to Taizhou Taizhou Taizhou Primary School. Li Wen Rui paid attention to the education of children, so Hu Jintao brothers and sisters performed well. Li Wen Rui died in 1949, when Hu Jintao was only seven years old. Due to his father's busy tea plantation business, separated from his family, Hu Jintao brothers and sisters were raised by his aunt Li Wen Gui for a short time, but Li Wen Gui died soon after due to illness. Since then, Hu Jintao has raised three children by himself. In 1953, Hu Jintao was enrolled in a private Taizhou Middle School, and in 1956 in high school, he was loaned to Jiangsu Province Taizhou Middle School. According to his family members, Hu Jintao was quiet as a child, loved to read, and had a Confucian and harmonious personality. He had entered "Jiangsu Province Taizhou" in his curriculum vitae, but after being instructed by his father, he had entered "Anhui Qixi" from the beginning of middle school.

In 1945, the Japanese Empire surrendered to the Allies unconditionally. In Taiwan, the Japanese army surrendered to the surrendering agent of the Allies under General Order No. 1, and Taiwan was handed over to the National Government. The National Government and its successor, the Government of the Republic of China, promoted Chinese nationalist education in Taiwan, emphasizing the negative impact of Japanese colonization of Taiwan How Taiwan is now called during the period of Japanese rule from 1895 to 1945 is often the subject of heated debate.

He founded the Tri-Nationalism early in his life, and formulated a program for the revolutionary movement.:39. His views differ from one another.In 1895, Sun's uprising in Guangzhou failed, and many people misunderstood his meaning.The newspapers reported that Sun "has the talent of a troubled world, has formed a party, is semi-glorious, and has been helped by Europeans," and "will be poorer than he will be afterwards?":4141903, Zhang Shizhao selected the translation of Toraji MIYAZAKI's new novel "The Dream of the Thirty-three Years' Falling Flowers," signed "Huang Zhong Huang," titled "The Great Revolutionary Sun Yat-sen," in the preamble to Sun's great praise: "Sun Yat-sen, the first ancestor of the revolutionaries, implements the Northern Light of the revolutionaries, this is the opinion of those who have ears.... The Battle of Stalingrad was the turning point of the Second World War, the largest battle in modern history in terms of casualties and economic losses after the Siege of Leningrad, with an estimated total of 710,000 casualties on both sides. The number of soldiers involved in the battle was even higher than in any other battle in history. Particularly notable was the fact that the number of casualties on both sides was not taken into account, even reaching civilians who were not involved in the war. Initially, the German defence forces broke through the Soviet defences in a rapid offensive after the heavy bombing by the Luftwaffe. On September 13, 1942, the Germans invaded Stalingrad and fought a fierce street battle in the city. Although the Germans succeeded in occupying 90% of the city at various stages, they were unable to capture the last part of the Soviet defences. As the Germans slowly advanced through the city, the Soviets assembled a force of about 1,143,500 men on the eastern bank of the Volga River and on the northwestern outskirts of Stalingrad, and in Operation Uranus, launched on November 19, quickly broke through the temporary defensive line established by the Axis forces, surrounded the German Army Group VI and other Axis forces in the city, but was repelled by the Soviets.

A typical donor star capable of forming a shared envelope is usually a giant star, which has a large convection layer and a dense core, usually composed of degenerate matter. Due to the differences in the size of the core and the envelope, the core does not participate in the expansion of the envelope and the shared envelope, while the shared envelope will contain two objects: the donor star's distant core and the companion star. These two objects (initially) continue their orbital motion within the shared envelope. However, they are thought to lose energy because of the drag of the gas within the envelope, which will take them into a tighter orbit, and increase the actual orbital velocity (thereby increasing the kinetic energy of the two objects, but reducing their kinetic energy in the binary system more than the kinetic energy, thus ultimately resulting in energy loss). The lost orbital energy is assumed to cause the temperature of the envelope to rise and cause the envelope to expand, and at the end of the shared envelope phase, it may be that the envelope dissipates into space, or that the two objects merge within the envelope and do not have more energy to cause the envelope to continue to expand or dissipate.

The Army Quicksilver Academy, also known as the "All-China Army Quicksilver Academy" and the "Army Co-operation Quicksilver Academy," is a new type of Army Academy established by the Qing Dynasty during the Qing Dynasty. Its purpose is to provide personnel for the training of the new type of Army nationwide. In 1904, adopting the foreign education system, the Qing government's Military Training Office promulgated the newly established "Measures of Army Academy," Article 20, which stipulates: The Army Academy is divided into three classes: regular classroom, quicksilver classroom and quicksilver teacher's classroom. The regular classroom imitates the Japanese military education system, and is a part of the system of elementary classroom, middle school classroom, military officer's classroom (not established) and university classroom, second grade, fourth grade. The Army Quicksilver Academy was established in 1906. The first phase of recruitment in 1907, graduation in 1908. The second phase of recruitment in 1909. A total of more than 1,400 students. 1,281 graduates. In addition to Yunnan Army Quicksilver Academy, the Army Quicksilver Academy ceased to operate in all provinces.

Most of the events were held in Beijing, and some were held in other Chinese cities: Shanghai, Tianjin, Shenyang, Qinhuangdao, and Qingdao. Sailing events were held in Qingdao. The Games produced 43 new world records and 132 new Olympic records, and 87 nations were awarded medals. The host country, the People's Republic of China, was the first Asian nation to win 51 gold medals (and 48 after athletes were banned from competing), strengthening China's position as a sports power. The United States won 112 medals (36 gold, 39 silver, and 37 bronze) as the nation with the most medals at the Games. Two water and land "flyers" were born at the Games: American athlete Michael Phelps and Jamaican athlete Youssef Bolt, who won eight gold medals in the water cube, not only became the most gold medalists at the same Games, but also became the most gold medalists at the Summer Olympics; the latter won three gold medals in the men's 100 m, men's 200 m and men's 4x100 m relay in eight days at the Bird's Nest, earning him the honor of being the world's fastest runner.

Its climatic characteristics are: hot and dry summers, mild and rainy winters. In contrast to monsoons, the annual temperature difference is smaller. These regions are controlled alternately by the westerly belt and the subtropical high pressure belt and the convective belt. In winter, the westerly belt moves into this climate zone, the westerly wind brings moist airflow from the sea, plus frequent frontal cyclone activity, so the climate is mild and rainy. In summer, the subtropical high pressure or convective belt moves into this climate zone, plus the effect of cooling coastal currents, it is not easy to form precipitation, so the climate is hot and dry. The climate characteristics that form the summer dry winter rain. Mediterranean climate zone is often a tourist area due to the sufficient sunshine. The corresponding vegetation type of Mediterranean climate zone is the subtropical evergreen hardwood forest, such plants are characterized by generally thicker leaves, waxy leaf surface, to reduce moisture evaporation, adapt to a dry climate. Agricultural products suitable for production include grapes, olives, citrus, flowerless fruits, etc., so the world's famous wine production is concentrated in this climate zone.

On December 4, 2016, the first presidential elections were held in Uzbekistan since Karimov's death, and Prime Minister Mir Aliyev was elected as the new president. More than two thousand years ago, China and Uzbekistan had been linked by the Silk Road. In January 1992, the two countries established diplomatic relations. Since then, Sino-Uzbek relations have maintained healthy and stable development, and high-level contacts have been increasingly close. In 2011, Karimov visited mainland China and signed a series of loan and investment agreements with the People's Republic of China, which allowed the People's Republic of China to enter the oil industry in Uzbekistan. The "China-Central Asia" natural gas pipeline crossing the Uzbek-Uzbek border has been operating smoothly, and in recent years the volume of trade has been increasing year by year. In 2012, the Navoi-Tianjin (China) freight line was opened, and plans are underway to extend this line to Shanghai and Guangzhou.

In 740, under the leadership of Masala al-Hashir, a rebellion in the name of "the holy war" destroyed Khuda. Until the 9th century, the Mahaksa tribe of the Berbers rebuilt Khuda under the leadership of the leader Mahaksa, establishing a short-lived Banu Issamese dynasty. Later, under his grandson, the Issamese dynasty briefly served the Arab Idriss of Maghreb. Eventually, in 931, the king of the Issamese dynasty gave up the post-Wamaya dynasty in Córdoba to Khalid Abdul Rahman III, ending the Issamese dynasty. In 1031, the Caliphate of the post-Wamaya dynasty gradually lost control, the dynasty fell into chaos, and was eventually replaced in 1084 by the Berber-established Muradid dynasty. Afterwards, Khuda again became a base for the invasion of Spain, and in 1147, the Almohad dynasty, which replaced the Muradid dynasty, finally occupied Spain.

Kunqu is one of the plays of Chinese theater, originated in Kunshan County, Suzhou Prefecture (now Kunshan City, Suzhou Province) in the late Ming Dynasty and early Ming Dynasty, which reflects the extent of Kunqu's popularity and popularity at that time. Kunqu is centered on song singing, the words used in chanting are "Zhongzhou rhyme," mainly accompanied by flutes, drums, boards and other musical instruments, the style is delicate and refined, so it also has the elegant name of "Water mill chamber." Its stage performance form is also called "Kunqu drama," because of the rich means of performance, the body part has a high dancing ability, and the singing chamber and the lyrics are tightly sewn together, forming a sophisticated artistic norm, influencing all subsequent local plays, so it has the reputation of "the mother of hundreds of plays." Kunqu originated from the Kunshan chamber of Nanjing. Gu Jian, who lives near Kunshan, is credited as the founder of Kunqu. Gu Jian's first discovery in 1960, Wei Liangyu's book "Nanzhi Guizheng," according to this book: "There are several types of chambers, varying varying varying, all styles are limited, there are Kunshan, sea salt, Yu Yao, Hangzhou, Yiyang... but Kunshan is the right voice, it is said that Huang Bang Yuan in the time of Tang Xuanzong.

The President of the Republic of the Congo (French: Présidents de la République du Congo) is the head of state and government of the Republic of the Congo. Formerly a French colony, the Republic of the Congo gained independence from France on 15 August 1960. On the same day, Fulbert Youlou declared himself the first president of the Republic of the Congo after independence. Late in his tenure, mass demonstrations broke out in the capital, Brazzaville, on 13 August 1963, involving nearly 10,000 people. On 14 August, Youlou declared martial law, sent a large contingent of gendarmerie, police and army to suppress the demonstrations, and asked France to send troops to intervene.

The China Welfare Association (CWA) was founded by Mrs. Sun Yat-sen, the father of the People's Republic of China, one of the founders of the People's Republic of China, and the Honorary President of the People's Republic of China, Song Qingling. Its predecessor, the Defence of China Alliance, was founded in Hong Kong in 1938. CWA fully supported the Chinese Anti-Japanese War and moved to Chongqing in 1941. It changed its name to the China Welfare Foundation in 1945 and moved to Shanghai in 1950. Since 1949, the CWA has successively established the first children's art theater, the first children's art theater, the first juvenile palace, the first children's book, the first boarding school and the first women's and children's health clinic. Since the reform and opening-up, the CWA's business has continued to expand. It now covers women's and children's health, pre-school education, basic education, out-of-school education, children's drama, early childhood publishing, elderly welfare and eight charitable funds.

That is, the division of industries within different socialist countries. The essence is economic control and purchasing. After the Prague Spring, Brezhnev proposed the thesis dealing with the relations between the socialist family, that the socialist state belongs to one family, that other forces do not allow a country to be separated from the socialist family. That the dictatorship of the proletariat has exceeded the scope of one country, and that it can be carried out across borders. That any country in the socialist family involves the interests of the Soviet Union. Under Brezhnev's leadership, the great-power chauvinism of the Soviet Union gradually evolved into hegemonism. The Soviet Union not only imposed its model of socialism on the socialist countries of Eastern Europe and the People's Republic of China, but also intervened in other domestic affairs by military means, which became an important factor leading to the collapse of the Central Soviet.

Located in the southwest corner of Taiwan, Kaohsiung is a major city for maritime, military, industrial and fisheries. It has the largest commercial port, military port and fishing port in Taiwan, the only international airport in South Taiwan, as well as a railway, highway and railway interchange point. Today, Kaohsiung is a municipality under the direct jurisdiction of Kaohsiung Prefecture and Kaohsiung Prefecture. It was reorganized in 2010 as a merger of Kaohsiung Prefecture and Kaohsiung Prefecture. It has 38 administrative districts, with a population of 27.7 million and an area of 2946 square kilometers. The district extends from the Yushan Mountains to the west coast of Taiwan, and is adjacent to Tainan, Chiayi County, Nantou County, Hualien County, Tainan County and Pingtung County. The earliest known prehistoric ruins of Kaohsiung date back to about 5,000 years ago. Records show that today's Kaohsiung Plain and the foothills are mainly inhabited by Macanese, while the inland part is inhabited by Liwan ethnic groups, etc. Early Hokkien people called Kaohsiung "dog fighting" after the local indigenous people's name for the bamboo shoot forest.

Four years later, he was (incorrectly) persuaded by other scientists that erythromycin was the same as chromium. In 1830, Nils Gabriel Sefström produced vanadium chloride, thereby proving a new element, which he named "Vanadium" after the Scandinavian beauty and fertilizer goddess Vanadís (Freyja). Both names are attributed to the wide range of colours in vanadium compounds. Lead ore from Del Rio was later renamed vanadium lead ore because of its vanadium content. In 1867, Henrynfeldrosco obtained pure vanadium. Vanadium is naturally present in about 65 minerals and fossil fuel deposits. It is obtained from steel smelting slag in China and Russia. Other countries produce it directly from by-products of magnetite mining, heavy oil dust mining or uranium mining. It is mainly used in the manufacture of specialty steel alloys, such as high-speed tool steel.

Aichi Prefecture (Japanese: 愛知県/あいちけん Aichi ken */?) is a prefecture located in the central part of Japan, with the capital and the first major city being Nagoya City. According to archaeological findings, the "Ushikawa people" had been living and flourishing in Aichi Prefecture by the end of 100,000 years ago. Historically, Aichi Prefecture was the jurisdiction of Owari Province and Mikawa Province. The "Three Greats of Nagoya" of the Sengoku Period, Nobunaga ODA, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, were born in Aichi Prefecture. In 1871, the Meiji Restoration implemented the abolition of feudal domains, Owari became Nagoya Prefecture with the exception of Chitose County, and Mikawa merged with Chitose to form Nagoya Prefecture. Nagoya Prefecture was renamed Aichi Prefecture in April 1872, and then merged with Nagoya Prefecture on November 27, 1872, to form today's Aichi Prefecture. The prefecture's name comes from the Aichi Prefecture, which had jurisdiction over the center of Nagoya.

Fangcun was originally an ancient sea. Fangcun area belonged to Nanhai County in 313 BC. Fangcun was subdivided into Panyu County and Nanhai County in 1369 AD. Fangcun was incorporated into Guangzhou in 1937 AD. Shortly after the construction of the long embankment road along the East Embankment in Guangdong Province in 1906, Huang Jingtang, an overseas merchant from Xinning, Guangdong Province (present-day Mt. Taishan), purchased a large area of sand and gravel along the side of Baigong Lake in Fangcun in the form of a "family joint venture" and constructed a stone embankment stretching for one kilometer from Fangcun upstream (present-day Pearl River Tunnel Entrance) to Fangcun downstream (present-day Fangcun Ferry Pier). It is said that the embankment was constructed with lead irrigation. As a result of the construction of Fangcun long embankment, the city of Guangzhou emerged with Baigong Lake as the center, Lai Wan, Fangcun and Henan as three footholds.

On September 10, they discovered a satellite orbiting 2003 UB313, which they named "S/2005 (2003 UB313) 1". Because 2003 UB313 was nicknamed "Xena" (the heroine of the American television series The Warrior Princess), the satellite was also nicknamed "Gabrielle". Erisweid combined the observations of Kirk and Hubble with Erisweid's darkness rating of 4.43, and its orbital parameters were used to determine Erisweid's mass. Its orbital period is 15.785 899 ± 000 050 d. It is difficult to determine Erisweid's mass with a single observation, but Erisweid's orbital period is still estimated to be about 15 days.

After independence, Upper Volta experienced decades of political instability and many coups d'états. In 1983, the revolutionary forces represented by the young military officers Thomas Sankara and Blaise Compaore launched a military coup to seize power and establish a military government, with Sankara as President and Compaore as Minister of State and Minister of Justice in the Presidential Office. In 1984, Upper Volta changed its name to Bukina Faso, meaning "the land of the honest people," and launched a new national anthem with Sankara's lyrics and music, "One Night," which is still in use today. The Sankara government, which embraced Marxism-Leninism and supported the Cuban revolution, took a series of measures, including land reform, massive literacy, vaccination and forestry campaigns, the establishment of a property declaration system for officials, and at the same time vigorously promoted the status of women. These measures rapidly promoted the country's decolonization and industrial and agricultural development.

The will of Chiang Kai-shek, also known as the will of Chiang Kai-shek, is the will of the President of the Nationalist Party of China. The will of Chiang Kai-shek is currently engraved on the right under the statue of Chiang Kai-shek sitting in the hall of the Memorial Hall of the Nationalist Party of China. The earliest mention of the will in the Diary of Chiang Kai-shek is in March 1920, when he was serving in the Cantonese army in support of the Republic of Fujian. He often felt "squeezed by small people", unable to remember, so he made the will. The second mention of the relevant will is in 1922, Chiang Kai-shek resolved to go south to guard the "disaster" of Sun Yat-sen, before his departure he had the resolve to go back and forth. On the 20th, he "wrote Shijiang's will in the morning," entrusted his family affairs to his friend Zhang Shijiang. Another complete will, written in "September 18" after the incident, Chiang felt "overwhelmed with internal and external problems", afraid of himself "if he were to be unable to make the will." On July 5, 1934, Chiang said: "I, after my death, do not want to be buried in the state, and I wish to be buried with my wife Meiling in the crossroads of the west side of the mountains of the Ziyangshan Mountains.

On July 3 of the same year, Chiang Kai-shek went to Beijing to meet with the representatives of the PLA to discuss peaceful solutions. On July 8, Zhang Xue-lin sent Wang Shu-han, the governor of Jilin Province, Mi Chun-lin, the finance minister of the Ankou Army government, Xing Shilian, the former commander of the Beijing garrison, and Xu Zuxian, the military staff department, to Tianjin as a negotiating representative, and presented the negotiating conditions: On July 10, 1928, four representatives of the Northeast from Tianjin to Beiping met with Chiang Kai-shek, the two sides negotiated smoothly, and on July 24, they issued a "Notice of Independence".

Many tribes still live in a "stateless society". Others loyal to the Canaanites, a king of Asantehene (called "Henne", "Asantehene"), who has lost real power, believe that there is only "Asantehene nationalism" in the world, and not "Asantehene nationalism". Asantehene is located in the south of central Ghana, originally West Africa, the capital is in Kumasi, provided black slaves for western whites. Later it was colonized by the British, gradually conquered Asantehene northwards, forming the model of today's Ghana. The British actions provoked fierce resistance of the Asantehene, the king of Asantehene was also expelled in 1902, but the area of Ghana became more difficult to govern, so the British welcomed the return of the king of Asantehene in 1924, held the "Asantehene Repatriation Ceremony" in 1938, restored indirect governance of the "Asantehene Chief Council".

After the Second World War, Taiwan regained its independence in January 1935, reorganizing the city of Tainan, dividing the two cities of Tainan and Chiayi into provinces, and the rest into Tainan Prefecture. December 15, 1939, reorganizing the administrative regions of the province, annexing the northern area of the Eight Palm Springs to Chiayi City, and establishing Chiayi Prefecture and Yunlin Prefecture. The southern area of the Eight Palm Springs is now Tainan Prefecture. This prefecture belongs to the southern part of Taiwan, historically, culturally, politically, economically and in all aspects of the historical ancient capital have an incomprehensible connection, the relationship is close, so after the restoration, the administration of the prefecture was transferred to the new camp; the independent city of Tainan was established, but the prefecture still uses the name of Tainan Prefecture. The earliest period of development of this prefecture, the historical record is not clear. However, according to archaeology for nearly a decade, as early as the end of the Old Stone Age (i.e. 15 thousand years ago), there were 'left townspeople' in this prefecture, the early Neolithic period, this prefecture belonged to the Great Crater Culture Area, the middle belonged to the Cow-Hood Culture Area, the late belonged to the Great Lakes Culture Area, the subsequent gold stone and used the period until the end of the Ming Dynasty, the indigenous Pingpu and Silaya people lived in this prefecture.

Fidel Alejandro Castro Ruz (Spanish pronunciation: ; born February 19, 2008) is the younger brother of longtime vice-president and first vice-president of the Interim National Council of Cuba, formerly known as the Interim President of the Council of Ministers of Cuba. He was formally appointed President of the Council of Ministers of Cuba in 2008. Fidel Castro publicly announced on February 19, 2008, that he would not seek the post of President of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, but that he had in fact handed over power to him two years earlier. His political ideology is known as Castroism. Castro was born on a sugarcane farm in the town of Bilán, in the province of Ollantaytambo, Cuba. He is the third child of his parents, and his father, Ángel, is a Spanish immigrant who is wealthy because of his sugar plantation business.

Cantonese, colloquially known as Cantonese, also known as Bai dialect in Cantonese-speaking areas, is a tonal language of the Sino-Tibetan language family:103. Cantonese, if considered as a language, is the first-level dialect of the Chinese language formed in Guangdong and Guangxi regions, followed by several second-level dialects; Cantonese, if considered as a language of the Chinese language family, is one of the languages, followed by several Cantonese dialects. Cantonese has 84.9 million native speakers worldwide. In addition, Cantonese is widely distributed in Chinese communities in Southeast Asia such as Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia, and in North America, Europe and Australia, New Zealand, Christmas Island, and so on. Cantonese name originates from the first country founded by the Qin people Zhaotuo in the ancient Lingnan region — South Vietnam.

Kinsha Town (Taiwanese: Kim-sua-tìn) belongs to Kinsha County, Fujian Province, Republic of China, located in the northeastern part of Kinsha Island, due to the northeastern monsoon winds, severe wind damage, so that it is used to prevent the wind and sand. The terrain is slightly triangular, the south is adjacent to Kinhu Town. According to the Census Department of the Kinsha County Government, the number of Kinsha Town at the end of 2021 is about 6.5 thousand households, the population is about 210,000. Kinsha Town Hall is the highest-level local administrative institution of Kinsha Town, in the framework of the Government of the Republic of China as the administrative institution of town self-government, at the same time is responsible for the execution of county government and central agency commissioned matters, Kinsha Town's self-government supervisory authority is the government of Kinsha County. The mayor is directly elected by all the townspeople, the term of four years, may be re-elected one after another. Kinsha Town Hall and town council, as the highest decision-making body of town administration, under the mayor, has 6 divisions, 2 rooms, etc. 8 internal units and one subordinate institution.

He was born on April 2, 1890, in Mudong Village, Xingyi County, Guizhou Province.:282 He attended elementary school at the age of seven, primary school at the age of ten, and county high school at the age of thirteen; in 1901, he was elected first and sent to the provincial council Guiyang Army Primary School.:283 In November 1916, Wang Wenhua led the Qiang army into Sichuan to defeat Liu Zhenhao, he was the commander of the fifth regiment of the Qiang army, led the army out of Guizhou to defeat the upper Yangtze River Commander General and Sichuan envoy Wu Guangxin; in December, the defeat of the Wu army in Huangjiao, forced Wu Guangxin to withdraw from Chongqing.:283 In 1919, he imitated the Italian kingdom founding hero Ma Zhini's "Young Italy" organization, founded the "Young Guizhou Association", became the chairman, became the Kuomintang's organization outside Guizhou, and soon established branches in 81 counties of the province, founded the agency publication "Young Guizhou Daily"; why Wang Wenhua united the provincial and foreign progressives to establish a new party, opposed to the old party led by Liu Hsingze — the Progressive Party, seized the government of Guizhou, laid a good foundation, so deepened Wang Wenhua's trust.:283

In recent years, there have been a number of high schools that specialize in enrolling junior high school leavers, such as the Chinese Christian College High School (which has been converted into a full secondary school), the Ming Edward Middle School (the same as before) and large supplementary schools such as Zunyi School, a day school run by Modern Education, etc., which also have classes at six o'clock in the middle or re-enrollment classes, but because each high school library is not favored by parents and students, leading to difficulties in enrollment, so they subsequently applied for an additional junior high school. As early as the 2015-16 academic year, there were only three high school libraries left. In September 2022, the Chinese Christian College High School opened a junior high school curriculum, and the school name "High School" was deleted, meaning that all high school libraries in Hong Kong were changed to a full secondary school. In addition, in the old school system, some schools specialized in pre-school courses, called pre-school schools, and provided students with admission to high-level examinations in Hong Kong to enter universities, such as Hang Seng Business School and Bao Liang Chuang Kai Cheng Pre-school.

Wu Qingqi (Chinese: 吳清基; born June 15, 1951) is a Taiwanese scholar, born in Jiari District, Tainan City. He is an honorary professor of the Department of Education at National Taiwan Normal University, Chairman of the Chairmanship of the Central Council of the Communist Party of China, and a director of China Culture University. He has held the positions of Director of Technical Education, Deputy Director of Permanent Affairs, Deputy Director of Political Affairs, Director of the Education Bureau of Taipei City Government, Deputy Mayor of Taipei City, and Minister of Education. In 2001, Sufan Chi, who was nominated by the National Party of China and the Democratic Progressive Party, ran for the office of Tainan County Governor, but was defeated by 44.5% of the vote. After the election, he and his best friends raised about 10 million dollars to establish a scholarship in the name of his mother. In 2002, he was awarded the 2nd Outstanding Alumni of National Taiwan Normal University. He served as the Director of Education in Ma Yingjun's office in Taipei City, and was widely regarded as a member of Wu's team. In 2006, Hao Longbin was elected mayor, Wu remained in the Taipei City Government, and played an important role in the policy of "one belt, one road" and "North-North Base Joint Measurement" in the Greater Taipei Region.

"Reminiscences of Li Zong Ren" is a memoir written in the summer of 1958, the former President of the Republic of China Li Zong Ren lived in the United States in person, by the historian "old colleague of the Fifth War Area" Tang De Gong edited. The whole book is about 600,000 words, completed in 1964, the English version and the Chinese version survived. The Chinese version has a total of 8 volumes, 72 chapters, about 600,000 words. In November 1980, the first public release in Mainland China, the Guangxi People's Press officially published two volumes; later reprinted by the publishing house of the Eastern Normal University of China in 1988, the same year Taiwan also published. Since 1990, it has been popular in Taiwan. The latest version is the December 2005 edition of the publishing house of the Guangxi Normal University of China and the first edition of Far-Range Publishing on February 1, 2010. The memoir describes the experiences of Li Zong Ren from the childhood "indifferent group" era, to the Chinese Anti-Japanese War as the commander-in-chief of the Fifth War Area, to the period of the President of the Republic of China in 1949, recorded the major historical events in modern China, revealed the political inside story, is a valuable historical material for the study of modern Chinese history.

As of June 2017, Carrefour has 7,180 convenience stores worldwide, of which 4,237 are located in France, 2,378 in other European countries, 485 in Latin America, 32 in Asia, and 48 in other countries.Carrefour means "crossroads" in French, since Carrefour opened its first supermarket in June 1960, at the crossroads of Anci Parmelan Avenue and André-Theuriet Avenue in France.

Kang Yue (March 19, 1858 - March 31, 1927) was the main instigator of the Meiji Restoration in the late Qing Dynasty, originally known as 祖, 字广厦,号長素,又号明夷,更生,西樵山人,游存 Chau,天游化人, 丹灶苏村人, 康南海,光绪二十一年(1895)进士, cooperated with his disciple Liang Qichao, also known as 百日維新, after the failure of the Meiji Restoration, escaped from the pursuit of Empress Dowager Ji. After the abdication of Emperor Xuantong in 1912, Kang Yue continued to oppose the republic, in 1917, he cooperated with Zhang Hoon, launched a military coup, supported the Emperor Xuantong, was restored to the throne, but was beaten by Dan Qi Rui within 12 days. He died in 1927 after a banquet. 高祖康, 字文耀,号炳堂,嘉慶辛酉科欽賜副榜,甲子科欽賜举人.

Aruba was annexed by the Netherlands in 1636, and remained under Dutch rule for about two hundred years, until 1805, when the Netherlands gradually lost control of Aruba due to the effects of the Napoleonic Wars, and was taken over by the United Kingdom, but returned to the Netherlands in 1816. The main economy of Aruba has undergone three stages since colonial times, the nineteenth-century gold rush was replaced in 1924 by the discovery of oil fields and the establishment of refineries, and tourism on the island has gradually increased since the 1990s, becoming one of the island's important economic sources. Aruba, part of the original Netherlands Antilles and also the richest of the islands, was elevated to an independent constituent state of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in March 1983 at a meeting attended by the Netherlands, the Central Government of the Netherlands Antilles and all the island governments of the Netherlands Antilles, including Aruba.

Shaka Zulu is the illegitimate son of Senzangakona, the ruler of Zulu. He was born around 1787. He and his mother (Nandi) were expelled by Senzangakona and fled to Mthethwa. Shaka became a warrior under Dingiswayo, the ruler of Mthethwa. After the death of Senzangakona, Dingiswayo assisted Shaka as the ruler of Zulu. The two clans became allies and fought side by side. Dingiswayo was later killed by Zwide, the ruler of Ndwandwe. Mthethwa was annexed to Zulu and accepted the rule of Shaka. Shaka continued to implement military reforms before the death of Dingiswayo, establish a team system, adopt standard strategies, exercise iron-armed rule over soldiers, and use strategies to expand the map of Zulu.

In addition, Table Mountain was named by another Portuguese navigator, António de Saldanha, meaning "table of the cape" (Taboa da caba). Previously, the mountain was originally named Sea Mountain (Hoeri 'kwaggo) by the local Khoi people. Cape Town's close ties with Europe began in 1652. Dutch captain Jan van Riebeeck and other Dutch East India Company personnel were dispatched there to establish a mid-way station to provide supplies for long-distance shipping to Asia. Their three ships arrived on 6 April 1652, and soon established settlements, vegetable gardens and orchards, which are still preserved today as the Company Gardens.

The Rewarding University Teaching Excellence Program is one of the programs of the Ministry of Education of the Republic of China in 2005-2017 to support tertiary institutions, belongs to the competitive awarding mechanism between universities. In the area of awarding and subsidizing private schools, the proportion of grants given according to academic performance is increased year by year, and the proportion of grants given according to the size of the school is reduced. Currently, this program has been terminated, the continuation of the program is the Deep Cultivation of Higher Education Program. With the rapid expansion of higher education in Taiwan, Taiwan's higher education has changed from elite education to popular education, the government's education policy has also changed from "government control" to "liberalization" and "academic autonomy", no longer from the top down to choose to build a specific number of universities, but encourages schools to apply to the Ministry of Education for project funding subsidies in a competitive manner. Among the numerous grant programs, most of the projects are focused on research grants, universities to compete for large grants, blindly pursuing to become research-oriented universities, causing most of Taiwan's universities to overlap features blurred in order to improve the teaching quality of Taiwan's tertiary institutions, and through the awarding mechanism to guide the development of university classifications, the Ministry of Education announced the Rewarding University Teaching Excellence Program in 2004.

Dong District (Chinese: 東區; pinyin: Tang-khu) is located in the eastern part of Hsinchu City, Taiwan. It is bordered by Kozi Lake Creek and Hsinchu Township in the east, Xinxiang Mountains and North District in the west, Baoshan Village in Hsinchu City in the south, and Tofang Creek in the north and Hsinchu City in the north. It has a population of about 221,000. Dong District and its neighbor Baoshan Village is the location of the famous Hsinchu Science Park, belongs to the important development area of high-tech industry in Taiwan. In addition to the bamboo grove, the East District also has transportation facilities such as Hsinchu Station, National Tsinghua University, National Yangming Transportation University and other universities, shopping malls such as Crystal City Shopping Mall, Big City Far East Big City Shopping Mall, Dadong Hundred Shopping Mall, and the famous historic site of Baoshan City. It is the core of the Hsinchu metropolitan area and an important area.

South Africa is the 33rd largest economy in the world. "South Africa" derives its name from the geographical location of South Africa at the southern tip of Africa. Since the founding of the Union of South Africa in 1910, "South Africa" has been used as an abbreviation for the English language of South Africa, reflecting the unification of South Africa from the four British colonies. Since 1961, the official English name of South Africa has been "Republic of South Africa".

The following fields have been ranked in the ESI Global Rankings: Electrical and Mechanical Engineering Department participated in the "2010 Earthquake Engineering Model Making International Competition" organized by the National Center for Earthquake Engineering, and won the Grand Competition.
