On November 7, 2015, the leaders of the two sides met in Singapore. Currently, the relationship between the two sides of the Strait is not only related to the interests of the two sides, but also to the situation in the Asia-Pacific region, as well as the strategic layout of the two major world powers, China and the United States, and global security, has become one of the focuses of global attention. At the same time, the rise of Taiwan's mainland consciousness and the collision with Mainland China's mainland consciousness of China's unification, making the relationship between the two sides of the Strait even more complicated. The relationship between the two sides of the Strait is also referred to as Taiwan-Taiwan relations, the relationship between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait, or land-Taiwan relations, and the relationship between Fujian and Taiwan is referred to as the relationship between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait. The relationship between the two sides of the Strait before the Second Sino-Japanese War is often also referred to as the relationship between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait. Following the transfer of sovereignty between Hong Kong and Macau in 1997 and 1999 respectively to the People's Republic of China, the relationship between the Republic of China and Hong Kong and Macau can also be included in the broader bilateral relations, but is specifically excluded, will be referred to as "Taiwan-Hong Kong relations" and "Taiwan-Australia relations".

At that time, ocean voyages meant adventure: they could not measure longitude accurately. With the advent of the new shipping lanes, cultural and trade ties between East and West increased greatly, spreading Western civilization throughout the world, and imperialism, colonialism and free trade began to emerge. The expansion and rapid development of European territory laid the foundation for its prosperity over that of Asia. The discovery of the new shipping lanes had far-reaching effects on the development of the world's continents hundreds of years later. For countries and peoples other than Europe, the effects of geographical discoveries were complex and contradictory. Apart from the exchange of goods, the death and occupation of indigenous peoples often brought with them a history of aggression, and it was not until recent years that American countries began to pay attention to the rights of indigenous peoples.

Coordinates: 25°05′31′′N 121°31′24′′E / 25.0918125°N 121.5232205°E / 25.0918125; 121.5232205 Shilin District (Taiwanese: Sū-lîm-khu; Basque: Pattsiran) is located in the northern part of Taipei City, is the largest administrative area of Taipei City. The northeastern part of the district is Datun Volcanic Group, with the highest elevation of Mt. Seven Stars at 1,120 meters; the southeastern part is Dalun Mountain and Dazhishan Mountains. The plains are distributed in the southwestern part of Sulu River, the lower reaches of Gedu River and between Keelung River and Freshwater River. In 2010, Taipei City held a flower exhibition, the district of Shilin is a rose, the Taipei City Government Civil Affairs Bureau specially produced flower plate gate sign. The Taipei City Light Festival in 2021 and the Daybreak Night in 2022 are all held in Shilin.

Guangzhou Racecourse Bus Co., Ltd. (Chinese: 广州马会巴士有限公司) is a bus company jointly invested by Guangzhou Bus Group Third Bus Co., Ltd. and Guangzhou Racecourse and Guangzhou Racecourse Entertainment General Co., Ltd., and officially licensed on December 8, 1994. The company is located on the site of the former Guangzhou Racecourse Factory on the west side of Huangpu Avenue in Tianhe District, Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province, China. It currently operates four urban routes and one night-time route. The construction of the Racecourse Bus began on August 18, 1994, and officially licensed on December 8, 1994.

T Tauri is a variable star in the constellation Taurus and is the prototype of T Tauri. It was discovered by John Russell Hind in October 1852. From Earth's perspective, T Tauri appears in the Kuiper belt, not far from ε Tauri, but it is actually 420 light-years behind it, and is not a member of the cluster formed with the cluster. To its west is the nebula NGC 1555, commonly known as Hind's variable nebula. Although this system is considered to be the prototype of T Tauri, it is the latter stage of the protostar formation, a very untypical T Tauri star. The system consists of three stars: T Tauri N (T Tau N), T Tauri Sa (T Tau Sa) and T Tauri Sb (T Tau Sb). It is estimated that T Tauri N is about 300 AU away from the southern binary, with a separation distance of about 7 AU, and an orbital period of 27.2±0.7 years.

According to the History of the Republic of China in Cambridge, in his speech after the victory in the general election, Sung Kye-jin advocated a cabinet system, reduced the power of the president, and seriously considered overthrowing Yuan Shikai, but Sun Yat-sen supported Yuan Shikai at the time. In February 1912, Empress Dowager Long wrote to Yuan Shikai to form a provisional republican government, while the League formed a north-south assembly and established the provisional government of the Republic of China earlier than the Empress Dowager Long. The independent provinces of the South finally elected Yuan Shikai as the provisional president. In August, Sung Kye-jin reorganized the League formed the Kuomintang as the deputy chairman: 2632. In February 1913, according to the provisions of the Provisional Treaty of the Republic of China, the first parliamentary elections were held in China, with the Kuomintang formed by the League formed the most seats. Since the Provisional Treaty adopted a cabinet system to balance the presidential power, in its spirit, Sung Kye-jin, who was then the chairman of the Kuomintang, became the prime minister.

Vibration in the Sun is triggered by the convective motion of the outer solar system, and the application of this knowledge to observations of solar-like stellar vibration is the field of astroseismology. A significant part of the missions of several space probes still in use is that of astroseismology: red giants are late-evolutionary stars whose core is depleted of hydrogen and hydrogen fusion stops. The outer radius of the star expands to 200 times its original radius, and the core contracts. However, there are two different steps in the evolutionary process. The first step is that nuclear fusion occurs outside the core, but the helium in the core does not react; later, the core temperature will be high enough to trigger the helium fusion reaction. Previously, these two steps could not be determined directly from the stellar spectrum, and the details of the evolutionary process are not fully understood. The Kepler Space Telescope observes hundreds of red giants at relatively close distances.

The Constitution of the People's Republic of China, commonly referred to in Chinese as the "Constitution of the Mainland of the Republic of China," was enacted on December 25, 1947 (the 36th year of the People's Republic of China).Around the time of its enactment, the National Government of the People's Republic of China transitioned from a national government led by one party of the National Party of the People's Republic of China to a government of the Republic of China formed by all the people in accordance with the democratic procedures in the new Constitution.The overall process lasted from December 35, 1946 (the 36th year of the People's Republic of China) to July 1948 (the 37th year of the People's Republic of China).According to the political theory of the National Party of the People's Republic of China, the constitutional process was a transition from the "Lecture Period" to the "Constitutional Period" in Sun Yat-sen's National Government Building Charter, and the implementation of the Constitution was the last step in China's democratization, as well as the goal of the National Party of the People's Republic of China and its commitment to the people.However, the National Party of the People's Republic of China and the Communist Party of China erupted the Second National Civil War due to disagreement over ideology, after the Communist Party of China established the People's Republic of China in October 1949 (the 38th year of the People's Republic of China), the National Government of the People's Republic of China was again easy to handle.

After 1960, he was promoted to the first secretary of the Southwest Bureau of the Communist Party of China and the first commissioner of the Chengdu Military District, and became the most powerful leader of the southwest region of China, known as the "Southwest King." In a euphoria, in 1959, he announced the cancellation of grain tickets in Sichuan, causing great dissatisfaction among the masses. During the Great Famine, Li fully fulfilled the task of grain procurement assigned to Sichuan by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in the absence of food reserves in Sichuan. Although he guaranteed the supply of food to the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the big cities such as Beijing and Shanghai, but caused a large number of deaths due to famine in this province due to lack of food. At the 7,000th National People's Congress, Li was exposed to the scandal of deceiving the Central Committee, but Mao Zedong, Zhou Enlai and others expressed their appreciation for his emergency food relief, and at the end, under the protection of Deng Xiaoping, who sent to the Sichuan Group at the Congress to learn the situation, he was safe and unharmed, and was not prosecuted.

Antananarivo (Malagasy pronunciation: ), sometimes shortened to Tana, is the capital of the Indian Ocean island nation of Madagascar. Located in the heart of the island, at an altitude of 1,280 metres (4,200 ft), it is the highest capital of the island nation and has been the most populous city in the country since the 18th century. Historically, it was the capital of the Merindians, and the Merindians are now the most populous people in the city, with a population of 2.1 million (2013). All 18 Malagasy ethnic groups in the country live here, and more foreigners include Chinese, Indians and French. Antananarivo is the political, economic, educational and cultural centre of Madagascar. The presidential palace, the Senate and the Supreme Court are located here.

Galactic tides are tidal forces governed by the gravitational fields of galaxies, such as the Milky Way. Areas that are specifically related to galactic tides include galactic collisions, the collapse of dwarf or satellite galaxies, and the Oort cloud of the Solar System, which is affected by galactic tides. When an object (the blue object on the left) is in the gravitational field of a massive object (the yellow object), it is distorted by the tidal force. According to Newton's law of universal gravitation, gravity increases with distance. The closer one approaches another object B, the more intensely A is affected by the gravitational force of B. This is also true for different parts of the object, where the surface of A is attracted by B more strongly than the core of A. When the gravitational force of other objects is particularly strong, this causes the distance between the surface of the smaller object and the core of the object to be pulled apart, and the object tends to flatten in the direction of the larger object.

For a sphere, the surface gravity acceleration g can be obtained by the following equation: where G = 6.6742×10−11 m3s−2kg−1 is the gravitational constant, M is the mass of the object, and r is its radius. For an irregular shape, the surface gravity varies with the position of the surface, and the calculation is more complicated, so the above equation is only an approximate value. Generally, the closer to the center of mass, the greater the value of the surface gravity g. For a rotating body, the apparent weight of the object on its surface needs to be reduced by the centrifugal force.

Before becoming deputy to Chiang Kai-shek, Dai Kasa had anti-communist ideas. On April 12, 1927, when the Kuomintang was dissolved, Dai Kasa actively stood up to expose more than 20 Communists among his classmates, which was appreciated by Chiang Kai-shek. From then on, Dai Kasa began to work on intelligence work. In 1928, he began to carry out intelligence activities for Chiang Kai-shek. In 1930, he was a member of the "Investigation and Communications Group" of the National Government intelligence organization. In 1932, Chiang Kai-shek was establishing a special intelligence group under the Military Committee, headed by Dai Kasa. In the same year, Chiang Kai-shek secretly ordered Dai Kasa and other members of the Party secret organizations "Lipyosha" (also known as "Blue Coat Society") and "Chinese Reconstruction Society", of which Dai Kasa was the Director of the Special Affairs Department of the Chinese Reconstruction Society, and independent of the Central Intelligence Agency of the CC, Dai Kasa developed a special affairs network through the Lipyosha and other organizations. In 1938, the "Military Committee Investigation and Statistics Bureau" (Chinese: 軍統), Dai Kasa was appointed deputy director.

The cycle converts two amino acids (from ammonia and aspartate, respectively) and a carbon atom from HCO3−, consumes four "high-energy" phosphate keys (3ATP hydrolyzes to 2ADP and 1AMP), and produces a relatively harmless metabolite, urea, which is excreted in the urine. Toluene is the carrier of these carbon and nitrogen atoms. Thus, the overall equation for the urea cycle is: since fumarate is removed by means of reactions 3 and 4 (by removing NH3 from aspartate), and PPi + H2O → 2 Pi, the equation can be simplified as follows: the product is aminomethylphosphate, which will be used as the raw material for the cytoplasmic part of the cycle.

During the Spanish colonial period and afterwards, Uruguay and its surroundings were known as "Cisplatina" and "Banda Oriental", later also as "Provincia Oriental", and after independence as "la República Oriental del Uruguay". Early on, the eastern bank of the Uruguay River was inhabited by the Chaldeans. In early 1516, this area was discovered by the Spanish explorer Juan Díaz de Soares. It has been contested by Spain and Portugal since 1680. Finally, in 1726, it was won by the Spaniards and became a Spanish colony, establishing the military port of Montevideo. In 1776, Spain annexed the area to the Governorate of La Plata, then known as "Banda Oriental".

Taiwan (also known as Taiwan in traditional Chinese as "Tai"; Taiwanese: Tai-oân, Tairo: Tai-uân; Hakka: Thòi-vàn), also known in the Western world as Formosa (Portuguese: Formosa), is an island located on the northwest side of the Pacific Ocean in East Asia. It is an island in the arc of East Asian islands, located between the Ryukyu Islands and the Philippines Islands, west of Taiwan Strait and the mainland of China, the strait is about 130 kilometers away, the surrounding area from 3 o'clock in the clockwise order of the Pacific Ocean (Philippine Sea), the Bay of Biscay, the South China Sea, Taiwan Strait, and the East Sea. Taiwan Island has an area of about 360,000 square kilometers, ranked 38th (or 39th) in the current global island area ranking, about 70% of the island's landform is mountainous and hilly, the plains are mainly concentrated on the western coast, the landform changes greatly, the highest point is 3952 meters.

Jipeng Fei (February 2, 1910 – February 10, 2000) was a politician and diplomat of the People's Republic of China. He was born in Linzhi County, Shanxi Province. In 1926, Jipeng Fei joined the military medical training class of the Xi'an Army Hospital. He was a medical officer of the 274th Brigade of the 26th Road Army. He joined the Chinese Red Army after the Ningdu Rebellion in 1931. After the outbreak of the war, he was appointed Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Health of the Central Military Commission. Afterwards, he studied at the Party School of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CCPC) and the Institute of Anti-Warfare and Marxism-Leninism. In the winter of 1938, Jipeng Fei was appointed as the Director of the Political Department of the New Fourth Army's Rear and Political Coordinator of the Military Medical Department. In October 1945, he was appointed as the commander of the Seventh Platoon of the Chinese Central Field Army and political commissar. After the occupation of Zhejiang in May, Jipeng Fei was appointed as the commander of the Seventh Military Regiment and the Military District Political Commission of Zhejiang. He was also a member of the Zhejiang Commission and the Minister of the Propaganda Department of the Party Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CCPC).

The City of New York is the official name of New York City. New York means "New York" — York is the name of a place in the United Kingdom. New immigrants from York County, England, came to the city to commemorate the Duke of York, later King James II of the United Kingdom. "New Aberracken" is the old Latin name for York during the Roman Empire. The nickname "The Big Apple" originated in the 1920s. John J. Fitzgerald of the New York Morning Post called New York "The Big Apple" when writing his column on horse racing, to symbolize the city's prominence in the horse racing industry.

Biography writer Jay Taylor, a senior U.S. diplomat, scholar, and China expert, was stationed in Taipei in the 1960s to provide analytical reports to the U.S. government. Prior to leaving Taiwan in 1965, he had the opportunity to meet Chiang Kai-shek in person. After Sino-American relations were established, he served at the U.S. Embassy in Beijing. He later became deputy director of the U.S. State Department's Intelligence Service, and is now a research fellow at Harvard University's Fe Zhengqing Research Center. The author considers Chiang Kai-shek to be the "ultimate survivor," believes that Chiang's greatest aspiration is for China to be united and prosperous, and believes in the notion of a "cross-Straits envoy."

The permutation test is a statistical non-parametric test based on the principle of re-sampling and counter-argumentation, first proposed by Ronald Aylmer Fisher and E. J. G. Pitman in the 1930s. The zero hypothesis of the permutation test is H0:F=G, i.e., all samples follow the same distribution. The permutation test determines whether to reject the zero hypothesis H0:F=G and accept the alternative hypothesis H1 by comparing the test statistics after the sample has been replaced with the test statistics before the replacement.

The Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Macao Special Administrative Region (Portuguese: Gabinete de Ligação do Governo Popular Central na Região Administrativa Especial de Macau; Portuguese: Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Macao Special Administrative Region) is a liaison office of the Central People's Government (State Council) of the People's Republic of China in the Macao Special Administrative Region.

While the later expeditionary army was reorganized into the 34th Army, the number of 60 cannons was reduced back to the mortar battalion, but the 60 cannons were reduced to subordinate weapons, so the infantry regimental 60 cannons were increased to 9, according to the logic of the triangular division, the infantry division would be equipped with 243 60 cannons, further strengthening the firepower of the base infantry. Jackal, one of the 88 modern constellations, is also one of the 48 constellations of Ptolemy. This constellation is one of the southern constellations, located just south of Libra, southwest of Scorpio, that is, between the southern bright star Sirius II and the southern gate twin stars. Unfortunately, it is located near -40° declination, and the northern hemisphere is not easy to see. It contains the ancient Chinese constellations of Tennyson, Tennyson, Tennyson, Tennyson, Tennyson, Tennyson. Basically, this constellation has no particularly bright stars, but there are about 30 stars with a visual magnitude of 2-3. 70 stars with a visual magnitude of 6, including several binary stars and multiple star systems. The brightest stars are Alpha Jackal, a blue giant; Beta Jackal, a Chinese star named Tennyson. There is no clear mythical correspondence, sometimes it is said that it represents the Greek mythical king Lycaon. Ptolemy set the representative as a wolf. Greek astronomer Hipparchus separated it from the constellation Centaurus around 200 BC, called the "beast".

The First Republic of Venezuela, the Second Republic of Venezuela and the Third Republic of Venezuela, the Federative Republic of Venezuela and the Fourth Republic of Venezuela The history of the Bolivarian Revolution in Venezuela refers mainly to a series of historical events from the Spanish colonization of 1522 to the present day.In 1811, Venezuela gained independence from Spain, the first country in South America to gain independence from Spain.

In 2016, Shenzhen surpassed Guangzhou to become the third largest city in the total economy of the Mainland of China. In the list of global cities published by GaWC in 2020, Shenzhen once again entered the Alpha-level, ranked 46th, and is one of the six world first-line cities (Alpha-level) in the Greater China Region. It is one of the most economically powerful metropolitan areas in South China and even in the whole country. High-tech industry, financial industry, modern logistics industry, cultural creativity industry are the four pillars of Shenzhen's industry, in China's system innovation, expansion and opening up, etc.

The first National People's Congress (NPC) was convened in 1954, and the current thirteenth National People's Congress (NPC) took office in March 2018. At present, the plenary sessions of the NPC are usually held in March each year. The NPC and the CPPCC are also known as the "NPC-NPCPC Meetings." The NPC and its Standing Committee meet in the Great Hall of the People's Assembly on the first floor and the Standing Committee Conference Hall on the second floor, respectively. In the years between the founding of the People's Republic of China and the promulgation of the Constitution, the People's Republic of China adopted a unicameral system under the Common Program of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC), with the CPPC exercising the functions and powers of the highest organ of state, and the Central People's Government Committee exercising the functions and powers of the permanent organ of the highest organ of state.

The main function of the World Trade Organization (WTO) is to mediate trade disputes among its members. Joining the WTO is not tantamount to signing a multilateral trade agreement, but its membership thresholds can serve as a gateway to a willingness to reduce tariffs and to cooperate legally and participate in international trade. It is the organizational and legal basis of the trading system, the administrator of numerous international trade agreements, the overseer of trade legislation of each member, and the place where disputes are resolved and negotiations are conducted on trade. The Organization is one of the most important international economic organizations of our time, with trade among its members accounting for the vast majority of the world's trade, hence the name "Economic United Nations". As of July 29, 2016, the World Trade Organization has 164 members, listed below in alphabetical order by the names of the economies. The trade relief measures prescribed by the World Trade Organization (WTO) Agreement can be divided into three categories: anti-dumping, countervailing duty and safeguard measures.

The 2022 FIFA World Cup is the 22nd edition of the FIFA World Cup, which was held in Qatar from 20 November to 18 December 2022. It was the second World Cup to be held in Asia since the 2002 Korea-Japan World Cup. The FIFA General Assembly elected the hosts for both the 2018 and 2022 World Cups on 2 December 2010, and the bidders for 2022 included the United States, South Korea, Japan, Australia and Qatar.

Deng Xiaoping said: "In 1980, we proposed political system reform, but it has not been concretely implemented, now it should be mentioned on the agenda." In early November 1986, then Vice President of the Chinese University of Science and Technology Fang Qianzhi and then Vice President of the Chinese Writers' Association, People's Daily reporter Liu Bingyan visited Shanghai Jiaotong University and Tongji University to give lectures to students. Chen Baqu, a graduate student of Tongji University, and others organized an unprecedented lecture session for Fang Qianzhi.

– Europe (green and dark grey) – European Union (green) – (listening) is a country in southeastern Europe on the Balkan Peninsula. It borders Hungary and Serbia to the west, the Republic of Moldova and Ukraine to the north and north-east, and Bulgaria to the south. Romania has a small coastline on the west coast of the Black Sea, the Danube is the main border with Bulgaria, and flows into the Black Sea from the east coast of Bulgaria. The capital of Romania, Bucharest, is located on the plains of the Danube tributary of the Danube in the south of the country, and is the first major city and industrial and commercial city of Romania. In the Paleolithic and Neolithic eras, there was human activity in Romania, and historical records date back to 101-104 AD. Romania's ancestors were Dacians, one of the Thracians.

Animation is the illusion created by the motion (playback) speed (e.g. 16 frames per second) of a series of static solid images (frames) that change continuously at a certain frequency over time, causing the visual impairment of the naked eye—by mistakenly believing that a picture or object (picture) is active and its film technology. The production of the picture is most commonly done by hand on paper or celluloid, and other production methods include the use of clay, models, paper dolls, sand paintings, computers, etc. Due to advances in computer technology, there are now many computer-generated animations using computer animation software, directly on a computer, or using computer processing in the course of animation production, all of which have been extensively used in the production of commercial animation. Animation is usually produced by a large amount of intensive and tedious labor, even as computer animation technology has advanced and developed.

Zhuangshan did not want to, Emperor Han sent Han Qianqiu and Empress Dowager Xue's younger brother Xue led 2,000 people to South Vietnam in 112 BC. When Han Qianqiu and Xue entered South Vietnam, Lujia and others finally launched a coup. Lujia told the people that Zhao Xing was too young, Empress Dowager Xue was a Han Dynasty man, and had a relationship with Han Dynasty envoys, and wanted to belong to the Han Dynasty, wanted to donate the treasure left by the former king to Emperor Han Wu, and wanted to sell the South Vietnamese who followed him to Chang'an to Han Dynasty people as slaves, not to the South Vietnamese's grain, but to the favor of the Han Dynasty emperor. Lujia and his brother led troops into the royal palace, killed Zhao Xing, Empress Dowager Xue and Han Dynasty envoys. After Lujia killed Zhao Xing, the eldest son of Zhao Yingzi and the wife of the South Vietnamese, Zhao Jiande became the new South Vietnamese king, and sent people to inform Zhao Guang, the king of South Vietnam's feudal lords, and county and county officials under the South Vietnamese state.

Taiwan Avenue starts at the end of the Taiwan 12 Line. During the Qing Dynasty, roads were available from Taiwan Province City (now Central District of Taichung City) to Salah Street (now Salah District). After the urban redevelopment during the Jiji period, Sakurabashi-dori Street was constructed, and in 1939, Taichung Prefecture redesignated Taichung Salah Road as a designated road. After World War II, Sakurabashi-dori Street was redesignated as Zhongzheng Road, and the area around Zhongzheng Road was the main urban development area of Taichung at that time (the urban redevelopment area of Jiji City), and after the five-way section to today's Taichung Port along the line were agricultural and rural landscapes. In 1956, the Taiwan Provincial Highway Bureau opened buses from Tokai University to Taichung District; in 1958, Taichung Port Road was completed with paving oil road; in 1962, Taiwan Road was classified according to the Highway Law, Taichung Port Road and Zhongzheng Road were redesignated as County Road 134.

In the past, the Constitution of South Africa was regarded as a parliamentary decree, Act No. 108 of 1996, but after the Citation of Constitutional Laws Act 2005 came into force, the Constitution was no longer regarded as a parliamentary decree and hence no longer used as a parliamentary decree. In 1909, the British Parliament passed the South Africa Act 1909, which consolidated the four British colonies in South Africa — the Cape Colony, the River Swabia Colony, the Colony of Natal, and the Orange River Colony — into a single self-governing territory — the Union of South Africa.

In the 9th century, the Slovaks established the Duchy of Netra, which was then conquered by the Kingdom of Moravia and became part of the Kingdom of Great Moravia. In the 10th century, after the dissolution of the Kingdom of Great Moravia, Slovakia was incorporated into the Duchy of Hungary and became part of the territory of Hungary in 1000. After the dissolution of the Austro-Hungarian Empire in World War I, the newly independent Czech Republic and Slovakia formed the Czechoslovak Republic. During World War II, Slovakia became a vassal state of Nazi Germany. After the end of World War II, Czechoslovakia regained its independence. In 1948, the Communist coup d'état of February 1948 transformed Czechoslovakia into a communist state and accepted the leadership of the Soviet Union as a member of its Eastern Bloc. Over the next two decades, Czechoslovak nationalism and anti-communism rose steadily, culminating in the Prague Spring; in August of that year, the Soviet armed invasion of Czechoslovakia put a stop to this movement.

The Republic of Kazakhstan (Kazakh: Казахстан Республики / Qazaqstan Respwblïkası / кількаستان Πολυسپیشنبلىيكاسى; Russian: Республика Казахстан), commonly known as Kazakhstan (Kazakh: Казахстан / Qazaqstan / кількаستان; Russian:Казахстан), is an intercontinental country, located on two continents, mainly in northern Central Asia, with a small portion of its territory west of the Ural River in Eastern Europe. Kazakhstan is also a culturally Turkic state in Central Asia. Kazakhstan officially positions itself as a democratic, secular, unitary constitutional republic.

Information exchange among OECD member states is provided by the Paris-based Secretariat. The Secretariat centralizes data, studies trends, and analyses and forecasts economic development. It also focuses on social change and trade patterns, the environment, agriculture, science and technology, taxation, and other issues. The Organization helps member states maintain prosperity and eradicate poverty through cooperation in economic growth, financial stability, trade and investment, technological innovation, and business management. It is also committed to protecting the environment while promoting economic and social development. Other goals of the Organization include creating jobs for all, ensuring social justice, and building clean and efficient governments. The Organization is at the forefront of listening and striving to help member governments respond to new developments and concerns, including trade and structural adjustment, cyber security, and the challenges of poverty eradication in developing countries.

This value will change as the Sun's mass changes (although the change is extremely slow and minimal). In August 2012, astronomers voted through a new definition, the new definition being in meters (m) units: 149,597,870,700 m. The relative positions of the inner planets can be precisely measured from space probes using radar and remote sensing. As with all radar measurements, these measurements depend on the time it takes for the light to return from an object. Then, these measurements are compared to those calculated by astrophysics: the calculated positions are usually called a calendar table, and are calculated using astronomical units. These comparisons use the speed of light on astronomical units, with a value of 173.144 632 6847 (69) AU/d (Barycentric Dynamical Time, TDB).

The stars in the main sequence are called main sequence stars. The molecular clouds that form the stars are in the region to the far right of the diagram, but as the molecular clouds begin to shrink, their temperatures begin to rise, and they slowly move towards the main sequence. At the end of the star's lifetime, they leave the main sequence, moving upwards to the right, where the red giant and red supergiant regions are, respectively, low-temperature and high-luminosity stars. Stars that pass through the red giant but do not have a supernova explosion move across the main sequence to the lower left, where the high-temperature and low-luminosity regions are, respectively, white dwarfs, and then gradually fade into black dwarfs due to energy loss. In the 19th century, the Harvard University Observatory conducted a large-scale photographic spectroscopy survey of stars, obtained spectra of hundreds of thousands of stars, and classified them, eventually completing the Henry Draper Catalogue.

The report is prepared by the offices of governments at all levels, such as the Office of the State Council, the Office of the Provincial People's Government, the Office of the People's Government at the Local Level, the Office of the People's Government at the County Level, and so on. After it is submitted for examination by the government leadership, it is formally read out by the government's official leaders at the 2nd and 3rd National People's Congresses and published in print. The full text of the report is then published to the public through various media. The structure of the report is usually divided into three parts. It reviews and summarizes the government's work over the past year. It reports on the achievements of the government and the completion of basic economic indicators, and then divides the government's work into several broad categories (such as economic, social undertakings, labour, etc.), detailing the government's initiatives and achievements respectively.

In June 1938, the 3rd and 2nd Reserve Divisions of the 2nd National Revolutionary Army (Director Chen Mingren) and the 11th Reserve Division (Director Zhao Dingchang) were formed into the Eighth Army in Hubei Province. Li Yutang was appointed as the commander of the army. After the formation of the army, the army went to Jiangxi. In June 1939, he was assigned to the command of the Ninth Ward. In May 1940, due to the decision of the Ninth Ward to concentrate the key units to strengthen the fighting force, the military units under the direct control of the Eighth Army and the 3rd Division of the core fighting force were transferred to the 10th Army of the National Revolutionary Army, the 2nd and 11th Reserve Divisions were taken back under the control of the Military Commission, and the Eighth Army was naturally disbanded. In May 1941, the newly formed 11th Army of the National Revolutionary Army was reorganized into the Eighth Army. Cheng Dong Guo was appointed as the commander of the army. Shortly afterwards, the army was transferred to the southern Yunnan Province, and stationed in the vicinity of Wenshan (Kaigang). In the spring of 1943, the 244th Regiment of the 82nd Division was stationed in Inshan. During the period in Hunan and Guizhou, the regiment had been subjected to long-term deductions of salaries, officers and men had several times shouted at the divisional surrounded units to ask for salaries, the army, the commander of the regiment supporting the deductions, and the battalion commander of the resentment.

Ma Ying-jeou (Chinese: 馬英九; born July 13, 1950) is a Chinese politician and jurist, born in Yongxin County, Jiangxi Province. He is currently a professor of law at Dongwu University. He served as the 12th and 13th President of the Republic of China, the Chairman of the Nationalist Party of China, the Mayor of Taipei City, and the Minister of Justice. He was an English translator for the President of Chiang Kai-shek. He was appointed Deputy Director of the First Bureau of the President's Office of the Republic of China. He was also a member of the Research and Development Evaluation Committee of the Executive Yuan and a representative of the National Assembly. In 1993, he was invited by the then President of the Executive Yuan to serve as the Minister of Justice, and then he became a member of the Executive Yuan's Political Affairs Committee. In the 2008 presidential election, Ma Ying-jeou was elected as the ancestor of the Ma clan in Fufeng County with nearly sixty percent of the votes.

The National Taipei University of the Arts (NTU, formerly known as National Academy of the Arts) is a public university in Guangdong, northern Taipei, Taiwan. It is a major public university in the arts, performing arts, humanities, and creative arts. It is committed to traditional and contemporary, local and international interchange, deepening professional arts education, integrating theory and practice, creation and exhibition, art and technology, and other multi-faceted aspects. Its professional facilities include a theatre hall, a dance hall, a music hall, a movie theater, the first professional art museum in Taiwan, and a science and technology art pavilion under construction (expected to be completed in 2021). Unlike other arts universities, the university mainly accepts independent admissions, and competition is fierce, and the admission rate is low. Some departments also have individual applications, stars, special talents, and other channels. Based on traditional culture, my literary spirit, I cultivate artistic creation, exhibition and academic research talents, in order to create new opportunities for the development of the arts.

The military is a special group, and the military is also a special profession, and their speeches and actions are strictly regulated. In normal times, the military can express their political positions by participating in secret ballots, but the military will adhere to the principle of political neutrality, avoiding as much as possible interference in the political situation; in wartime, the military must obey the orders of the supreme leader of the state, defending the national territory and the security of the people. Because all actions of the military are in the interest of the state, defending the territorial integrity of the state and the security of the people. Therefore, the military should not fall under the control of a particular person or political faction, forming an instrument for controlling changes in the political situation. How to measure the degree of nationalization of the military, i.e. the extension of the nationalization of the military, is highly controversial.

The Iraq War is a controversial illegal war that has not been authorized by the United Nations Security Council. The Iraqi multinational force consists of 120,000 U.S. troops, 45,000 British troops, more than 2,000 Australian troops, 200 Polish troops and about 50,000 Iraqi troops. They launched military strikes against Iraq through U.S. bases in Kuwait. On March 20, 2003, the multinational force grew to 300,000 troops and officially declared war on Iraq, marking the beginning of the Iraq War. The U.S. 3rd Infantry Division advanced from the desert northwest of Kuwait to Baghdad, accompanied by several units of the U.S. 101st Airborne Division and 82nd Airborne Division. In the other direction of southeastern Iraq, the U.S. Marine 1st Expeditionary Force and the British Expeditionary Force (including the 1st Armoured Division comprising the 4th and 7th Armoured Brigades and several Marine Corps) launched pincer attacks to open Iraq's shipping lanes.

With a population of about 16.5 million, it was the most populous village in Taiwan before it was transformed into a municipality in 2014. It is home to the headquarters of famous large enterprises such as the Marine Corps Land Battle Sixth Brigade Military Organization, Hitachi Computer, Huaya Technology, Stemo Semiconductor, and the largest hospital in the country, such as the Linkou Changgeng Memorial Hospital, making it one of the industrial centers of the North Taiwan region and a developed and important satellite city in the vicinity of Taipei City. The earliest origin of the mountain came from the Kulon tribe, one of the Taiwanese indigenous Pingpu tribe, originally inhabited the area of today's Taoyuan City, originally classified by scholars as the Kedagren tribe, later Mr. Li Jinjie, based on the linguistic data he collected, proved it to be an independent tribe. Compared to other Pingpu tribes, the population of the tribe is smaller and is now almost completely Han Chinese.

Lee was born in a two-storey villa at 92 Kampong Java Road, Singapore, the eldest son of his father Lee Chin Koon and his mother Chua Jim Neo. Lee had three younger brothers and a sister; his second brother, Dennis, studied law at the University of Cambridge along with Lee; his third brother, Freddy, was chairman of a stock brokerage; his younger sister, Kim Man; and his fourth brother, Lee Xiang, a doctor who studied medicine at the University of Cambridge. In 1935, at the age of 12, Lee enrolled in the local English College of Letters (junior high school); in 1940, at the age of 17, he enrolled in the upper middle of the school, but dropped out after the Japanese occupation of Singapore.

After the death of Stalin, the Stalinist model lost its momentum and the Soviet Union fell into an abnormal development trajectory. After World War II, as the themes of the times gradually shifted towards peaceful development, the Soviet Union welcomed the "Amendmentism" of a new leader, and relations with the West became less harmonious. However, the insistence on military and heavy industry-first "Stalinism" still firmly controlled all aspects of the Soviet Union, suppressing the disadvantages of social dynamism further emerged, the subsequent amendments were abolished due to insufficient results, the Soviet Union remained in a stagnant and closed state, its development path was increasingly questioned both at home and abroad. The Soviet Union began to implement new economic policies in 1922, Lenin reformed the communist policy during the war, and stressed the further development of intra-party democracy. However, since Stalin came to power in 1924, a highly centralized political and economic system was formed.

High society (also known as upper class, nobility, house of lords, etc.) is the vested interests of a society that controls political power and the distribution of social and natural resources. In capitalist societies, the upper class includes entrepreneurs and high-ranking managers of conglomerates with the largest capital, investment bankers and venture capitalists. In feudal societies, the upper class includes well-known family members with noble titles. In turbulent times, the figures of the upper class are not always fixed, such as Louis XVI before and after the French Revolution, and after June 1790, as defined above, he is no longer the representative of the upper class. In socialist countries, the upper class refers to high officials of a party with privileges, having the "red nobility", the name of the new class (Japanese: 共産貴族; Russian:партийной  nomenclature).

On October 10, 1965, the Turkish general election was held, the Justice Party won a majority, the government resigned, and a new government was formed by Süleyman Demirel. He was subsequently appointed Turkish Ambassador to the United States. On April 29, 1972, President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan reappointed the former ambassador to the United States, the non-partisan Senator Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, as Prime Minister. At six o'clock on May 13, Erdoğan presented his cabinet to Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, who announced it to the press. At about twelve o'clock, Erdoğan informed Recep Tayyip Erdoğan that he would not accept the cabinet because he wanted the list of ministers proposed by the president to be made up of members of all the major political parties, a "non-partisan" military force that went beyond the requirements of the cabinet. The government proposed by Recep Tayyip Erdoğan existed for only four hours. Recep Tayyip Erdoğan continued to serve as a senator until 1972.

The "Opinion" calls for accelerating the application of information technology, improving the construction of mobile payment system, promoting the popularization of "one-card" urban public transportation, improving technical standards, accelerating the construction of interconnection and interconnection platforms, promoting interconnection and interconnection work, and basically realizing interconnection and interconnection across the country in 2020. On October 21, 2013, Beijing Zhongqiao Jin Card Technology Co., Ltd. was established to undertake the construction of the national one-card clearing and settlement platform for transportation. In 2014, the China Transport and Communications Information Center obtained the resources of the International Card Organization Application Service Organization Registration Identification Code (RID Code) and the Issuing Organization Registration Identification Code (IIN Code) which have been approved by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). RID Code is used to indicate the identity of the card organization application service organization, its component application identifiers have global uniqueness; the recipients of IIN Code will have the qualifications to become a card organization.

They developed customizable software to help them effectively locate, identify, and edit data stored on the Internet. In March 1994, Jerry's Web Guide was renamed Yahoo!. By the end of 1994, Yahoo! had received one million hits, and Ferro and Yang realized the enormous commercial potential of their site, and founded the company on March 2, 1995. On April 12, 1996, Yahoo made its first public offering, selling 2.6 million shares for $13 each, raising $133.8 million.

Nowadays, "extinction" refers to the extinction of the descendants of the same species that are identical in name and primitive appearance, and the surviving descendants are differentiated from their ancestors by the way species are formed. According to the 2019 Global Assessment of Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services by IBPES, the biomass of wild mammals has declined by 82%, natural ecosystems have lost about half of their area, and millions of species have been extinct. The risk of all extinctions is mainly due to human activities. 25% of all animals and plants are threatened with extinction. As of June 2019, one million species of animals and plants are at risk of extinction. Since 1750, the Earth has lost at least 571 species of species, and more are likely to be lost. Today's species extinctions are mainly due to human activities that destroy natural habitats, such as deforestation or conversion of land into farmland.

Liberia mainly celebrates holidays of some significance to its own country or Christianity. New Year's Day (January 1); Armistice Day (February 11); Cemetery Day (March 2nd Wednesday); President Robert's Birthday (March 15); Prayer Day (April 2nd Friday); Unity Day (May 14); Independence Day (July 26); Flag Day (August 24); Thanksgiving Day (November 1st Thursday); President Truman's Birthday (November 29); Christmas Day (December 25). Since 1462, Portuguese, Dutch, British, and French colonists have successively entered the area, and Europeans call it the "Pepper Coast", where slaves are traded. In 1821, the American Colonial Society established a Black "Immigration Zone" along the coast. From 1822 to the 1960s, the main settlers were freed slaves, and a portion of the American black population was transferred to the area, known as "Monrovia".

Pluto, also known as Charon and asteroid 134340, was discovered in 1978 by the U.S. Naval Observatory. Pluto is the largest of the five known natural satellites of the dwarf planet Pluto, with an average radius of 606 km. Charon is the sixth known extrasolar planet, after Pluto, Eris, Haumea, Orion and Co-op. Pluto is half the diameter of Pluto, one-eighth the mass of Pluto, compared to its parent planet Pluto. Pluto is a very large moon, it forms a double dwarf planet with Pluto, its system is centered outside of Pluto. The reddish-brown polar cap of Pluto is composed of thorium, an organic polymer, which may be the basic component of life. These thoriums are produced from methane, nitrogen and related gases released from the atmosphere of Pluto.

The historical development of South African language and its status in South African society is disputed. The Encyclopedia Britannica describes the language as follows: "Few languages can produce as much controversy as South African." South African was originally a Dutch-speaking dialect used in South Africa, developed essentially between 1652 and 1705 by European immigrants of Christianity and contract workers and slaves brought to South Africa by the Dutch East India Company. Most of these European immigrants were Dutch, and there were also many German and French immigrants. There were also some immigrants from Scotland and other European countries. As for these contract workers and slaves, apart from Malays from the Malay Peninsula, there were also Coycois and Busumans of African descent.

Faisal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (Arabic: فيصل بن عبدالعزيز آل سعود ; 14 April 1906 – 25 March 1975) was the third King of Saudi Arabia. He was born in Riyadh. He was the third son of the first King of Saudi Arabia, Abdulaziz Al Saud. He was the head of diplomatic affairs in 1930, commanded the army in the 1934 invasion of Yemen, his father died in November 1953, his brother Shat succeeded to the throne, he was made Crown Prince. He began the reign of the dynasty in 1958, became prime minister in 1962, relations with the king deteriorated, he seized power with other brothers, became regent in early 1964, took office in November. He was assassinated by his nephew Faisal bin Musaid on 25 March 1975.

Blue whales have a lung capacity of 5,000 liters. Blue whales have two pores and are protected by a large "shield". Blue whales have fins that are 3-4 meters long. The upper part of the dorsal fin is grey with narrow white edges, while the lower part is entirely white. The head and tail are generally grey. The dorsal part of blue whales is usually grey, and sometimes the dorsal fin is also this color. The degree of mottling varies from individual to individual. Some individuals may be grey throughout, but other individuals are deep blue, grey and black mixed together.

The Legislative Assembly is the highest legislative body of the Republic of China, shortly known as the House of Representatives; after the National Assembly was frozen, it is generally considered to be the Parliament of the Republic of China. It was formerly known as the House of Representatives (1913-1925), the first legislative body of the Republic of China. The Legislative Assembly was established in Nanjing in 1928 during the period of the National Government in order to restore the rule of law. Initially, it was a subsidiary body of the National Government, but in 1948, due to the implementation of the Constitution, the Legislative Assembly withdrew its administrative powers from the system and became a formal parliamentary body. It is now a unicameral parliament with 113 seats. In 1992 (the 81st year of the Republic), the Legislative Assembly began to be fully and regularly re-elected. All 113 members of the Legislative Assembly are elected by popular vote, and the President and Vice-President are elected by the Legislative Assembly. The current tenth member of the Legislative Assembly is sworn in on February 1, 2020, and serves until the expiration of his term of office on January 31, 2024.

All long-period comets have very large orbits, sizes in the order of thousands of astronomical units, and come from all directions, and are not confined to the ecliptic plane. The Oort Cloud occupies a very large space, and its closest distance to the Sun is probably a trillion (thousands of billions) of astronomical units (0.03-0.08 light-years) from the outermost celestial bodies of 2,000-5,000 astronomical units (0.03-0.08 light-years). However, the estimate has been reduced accordingly after a more accurate grasp of the distribution of the sizes of long-period comets. There is no similar estimate of the mass of the inner cloud cluster. Based on actual observations of comets, the vast majority of Oort Cloud objects are composed of "ice" such as water ice, methane, ethane, carbon monoxide and hydrogen cyanide. All support this conclusion. The Oort Cloud is the remnant material of the early protoplanetary disk that formed the Solar System 4.6 billion years ago. A model created by Julio Ángel Fernández shows that the main source of periodic comets is the discrete disk, and that it may also be the source of many Oort Cloud objects.

During this time he worked as a driver, then transferred to the Faculty of Commerce at Ritz-Carlton College (1928 - 1932), where he earned a Bachelor of Commerce degree. He then worked as an auto mechanic and workshop supervisor at a bus company. After World War II, he joined the 31st Motor Infantry Division of the Philippines. When the Bataan Peninsula surrendered in 1942, he fled to the mountains, escaping at least four Japanese raids. He organized the Western Luzon guerrillas, and became a captain on April 5, 1942. On January 29, 1945, he cleared the Japanese coast of the province of Trieste, helping the U.S. Army and the Philippine Federal Army land in combat. On April 22, 1946, with the support of some former guerrillas, he was elected to the Philippine House of Representatives as a member of the Liberal Party. In 1948, President Manuel Rojas sent him to Washington to attend the guerrilla affairs conference, helping the U.S. Congress pass the Rogers Veterans Act, for the benefit of Filipino veterans.

Tang Shaoyi (January 2, 1862 – September 30, 1938), also known as Shao-chuan, was a political figure, diplomat, and translator in the late Qing Dynasty. He was the first prime minister of the Republic of China in 1912, and later held various positions in the military government of Guangzhou and the National Government. He was assassinated in Shanghai on September 30, 1938 by agents of the National Government. Born on January 2, 1862 (December 3, 11th, Qing Dynasty), Tang Shaoyi was the fourth of six siblings in Tangjiawan Town, Xiangshan County, Guangdong Province (now Zhuhai City).

In 1948, he was elected Vice President of the Republic of China by the National Assembly. In January 1949, he succeeded Chiang Kai-shek as acting President. On November 20, 1949, the government withdrew from Chongqing West to Chengdu accompanied by the capital, and Li did not go as acting President together. Instead, he took a plane to Hong Kong to declare that he entered a hospital to treat stomach disease, and handed over the military dictatorship to the then Chief Executive Yan Xishan. Chiang returned to replace Li's absence, led the Kuomintang to continue the fight against the Communist Party of China. Li waited in Hong Kong for two weeks, and then left the United States with his family. Li did not go to Taiwan, was impeached in 1954. Afterwards, he returned to mainland China via Switzerland in 1965, died in Beijing in 1969. In the spring of 1908, Li was admitted to the Guangxi Army Primary School No. 3:92. On May 1, 1916, the Guangxi Military Capital Command was established in Zhaoqing:101.

Measurements during the occultation period set the upper limit of surface pressure of any possible atmosphere at 1-2 mP) (10-20 nbar). In January 1986, Voyager 2 conducted only one close-up study of the Uranus system and took several images of Triton, thus observing about 40% of its surface. Triton was discovered by William Herschel on 11 January 1787, the same day as the discovery of Oberlong. Triton and the other four moons were named by John Herschel at the request of William Lassell, who was supposed to have discovered Ariel and Uranus earlier that year in 1852. Lassell supported Herschel's seven known Saturn moons as early as 1847 and named the eighth newly discovered moons in 1848 on the basis of Herschel's naming plan.

On 27 February 1974, after the resignation of Raymond Machelin, Chirac was appointed Minister of the Interior. From March 1974, President Pompidou entrusted him with the preparations for the presidential elections, which would be held in 1976. On 2 April 1974, Pompidou's sudden death promoted the elections. Giscard d'Estaing was elected as the successor to Pompidou in France's most intense election campaign of many years. The new president chose Chirac to head the cabinet. When Chirac became President, he nominated Chirac on 27 May 1974, in order to reconcile the Giscard and non-Chirac factions in parliament, at the time Chirac was 41 years old. Chirac faced the hostility of the Baron de Gaulle. In December 1974, he led the UDR coalition. As Prime Minister, Chirac quickly convinced the de Gaulleists that despite Chirac's proposals for social reforms, de Gaulleism would be preserved.

Faced with the enormous development gap with the western industrialized countries and the situation of successive wars and defeats and humiliation of the country, the social quest for change and nationalism gradually emerged and intensified. In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, the southern Jiangsu-Zhejiang Lake area and some overseas countries began to appear a revolutionary group composed of overseas Chinese expatriates, trade unions, new army, students, etc., claiming to overthrow the Qing government and establish a new government. Since the Guangzhou uprising in 1895, revolutionary parties represented by Sun Yat-sen have launched numerous armed uprisings, but many were defeated by the Qing court. In November 1908, the leader of the Qing court, Empress Dowager Jixi and Emperor Guangxu died in succession, the inherited power and prestige of the ruling group was greatly diminished. In September 1911, due to the Sichuan Road Patrol Movement, the Qing government sent the army to suppress Hubei. On October 10, the Communist Party and Literary Society launched the Wuchang uprising, on November 11, the establishment of the military government of the Republic of China, and in the course of several months, the provinces responded, it was for the Xinhai Revolution, and Xiamen also declared independence on its own.

North America is the northern part of the Western Hemisphere (or Northern Hemisphere). It lies on the east coast of the Atlantic Ocean, on the west coast of the Pacific Ocean, on the north coast of the Arctic Ocean, and borders South America with the Panama Canal. North America also includes many islands in the Caribbean Sea (mainly the West Indies). North America covers an area of 2422.8 million square kilometers (including nearby islands), about 16.2% of the total land area of the Earth today, and is the third largest continent in the world. With a population of 5287.2 million (July 2008), it is the fourth largest in the world. The United States and Canada are the largest and most influential countries in North America in terms of area. North America is characterized by a mixture of tropical, temperate and cold climates. It has a temperate continental climate and a subtropical pine forest climate.

In the 1970s, oil production constraints led to a spike in oil prices, resulting in a boom in OPEC earnings and a long-term impact on the global economy. In the 1980s, OPEC began to set production targets for its member states: generally by reducing oil production to drive up prices. The organization's 2008 and 2016 decisions reduced the supply of oil in excess of demand. Economists often view OPEC as a typical cartel, because oil-producing countries reduced market competition through cooperation within the organization, and its negotiating behavior was protected by the principle of state immunity under international law. However, as non-OPEC countries further expanded their energy resources, OPEC's position in international trade was often challenged.

(a wholly owned subsidiary of Canzhong Bus Group), Guangzhou Canzhong insisted on the use of Chinese "Canzhong Canzhong" outside the car on October 8, 1994, and from time to time changed the car's broadcast language from Mandarin First Canzhong Second to Hong Kong's Canzhong First Canzhong Second.

Aluminum is the third most abundant element on Earth, after oxygen and silicon. It is an amorphous clay rock and is the main industrial mineral of aluminium. It consists mainly of different proportions of iron oxide hydroxide. Aluminum ore is not overly concentrated in certain regions, but is distributed throughout the world. However, it is difficult to extract it from ordinary rocks, so a higher content of aluminum ore is the main raw material for the production of aluminium. Aluminum ore is generally deposited in sea basins and lake basins, and can also be produced in basalt or other rock weathering shells. In 2007, aluminum ore production in Australia accounted for 30% of world production, followed by China, Guinea and Brazil. Types and applications of aluminum ore Based on the processing methods that must be applied during the processing phase of aluminum oxide, metallurgical aluminum ore is subdivided into two basic types: 1. low-temperature trihydrate aluminum ore (also known as trihydrate or tropical aluminum ore); and 2. high-temperature pumice (also known as monohydrate or European aluminum ore). Note: ABx aluminum ore is mainly a type of trihydrate-rich aluminum ore.

Coordinates: 22°59′03′′N 120°12′27′′E / 22.984129°N 120.207404°E / 22.984129; 120.207404 National Tainan University (南大) (Chinese: 南大) is a national university located in the central and western district of Tainan City, Taiwan.

In 1498, Portuguese explorers landed on the coast of Mozambique. At the same time as the rapid development of East Africa, Portugal turned its attention to India and Brazil. In the 19th century, European colonies in Africa entered their heyday. After losing the vast territory of Brazil, Portugal began to concentrate on the development of African colonies, which led to direct conflict with the British Empire. These companies ruled from the coast to the interior, they set up large farms on their territory, and began to levy taxes on the local population. At the same time as the rapid development of the colonies, the resistance of the local people did not stop. In 1895, a resistance force composed of Mozambican and Zimbabwean tribes was eliminated, and in 1951, in order to announce to the world that Mozambique had greater autonomy, Portugal positioned it as an overseas territory.

In October 1945, he became a member of the Legislative Yuan. In early 1949, he went to Hong Kong. In the winter of the same year, he returned to Guangzhou to participate in the educational activities of the People's Republic of China. During the period of the People's Republic of China, he was initially the chairman of the Guangdong Province Educational Trade Union. In 1951, Xu was appointed as the president of Zhongshan University. He was originally appointed as the president of another university, but Mao Zedong wanted Xu to be the president, so Xu was appointed. Xu was a member of the first, second and third deputies to the National People's Congress, the third and fourth deputies to the Guangdong Provincial People's Congress, the third and fourth deputies to the National People's Congress Standing Committee, the first, second and third deputies to the Guangdong Provincial People's Congress. He was a member of the fourth, fifth and sixth deputies to the Guangdong Provincial People's Congress of the People's League of China. The first secretary is the title given to the heads of local organizations of the Communist Party of China, the heads of some military organizations and the main heads of the Communist Youth League of China, and is also the position of the highest leader of some political parties. Since the 1950s, local organizations of the Communist Party of China, from provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the Central Government to local, county and township Party committees at all levels to Party branches, have established the positions of "first secretary" (some also have "second secretary", "third secretary", etc.). Meanwhile, the main heads of Party committees at all levels are called the first secretary, and other leading members are called the second secretary, the third secretary, the secretary, etc., respectively. The establishment of such positions within the Party lasted until October 1987, when the thirteen great leaders of the Communist Party of China were officially abolished. Among the Party committees of provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities directly under the Central Government, the first secretary was established by the Shanghai Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China. In the early days of the People's Republic of China, the Eastern Affairs Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China directly led the work of Shanghai, and the name of the Eastern Affairs Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the Shanghai Committee was once used.

In astronomy, a QB1 object (Cubewano) is an object in the Kuiper belt that orbits outside of Neptune and does not produce an orbital resonance with the planet. Such objects have a semi-major axis of between 40 and 50 AU and do not enter the orbit of Neptune, sometimes referred to as a traditional Kuiper belt object. The orbit is nearly circular (with an eccentricity of less than 0.15).

From the late 1970s to the early 1980s, Deng led the uprising, advocated reform and opening-up, led the Vietnam War, abolished the lifetime leadership system for cadres, advocated family planning, promoted compulsory education, advocated one country, two systems, and opposed bourgeois liberalization.On February 19, 1997, Deng died in Beijing at the age of 92, and his ashes were scattered in the sea on March 2 of the same year.Deng's relatives, Deng Jimin, served as an important member of the Imperial Court, and was appointed the Shokyo of Daliji Temple:19.On August 22, 1904 (July 12, 1930), he was born in Guang'an, Sichuan Province, China:9, was named Deng Xiangshan.On the 15th day of Chinese Lunar New Year 1909, Deng was sent to a private school in Hongcun, where he was educated.

Nikolai Ivanovich Bukharin (Russian: Николай Иванович Бухарин; October 9, 1888 – March 15, 1938), nicknamed "The ABC of Communism", was a member of the Politburo of the All-Union Communist Party (Bolsheviks), an important Marxist theorist and writer of the Soviet Union, an activist of the international communist movement, and an early leader of the Bolshevik Party. Bukharin was one of the most important leaders of the early days of the Soviet Union, leaving numerous theoretical works throughout his life, and Lenin described him as one of the few theorists in the Soviet Communist Party. After Lenin's death, together with Trotsky, Stalin, Zinoviev, Kamenev, and Likov, he became the main leader of the Soviet Union. He was an important political ally of Stalin in the early years of his rule, and helped Stalin to expel Trotsky from the party, and later in 1926 helped to overthrow Zinoviev and Kamenev.

Huangxing and founded branches in the field, members respectively in Hunan, Shanghai, Tokyo, etc., founded organizations such as "Tong Hae-kai", "Huang Han-kai", "Patriotic Association", "New Huang-kai", "Ten-man-kai" and so on, became the most influential anti-Qing organization in China's internal provinces at that time. Since the establishment of Huangxing, Huangxing in Liu Ui I had been handed over to the head of the Co-老会 Dalong, Hunan Hongjiang-kai leader Ma Fuyi, because he was accused of communicating with the party, the other Tong Hae-kai several controlled, so that the Co-老会 party members did not directly with the headquarters of Huangxing Huangxing Party, prevented by the leakage of secrets.:20 In response to the uprising, increased the number of men and horses.
