In fact, from April to June in the tropics, both the Southern Cross (in the low southern sky) and the Bear can be seen (in the low northern sky). In the sky, the opposite of the Southern Cross is Aries, so it cannot be seen in the sky at the same time as the Southern Cross. For the area south of 34° S, the Southern Cross is an arctic constellation, so it appears in the sky only at night. The Southern Cross is adjacent to Centaurus (around the triangle) and flies. Some astronomers confuse the Southern Cross with the nearby false cross. The shape of the Southern Cross is somewhat like a kite, and in fact it also has a fifth star (Epsilon), while the false cross is diamond-shaped, and is darker, does not have a fifth star, and does not have an important "indicator star" function.

According to the mean distance (semi-major axis) between the Sun and Amoor, Amoor I asteroids can be classified into four categories: Amoor I asteroids have a semi-major axis between the Earth and Mars, between 1,000 and 1,523 AU, and are fewer in number than one fifth of Amoor I asteroids, and have a lower eccentricity than the other three Amoor I asteroids. Some Amoor I members, such as (15817) Lucianotesi, do not pass through the Martian orbit, and can be considered to be part of the "Fire Zone", however, not all asteroids between the Earth and Mars belong to Amoor I. Amoor I asteroids crossing the Martian orbit (e.g. (433) Aesthesia) pass through the Martian orbit from within. Some Amoor I asteroids with a semi-major axis very close to the Earth's orbit (e.g. 1992 JD) can be classified as Arjuna asteroids.

Gonggong, officially designated 225088 Gonggong, previously designated (225088) 2007 OR10, is an extrasolar planet orbiting Neptune in a discrete disk, approximately 1,500 km in diameter, and was the largest unnamed object in the Solar System before it was named. The discovery of Gonggong was reported by astronomers at the California Institute of Technology as part of a paper by Dr. Meg E. Schwamb, a Ph.D. student of Michael E. Brown, who nicknamed it Snow White.

On October 19, 1935, the Red Army arrived in northern Shaanxi province. On November 25, 1935, the Red China announced the re-publication of the newspaper at the Wayao Fort in northern Shaanxi province, and the Red China resumed its work. In July 1936, the Red China was transferred to Shaanxi security (now Zhidan County, Shaanxi Province), Liao Chengzhi was in charge of the foreign telecommunications department, and Zhonghua was in charge of the Red China. On January 29, 1937, the Red China was renamed the New China Gazette, while the Red China was renamed the New China News Agency in Yan'an. However, Xinhua News Agency and the New China Gazette were the same organization at that time. The news text radio station's call number was QST (i.e., indicating the radio stations to listen to) de CSR. CSR was the original call number of the Red China News Agency, until early 1939, the Communist Party of China separated the two, thus ending the history of the newspaper and the company, Xinhua News Agency began to develop independently.

The Union of the Comoros (French: Union des Comores; Arabic: République القمر المتحدة ), commonly referred to as Comoros or Comoros (French: Comores; Arabic:جزر القمر ), is an island nation of African Arab States, located in the northern Indian Ocean, between Mozambique and Madagascar. Its main territory consists of three volcanic islands: Greater Comoros, Moreli and Angoulême. The government of the Union of the Comoros also claims the French-ruled island of Mayotte to be part of the Comoros. The territory of the Comoros also includes many other small islands. The name Comoros is derived from the Arabic al-qamar, meaning moon, on the flag of the Comoros.

Former Minister of Foreign Affairs, Deputy Secretary-General of the Presidential Office and Director of the Public Affairs Office of the Presidential Office, joined the Democratic Progressive Party in 2015, served as Director of the Department of International Affairs of the Communist Party of China, became Director of the New South Policy Office of the Presidential Office in 2016, and became Chairman of the Foreign Trade Development Association of the Republic of China in 2017. Huang graduated from Tainan Elementary School; studied at the National Taiwan University, originally in the Department of Agricultural Engineering, then transferred to the Political Department of the International Relations Unit in his sophomore year. He passed the 18th round of the Taiwanese Diplomatic Examination, then entered the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, in 1985 he was the "Important Secretary" of the then Deputy Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, recommended to the British Embassy, in 1986 he was a member of the Department of North America of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, in 1991 he was a member of the Congressional Committee of the U.S. Embassy, in 1996 he was the Head of the Department of North America, a specialized member.

Yuko (Yuco, Yucpa, Yuko, Yupo) is a Caribbean language spoken by 7,000 to 8,000 Yuka people living in the province of Suriname, Venezuela, and on the border with Colombia. It is also known as Carib Motilón, Macoíta, Northern Motilón, and Manso. Rio Casacará, Iroka, and Rio Maracas are the main dialects of the Yuka language, although they differ in that they can be considered separate languages.

Because Mercury's orbit lies inside the Earth (the same as that of Venus), it can only appear in the sky at dusk and during the day, rather than around midnight. At the same time, like Venus and the Moon, it exhibits a complete series of phases in its orbit relative to the Earth. Although seen from the Earth, Mercury is a very bright object, but it is closer to the Sun than Venus and therefore less visible than Venus. From the Earth, the brightness of Mercury varies greatly, with magnitudes ranging from -2.3 to 5.7, but its maximum separation angle from the Sun is only 28.3 degrees. When it is brightest, it should be technically easy to see it from the Earth, but because of its proximity to the Sun, it is actually not easy to find. Unless there is a total eclipse, Mercury is usually invisible under sunlight.

This result explains why the Big Bang did not produce carbon, because within a minute of the Big Bang, the temperature required for the 3 helium process is already lower than that required for the 3 helium process. Usually, the probability of the 3 helium process is very small. However, the base state of beryllium-8 has almost all the energy of two alpha particles. In the second step, 8Be + 4He has almost all the energy of the excited state of 12C. This resonance greatly increases the probability that alpha particles will bind to beryllium-8 to form carbon. In order to form carbon in stars, prior to actual observation, Fred Hoyle predicted the existence of this resonance based on the physical necessity of its existence. The resonance of this energy and the prediction of the process subsequently provided very important support for Hoyle's hypothesis of stellar nucleosynthesis. Hoyle's hypothesis assumes that all chemical elements were originally formed from hydrogen (the real primordial material).

China-Montenegro relations (Montenegro: Odnos Kina i Monte Gore) refers to the historical and modern bilateral diplomatic relations between China and Montenegro. After the independence referendum of Montenegro in 2006, Montenegro declared its independence from Serbia and Montenegro on 3 June that year. Since the establishment of the relationship, the economic ties between the two countries have been steadily strengthened. At the beginning of the establishment of the relationship, Montenegro signed the China-Europe Free Trade Agreement on 19 December 2006 and became a member of the China-Europe Free Trade Area. By 2020, China has become Montenegro's second largest trading partner and import source country, after Montenegro's neighbor Serbia. In 2020, bilateral trade between China and Montenegro reached €240 million, of which China exported €218 million to Montenegro, down 1.8% from 2019.

Provisional names are retained until an asteroid has been given a permanent designation but has not yet been named, such as (29075) 1950 DA. Modern technology is discovering more and more new asteroids and more and more unnamed asteroids. Early discovered but long-lived unnamed asteroid (3360) 1981 VA, now named (3360) Syrinx; since September 2008, this title has been replaced by (3708) 1974 FV1. In very rare cases, a minor planet's provisional name may become its own official name: as yet unnamed (15760) 1992 QB1 in its provisional name represents a population of the Kuiper belt, known as QB1 (cubewano).

A focal point, also sometimes called a vantage point in geometric optics, is the point at which the light from the source converges after passing through a telescope. However, a focal point is only a conceptual point, and in reality there is a range in space, called a blurring circle. Such an unideal focal point may result in image distortion of an optical image, with the smallest blurring circle being the iris disc, in the absence of a significant image distortion, because the opening of the optical system produces diffraction. As the aperture increases, the image distortion becomes more severe, and the iris circle is the smallest under a large aperture. An image, a vantage point, or a region that is well concatenated is confocal, and that is not well concatenated is defocused. The boundary between the two is sometimes used as a definition of a blurring circle. The primary focus or focal point is the focal point of the spherical plane: a divergent (negative) lens or convex lens cannot converge the targeted light at a single point, in other words, the focal point is the point at which the light reflected by the lens or penetrated by the lens appears to be emitting.

The Cassini spacecraft will enter the inner circle of Saturn's rings, orbiting Saturn once every seven days. The spacecraft will dive a little deeper into this previously untouched region to get closer to the appearance of Saturn's rings. On December 4, 2016, the spacecraft passed through the rings for the first time. The Cassini spacecraft was destroyed in the atmosphere of Saturn on September 15, 2017, and the final images were transmitted before the end of the mission. This procedure was chosen to avoid contaminating Saturn's defenses, which could potentially be biogenic. A group of 16 European countries and the United States are responsible for designing, manufacturing, flying and collecting data from the Cassini orbiter and the Huygens probe. The mission is managed by NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in the United States, where the Cassini orbiter is also manufactured. The Huygens was developed by the European Space Research and Technology Center (ESTEC), with the main contractor being France's Société Française d'Aéronautique de Terrez-Alain, and assembling equipment and instruments from many European countries (the batteries and two instruments on the Huygens were manufactured by the United States).

The independence of Outer Mongolia (Mongolian:Үндэсний эрх wolnościний revolution) refers to the historical event that the Outer Mongolia region became a sovereign state in the first half of the 20th century after the independence of China. Outer Mongolia includes today's Mongolia and the Danube region, Mongolia is an independent sovereign state widely recognized by the international community, and the Danube region is controlled by Russia. Since the collapse of the Xinhai Revolution Qing Dynasty, Outer Mongolia has actually been in a semi-independent state. In 1921, under the intervention of the Soviet Red Army, the Republic of China government was still able to control Inner Mongolia, and the Outer Mongolia region became an independent state without jurisdiction. Outer Mongolia declared independence many times before and after, and now Mongolia (1924) was confirmed by China, it was at the end of World War II, when the Republic of China and the Soviet Union signed the Treaty of Friendship and Cooperation between China and the Soviet Union.

In 1983, the National Party government introduced a framework for a new constitution, which required a referendum to determine white voters' support for the reform. The New Republic Party, led by Vase Raw, supported the new constitution, but demanded black representation in parliament. The Progressive Federal Party, which opposed the exclusion of blacks, and the Conservative Party, which opposed the inclusion of blacks and Indians, called for a vote against it. However, many Progressive Federal Party supporters, as well as some anti-government English-language newspapers, supported the new constitution as a "step in the right direction".

Magnetic storms can also cause damage to aircraft. In March 1989, earthquake-induced electrical currents disrupted power distribution in almost all of Quebec. In 1931, Sidney Chapman and Vincenzo C. A. Ferraro wrote an article, "A New Theory of Magnetic Storms," attempting to explain this phenomenon. "The magnitude of the storm. In normal quiet, the Dst index is between +20 and -20 N Tesla (nT). There are three stages of a geomagnetic storm: the initial stage, the main stage, and the recovery stage.

Coordinates: 34°00′N 109°00′E / 34.000°N 109.000°E / 34.000; 109.000 Shaanxi Province, also known as Shaanxi or Qin, is an inland province of the People's Republic of China, located in the northern part of central China, composed of three geographical regions: Guanzhong, northern Shaanxi and southern Shaanxi. It is adjacent to Gansu Province and Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region in the west, to Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region in the north, to Shanxi Province and Henan Province in the east, and is connected to Hubei Province, Chongqing City and Sichuan Province from the southeast to the southwest. It is often regarded geographically, economically and politically as a northwestern region or western province. The origin of the name Shaanxi is related to historical changes.

The 99th Army of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA) is the main unit of the Huangpu branch of the Central Army. Its predecessor was the 99th Division of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA), composed of the 52nd Division of the 18th Army and the 59th Division of the Fifth Army. In the early stages of the war, in order to strengthen Guizhou's military power, the 99th Army was expanded on the basis of the 99th Division and was subordinated to the 99th Division. It was stationed in Zunyi, Guizhou. In the spring of 1939, two divisions were assigned to Chang'an, Ya County. In November 1939, it went to Guangxi to participate in the Battle of Guinan. In September 1941, it participated in the Second Battle of Chang'an and the Third Battle of Chang'an. In May 1942, it participated in the Battle of Zhejiang and Gansu. It was stationed in Yiyang, Hunan. In the Fourth Battle of Chang'an, the NRA was responsible for the defense of the Xiangyin River and the Yuan River. Later, it participated in the Battle of Oxi, the Battle of Changde, the Battle of Chang Heng and the Battle of the Hunan-Guangdong- Gansu Border Area. When the war was won, it was transferred from Liuyang, Hunan to Yongshu, Jiangxi and the surrender of Jiujiang.

In 1914, Dong became the editor-in-chief of the Beijing Daily, and after 1916 served as long-term secretary to Xiong Xiling. On March 1, 1925, Dong founded the Yongzhuang in Tianjin. After the Imperial Revolt of 1928, the Yongzhuang was the first to reveal the truth about the Japanese army, causing a great stir. By 1930, the Yongzhuang had nearly 20,000 copies in circulation, becoming the third largest newspaper in Tianjin, after the Dagong and Yi Zheng newspapers. In 1934, Dong joined the Kuomintang after being introduced by Chiang Kai-shek. Initially, Dong was responsible for inspecting foreign news and telecommunications in the Shanghai office of the Military Committee of the National Government. After the outbreak of the war against Japan, Dong was appointed as the fifth deputy minister of the Military Committee of the National Government, and shortly afterwards, he was appointed as the deputy minister of the Kuomintang's Central Propaganda Department, responsible for building the international image of the National Government at the time and fighting for the support of the Western media for China's anti-Japanese war.

The archives' database is a member of the International Internet Preservation Consortium. In 1996, Brewster Kahle founded the Internet Archive at the same time as founding the lucrative Alexa Internet; data collection began in October of the same year. Announced in August 2012. On November 6, 2013, the archives' headquarters in Richmond burned down, damaging many facilities and some nearby apartments. The archives' headquarters from 1996 to 2009, located in San Francisco, USAThe headquarters since 2009, formerly the Internet Archive of the Fourth Church of the Christian Sciences in San Francisco, USAThe Time Machine is one of the Internet Archive's most important services, named after an American cartoon called The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show.

On September 27, 1954, the session elected the Standing Committee of the First National People's Congress. At the second session of the First National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China (July 5, 1955 – July 30, Beijing), the session was attended by 1,118 delegates: Mr. Li Fuchun made a report on the first five-year plan for the development of the national economy, Mr. Li Xianmen made a report on the State Accounts for 1954 and the State Budget for 1955, Mr. Peng Dewei made a report on the draft Military Service Law of the People's Republic of China, Mr. Peng Jin made a report on the work of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, Mr. Deng Xiaorong made a report on the comprehensive planning for the control and development of the water resources of the Yellow River, and Mr. Chen Yun made a report on the question of grain procurement and marketing.

Lisson's assessment was that it established the necessity, legitimacy and feasibility of organized international sanctions against South Africa, whose policies were seen as a direct threat to peace and security in South Africa and the world. The meeting also concluded that, to be effective, sanctions must involve the United States and the United Kingdom, although both countries were major obstacles to their implementation. The Anti-Apartheid Movement (AAM) attempted to make sanctions one of the debates in the 1964 British elections, asking candidates for their views on economic sanctions against South Africa and other punitive measures. Most of the candidates responded in the affirmative. However, the victorious Labour Party completely abandoned its previous commitment to apartheid.

The Constitution of the Republic of China, abbreviated as the Constitution, is the fundamental law of the Republic of China. It has the highest legal status, surpassing all laws and orders. The Constitution of the Republic of China was passed by the Constituent National Assembly in Nanjing on December 25, 1946, the Constitution of the Republic of China was promulgated by the National Government on January 1, 1947, and the Constitution of the Republic of China came into force on December 25, 1947. The Constitution of the Republic of China is the third constitutional law since the founding of the Republic of China, replacing the previous Constitution of the Republic of China. However, before the Constitution came into force, the general outbreak of the Chinese Civil War, the National Assembly therefore enacted the Provisional Provisions for the Mobilization and Insurrection Period in 1948, as an appendix to the Constitution during the war; however, as the Republic of China lost its sovereignty over mainland China after the Civil War in 1949, and the effective area of governance was reduced to Tai Pong Kim Ma, the period of application of the provisions was constantly extended, and the implementation of the Constitution became unreliable.

The wealth, prestige and political influence of the Song dynasty grew rapidly with the development of the business of the three sons-in-law, and became known as the "Song dynasty"; however, the marriages and political choices of the three sons-in-law led to different paths in their respective lives. At the time of the Northern Expedition, Sun Yat-sen died of illness, and Qingling Yazhi succeeded his late husband Li Shi in the pursuit of Chinese unification. Soon afterwards, Chiang Kai-shek led the National Revolutionary Army in the Northern Expedition and became the leader of a new generation in China; Confucius Xiangxi also became the political leader in charge of the national government's finances with the development of Chiang Kai-shek's power. Later, Japan intensified its aggression against Chinese territory and sovereignty, Chiang continued to insist on "first in China, then out of China", sweeping the Chinese Communist Party; Qingling was deeply dissatisfied with this, vigorously attacked Chiang Kai-shek, and the friendship between Meiling and the Hingling family broke down, and the Hingling family became increasingly estranged. When the Nanjing National Government intensified its suppression of the Communist Army, Vice Commander Zhang Xue-liang kidnapped Chiang Kai-shek in Xi'an and demanded a halt to the civil war.

At a graduation ceremony on May 11, 1996, Dr. Sagan revealed the profound insights he had gained from this photograph, and his student, the current American astronomer Neil de Grasse Taessen, quoted it in his sequel to Sagan's first documentary, Space Exploration: The Earth is a tiny stage in the arena of the vast universe. Think of the bloody winds and rains that the emperors would rise from, just to enjoy for a short time, in glory and victory, the sensation of dominating a small part of the universe.

Shaka Zulu (1781–1828) or Shaka ka Senzangakhona, the founder of the Zulu kingdom in Africa. He was the illegitimate son of Senzangakhona kaJama and was expelled by his father. With the help of Dingiswayo, the leader of Mthethwa, he became the leader of the Zulu people. Later, through war, he gradually conquered all the tribes and established the Zulu kingdom. In 1827, his mother Nanti died and he became increasingly violent. Around 1828, he was murdered by his half-brothers Dingon and Mlangano, and then Dingon killed Mlangano and seized the throne.

During the Qing Dynasty, this area was under the jurisdiction of Fengshan County. In the early days of the Japanese occupation, it was formerly under the jurisdiction of Fengshan Branch Office and Tagu Branch Office; in 1920, Taiwanese local government was reorganized into Kaohsiung City, Kaohsiung County, and under the jurisdiction of Kaohsiung Street and Left Battalion House; in 1944, there were six towns, including Tan Town, Ju Town, Yamashita Town, Minato Town, Xinbin Town, and Sentinel Town. After the war, the above-mentioned seven districts and Left Battalion House were merged to form the present-day Ko Shan District of Kaohsiung City. According to the statistics of the Municipal Affairs Bureau of Kaohsiung City Government, Ko Shan District had about 60,000 households and a population of about 140,000 at the end of 2021, the largest and smallest villages in the district were Longshui Li and Moyuan Li, respectively, and the population of the two villages at the end of 2021 was 31,647 and 573, respectively. The Ko Shan District Public Office is the dispatching agency of the Kaohsiung City Government in Ko Shan, the executive agency of the Shuri District Government in the framework of the Government of the Republic of China, and the upper-level supervisory agency is the Kaohsiung City Government.

This unusually weak white dwarf was noted around 1910 by Henry Norris Russell, Edward Pickering, and William Fleming et al. White dwarfs are thought to be the final product of the evolutionary stages of medium- and low-mass stars, of which 97% of the stars in our galaxy belong. Medium- and low-mass stars pass through the main-sequence star stage, which ends with a hydrogen fusion reaction, undergo helium fusion in the core, burn helium into carbon and oxygen in a three-helium process, and expand into a red giant. If the red giant does not have enough mass to produce a higher temperature for the burning of carbon, carbon and oxygen accumulate in the core.

According to Rubin and Grossman, the smallest asteroids were discovered by telescopes on Earth, blurring the distinction between meteors and asteroids. Some of the smallest asteroids discovered (based on absolute magnitude H) are 2008 TS26, with H = 33.2, and 2011 CQ1, with H = 32.1. Smaller than meteors are classified as micro-meteorics and interplanetary dust. The asteroid center does not use the term "meteor". Meteors, meteors, and meteorites are all debris from the Solar System, but have different names in different states, and in the meteor phase also produce ion tail, meteor dust, or emit sound and leave traces of dust. Meteors are visible light that enters the Earth's atmosphere, and are seen as meteors or asteroids.

Free content, or free information, means that its content is free from legal restrictions that prevent people from using, publishing, improving, and sharing art or creation. Importantly, when free content is modified, extended, or incorporated into other works, the resulting work must be lawfully published with equal or narrower freedoms. Whether it is free or payable, free content must be modifiable in order to qualify as free content.

The Fifty-third Army of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA) was a centralized army-level unit of the Northeast Division of the Army of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA) from 1933 to 1948. On February 15, 1933, the National Government formed the Fifty-third Army of the National Revolutionary Army (NRA) in Pingquan County, Hebei Province with the 106th, 108th, 106th, 109th, 29th, 30th and 2nd Cavalry Divisions to fight the Japanese invasion of Hebei Province in northern China.

Noor Mohammad Turkey (Persian: نور محمد ترکۍ ; 15 July 1917 – 8 October 1979) was an Afghan politician, leader of the Democratic Republic of Afghanistan and General Secretary of the Afghan People's Democratic Party (ADP). As a young man, Turkey studied at Moscow State University and Kabul University. After graduation, he worked as a journalist. In 1965, he founded the Afghan People's Democratic Party (ADP) and served as General Secretary. In 1973, Turkey helped Dawood seize power. On 26 April 1978, he was arrested on charges of "violating the provisions of Articles 46 and 47 of the Afghan Constitution." On 27 April 1978, the ADP staged a military coup, Turkey was released from prison, the ADP was founded on 30 April, and he became Chairman of the Chairmanship of the Revolutionary Committee (Head of State) and Chairman of the Council of Ministers (Prime Minister).

Ali Abdullah Saleh (Arabic: علي عبدالله صالح ; 21 March 1947 – 4 December 2017) was the first President of Yemen and a dictator. He served as President of the Arab Republic of Yemen (Northern Yemen) from 1978 to 1990. Following Yemen's reunification, he served as President of the Republic of Yemen until his resignation in 2012, serving as the governor for 34 years. Born on 21 March 1947 in Beit Amah, Sana'a Province. He participated in the "9.26 Revolution" that overthrew the monarchy in September 1962. After the establishment of the Arab Republic of Yemen (Northern Yemen), Saleh enrolled in the Armoured Corps School in 1964. From June to July 1978, he was a member of the Interim Presidential Commission, Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces and Chief of Staff. In July 1978, he became President of the Arab Republic of Yemen and Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, formally seizing military and political power.

Coordinates: 25°2′8.9′′N 121°25′59.4′′E / 25.035806°N 121.433167°E / 25.035806; 121.433167Fu Jen Catholic University (Chinese: 輔仁大學), commonly known as Fu Jen Catholic University (Chinese: 輔仁大学), is a Catholic university in Taiwan.

In 1923, Luo Zhuying was recruited with his compatriot Zou Ru Yan, serving as a major in the Guangdong Military Staff under the Government of the Republic of China, but resigned shortly after his appointment. Luo Zhuying actually participated in the National Revolutionary Army began in August 1925 before the National Revolutionary Army's Eastern Campaign, about the end of the 13th year of the Republic of China entered the Huangpu Military School, recommended by his classmate Chen Cheng to join the army, in the beginning of the 14th year of the Republic of China after the arrival of Soviet troops as the commander of the third battalion of artillery battalion of the Huangpu Military School, since then Luo Zhuying's brigade duties were closely related to Chen Cheng's Pingfeng Qingyun. As the National Revolutionary Army fought in Guangzhou, Chen Cheng's battalion of artillery successively served in the war, in the second campaign of the Eastern Campaign to capture Huizhou City, the accurate shelling of the battalion of artillery destroyed the traditional tower, making it possible to break the stalemate, Luo Zhuying was gradually promoted to the deputy commander of the major battalion.

The Siberian Plain is located in northwestern Asia (mid-western Russia), between the Ural Mountains and the Yenisei River, south of the Kazakh Hills, the Sagin Mountains, and the northern shore of the Kara Sea. It is one of the world's most famous plains, with a width of 1000-1900 km from east to west, a length of 2500 km from north to south, and an area of 274 million square kilometers. Most of the plains are poorly drained, forming some of the largest swamps and floodplains in the world. Important cities in the plain include Omsk, Novosibirsk and Chelyabinsk. It is low-lying and wide, with an altitude of 50-150 m in the central and northern regions, and 220-300 m in the western, southern and eastern margins. The Ob River - Ercis flows through the whole territory. The lower reaches of the Ob River are often flooded and evaporate weakly, resulting in a large number of swamps and wetlands on the surface. All of them have a sub-polar continental climate. The winters are long and cold, with average temperatures below -20°C, and the summers are briefly mild, with temperatures between 10-20°C.

The Republic of Djibouti (Arabic:جمهوريه جيبوتي ; French: République de Djibouti; Somali: Jamhuureedayayaya; Afar: Gabuutih Ummuuno) is a country in northeastern Africa on the west coast of the Gulf of Aden. It is bordered by Eritrea to the north, Ethiopia to the west, southwest and south, Somalia to the southeast, and Yemen to the northeast.

Coordinates: 23°02′22.3′′N 113°22′38.1′′E / 23.039528°N 113.377250°E / 23.039528; 113.377250 The Guangzhou Academy of Fine Arts (GAFA) is the only higher art academy in Guangdong Province and South China. It is one of the eight major art academies in China.

In 1920, the League of Nations entrusted Britain with the administration of the Palestinian territories. In 1922, Britain divided the Trust Territory along the Jordan River into two parts: the East (present-day Jordan) was administered by the Hashemite family, who fought alongside Lawrence; the West was administered by Britain, and the area became officially known as the Palestinian Territory, which had not yet become a recognized state. At that time, the Jewish population accounted for 11% of the total population. With British support, the Jews launched the third and fourth "wave of return", and in 1931, the Jewish population rose to 17%, leading to clashes with the local Arabs. Pan-Arabists were displeased with this, and Amin al-Hussein launched the Palestinian uprising in 1920. In 1933, the Nazis came to power in Germany, triggering the fifth "wave of return", and from 1937 to 1948, the Zionists carried out numerous terrorist attacks, and several bloody riots occurred in 1936-1939.

Taiwan Road was one of the highest government offices in Taiwan during the 212 years of the Qing Dynasty (1727-1885), and there was also the Taiwan Prefecture, which was the official administrative division of the Qing Dynasty. 'Do' was originally an outpost of the 'province' (Fujian Province) of the Qing Dynasty, and was not an official local administrative division, so the Taiwan Prefecture, which was under the jurisdiction of Fujian Province in the early Qing Dynasty, was the official administrative division of the Qing Dynasty. However, in the latter half of the Qing Dynasty, the power of the 'Do' increased, and all the 'Do's' in the mainland provinces of the Qing Dynasty were the same, and the 'Do' gradually became a new layer of'quasi-administrative division' between the 'province' and the 'province' of the Qing Dynasty. This is not unique to Taiwan Road, but Taiwan Road also gradually overtook the Taiwan Prefecture, but it was also under the jurisdiction of Fujian Province. Taiwan Road was formerly Taixia Road from 1684 to 1727.

Optical binary stars can be identified by measuring the difference in parallax, or the difference in their own motion or radial velocity. However, most binary stars have not been adequately studied to determine whether they are optical binary stars, gravitationally bound binary stars, or multi-star systems. Binary systems are very important in astrophysics because calculations of their orbits can directly determine the mass of their constituent stars, thereby indirectly estimating other stellar parameters, such as radius and density. This can also determine an empirical mass-luminosity relationship (MLR), from which the mass of a single star can be estimated. If binary stars can be decomposed into two separate stars in an optical telescope, in this case they are called visual binary stars. Many visual binary stars have long-period orbits of several centuries or thousands of years, so their orbits are uncertain or obscure.

On June 4, 1928, at 5:30 a.m., Zhang Shaolin was on a train passing through the junction of the Beijing–Manchuria Railway and the Nanmen Railway at the Three-hole Bridge (now known as the Three-hole Bridge), when he was blown up by explosives buried by the Japanese army. Zhang Shaolin was seriously injured and sent back to Shenyang, where he died. Because the incident took place east of the station, the incident is known as the "Kokutun Incident." At that time, in Japan, due to the failure to reveal the murderer, the Japanese government always referred to it as "Manchurian Major Events" (Manchurian: 満洲某重大事件/まんしゅうぼうじゅうだいじけん). Zhang Shaolin was the supreme leader of the PLA, the ruling military clique in northeastern China, known as the "Northeast King" and "Major General", the forces were constantly expanding within the Shanhai-Guangguan, and on June 18, 1927, the government of the People's Republic of China was established in Beijing, claiming to be the "Major General of the Army and Navy of the People's Republic of China," became the last ruler of the Northeast government, and was also the head of the People's Republic of China at that time not internationally recognized.

In mid-April 1939, Britain, France and the Soviet Union held military and political negotiations in Moscow. During the negotiations, the Soviet Union made a number of proposals to Britain and France: In the winter of 1939, the Soviet Union failed in its attempt to exterminate Finland, but forced Finland to cede some of its territory. On August 3, 1939, German Foreign Minister Ribbentrop offered the Soviet Union hopes of improving relations. At that time, the Soviet Union secretly signed the Treaty of Non-Aggression between the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany on August 23, 1939, in order to defuse the situation. After the outbreak of World War II, the Soviet Union, according to the scope of the Treaty, sent troops to partition Polish territory, occupy a large part of Eastern Europe, commit the Katyn massacre, and massacre Polish national elites. Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania were forcibly annexed to the Soviet Union, the national elites of the three countries were massacred, and hundreds of thousands of people were forcibly deported to Siberian concentration camps.

In 1969, Democratic Senator Gaylord Nelson held lectures at universities in the United States, planning to organize a campus campaign against the Vietnam War on April 22, 1969, but at a preparatory meeting in Seattle in 1969, one of the organizers of the campaign, Dennis Hayes, a law student at Harvard University, proposed that the campaign focus on a nationwide grassroots campaign on the theme of environmental protection. On April 22, 1970, more than 20 million people across the United States participated in the environmental movement, and its success made it a tradition to organize environmental activities on April 22 every year.

Some of these countries have highly centralized planned economies and others have socialist market economies. Although the Democratic People's Republic of Korea still claims to be a socialist republic, it is by definition not included in the narrow sense of a socialist republic, since it has deleted communism and Marxism-Leninism as guiding ideologies and ideologies of the Party and the State. Some officials in China have recognized that the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is not a socialist republic, because the Korean Labour Party abandoned Marxism-Leninism in 1980 and established the idea of subjectivity as the only guiding ideology. Because of differences in the understanding of Marxism and its political objectives, different types of Marxists have completely different views on what constitutes a socialist republic. For all Marxists who oppose Stalinism, for example, democratic socialists believe that "there is no socialism without democracy." Social democracy is theoretically universal, and universal suffrage includes the right to vote and the universal right to be elected.

British Burmese, a colony of the British Empire on the South Central Peninsula, existed from 1824 to 1948. Formerly part of British India, it became an independent colony in 1937. Occupied by Japan during World War II, it became the Burmese state; it did not become officially independent until 1948. Britain fought the First Anglo-Burmese War with the Khmer Rouge for the eastern border of British India. Britain was victorious, and in 1824 established British Burmese, administering the occupied land. British Burmese was then a province under British India. In 1852, Britain won the Second Anglo-Burmese War, seized the city of Bukgo, and called it Lower Burma. In 1886, Britain won the Third Anglo-Burmese War, the Khmer Rouge was defeated, Britain completely occupied Burma, and established a government in Yangon. After the British occupation of Burma, there was much resistance, British forces united rural leaders into a colonial government to govern the country, and adopted a policy of "divide and rule" against all ethnic groups: directly governing the Burmese people, indirectly governing other peoples.

With the end of apartheid, Bantustan was abolished and re-annexed to South Africa in 1994. The British colonial government of the 19th century and subsequent South African governments established "reserves" in 1913 and 1936, respectively, with the aim of separating South Africa's blacks from whites. When the National Party came to power in 1948, Indigenous Affairs Minister (later Prime Minister of South Africa) Hendrik Verwoerd built on this foundation a series of measures to reshape South African society, making whites the majority population. Establishing a "homeland" or "Bantustan" was a central element of this strategy, as the government's long-term goal was to make Bantustan independent. As a result, blacks would lose their South African citizenship and voting rights, and whites would continue to control South Africa. "In 1947, advocates of apartheid used the term "Bantustan" when referring to the partition of India.

Hunting and gathering were widespread survival strategies among wild carnivores from about 1.8 million years ago by the Homo erectus until the arrival of the Homo sapiens 200,000 years ago. Prehistoric hunter-gatherers lived in groups of several families, forming dozens of individuals. It was the only way of survival until the end of the Miocene, about 10,000 years ago, when this lifestyle was gradually replaced by the spread of the Neolithic Revolution. From about 80,000 to 70,000 years ago, during the transitional period from the Middle to Late Paleolithic, some hunter-gatherer tribes began to specialize in hunting activities, focusing on selecting smaller (usually larger) prey and gathering smaller amounts of food. This specialization also included the production of specialized tools, such as fishing nets, hooks, and bone fishing forks.

In the period from the end of the Qing Dynasty to the time of the Northern Ocean Government, China's society underwent tremendous changes, and in order to meet the demands of social modernization, a new administrative system was gradually formed in townships and villages. In the period of the National Government, a nationally unified administrative system at the township level began to be formed. In 1909, the Qing Government promulgated the "Regulations on the Local Autonomy of Townships and Villages," under which townships, townships and townships were autonomous under state and county governments. Townships, townships and townships were defined as, respectively, "the area of a township is a town, the rest of a city, a village, a village, a hamlet, a village, etc., the area with a population of more than 50,000 is a town, and the area with a population of less than 50,000 is a township." In June 1929, the National Government proclaimed the "Organization Law of County," under which districts, townships and townships were autonomous, and the chief executive officers were the heads of districts, townships and townships, who were directly elected. After the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949, townships remained the main basic administrative units in rural China.

Founded in 1937, Sangmyung University is a comprehensive private university located in Cheonlu District, Seoul Special City, Cheonan City, Chungcheongnam Province. The symbols of Sangmyung University are plum, deer and pine. There are 12 single-degree universities and one nurturing university, 6 graduate schools, 2 departments and 74 majors. It has more than 20,000 students and 469 full-time faculty members. Seven departments of Sangmyung University have been selected by the Korea Ministry of Education as Korea's distinctive undertaking, namely: Family Welfare, Historical Literature, Intellectual Property, International Commerce, Buddhist Education, Ceramic Materials Art, Industrial Design, Environmental Architecture, Architectural System Engineering, Information and Communications Engineering, and Luxury Goods.

In the United Kingdom, the Senate is called the House of Lords. Although the Senate of Malaysia is often referred to as the Upper House, the original Malay is the Senate of Malaysia. In the Netherlands, the "Eerste Kamer" (Dutch: Eerste Kamer), the German Senate is the "Bundesrat" (German: Bundesrat), and the Indian Senate is similarly referred to as the "Bundesrat". In some former colonies, the so-called "Legislative Council" is used. In European countries with a longer parliamentary system, the history of the Senate (or the Upper House) is generally longer, starting with the earliest assemblies of auxiliary monarchs, the members of which were crown princes and nobles, and later the House of Commons (or the Lower House), the House of Commons, and the House of Lords as a more powerful parliament.

On May 3, 1947, at 7 a.m., Chiang Kai-shek took off for Xuzhou, where he listened to the report on the campaign. He believed that "the heads of the divisions in the front line were mentally weary and exhausted, each of them tried to defend themselves, without mutual assistance and cooperation, and without a spirit of coordination, so that the aircraft were lost repeatedly, they were passive and did not obey the orders of their superior officers, so that the entire line was stagnant and delayed and a deadly situation formed, and he was deeply concerned. Nevertheless, it is estimated that its own gravity is still sufficient to maintain fluid static equilibrium, thus meeting the definition of a dwarf planet. Astronomers believe that Haumea's elongated shape, unusually fast rotation, high density, and high reflectivity (due to its crystalline water ice surface) are the result of a supercollision; this makes Haumea the largest member of the collision family, which includes several large extrasolar bodies and Haumea's two known moons. Haumea was a Pluto-like object, but more observations were needed to determine if it was in motion. Two teams claimed to be the discoverers of Haumea. In December 2004, a California Institute of Technology team led by Mike Brown discovered Haumea in a series of photographs they took on May 20, 2004.

The Republic of Zambia, commonly known as Zambia, is a landlocked country in southeastern Africa. It borders the Democratic Republic of Congo, Tanzania, Malawi, Mozambique, Zimbabwe, Botswana, Namibia and Angola. Its capital is Lusaka. The indigenous population of Zambia was continuously absorbed and integrated by foreigners 2,000 years ago. Bantu-speaking inhabitants began to enter Zambia in the 15th century, peaking in the 17th and 19th centuries. European colonists and missionaries began to enter the area in the mid-19th century. In 1888, British colonist Cecil Rhodes obtained mining rights from the local chiefs. In the same year, British authorities established South Rhodesia and North Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe and Zambia, respectively).

The first detailed close-up photograph of Uranus was taken by Voyager 2 when it flew over Uranus in 1986, and it is the only close-up photograph to date. Voyager 2 was closest to Uranus on January 24, 1986, at a distance of 127,000 km. Because Uranus's south pole was facing the Sun at that time, only features of the Northern Hemisphere were photographed. Based on the error range of the data currently available, it is not yet possible to determine whether Uranus has a larger mass than Uranus. Uranus' past geological activity is thought to have been influenced by tidal heating, when its orbital eccentricity was greater than it is today. In its early days, Uranus appeared to produce a 4:1 orbital resonance with Uranus IV, although it did not produce such a resonance later. The resonance also increased Uranus' orbital eccentricity, leading to instability of the tidal force on Uranus and an increase in its internal temperature.

The National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) is an independent agency of the U.S. government responsible for the collection of all U.S. official historical records. It is responsible for issuing acts of Congress, presidential proclamations and executive orders, and maintaining copies of federal statutes. On June 19, 1934, President Roosevelt signed an act establishing the "National Archives." The National Archives receives many visitors every day, and Alia She became the first millionth visitor to the U.S. National Archives on September 29, 2005. The digital era has brought new opportunities to the National Archives, allowing people from around the world who have never had a chance to visit the National Archives to access the materials in the National Archives collection.

Jomo Kenyatta (October 20, 1891 – August 22, 1978) was a Kenyan politician, dictator, the first President of Kenya, and the father of Kenya. He converted to Christianity in 1914 and moved to Nairobi. He married in 1920 and entered government service. He entered politics in 1924, joining the Kikuyu Central Association to fight for land rights for the Kikuyu people. In 1929, he was appointed by the KCA to London, United Kingdom, to seek the support of the British Parliament. He returned in 1930, but became involved in a dispute within the KCA over the status of women, and soon left the country again. From 1932 to 1933, Kenyatta studied economics in the Soviet Union, but was forced to leave the Soviet Union and return to London with his sponsors, the prominent black leader George Padmo of Trinidad and Tobago, who overthrew the Soviet authorities.

In 1970, the name of the school was changed to "Asahikawa University." Coordinates: 24°59′58′′N 121°29′56′′E / 24.999397°N 121.49898°E / 24.999397; 121.49898 Zhonghe District (Tiong-hô-khu, Hakka: Chûng-fò-khî) is located in the southwest of New Taipei City, Taiwan, southwest of the Taipei Basin, a satellite city belonging to the Taipei metropolitan area. With a population of about 40.3 million, it is the third largest district of the population of New Taipei City. Zhonghe District was first formed in 1920 as "Zhonghe Zhuang", named after "Zhonghe Hang" and "Zhanghe" two villages within its borders. In the early post-World War II period, it was renamed "Zhonghe Township".

On October 10, 2019, the Congress of Deputies of the National People's Government of Cuba announced that the current Chairman of the National Council of Cuba and Chairman of the Council of Ministers, Carlos Carnell, had been elected President of the Republic of Cuba. Before the arrival of the Spaniards, the island was inhabited by the Tenos, Simón Bolívars and Guanajuato Bayes. Their ancestors migrated from the North, Central and South American continents. The Tenos first mastered pottery making and agriculture. The Simón Bolívars and Guanajuato Bayes were more backward, hunter-gatherers and fishermen in caves, and later planted tobacco and other crops. Cuba was discovered by Columbus in October 1492. It became a colony in 1511. In 1515, the city of Havana was founded. Indigenous peoples who did not want to convert to Christianity were forced by the Spanish colonists to hunt for gold. In 1529, the outbreak of measles in Cuba killed two-thirds of the indigenous peoples who survived from smallpox. They had no resistance to epidemics from Europe, and almost all of them were extinct within a century.

On January 13, 1953, at its twentieth meeting, the Committee of the Central People's Government decided to form a Constitution Drafting Committee consisting of more than thirty people, including Mao Zedong, to form the formal constitutional organ of the Central People's Government. At the end of 1953, Mao Zedong led the Drafting Committee to the West Lake State Hotel. About 150 million people participated in the discussion of the first Constitution, and more than 1.38 million articles of the Constitution were submitted. More than 5.9 million representatives of the people's congresses of provinces, cities and counties also submitted their views. Based on the opinions obtained, the Drafting Committee amended the original draft, submitted it to the Committee of the Central People's Government for discussion and adoption at an interim meeting, and formed the Constitution to be submitted for examination. On January 15, 1954, Mao Zedong sent a telegram to Liu Shaochi and other central leaders, listing in the telegram 10 Chinese and foreign constitutions of various kinds (hereinafter referred to as the "Chinese and foreign constitutions"), asking the members of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China and the members of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in Beijing to take time to read them.

Thailand is the only country in modern Southeast Asia that has been spared from foreign colonization, but has still been forced to sign a number of unequal treaties and lose a large part of its territory. During the reign of King Chulalongkorn, the political and social system of Siam underwent a series of Westernization reforms, becoming a modern monarchy-dominated and authoritarian state. In 1932, the Siamese constitutional revolution broke out, the royal family decided to change the monarchy to a constitutional system. Prime Minister Abhisit Vejjajiva Sonkan pursued a policy of Thaiization, and changed the country's name to Thailand. During the Cold War, Thailand became a major ally of the United States in Southeast Asia, and led the establishment of the Southeast Asia Treaty Organization. The political environment in modern Thailand is not very stable, the military has repeatedly overthrown the civilian government with military coups, since the 2014 Thai coup, Thailand is under military rule, and is experiencing a popular demonstration movement. After legalizing the use of medical cannabis in 2019, and thus decriminalizing cannabis on June 9, 2022.

Chao'an District is a municipal district under the jurisdiction of Chao'an City in the lower Han River in eastern Guangdong Province, China. Formerly Haiyang County, it was renamed Chao'an County in 1914 due to the same name as Haiyang County in Shandong Province. It was abolished several times and re-established as a county in December 1991. On June 28, 2013, after approval by the State Council, Chao'an County was abolished and Chao'an District of Chao'an City was established. Before the re-establishment of Chao'an City, the area of Chao'an City was under the jurisdiction of Chao'an County. Chao'an is also a famous overseas Chinese township, famous overseas Chinese people include Rao Zongjie, Li Jia-cheng, Chen Wei-nan, Cai Lan, Sun Da-wen, etc. Since the establishment of Haiyang County, Chao'an District has a history of 1691 years (AD 331 - AD 2022). In the pre-Qin Dynasty, Chao'an District belonged to Hokkien territory. Qin Shi Huang thirty-three years (AD 214), Qin Xia Yue, Nanhai County, Guilin County and Xia County, now Chao'an District belongs to Nanhai County Jiaoyang Xiaohan Gaozhu three years (AD 204), Nanhai County Longchuan County Decree (Director) Zhao Tuo annexed Nanhai County, Guilin County and Xiao County, founded Nanhai Province, in the present Chao'an District Jiaoyang County, still belongs to Nanhai County.

A perihelion comet is a comet whose perihelion is extremely close to the Sun, and its distance from the Sun's surface can be as short as a few thousand kilometres. Smaller perihelion comets are completely evaporated when approaching the Sun, while larger comets can pass through the perihelion many times. However, the strong tidal force of the Sun usually causes them to split. Among the various types of perihelion comets, the most famous are the Kreutz Sungrazers, all of which are formed by the splitting of a giant comet when it enters the inner Solar System, thus producing many small comets. Extremely bright comets witnessed by Aristotle and Ibiharu in 371 BC may have been its parent. Large comets that appeared in 1843 and 1882, as well as the Ikeya-Kan comet in 1965, are all fragments of the same comet. They pass through the perihelion, emitting extremely bright comet tails that are much brighter than the full moon and can be seen with the naked eye on clear days.

Eugene Chen (July 2, 1878 – May 20, 1944), born in Shunde, Guangdong, a descendant of the Taiping army, was a prominent left-wing figure. His most notable achievement in life was as Foreign Minister of the Wuhan National Government in 1927, relying on hard diplomatic means, several negotiations, the recapture of the Hankou and Jiujiang imperial territories, the creation of the myth of the diplomatic victory of weak states. Eugene Chen, born in Shunde, Guangdong, parents Hakka:3. Born in 1878 in the British colony of Trinidad in the Caribbean (then known as Thousand Miles) St. Fernando. His father was a member of the Taiping army, was forced to leave China after the failure of the Tiananmen Treaty, fled from Hong Kong all the way to Trinidad, a million miles away, ran a local retail store, and had small savings.

Giovanni Domenico Cassini (Italian: ; 8 June 1625 – 14 September 1712), also known as Jean-Dominique Cassini, was a French astronomer and water engineer born in the Republic of Genoa (now in Italy). Born in 1625 in Perignano (now in the province of Inferior) in the Republic of Genoa, Cassini worked at the Panzano Observatory from 1648 to 1669. From 1640 he was professor of astronomy at the University of Bologna, and became the first director of the Observatory until his death after the establishment of the Paris Observatory in 1671.

According to the former Secretary-General of the Andean Community, Alan Wagner Thyssen, a full-fledged union similar to the European Union is likely to be formed in 2019. The union will merge the two existing free trade organizations, the Southern Common Market and the Andean Community of Nations, to create a free trade area covering South America, eliminating tariffs on non-sensitive goods and sensitive goods by 2014 and 2019, respectively. The union's headquarters will be in the Ecuadorian capital, Quito, the parliament in Cochabamba, Bolivia, and the South American Bank will be in the Venezuelan capital, Caracas. In the early 19th century, Simon Bolivar directly led the national independence movements in Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Bolivia, and his statue can be seen in almost every Latin American capital. Bolivar planned to build a federal state on the basis of these post-independence countries to ensure prosperity and security, but failed to achieve this goal until his death.

On May 28, 1948, the CPC Central Committee issued the "Instructions on Countermeasures to the Kuomintang in the White Zone," which called for the establishment of a broad-based anti-trafficking, anti-civil war, anti-dictatorship and anti-terrorist front based on the struggle for survival. In May 1948, Li Weihan was promoted to the position of Minister of Construction of the Central City. On September 26, 1948, the CPC Central Committee decided to change the name of the Construction Department of the Central City to the Construction Department of the Central Unified Front. It was responsible for the management of "the work of the State Union Zone at that time, the work of national minorities, the work of the struggle against the regime, the work of the overseas Chinese and the liaison work of the Eastern Brotherhood Party," and specifically for the preparation of the convocation of a new CPC Central Committee. On the eve of the anti-right movement in May 1957, the Construction Department of the CPC Central Committee convened 13 seminars for leaders of all democratic parties and non-party democrats. It also jointly convened 25 seminars for people in the business and industry sectors with the Eighth Office of the State Council.

Many animals fall in love during this time, so China also refers to spring as the season of the "rebirth of all things." Spring temperatures and changes in the biological world also have an impact on people's psychology and physiology. For agriculture, spring is the season for sowing many crops, as well as the harvesting season for many crops. Every March to April, the pressure of the southern central peninsula and southwestern China first drops, attracting warm southerly coastal winds, alternating with cool northeasterly winds. At this time, the continental anticyclone gradually weakens, and often moves east to the East Sea or Ryukyu Islands, causing northerly winds to reach Hong Kong, through a wider warm sea surface. Hong Kong's temperature and dew point steadily rise, while the coastal sea temperature remains low. When the dew point is higher than the sea temperature, fog and low-sky clouds appear, visibility gradually decreases, until another cold front or cold current reaches.

Line 11 of the Guangzhou Metro is one of the under construction lines of the Guangzhou Metro, belongs to the urban rail transport system. It is also the first ring-line subway in Guangzhou. Its provisional color is dark purple. This line is a large ring-line, at the same time incorporating Baigong Lake and the southern section of the Guangzhou City Mid-Axis Line into the subway network. Line 11 is one of the seven new lines in the Guangzhou Municipal Tram Transportation 12th Five-Year Plan, which is expected to be completed by the end of 2023 or later. Line 11 (the ring-line) is 44.2 km long, with 31 stations. The line crosses the main city of Guangzhou, connects the Laiwan District, Yuxiu District, Baiyun District, Tianhe District and Haizhu District in the central city of Guangzhou, connects Guangzhou Railway Station, Guangzhou East Station and other major transportation hubs, while taking care of the design of Baigong Lake in Fangcun and Jiangcun City. The line starts at Fangcun Station in Laiwan District, runs along Fangcun Avenue to the west, passes through the Guangmo Railway to the northeast, passes through the Pearl River to the northeast, passes through the Yellow Sands Avenue to the southeast, passes through the Laiwan Lake Park to the southeast in an S-shaped curve, then turns to the northeast, and generally runs along the railway.

International law is a generic term used in the modern international community. In ancient times, the law regulating relations between states did not use the word "international law". In ancient Rome, there was a distinction between civil law and universal law. Since the ordinary religious law of Rome did not apply to foreigners, the Romans separated the law from religion, and called it "universal law". Universal law was not international law, but only Roman private law involving foreigners. However, at least since Cicero, universal law has been understood as the principle of justice agreed upon by all states in contact with Rome, as opposed to natural law (jus naturale) based on natural justice.
