Yu Jizhang (Chinese: 余日章; 1882 – January 22, 1936), born in Wuchang, Hubei, Hubei Province, was a modern Chinese politician. He was educated at the Wuchang University of Chinese Studies in 1895 and then at St. John's University in Shanghai. He graduated from the Wuchang University of Chinese Studies in 1931. He was appointed to the faculty of education at Harvard University in 1934. He graduated in 1910 with a master's degree and became president of the Wuchang University of Chinese Studies. He officiated at the wedding of Chiang Kai-shek and Song Mei-ling on December 1, 1927, and attended the International Missionary Association in Jerusalem in 1928. He went to the United States to seek international assistance after the September Revolution of 1931. He was diagnosed with cerebral hemorrhage on January 4, 1933 in Washington, D.C., and returned to Shanghai in August of the same year. He died in Shanghai in 1936 at the age of 54.

Leizhou Bay is the largest natural bay of the Leizhou peninsula, the total area of about 900 square kilometers; Leizhou belongs to the tropical marine climate. Both sides are by the sea, the east is the South China Sea, the west is the North Bay. The summer and autumn festivals are long and many typhoons and thunderstorms, is the world's second minefield, the annual average of more than 200 days of lightning strikes, precipitation 1707 mm, the average temperature 23 °C, the historical highest temperature 38.5°C (June 8, 1977), the lowest temperature 0°C (December 2, 1975, December 29, 1975), the temperature difference between the years is obvious. The average annual precipitation of 1172 mm, the relative occurrence of dry wet season. The rainy season from June to September, mainly southerly winds. The city has uneven rainfall, the east, central, northerly heavy rainfall, the west, southern low rainfall. The annual average humidity of 84%. Leizhou City is under the jurisdiction of three street offices, 18 towns: Leicheng Street, Xihu Street, Xincheng Street, Baisa Town, Shentang Town, Jiao Town, Yangjia Town, Tangjia Town, Pingshui Town, Jiao Town, Songzhu Town, Nanxing Town, Lei Gao Town, Dongri Town, Tongfeng Town, Longmen Town, Yingli Town, Beihe Town, Uishi Town, Tantou Town, Zhangcheng Town and Zhanjiang Dynasty High-Tech Industrial Development Zone.

It is thought to have a bow shock outside the sheath, but data from the Interstellar Boundary Probe (IBEX) show that the Sun moves too slowly in interstellar matter to form a bow shock. Voyager 1 detected a stasis zone in the sheath in 2010 that began at about 113 AU. Data from Cassini and the Interstellar Boundary Probe (IBEX) challenged the theory of the "heliotail" in 2009. The particles contained in the solar wind have fields from the corona and carried by the particles, especially the magnetic field. When the Sun rotates in a period of about 27 days, the magnetic field also follows the solar wind in a spiral line. The changes in the solar magnetic field are also transmitted outwards by the solar wind and cause geomagnetic storms in the Earth's own magnetosphere.

Taiwan Island is crossed by the Northern Tropical Cyclone, the climate is hot, summer is long, between the tropical and subtropical zones, the subtropical monsoon climate to the north of the Northern Tropical Cyclone, and the tropical monsoon climate to the south. Taiwan Island has a population of about 23 million people, more than 70 percent of which are concentrated in the western five metropolitan areas, of which the Taipei metropolitan area with the administrative center Taipei as the core is the largest, about 7 million. Ethnic group consists mainly of Han and indigenous peoples: the indigenous peoples consist of several tribes belonging to the southern island peoples, the Han peoples are divided by ethnicity and immigrant age into Minnan (Khloo), Hakka and foreign province ethnic groups, of which Minnan ethnic group is the largest ethnic group in Taiwan. Taiwan Island is a continental island formed by plate collision rise, is part of the East Asian island arc (formed by the Philippine plate submerged into the Eurasian plate), about 30,000 years ago during the glacial period began human migration to Taiwan, since ancient times as a place of indigenous peoples; and the reason for this, plus the principle of one-in-one, has led to today's "Taiwan" often become the common name of the Republic of China.

The Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission is one of the main leaders of the Communist Party of China and is a state-level post. Established by the Constitution of the Communist Party of China and elected by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission, the Vice-Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission and the Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission are non-restricted in terms of the number of terms of office. According to historical practice, the Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission and the Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission serve concurrently as the Chairman of the State Central Military Commission.

Durban (South African: Durban) is the largest city in KwaZulu-Natal Province, South Africa. It is called eThekwini in Zulu, itheku in Zulu means "seaport or lagoon" and eThekwini derives from this name. Durban is the third most populous city in South Africa, after Johannesburg and Cape Town. It is also the manufacturing centre of South Africa, after Johannesburg. Durban forms part of Durban, and is known as the busiest port in South Africa. It is also considered one of the most popular tourist destinations due to its warm subtropical climate and expanding beaches. The city, along with the many small towns around it, has a population of nearly 3.7 million, making it the largest city on the African part of the Indian Ocean coastline.

Namib Desert (Namib is a Namibian language) is a desert in western Namibia, in Africa's largest national park — Namibia — Knock Loaf National Park. The desert covers an area of 50,000 square kilometers, lies on Namibia's 1,600 kilometers (1,000 miles) Atlantic coastline, ranging in width from 50 to 160 kilometers (30 to 100 miles) from east to west, and is also part of the Namibian Desert Region in southwestern Angola. This region is considered to be the world's oldest desert, with a dry and semi-dry climate that has lasted for at least 80 million years, and where air blowing from the Atlantic to the region has dried and cooled down after passing through the cold Benjira Current, forming a dry climate. The desert receives less than 10 mm (0.4 in) of rain a year, and almost no grass grows. Some unusual species of flora and fauna only occur in this desert.

This also indicates that large-scale rearrangements have occurred during the formation of Saturn V. The main hemisphere has been severely impacted and is very bright. Like the crater on Jupiter IV, Saturn V's crater lacks obvious features that can be observed on the Moon and Mercury. On the other hemisphere, bright networks can be seen on the black surface, and a few craters can be identified. These bright regions were thought to be material that erupted from ice volcanoes in early Saturn V. However, recent observations of Saturn IV have shown that the bright stripes spreading across the surface are actually ice-shaped cliffs, so astronomers have speculated that the stripes on Saturn V are also ice-shaped cliffs. Cassini flew close to Saturn V on January 17, 2006, and took a series of high-resolution photographs. Although scientific analysis is still in progress, these photographs show that the stripes on Saturn V's surface resemble the stripe structure of Saturn IV, but are actually ice cliffs.

They are usually, but not always, accompanied by coronal mass ejections. The term also applies to stars with similar phenomena, but is usually used to refer to them as "star flares". Flares affect the entire atmosphere of the Sun (luminescence, chromosome, and corona). When plasma is heated to tens of millions of K, electrons, protons, and heavier ions are accelerated to near the speed of light. The electromagnetic spectrum they produce, from radio waves to gamma rays, includes electromagnetic radiation of all wavelengths. However, most of the energy is outside the visible light range, so most of the flares are invisible to the naked eye, requiring different frequencies to be observed with different instruments. Flares occur in the region of activity surrounding the Sun's black hole, from where a strong magnetic field penetrates the photosphere connecting the corona to the magnetic field inside the Sun. Flares suddenly (on a time scale of minutes to tens of minutes) release the energy stored in the corona; coronal mass ejections (CME) can also release equal energy, but the relationship between the two is not clear.

In January 2013, the company announced a breakthrough milestone of 240 billion URLs. As of December 2014 (2014-12) As of July 2016 (2016-07) As of September 2018 (2018-09) From October 2013 to March 2015, the site's global Alexa rankings For 163 years, the site's Time Machine has respected robots.txt to determine whether a site is crawled; or if it has been, whether its archives can be viewed publicly.

After the founding of the People's Republic of China, Mao Zedong served as Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission from 1954 until his death in 1976, the longest-serving post in the era of Mao Zedong, except for the Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. After Mao Zedong's death, he was succeeded by Guo Feng Hua, Deng Xiaoping replaced Guo Feng Hua as Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission at the 6th Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in 1981 until 1989, and then by Jiang Zemin as Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission at the 5th Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. Jiang Zemin resigned as Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission at the 4th Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in 2004, and was succeeded by Hu Jintao. After the 1st Plenary Session of the 18th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in 2012, Xi Jinping succeeded Hu Jintao as Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission. Objectively speaking, in Mainland China, after the complete stabilization of the military power, the General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee (formerly Chairman of the CPC Central Committee in 1982) and the Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission are both concurrently appointed, with the longest-serving Mao Zedong holding both positions for life.

Coat of arms of the People's Liberation Army China Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center, also known as the 20th Experimental Training Base of the People's Liberation Army (63,600 troops of the People's Liberation Army), Dongfeng Base, Dongfeng Space City, located at the intersection of the Shuttletown of Jinta County, Jiuquan City, Gansu Province and Dongfeng Town of the Alliance of Zeniths of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, 1,000 meters above sea level, covering an area of about 2,800 square kilometers, belongs to the Strategic Support Force of the People's Liberation Army, is one of China's missile and satellite launch bases. China Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center was the first manned rocket launch test base of the People's Republic of China, built in the 1950s through the cooperation of experts from the Soviet Union.

This duty is called Cho Queen, and is a noble duty among the ladies in the palace, often performed by the daughter of a prince, that is, a queen, because of the honor and high status of this duty, all the queens are willing to perform the duty. Cho Queen since the beginning of the Heian period, the first Emperor Kanmu, then until the Meiji Emperor, and successive emperors, and Ise Saigu and Kamo Saigu-in compared, is one of the more distant Shinto rituals. Initially, the duties of both sides of the curtain were performed by the queen, but since the Heian period, it has become the custom to perform the duties of the left side of the curtain by the queen, and the right side of the receiving duties by the chambermaid. And the chambermaid who was chosen to perform the right side of the ceremony will be called Cho chambermaid, the chambermaid in the chambermaid's position only next to the highest female officer, is the deputy of the chambermaid's office, therefore, the ladies are selected as Cho chambermaid, their position is undoubtedly directly elevated to the chambermaid, and if the chambermaid is selected as Cho chambermaid, then the chambermaid's position will also be enhanced among the many chambermaids, because she has been performing the sacred duty of "declaration of the new emperor."

Sam-tiông-khu, formerly known as "San-têng-po", is located in northwestern New Taipei City, Taiwan, on the west bank of the Tamsui River, one of the satellite cities of the Taipei metropolitan area. Due to its early development in the vicinity of Taipei City, the pre-reformed city of San-têng-po was the first county city of Taipei Prefecture, and the first county city of Taiwan to be reorganized by a town. San-têng-po, formerly known as "San-têng-po", means "plain" in Taiwan, is unrelated to the Japanese county of San-têng-po. Taiwan's modern development is from south to north; the northern development, of which, began along the Tamsui River. During the Qing Dynasty, the entire Taipei Basin was connected to the outside world, all relying on the water transportation system formed by the Tamsui River and its tributaries, at that time, large sailing ships from China could reach Xinzhuang. Hokkaido immigrants who landed in Xinzhuang, gradually reclaimed the north, and named the traditional name "Po" for the riverbank Shazhou Plain.

These volcanic processes enhanced visual contrast, making Io's surface appear like a pizza. These volcanic processes provided supplementary material for Io's thin atmosphere and for Jupiter's massive magnetosphere. Io played an important role in 17th and 18th century astronomy, being discovered by Galileo in 1610 along with other Galilean moons. This discovery led to the acceptance of the Copernican model of the Solar System, the development of the planetary motion law by John Kepler, and the first measurement of the speed of light by Ole Rømer. From Earth's point of view, in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, Io was only a point of light, until we were able to explain large-scale features on its surface, such as dark red polar regions and bright equatorial regions.

In 1946, Nixon was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives for California's twelfth congressional district, and in 1950 he was elected to the U.S. Senate. The false testimony of Alger Heath made him an anti-communist leader and a nationally renowned politician. Nixon ran against Dwight D. Eisenhower in the 1952 U.S. presidential election and served as Vice President for eight years after winning. In 1960, he ran for President, but lost to John F. Kennedy by a narrow margin. In 1962, he ran for Governor of California, but was defeated. In 1968, he ran for President again and won. Nixon initially increased U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War, but then gradually withdrew, suspending U.S. involvement in 1973. In 1972, he visited the People's Republic of China, opening a new chapter in diplomatic relations between the two countries, and in the same year signed an anti-ballistic missile treaty with the Soviet Union and implemented a policy of détente.

The Indian leopard (Acinonyx jubatus) is a large cat, the only extant species of the genus Cheetah. It is found in Africa and Iran, historically in Western, Central and South Asian countries, and in more arid and hot open habitats, including grasslands, semi-desert and bare rock areas. It was largely bred by the British colonial Indian royal family, used for hunting antelopes and deer, and is similar in appearance to the leopard, hence the name Cheetah. It is yellowish-brown or pale yellow in color, white on the muzzle, chin, chest, abdomen and inside of the limbs; it has black spots on the body, which are smaller and more solid than the leopard; the head is small and round, the muzzle is shorter, the eye is white, and the corner of the inner eye along the nose is a distinctive black stripe. It is divided into four subspecies: the East African leopard, the Northeast African leopard, the Northwest African leopard and the Asian leopard; the largest and most abundant of which is the East African leopard, the adult male weighs 29-71 kilograms, weighing 45 kilograms, the adult female 21-63 kilograms, weighing 38 kilograms; the other three subspecies usually weigh less than 35 kilograms.

The planet is not in the habitable zone of its parent star, and is only 0.04 AU away, with a rotation period of only 3.236 days, which is far higher than the temperature at which liquid hydrogen exists, and even higher than the temperature at which many silicate rocks melt into plasma. In contrast, the surface temperature of Venus, the planet with the highest surface temperature in the Solar System, is 462°C or 735 K. Seismic analysis, chromosome activity, and stellar rotation (revolutionary anthropology) studies have determined that the two stars are slightly older than the Solar System, at about 4.5 to 7 billion years. The habitable zone of South Gate II B ranges from 0.5 to 0.9 AU. A 2009 computer simulation showed that the most likely location of a planet in the habitable zone is the boundary line within the habitable zone. Special assumptions must be made in the simulation in order to obtain an environment far away from the star, allowing the planet to form an environment that facilitates the accretion process.

The Republic of Paraguay (Spanish: República del Paraguay; Guarani: Tavakuairetã Paraguái), commonly referred to as Paraguay (Spanish: Paraguay; Guarani: Paraguayá), is a sovereign state in South America and a landlocked country in South America, located on both sides of the Paraguay River. Its southern border is entirely with Argentina, and its northeastern and northwestern corners are Brazil and Bolivia, members of the Union of South American States and the Common Market of the South. Its capital and largest city is Asunción. Although Paraguay is a landlocked country, ships on the Barana River and in ports along the Barana River can also pass through the Barana-Paraguay River waterway to the Atlantic Ocean. Paraguay is a developing country, and is a member and founding member of the Common Market of the South, the United Nations, the Organization of American States, the Non-Aligned Movement and the Lima Group.

In Greek mythology, Pisces represents the incarnation of Aphrodite and Eros in the water. In order to escape the attack of Tikhon, the son of Gaia, the goddess of the earth, Aphrodite became a fish hiding in the Nile (Jurassic River). Later, she found that she had forgotten to take her son Eros with her and fled with him, so she went ashore to find Eros. To prevent her from being separated from her son, she tied her feet together, then they became a fish shape and dived into the river. Later, Zeus raised Aphrodite's first incarnation of the fish to the sky to become Pisces Scorpio, and the two fish she tied together with Eros's incarnation were called Pisces. Ancient Chinese tradition called the zodiac of Pisces Pisces the zodiac of the wall of Pisces, Thunder, Cloud Rain, Saturn, Pisces of Pisces, Outer Screen and Pisces of Pisces. Equatorial coordinates of the celestial sphere: 01h 00m 00s, +15° 00′ 00′′.

In the spring of 1924, Zhu returned to China and became a professor of geology at Peking University and a lecturer in German. In March 1926, the students of Beijing were suppressed by the interim government during a student demonstration, resulting in 38 fatalities. Zhu was accused of being responsible for the student demonstration and was wanted by the interim government. Zhu fled to his hometown, and in July of the same year became a professor and head of the department of geology at National Guangdong University. In October, Guangdong University was reorganized as National Zhongshan University, Zhu became the acting chairman of the Zhongshan University Committee. In November 1926, Zhu became a member of the Guangdong Provincial Government of the Guangzhou National Government, and began his political career. In May 1927, he was transferred to the Zhejiang Political Affairs Committee and head of the Zhejiang Agricultural and Industrial Department. In June, he was appointed vice-president of Zhongshan University, and after the establishment of the two Guangdong Geological Surveys, he also served as the director.

On December 19, 2015, three subway line sections were opened. Line 11 Luoshan Road Station - Kangxin Highway Station was opened. On January 1, 2016, Kunshan City Railway Investment Development Co., Ltd. officially took over the operation of Line 11 Huaqiao section. On April 26, Line 11 Kangxin Highway Station - Disney Station was opened. On December 30, 2017, Line 9 Yang High School Road Station - Cao Road Station was opened. On March 31, 2018, Pujiang Line Shen Du Highway Station - Huizhen Road Station was opened. On August 25, 2020, Line 11 Chen Xiang Highway Station was opened. On December 26, Line 10 Stage 2 Xinjiang Bay City Station - Keelung Road Station was opened. On the same day, Line 18 Stage 1 South Head Station - Miqiao Station was opened for the first time. On January 23, 2021, Line 15 Gucun Park Station - Zi Zhukou High New Area Station was opened for the first time (in which Guilin Road Station was suspended due to the slow construction progress).

The National Library of Australia is the largest reference (non-lending) library in Australia. It was established in 1960. It is located in the Australian capital Territory of Canberra. Under the Federal Act on the National Library of Australia, the National Library is responsible for "the maintenance and development of the national library collection, including a comprehensive collection of library materials on Australia and the Australian people". The library's collection comprises 10,416,119 items. Although the National Library was formally established in 1960 (through the National Library Act 1960), its structure dates back to the establishment of the Library of the Federal Parliament in 1901. The Library of the Federal Parliament is the library of the Australian Parliament, but has since been established with the aim of collecting information of a national nature rather than a purely parliamentary library.

The Panyu Lotus Card was first introduced by Panyu City Bus Co., Ltd. on June 23, 1997, and has been used to deduct fares on its buses. More than 400,000 cards have been issued to date. Panyu City (now Panyu District) is the second area in Mainland China, after Shenzhen, to use non-contact IC card to store valuable tickets. With the development of the times, as the card can only be used on bus routes belonging to Panyu Motor Company (commonly known as "green and white cars"), the application scope is narrow, it is becoming increasingly inconvenient for Panyu citizens to travel. As Panyu Motor Company began to be compatible with "Yoseongtong", many citizens began to switch to Yoseongtong, the card also gradually exited the stage. In 2003, three routes of 1, 13 and 15 routes of Panyu Motor Company began to be compatible with Yoseongtong. Since November 10, 2006, all routes of Panyu Motor Company are compatible with Yoseongtong, at that time using Yoseongtong to ride on the buses of Panyu Motor Company has no fare advantages.

According to WHO estimates, the suicide rate among Chinese men has been higher than among women since 2001. The widespread use of pesticides in rural China and the poor healthcare facilities in rural areas are among the reasons why the suicide rate in rural China has been among the highest in the world. According to a 2006 letter from the journal Nature, per capita drug use rates in the United Kingdom and Sri Lanka are not significantly different each year, but because of these two factors, the death rate of drug users in Sri Lanka is 15 times higher than in the United Kingdom and Sri Lanka. The authors speculate that the high suicide rate in rural China may be due to similar mechanisms. In the case of suicide, the motives of each suicide attempter are different, and the psychological quality of the individual, the microenvironment and the degree of social support in the vicinity play a major role. The macroscopically high suicide rate undoubtedly reflects problems at the social and cultural levels, which need to be prevented and solved at the level of public policy.

Although society is classified, in a fair society, people can find an appropriate way, through struggle, to seek to belong to the upper classes. The upper class is the subject of many literary works, such as The Tea Lady, The Long Road Ahead, Memories of the Water Age, and The Tale of the Merchant. The upper class persons, such as Princess Diana, and Baroness Hilton, are also the subjects of the inquiry of the underground magazine The Cowboys. Traditionally, the upper class in China usually refers to a group of people with a higher social status, usually with higher education, taste, and a taste for fine art (at least "submissive elegance"; the latter is distinguished from the upper class by the fact that the latter is classified purely by wealth. In most people's eyes, the "upper class" is similar to the "upper class", but some "upper class" people dislike the newly wealthy person (the "burnout"), trying to figure out how to limit their "entry"; some clubs, such as the Hong Kong Jockey Club, require more than one current member's recommendation to join, not just money.

In 1925, Sun expected to go to Nankai Secondary School in Tianjin City to study literature and thus enter university, but after his father, who was serving as a judge in Harbin, suggested that "China needs engineers and Russian-speaking talents," he left his hometown with his father to the northeastern Chinese city of Harbin in the ice and snow, and entered the Russian-speaking secondary school for Russian overseas students, studying Russian.17. In 1934, after graduating from Harbin Institute of Technology, Sun returned to Guangdong to disguise himself as a businessman and entered Guangdong.23-24. In 1936, because the paper "New Algorithm for Power Grid Distribution" published in the Engineering Magazine of the Chinese Society of Engineers was recognized by the National Government Resources Committee, and joined the Resources Committee in Nanjing, participated in the preparation and construction of the Xiangtan Xiangjiang Power Plant.

Mu Bin (Chinese: 缪斌; 1899 – May 21, 1946) was a Chinese politician from Wuxi, Jiangsu Province, who was executed for adultery after being sentenced to death. After graduating from Shanghai Nanyang University, he joined the Nationalist Party of China in 1922. In 1923, Huangpu Military Academy was founded, and he was appointed as a telecommunications and political instructor in the faculty. In February 1925, he was appointed as a representative of the 1st Party Regiment in the army, participated in the 1st Eastern Campaign, and as a captain of the Death Squad in the attack on Chen Jiangming, led the attack on Freshwater City. In April of the same year, he became one of the initiators of the right-wing Sunnism Society in the army. In October, he was appointed as a representative of the 2nd Party Division of the 1st Army of the National Revolutionary Army, and joined the army in the 2nd Eastern Campaign. In January 1926, he was elected as the 2nd candidate of the Nationalist Party of China's Central Executive Committee (he was subsequently re-elected as the 3rd and 4th candidate of the Central Executive Committee).

The National Committee for the Defence of Children of the People's Republic of China was the leading body for the work of national children in the early days of the People's Republic of China. From January 31 to February 5, 1950, at the Berlin Conference of the Council of the International Federation of Democratic Women, a call was issued for the strengthening and expansion of the Movement for the Defence of Children, calling on the member countries of the International Federation of Democratic Women to organize a broadly representative National Committee for the Defence of Children, to unite all those in the world who care about the welfare of children, to unite against the aggressive war of aggression of imperialism, to strive for a lasting peace in the world, and to strengthen and expand the International Movement for the Defence of Children. Subsequently, the Movement was widely promoted, and by November 1951, France, Italy, Tunisia, Belgium, Iran, Vietnam and other countries had established National Committees for the Defence of Children. On November 26, 1951, in response to the call of the International Federation of Democratic Women, the National Committee for the Defence of Children of the People's Republic of China was established.

Coordinates: 23°09′55′′N 120°10′37′′E / 23.165256°N 120.177040°E / 23.165256; 120.177040Ka-lí-khu (Chinese: 佳里區) is located in the western part of the south-eastern part of Taiwan. It is one of the most populous towns in the whole county before the merger of the city. It is flat and has an altitude of 5.5 meters. It is surrounded by the rivers Tseung Kwan and Seung Kwan. Ka-lí-khu is the gateway to the salt sub-zone and the center of the political system in Dabeimen region. Since the days of Jiang Zemin, many writers and poets from the salt sub-zone have come to be regarded as the literary capital of Taiwan.

Due to the long history of establishing the school, and the commercial development of the surrounding area, the neighborhood of the school district has formed a relatively large-scale Zhongyuan Night Market (Zhongli District Practice Road, along with the Nishin Road). The school gate of Zhongyuan University is often called McDonald's Gate or Bread Gate by students because of its M-shaped appearance. The school gate was completed in 2012. Atsushi, Shin, Rik, GyoAACSB(Association for the Promotion of International Business Schools)In February 2015, Zhongyuan University Business School passed the accreditation of the Association for the Promotion of International Business Schools (AACSB), one of the world's three leading business school evaluation units, and is ranked among the top 5% of excellent business schools in the world. As of October 2020, only 26 schools out of more than 100 public and private universities in Taiwan have this distinction, which proves that Zhongyuan University is not only focused on education in the field of science and technology, but also further becomes a private university that nurtures all-round talent in all fields.

Due to the high birth rate of blacks, Zimbabwe's population has risen to 14.43 million (2018), and blacks have now made up more than 99% of the total population, mainly of the Shawna (79%) and Ndebele (17%) ethnic groups. Since the 11th century, there have been various indigenous nations in Zimbabwe such as Rozvi, Mutapa and Mthwakazi. The British South African Company invaded Zimbabwe in 1890, and after massacring the locals, drew up the borderline of what is now Zimbabwe. 1890 to 1980 was the colonial era in Zimbabwe's history (Rodisia), and was ruled by whites, the name derived from Cecil Rhodes, who established a colony in the area for the United Kingdom.

On October 5, 1903, the Foshan-Sansui section was completed, marking the completion of the entire line of the Guangdong-Sansui Railway, which cost a total of $40 million. At that time, two Guangdong governors, Zen Chunhui, presided over the grand opening ceremony. In 1929, the National Government annexed the province's Fengxiang Road to the Cantonese-Canadian Railway Administration, and renamed the Cantonese-Canadian Railway Guangdong-Sansui section. On October 21, 1938, after the occupation of Guangzhou by the Japanese army, the Sheweitang-Foshan right line and the Foshan-Sansui single line were all demolished, some of the railway freight was laid elsewhere, the remaining railway freight was concentrated at Huangsha Station to be transported, and the trackbed after the demolition was converted into a highway. After the end of the Anti-Japanese War in 1945, the railway was received by the Guangdong District dispatcher office, and the remaining railway was repaired and maintained. In July 1946, all the demolished railway lines were re-launched in their original form.

The Central and South China Sea is located in the West District of Beijing City, Xi Chang'an Street Street, a broad term refers to the area adjacent to the China Sea and the South China Sea in the Beijing Imperial Palace, adjacent to the Forbidden City. It occupies 100 hectares, including about 50 hectares of water, is the seat of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, the CPC Central Committee Secretariat and the General Office of the CPC Central Committee. Since the establishment of the People's Republic of China, all the leaders of the Party and the state have lived here, so the location of the Central and South China Sea is often used to refer to the highest power of the Communist Party of China and the Government of the People's Republic of China. In a narrow sense, the Central and South China Sea refers only to the two connected lakes "China Sea" and "South China Sea" on the west side of the Beijing Forbidden City. Historically, the North Sea, the Central Sea and the South China Sea are collectively known as Taili Pond, is the core part of the "West Garden" or "West Interior" of the Imperial Palace in the Ming and Qing dynasties. During the Jin Dynasties, in today's northern part of the Central and South China Sea there are Taili Pond and Daning Palace, Taili Qiubo is one of the eight scenes of Yanjing formed in the Jin Dynasty.

The history of white South Africans dates back to the 16th century. The Portuguese navigator Vasco da Gama arrived at Cape Horn and began the colonization of white South Africans. Portugal subsequently controlled the route through Africa to India, but did not fully colonize the area. The European colonial history of South Africa began in 1652, with the colonization of Cape Horn under the leadership of Jan van Ribeck of the Dutch East India Company. The first national census of South Africa was held in 1911, when the white population was 1,276,242. By 1936, South Africa estimated that there were 2,035,857 whites, and by 1946, that figure had risen to 2,372,690. After the end of the white regime in 1994, many white South Africans chose to emigrate to the United Kingdom, the United States and Australia in order to escape the reprisals of the new black regime.

Japan continued to implement the city system in Taiwan based on the Taipei Governor's Office, and established Taipei on the basis of the "three city streets" in 1920, and continues to this day; in the same year that Taipei was established, the jurisdiction included today's Taipei Prefecture, including Taipei City, New Taipei City, Keelung City, Yilan County, and so on. The Japanese Governor's Office carried out large-scale public construction of the Taipei Prefecture, making it an important base for Japan's crossing of the Southern Ocean, and laid the foundation for the development of Taipei City. After the end of World War II, Taiwan entered the Republic of China, Taipei City and Keelung City were separated from the Taipei Prefecture to become provincial cities, and the jurisdiction of the remaining Taipei Prefecture was reorganized into Taipei County. In 1949, the Government of the Republic of China was defeated in the Civil War and the capital was moved to Taipei, and Taipei became the governing center after the Republic of China lost its continental territory (the relocation of the provincial capital); after the Civil War, a large number of foreign provinces moved to Taiwan with the National Government, most of them living in Taipei, once made Taipei's population increase rapidly.

Purchasing power parity (PPP) is a coefficient of equality between currencies based on different price levels, which allows us to make economically reasonable comparisons between countries' GDP, and this theoretical exchange rate may differ greatly from the actual exchange rate. The unit of account for purchasing power parity is the international dollar (Intl.$) or the "international currency unit" (ICU). Purchasing power parity is based on the dollar, i.e. the purchasing power of a dollar in the United States is the reference base; therefore, the purchasing power of a dollar in individual countries is equal to the purchasing power of a dollar in the United States, so in many cases, purchasing power parity is directly measured in US dollars.

According to the registration data of the Taiwan Taoyuan District Court, Jiping Secondary School was approved by the Education Department of the Taiwan Provincial Government on August 24, 1965, and its affiliated corporation was registered as the "Private Jiping Higher Secondary School Foundation Corporation of Taiwan Taoyuan County" on August 19, 1966. According to the archives of the National Archives of Taiwan, on August 14, 1965, the "Private Jiping Primary Secondary School Board of Taiwan Taoyuan County" was approved by the Education Department of the Taiwan Provincial Government in Letter No. 48148. In August 1966, the Foundation "Private Jiping Higher Secondary School Foundation Corporation of Taiwan Taoyuan County" was registered and announced by the District Court, and its purpose of establishment was "Development of education, cultivation of youth." On April 30, 1982, Choi Chong-hoon, the chairman of Jiping Secondary School, wrote in the "Jiping Monthly" published by the school, which was titled by the Minister of Education, Zhu Hui-sun, that the educational goal of Jiping Secondary School was "In addition to cultivating graduate colleges, continue to deepen high school students; moreover, we shoulder responsibility for the balanced development of virtue, intelligence, body, group, beauty and five-fold education for the upcoming high school students serving the society, for the nation to build a nation of hands-on minds and uses, good morals and virtues, upholding the law in public, and for the nation to build a democratic and liberal society with three-party socialism and peace, laying a solid foundation."

Queensland is a major exporter of milk, coffee, tobacco, peanuts, timber, beans, apples, bananas, pears, cucumbers, lychees, mangoes, cereals, sugar cane and cotton. It is rich in mineral resources, accounting for 24% of Australia's total production. The main minerals are lead, zinc, copper, uranium, aluminium clay, manganese, silver, gold, molybdenum, coal, iron ore, petroleum, natural gas, phosphate, rhododenite and protein stone. The Dutch discovered Queensland around the 17th century. In 1770, Captain Cook of the British Navy charted the coastline of Queensland. After 1810, a wave of gold rush attracted many immigrants, and the land lease schemes granted by the colonial government further encouraged the flow of free immigrants. Queensland was part of the British colony of New South Wales until 6 June 1859; on 6 June 1859, Queensland enacted the first new law; and on 10 December that year, the first Governor of Queensland, Sir John Bowen, formally proclaimed the independence of Queensland from New South Wales as a self-governing colony.

The Republic of Guatemala (Spanish: República de Guatemala), commonly known as Guatemala, is located in Central America, bordering the Pacific Ocean to the west, the Caribbean Sea to the east, Mexico to the north, Belize to the northeast, Honduras and El Salvador to the southeast. The Spanish name "Guatemala" comes from the Nahuatl word cuauhtēmallān, or "place with many trees", derived from the K'iche' people word "many trees".

The islands of Kiribati were discovered by the British and Americans in the late 18th and early 19th centuries. In 1820, a Russian admiral, Admiral Clausenstedt, named the main island the Gilbert Islands. In the early 19th century, pirate and slave ships landed on Kiribati, bringing weapons and disease, and the first British colonists landed on the island in 1837. During World War II, Tarawa Atoll and other islands were occupied by Japanese forces, the Battle of Tarawa was one of the bloodiest battles in the history of the United States Marine Corps, and Marines landed on the island in November 1943. Some islands of Kiribati, particularly the Lane Islands, were used by the United Kingdom and the United States for nuclear testing in the 1950s and 1960s. Gilbert and the Erie Islands became self-governing territories in 1971. In 1974, due to ethnic disputes, residents of the Erie Islands, who belonged to the Polynesian population, called for a vote, and in 1975 separated from the Micronesian-dominated Gilbert Islands.

In December 2007, the station was closed. On December 28, 2009, the station was opened with the opening of Line 5. The top research and higher education institutions in the United States are called private universities because of the ease with which funds are used, the willingness of alumni and businesses to contribute, and the fact that they enjoy the same government support as public universities. Under the scholarship system, private universities tend to monopolize the best sources of young people. In terms of the University Department, almost all of the top 20 universities in the United States are private universities, and their alumni and professors hold the vast majority of the world's Nobel Prizes, such as the eight Ivy League universities, as well as the universities of Chicago, Stanford, MIT, California Institute of Technology, Johns Hopkins University, Carnegie Mellon University, and others. The "public" and "private" nature of British universities is difficult to distinguish, because for centuries, British universities have been highly autonomous, and until the early 20th century, they relied on government funding to operate.

For example, in the case of China, the Battle of Xuzhou began after the Battle of the Tsupo Line and the Battle of Nanjing, and lasted from late December 1937 to the capture of the city of Xuzhou by the Japanese on May 19, 1938. However, for the Japanese, until April 1938, the Japanese had adopted a policy of not expanding the battlefield, not implementing large-scale military plans with plans and objectives. Even if there were large-scale operations such as the Taierzhuang outbreak, for the Japanese, the only tactical policy was to push the battlefield farther forward; the Japanese definition of the Battle of Xuzhou was the operational policy of "eliminating the enemy forces in the Xuzhou region" formally adopted by the headquarters on April 7, 1938.

In Japan and elsewhere, public universities refer exclusively to universities established by local governments, while universities established by state funds are called "national universities." Universities on the mainland of China are mainly public universities, and their expenses are borne by the state budget. The competent units of public universities (excluding military schools) are usually the Ministry of Education and the provincial education administration, while some schools are competent units of the State Ministry or committees in charge of certain matters, such as the Ministry of Industry and Informatization of Harbin University. Universities under the responsibility of the Ministry are generally focused on the construction of universities. Some universities currently under the administration of the provincial education administration were formerly under the administration of the Ministry, but in the reforms of the late 1990s they were assigned to the responsibility of the provincial education administration, such as the Southwest University of Political Science and Law and Yanshan University. Some of these universities belong to the provincial ministries for the construction of universities, i.e. under the responsibility of the provincial education administration and with the involvement of a committee.

Cape Peninsula is a prominent peninsula in South Africa. Behind the peninsula is a huge rock called Table Mt., which rises above 1000 m. The peninsula's point is the famous Cape of Good Hope, which was discovered in 1652 by a Dutch East India Company ship, landing at Table Bay, which opened the colonial history of South Africa. Cape Peninsula has a beautiful and narrow coastline, the most famous of which is the Gulf of Bother, Girl's Bay, with twelve peaks facing the edge of the bay, known as the "Twelve Pilgrim Mountains", the whole coastline has penguins, and 2,600 species of plants have been discovered. Another specialty of the Cape Peninsula is ostrich, which accounts for more than 90% of the world's total production. Cape Peninsula University of Technology is located on the Cape Peninsula.

Urdu (Urdu:اُردُو) is an Indo-Aryan language belonging to the Indo-Iranian language family. It is the 20th most widely spoken language in the world, the national language of Pakistan and one of the 24 official languages of India. From a macro perspective, Urdu can be regarded as part of the Indo-Pakistani language, with all the Indo-Pakistani languages making up the fourth largest language in the world. Between 1200 and 1800, under the rule of the Delhi Sultanate and the Mughal Empire, Urdu was influenced by Persian, Turkish, Kurdish and Arabic. Urdu is spoken by some 60 to 80 million native speakers, of whom 52 million are in India (2001), accounting for 6% of the country's population at that time; 13 million in Pakistan (2008), accounting for 8% of the country's population; and there are also native speakers around the world.

One day after marriage, Orpheus, while playing, was bitten by a poisonous snake and died of poisoning, and crashed into the dungeon. Orpheus, in desperation, embraced the harp, ventured into the dungeon, to seek his beloved wife. Arriving in the dungeon, his sad and complaining harp touched the softening of Pluto, so Pluto's unprecedented response to the Pluto's history to return to the sun, but repeatedly told Orpheus on his way back to the sun, do not look back at his wife. Orpheus responded, did not look back all the way, but just as he was about to arrive in the sun, could not resist to see if the wife had followed and returned, did not expect that at this time, his beloved wife, in a loud cry, fell into the Underworld again.

United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2758, adopted at the 26th Session of the United Nations General Assembly on October 25, 1971, on "Restoration of the Legal Rights of the People's Republic of China in the Organization of the United Nations". The People's Republic of China replaced the seat of the Republic of China in the United Nations. On October 1, 1949, the victorious Communist Party of China established the People's Republic of China, and the Republic of China withdrew from Taiwan, forming a "two-China" regime. The Government of the People's Republic of China subsequently attempted in various ways to obtain the seat of the United Nations "China" owned by the Government of the Republic of China. On August 24, 1950, the Prime Minister and Foreign Minister of the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China, Zhou En, sent a telegram to the President of the United Nations Security Council, Mark Malloch Brown, and Secretary-General Trygway Lai, on behalf of the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China, to file a complaint with the United Nations concerning the "Armed aggression of the United States against the territory of China, Taiwan," demanding that the United Nations Security Council take immediate measures to "sanction the crimes of the armed aggression of the United States against the territory of China."

After receiving military training abroad, he returned to the country in 1964 and waged guerrilla warfare against the Portuguese army in the northern part of Mozambique. In 1970, Machel became the main military leader of the Mozambican National Liberation Front (MLF). In the aftermath of MLF's military attacks, Portugal was plunged into war. On April 25, 1974, a military coup took place in Portugal and the new government announced its withdrawal from Mozambique. The MLF finally led the Mozambican people to independence. On June 25, 1975, Machel was elected President of Mozambique. During his tenure, Machel established a one-party dictatorship at home, nationalized the property of former Portuguese colonists, and popularized basic education and health care systems in underdeveloped areas. Internationally, he supported the struggle of blacks in Rhodesia and South Africa against apartheid. His opponents formed the Mozambican National Resistance Movement (MoRENAMO) in 1976 with the aim of overthrowing the one-party dictatorship and waging a military struggle against the MLF.

In the early 13th century, an ancient grenade, the earthquake torpedo, appeared in the Chinese army. In 1405, a handwritten manuscript in Italy showed an example of a hand grenade. After the 17th century, a hand grenade made of iron shells appeared. At this time, the name hand grenade appeared in Europe, and it is still used today. In the 17th and 18th centuries, hand grenades were widely used in the European army, and there were professional grenade troops. In the 19th century, the development of guns and the reduction of siege of castles made grenades unpopular. In the 20th century, the Russo-Japanese War of 1904 and subsequent World War I and World War II, trench warfare arose, and grenades were widely used. In modern infantry, grenades are one of the most important weapons.

As a regional commercial empire, Oman controlled the island of Zanzibar and the coast of Swaziland. In 1834, Syed bin Sultan transferred the capital to Zanzibar, known as the Sultanate of Zanzibar. Oman became the hegemonic power of the Indian Ocean, prospered in the slave trade in the Great Lakes region of Africa, many families moved to Zanzibar. After the British declared the slave trade illegal, the fate of Oman began to reverse, the Omani economy began to collapse, the mountain tribal uprising, the establishment of the Islamic Emirate of Oman. In the 1850s and 1870s, the population of Muscat fell from 55,000 people to 80.00 people. In 1856, Syed bin Sultan died, his two sons respectively ruled Muscat and Zanzibar, in 1861, the two territories officially split, Oman declined. In 1868, the Emirate of Oman seized Muscat.

Secondly, he oversaw the party affairs organization of the Kuomintang, which led to the nickname "Chiang Kai-shek's Chen Jia Party." Chen had been suffering from tuberculosis since the Revolution in Xinhai, was hospitalized frequently with hemorrhage, and had undergone several surgeries during the war. In the 1950s, Reagan switched from acting to television and worked for the industrial company General Electric. In 1964, Reagan delivered a "Time to Choose" speech to Republican presidential candidate Howard Howard, which earned him national attention and became a spokesman for the neo-conservatives of the time. After winning a number of supporters, Reagan was elected governor of California in 1966. During his tenure as governor, Reagan chose to raise taxes and successfully reduce the budget deficit to a profit. However, his actions in raising taxes also caused protests by students at the University of California, Berkeley. During student demonstrations, Reagan imposed the National Guard on campus in a harsh manner. Reagan defeated then-Democratic President Jimmy Carter in the 1980 election campaign, and the Republican Party won the Senate for the first time in 26 years.

After World War II, Eisenhower was appointed by President Truman as Chief of the United States Army Staff (1945–1948), President of Columbia University (1948–1953), and the first Supreme Commander of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (1951–1952). In 1952, Eisenhower, aged 62, ran as a Republican in the 1952 United States presidential election. Eisenhower's primary intention was to prevent his party from competing with the Republican Senator Robert A. Taft, who had opposed the establishment of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization openly because he did not want the United States to be in a "conflict with the outside world" again after the war. Eisenhower won both that year's election and the 1956 re-election by an overwhelming margin, defeating his Democratic opponent, Adele Stevenson II, twice in a row.

In 1985, Weidila was sentenced to life imprisonment for crimes against humanity. In 1990, President Carlos Saur Menem granted an amnesty to Weidila and other leaders of the military government during the dictatorship in order to gain the support of the right wing. In 1998, Weidila was again placed under house arrest. In 2007, this amnesty was declared invalid. Weidila was subsequently arrested. On 22 December 2010, the court found that he had ordered the abuse and murder of 31 political prisoners during his presidency, and sentenced him to 50 years in prison for "the baby-stealing case". The charges were that he commanded the stolen babies of political prisoners during his presidency, and believed that at least 400 babies had been hugged during the detention of their parents. To date, more than 100 children of recognized dissidents have been reunited with their biological parents. Thus, he was sentenced to 50 years in prison again for crimes against humanity.

On July 1, 1925, the National Government was formally established in Guangzhou, and the National Government Committee also operated at the same time. Until 1926, the Committee was roughly structured as one chairman, a number of members, all of whom were elected by the Central Executive Committee of the Kuomintang. Afterwards, one chairman and five permanent members were elected from among the members of the Committee. Between April 16 and September 20, 1927, Ninghan was divided, and both Wuhan and Nanjing were established as National Governments. In Wuhan, the National Government Committee abolished the chairman, still had a number of members, all of whom were elected by the Central Executive Committee of the Kuomintang. Afterwards, five permanent members were elected from among the members of the Committee. After the election, five permanent members were elected: Wang Xiewei, Tan Yanxiang, Sun Ko, Xu Qian, and Song Ziwen. In the Nanjing National Government led by Chiang Kai-shek, except for the retention of one chairman and the addition of seven permanent members, the remaining appointment system was the same as that of the Wuhan National Government.

A window is a visible area of the user interface. Windows are usually rectangular. It contains various controls, and is used as an interface for input and output. Although windows are commonly used in graphical user interfaces, they are also sometimes used in command line interfaces. A system that uses windows as the main user interface is called a window system. This idea originated in the Schläparlo Alto Research Center. In a window system, windows are usually drawn as two-dimensional objects, placed on a desktop. Most windows can be resized, moved, hidden, recovered, and closed at the user's request. When two windows overlap, as in everyday life, one of them must be on top of the other, while the lower one is somewhat covered by the upper window. The part of the window system that manages this operation is called the window manager.

When most Pluto asteroids have low orbital inclinations, an orbital characteristic that is indeed similar to Pluto emerges: an inclination of 10-25o, an eccentricity of 0.2-0.25, with the result that the perihelion is within (or approaching) the orbit of Neptune, and the ecliptic is near the outer edge of the Kuiper belt (where the orbital period resonates at 1:2 with the orbit of Neptune). The orbital periods of Pluto asteroids are near 247.3 years (1.5 times the orbital period of Neptune), with variations upwards and downwards of only a few years.

Townships and townships organize basic militia battalions or companies, leading the basic militia of the whole township. Cities and townships organize urban militia, large factory and mining enterprises can organize workshops and sub-factories as units, and small and medium-sized enterprises can organize across workshops and battalions. Administrative villages organize ordinary militia battalions (battalions), leading the basic militia and ordinary militia of their villages. Enterprise units belonging to counties and townships (townships) have relatively stable personnel, administrative and party organizations are relatively sound, militia organizations can be established, and belong to the townships and townships' People's Armed Forces Ministry under direct leadership. According to 2011 data, after the reform of the Chinese militia, about 8 million people have been organized permanently. As of 00:00 on July 1, 2020, the reserve forces of the People's Liberation Army (PLA) will be fully integrated into the PLA leadership and command system, and the current dual leadership of military areas will be adjusted to the centralized and unified leadership of the CPC Central Committee and the CPC Central Military Commission. In August 2021, the Thirty-third Session of the Standing Committee of the Thirteenth National People's Congress amended the Law on Military Service of the People's Republic of China, adjusted the basic system of military service, clarified the relationship between militia and reserve service, and changed the "military service system of combining voluntary service with voluntary service, militia with combining reserve service" to "military service system of combining voluntary service with voluntary service as the main subject."

The hydrogen atom is the only atom with an analytical solution to the Schrödinger equation, so the study of hydrogen atomic models played a key role in the development of quantum mechanics. In the 16th century, hydrogen was first prepared by mixing metals and strong acids. From 1766 to 1781, Henry Cavendish first discovered that hydrogen was an independent substance. The industrial production of hydrogen mainly used natural gas in the process of steam reforming, or through energy-consuming hydroelectric reactions. Hydrogen is more commonly found in nature in the form of hydrogen (a diatomic hydrogen molecule), with a few instances of single-atomic hydrogen. Hydrogen is a highly flammable substance, as long as its volume ratio in air is between 4% and 75%, it can burn at concentrations of 4% to 74% when mixed with air, or at concentrations of 5% to 95% when mixed with chlorine, forming an explosive mixture, which can be ignited by sparks, high temperatures or sunlight.

Centigrade is the universally used unit of temperature in the world, symbolized by °C. At standard atmospheric pressure, the freezing point of pure water (i.e., the temperature at which solids coexist) is 0 °C, and the boiling point of water is 100 °C, divided into 100 equal parts, each equal to 1 °C. In 1742, the Swedish astronomer Anders Celsius set the freezing point of water at a high pressure at 100 °C, and the boiling point at 0 °C, divided into 100 scales, the exact opposite of the current centigrade. This is done to avoid the generation of negative numbers. Since Sweden has long been below the freezing point, the use of the opposite of the current centigrade can avoid the generation of negative numbers. It was not until 1744 that the centigrade was changed by Carl Linnaeus to the current centigrade: the freezing point is 0 °C, and the boiling point is 100 °C.

. Canada was inhabited by indigenous peoples as early as 1,400 years ago. At the end of the 15th century, British and French colonists explored the east coast of North America and established colonies there. In 1763, after the Seven Years' War, France was forced to cede almost all of its North American colonies to Britain. In the following decades, British colonists explored westward to the Pacific and established several new colonies. On July 1, 1867, the 1867 Constitution Act was passed, dividing Canada into two provinces, Ontario and Quebec, and forming the Commonwealth of Canada with the three British North American colonies of New Brunswick and Nova Scotia. Over the next 100 years, several other British North American colonies joined the Commonwealth, forming modern Canada. On December 11, 1931, the British made Canada an independent nation by the Westminster Act, but the head of state was still King George V of the United Kingdom, and the British Parliament retained constitutional powers over Canada.

According to the agreement of the Communist Party of China to establish the Anti-Japanese Unified Front, the formation of the new Fourth Army was under the command of the Commander-in-Chief of the War Zone, Gu Zhu. However, the new Fourth Army was in fact subordinated to the leadership of the Communist Party of Yan'an. Mao Zedong insisted that the forces under the leadership of the Communist Party of China "should not be restricted by the Kuomintang, should go beyond the limits permitted by the Kuomintang, should not be appointed by any other person, should not be rated at a higher level, should expand their army independently and should resolutely establish bases":1-16. The National Revolutionary Army in the same war zone and the new Fourth Army occasionally had armed conflicts. Upon completion of training, the new Fourth Army was divided into four divisions, named "Unity Division, Forward Division, Brave Division and Resistance Division," on April 27, 1938, left the Anhui West Yingsu Base, headed for the front line, arrived at Nanling on May 10, and on May 16, was divided into small units along the Nanjing-Wuhu Railway submarine-launched Japanese defence line, and fought for the first time with the Japanese army: 268-269.

Yahoo! is an American Internet service provider, with well-known branded services including portals, e-mail, sports, and news. It is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California. The investment fund managed by Apollo Global Management holds 90 percent of the shares, while Verizon Communications holds 10 percent. In January 1994, two Stanford University graduate students David Filo and Jerry Yang created a website called Jerry's Guide to the World Wide Web. Jerry's Guide to the World Wide Web is a web information index, a customizable database, designed to meet the needs of thousands of users who have just started using web services through the Internet community.

It even controlled Deguang and Ganzi, to the east of Jinsha River. These two disputes were known as the First and Second Kangxi Disputes respectively. The Kangxi region, in the traditional sense of the Tibetan people, fell into the hands of the government of Ka Xia in Tibet. At the same time, the 13th Dalai Lama seized power and reformed Tibet politically, economically, militarily, etc. The conflict between him and the 9th Panchen Lama became more and more acute, and the 9th Panchen Lama fled to Qinghai. In June 1930, a dispute broke out between the Grand Temple of Ganzi and Baili Tongji over the production of temples, and the 9th Panchen Lama secretly supported Baili Tongji. Baili Tongji was in a weak position in the dispute, and demanded the involvement of the river army. Liu Wenhui immediately sent an army to occupy the area, but was soon driven back by the Tibetan army. The Third Kangxi Dispute (also known as the Qing-Tibet War) broke out. When the national government learned of the border dispute, it dispatched Tang Kesan, a member of the Mongolian Tibetan Commission, and Liu Zhenting, a special commissioner, to Ganzi to mediate.

Wang Huning (born October 6, 1955 in Laizhou, Shandong), born in Shanghai, is a political scientist, politician, one of the main leaders of the Communist Party of China, and the current Chairman of the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China and the Office of the Central Committee for Reform and Development. Wang Huning served as the Director of the Policy Research Office of the CPC Central Committee from 2002 to 2020, and was the main author and think tank of Jiang Zemin, Hu Jintao and Xi Jinping for three consecutive years as General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee. Wang was born in the academic world, is a Master of Law in International Politics at Fudan University, has served as a director, deputy secretary-general of the Chinese Political Society, dean of the Faculty of Law at Fudan University, professor of the Department of International Politics, and doctoral supervisor. He joined the Communist Party of China in February 1977, joined the Communist Party of China in April 1984, transferred to the Central Research Institute of Political Science at Fudan University in 1995, and successively served as the head, deputy director and director of the Political Section.

Guangzhou Railway Station is currently a transfer station of Lines 2 and 5 of the Guangzhou Metro, located in the basement of the West Square in front of Guangzhou Railway Station, Yuxiu District, Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, China. Opened on December 29, 2002. The station has an area of more than 20,000 square meters and is the third largest subway station in Guangzhou, after Guangzhou South Station and Tianhe Park Station. Guangzhou Railway Station has three floors, the ground floor consists of West Ring Road, People's North Road, Inner Ring Road elevated platform, Guangzhou Railway Station and the Square in front of the station and other nearby stations, the basement floor consists of the station hall; the basement floor consists of Line 2 platform; the basement floor consists of Line 5 platform; the basement floor consists of three floors. Although both the station hall and the platform are furnished with enamel panels, the color schemes are different, Line 2 is light green and light jade, Line 5 is a single dark red. Guangzhou Railway Station's subway station hall structure is roughly L-shaped, the north-south part is Line 2, the east-west part is Line 5, all are located on the basement floor.

In April 1789, an epidemic (presumably smallpox) claimed the lives of many of Sydney's indigenous people. It is conservatively estimated that 500-1000 indigenous people died in the area between Broken Bay and Botany Bay, and both Guernsey and Daruk were infected. During MacKay's tenure as Governor of New South Wales, Sydney underwent initial development. Prisoners built roads, bridges, docks and public buildings. By 1822, the city had banks, markets, well-maintained boulevards and institutionalized police forces. The 1830s and 1840s were the stage of urban development (such as the first urban developments). Ships began to carry immigrants from the British Isles hoping to start a new life in the new country, and Sydney entered a highly developed golden age.

40 Borealis (also known as 40 Borealis ο2) is a triangular star system less than 16.5 light-years from Earth, p. 1. 40 Borealis A is an orange-red main sequence star, a dwarf of spectral type K1. Its two companions, 40 Borealis B and 40 Borealis C are 9th magnitude white dwarfs (spectral type DA4) and 11th magnitude red dwarfs, respectively, or flashing stars (spectral type M4.5e), so it is also referred to as variable DY Borealis. It is speculated that 40 Borealis B was originally a main sequence star, and was the largest star in the system, but it emitted most of its mass before it became a white dwarf.

After the Battle of Wuhan in October 1938, the Japanese occupied most of the territory east of the Beijing-Han and Guangdong-Han railway lines in China, but did not achieve the goal of forcing the Chongqing National Government and the masses of Chinese soldiers to give up their resistance. In addition, due to the early offensive operations, the Chinese People's Revolutionary Army suffered heavy losses from successive attacks on the Japanese in battles such as the Battle of Songhae. After the occupation of large areas by the Japanese, the Japanese needed to allocate forces to defend them and their mobilized forces were weaker. The guerrilla warfare of the Chinese army in the areas occupied by the Japanese also required the Japanese to increase their forces to defend the occupied areas.

Alassane Dramane Ouattara (born 1 January 1942) is a Ivorian politician who served as Prime Minister of Côte d'Ivoire from 1990 to 1993. He is currently President of the League of Republicans. Ouattara participated in the 2010 Ivorian presidential election and was declared victorious in the general election by the Independent Electoral Commission. However, the results of the election were not recognized by the Ivorian Constitutional Commission and it was announced that the current President, Laurent Gbagbo, was re-elected. On 4 December 2010, Alassane Ouattara and Laurent Gbagbo both insisted on winning the election and took the oath of office respectively. On 31 March 2011, the Ivorian Republican Army, which supported Alassane Ouattara, began the siege of Abidjan, Ivory Coast's largest city and economic capital.

Before the second round of voting, a debate with the Socialist Party of Mitterrand gave Deschamps a considerable advantage, with "not only you have a conscience" being a representative phrase.

The Hill sphere, also known as the Roche sphere, is roughly the space region around an object (such as a planet) where the objects it attracts (such as moons) are controlled by it, rather than by the larger objects it orbits (such as stars). Therefore, if a planet is to retain its moons, the orbit of the moons must be in the Hill sphere of the planet. Similarly, the Moon has its own Hill sphere, and any object in the Hill sphere of the Moon will become a moon of the Moon, not a moon of the Earth. More precisely, the Hill sphere is roughly the gravitational sphere of a small object that is only affected by perturbations when faced with the gravity of a large number of objects. This is defined by the American astronomer George William Hill based on the work of the French astronomer Edward Roche, for which reason it is sometimes referred to as the Roche sphere.

Time magazine named it the best television series of the 20th century on December 31, 1999. The Simpsons had a huge impact on popular culture: for example, the muttered "D'oh!" when Homer Simpson was annoyed was included in an English dictionary. Matt Groening first imagined the Simpsons in the lounge of James L. Brooks' office. When Brooks asked Groening to come up with an animated short, he initially intended to recommend his own Hell's Life series. But when he realized that releasing Hell's Life would cost him his copyright, he opted for a different path and created a group of dysfunctional family members to replace him. On April 19, 1987, the Simpsons appeared for the first time in the form of an animated short on The Tracy Elman Show.

In the summer of the Northern Hemisphere, observers are most likely to be able to see Uranus near the summit, because as an astronomical magnitude standard, its apparent magnitude is defined as 0, so astronomers use Uranus as the standard for luminosity measurements. Uranus is only one-tenth the age of the Sun, but has a mass 2.1 times that of the Sun, and is expected to live only one-tenth as long as the Sun; both stars are currently nearing the midpoint of their lifespans. Uranus's spectrum is classified as A0V, slightly warmer than Sirius's A1V. It is still in the main sequence star stage, fusing hydrogen in its core into helium to emit light and heat. Uranus has an unusually low abundance of helium-heavy elements (larger atomic sequences), and its luminosity varies slightly from period to period, so astronomers suspect it to be a variable star. It rotates quite rapidly, with an equatorial rotation speed of 274 km/s. Centrifugal forces push it out of the equator, with temperature variations reaching their maximum through the surface of the photosphere at the pole.

Communism is a political ideology based on Marxism. It aims to achieve the ideal of a social system in which "everything is distributed to the fullest extent possible according to need." It advocates that differences in labour do not lead to any inequality in occupation and consumption, and opposes any privilege. Communism advocates the abolition of private property, and the establishment of a society without a class system, without a state and government, and with collective production. Communism envisages that all future class societies will ultimately transition to a communist classless society. Early forms of human social organization were called primitive communism, and communism as a political goal is often regarded as an ideal form of future social organization.

South America (Spanish: Sudamérica or América del Sur; Portuguese: América do Sul; French: América du Sud; English: South America; Dutch: Zuid-Amerika; IPA: ), also known as South America, is one of seven continents located in the southern hemisphere (or southern hemisphere), west of the South Pacific, to the west of the Pacific Plate and the Nazca Plate. The internal forces between the Pacific Plate and the Nazca Plate are tension, giving rise to the East Pacific Ridge; the internal forces between the Nazca Plate and the South American Plate are compression, giving rise to the Peruvian-Chilean Trench, and below the South American Plate. To the east is the Atlantic Ocean, to the north is the Caribbean Sea.
