His active involvement in the Chinese pronunciation, now called the Chinese pronunciation symbol, is still widespread among Taiwanese and overseas Chinese expatriates. In addition to the cultural movement, he was also regarded as a teacher by Chiang Kai-shek, the son of President Chiang Kai-shek. In June 1913, he participated in the founding of the daily newspaper Public Comment. In 1913, he participated in the Second Revolution against the Yuan Shikai regime initiated by Sun Yat-sen. After the defeat in August, he returned to Europe in September. In early 1920, he founded the Chinese-French University in Beijing with Li Shizheng, Cai Yuan Pei, and others. In the winter of 1920, he founded a branch in Lyon, the Institut Franco-Chinois de Lyon (French: Institut Franco-Chinois de Lyon), with Wu Winghui as its principal. The funds were jointly raised by the Chinese and French sides, and later in 1924, he received a donation from France in the form of a refund of the Gungzi loan.

In ancient times, the Yangtze River belonged to ancient Vietnam and was inhabited mostly by Vietnamese people. In ancient Vietnamese, "yellow ox" is "mo", (the Yangtze River dialect is now called "ox" and "ox meme"); "goat" in Vietnamese is "yang", and "yang" of the sun. "moyang" (Tang:, Romanized:mozyiengz) means "goat" and "goat", so it is assumed that the ancient Yangtze River was a place where cattle and sheep gathered, or a cattle and sheep market. And the existing village by the desert Yangtze River is called "gyuchang village." The Yangtze River is located in the north of the river, so it is called the Yangtze River. (Ancient Chinese geographical position, the mountain north water south is called Yin, the mountain south water north is called Yang.) As for the Yangchun, the ancient "blue" and "spring" means east, the Yangchun is located in the east of the river, so it is called the Yangchun. The Yangtze River, as the administrative center of ancient Goryeo County, County, has a history of more than 1000 years, but for a considerable period of time, "Yangtze River" is only a geographical concept, no specific city exists.

Middle America, often translated as "heartland" "town value" "half America" "middle class" "middle America" "middle America" "middle America" is a colloquial term in American English used to describe the cultural state and regional characteristics of most of the geographically rural and suburban areas of the United States. The term is often used in comparison to cities to refer to the differences in values between the two states that reflect cultural differences in the United States. Geographically, "Middle America" refers to the area between the eastern (especially northeastern) and western shores of the United States. The term is sometimes used to refer to the inland areas of coastal states, especially when these areas are rural. Most of the central valleys of California and the inland portions of Pennsylvania are commonly referred to as "Middle America".

The Green Revolution of the Kingdom of Libya was a revolution launched on 31 August 1969 by a group of free officers led by Gaddafi. The revolution led directly to the overthrow of the Kingdom of Libya, and Gaddafi became the supreme leader of Libya. In early January 1969, Gaddafi issued the "First Guards" as a code to the officers who planned the revolution, and set 21 March as Revolution Day. The date was changed to 24 March because of the large number of high-ranking officials attending a concert to raise funds for the Palestinian refugees. King Idris I suddenly went to Benghazi on 24 March, so it was changed to 5 June. During this period, Gaddafi suspected that the plan had been suspended temporarily. Several members of the crowd were suddenly dismissed, fearing that the revolutionary plan had been realized, and Gaddafi decided to launch the revolution before 4 September. On 31 August 1969, Gaddafi, who was a lieutenant at the time, and Comrade Colonel Jarrod, etc., set out from Benghazi, using the night training he had been authorized to cover, using the armored troops of the three battalions that entered Tripoli in the evening, besieging the blockade forces, and detaining the commander of the King's Guards.

In April 1922, Wu Pefu secretly sent people to Guangdong, and contacted Chen Jiangming, asking Chen Jiangming to use force against Sun Yat-sen's Northern Expedition. In May, Wu Pefu secretly made a pact with Chen Jiangming, Wu Pefu expelled Xu Shichang in the north, and Chen Jiangming overthrew Sun Yat-sen in the south. The steps were as follows: The first step was to restore the throne through the cowardly Li Yuanhong, use the abolition of the governor's army to strike Cao Kun and the provincial factions, if the failure was also the victim of Li Yuanhong, then let the National Assembly rush to elect Wu Pefu and Chen Jiangming as vice presidents, when the time was not ripe to elect the writer Wu Tingfang and Cai Yuan-pei as vice presidents, temporarily transition. The Northern factions, according to Cao Kun and Wu Pefu's wishes, issued telegrams, demanding the simultaneous resignation of the presidents of the North and South. The 203 members of the old House of Representatives of the two Houses of Parliament issued a declaration on May 31, 1922, announcing the immediate exercise of the powers of the National Assembly, cancelling the two governments of the North and the South, and combining the legal government.

Luminous red novae (LRNes) are believed to be explosive phenomena caused by the merger of two stars. They are characterized by distinct redness, and the luminous curve repeatedly returns to its original luminous duration and wanders in the infrared region. Do not confuse high-luminosity red novae with standard novae — with white dwarfs as the main protagonists, exploding on the surface. In the past 30 years, only a small number of objects have been observed with luminous red novae. In the Andromeda Galaxy, M31 RV, which flickered in 1988, may be a luminous red nova; in the Milky Way, V4332 Taurus, which flickered in 1994, followed by V838 Monoceros, in 2002, were observed closely. The first confirmed luminous red nova was M85 OT2006-1 in the Milky Way galaxy.

In general, the earliest conception of the planned economy was Liszt's criticism of Adam Smith's Theory of National Wealth, which was the first theoretical elaboration of government intervention in economic behavior, and later The National System of Political Economics, which systematically elaborated the necessity of government intervention in the economy and the dominance of economic development. Germany was influenced by it to create an economic history school, vigorously promoted government control of economic behavior, and at the same time dominated the economic development of Germany with this ideology, achieved the rapid economic development of Germany, such claims are called state socialism, or "state capitalism" in Marx and Lenin's mouth, which is an economic development model based on government intervention to implement the planned objectives, essentially similar to the spirit of the planned economy. After World War I Germany's defeat, the government lost effective control of international economic relations, the history school went to extinction, but the German economy still retains a strong characteristic of government intervention, after the Nazi rise, revived the practice of the history school, restored the German economy.

Since the re-occupation of the Falkland Islands in 1833, the United Kingdom has continued to occupy a place in the South Atlantic. In 1908, the United Kingdom expanded its claim to the territory, including what is now the British Antarctic Territory, to include South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands. The Territory is administered by three separately administered territories, Graham Land, the South Auckland Islands and the South Shetland Islands, administered by the Governor-General of the Falkland Islands in Stanley Harbour. In 1943, at the height of World War II, the United Kingdom secretly launched a military plan known as the Tabernacle Plan to gain reconnaissance and meteorological information for the South Atlantic. This "secret" wartime project evolved into the post-civilian Falkland Islands Land Survey, later known as the British Antarctic Survey (BAS).

"Horror" is the second episode of the fifth season of the American animated sitcom The Simpsons, which premiered on October 7, 1993, on Fox Television Network in the United States, and was later released on VHS tape and DVD. The episode was written by John Whitty, directed by Richie Moore, and returned by Kelsey Graham after returning from jail to assassinate Bart Simpson's juggler Bob. "Horror" is a parody of the 1962 film "Horror" and its remake. In addition, "Horror" is a cross-cultural reference to several horror films, including The Phantom Menace. One scene in which juggler Bob repeatedly stepped onto a plough and was hit in the middle of the face by the plough, also becoming one of the most memorable scenes in the history of The Simpsons.

Europe (dark grey) The Kingdom of Norway (Norwegian: Kongeriket Norge), commonly known as Norway (Norwegian:Norge  pronounced help·information), is located in the western part of the Scandinavian Peninsula, bordering Sweden to the east and the Atlantic Ocean to the west. The coastline is extremely winding, forming a unique canyon landscape. In addition, Norway also borders Finland and Russia. Norway's territory also includes the Svalbard Islands and the Isle of Man, in addition to the claims to the Antarctic islands of Queen Maud and Peter I Island. The capital is Oslo. Ranked first in the Global Human Development Index from 2009 to 2011, 2013 to 2018, Norway is a highly developed country, with the highest per capita national product and standard of living. Norway formed a united kingdom around the 9th century.

On December 8, the soldiers of the Chuan army launched a coup d'état in Chengdu because they were dissatisfied with the lack of payment of troops. Pu Tianjun and Zhu Qinglan fled because they could not cope with the situation. The new military headquarters organized Yin Chang Heng to put an end to the incident, led the assembled troops, led the troops to attack the governor's palace, and killed Qing Foreign Minister Zhao Erfeng. Because of his achievements in suppressing the riots, Yin Chang Heng was hailed as the governor by all quarters in Chengdu. Yin Chang Heng promoted the reorganization of the military government and stabilized the situation. After the establishment of the Daehan-Sichuan military government, the situation in Sichuan emerged in which the two military governments of Rong and Chongqing coexisted. Yin Chang Heng had planned to unify by force, the Shu military government had also invited the Yunnan army to enter the river to help unify, after mediation and consultation, Yin Chang Heng abandoned the unification by force, the Yunnan army also left Sichuan, the two sides sent representatives to a meeting in Chongqing in January 1912, and on February 2, the agreement was reached: with Chengdu as the political center, seek the governorship of Sichuan, with Rong and Chongqing as vice governors; Chongqing as the capital, seek the governorship of Chongqing.

After the establishment of the Republic of Big Brother, he was appointed as the military governor of the Caracas and Barinas regions of Venezuela. At the end of 1829, he opposed the centralist ideology of Simon Bolivar and pushed for the secession of Venezuela from Big Brother. In 1830, after Bolivar's death, Venezuela declared independence from Big Brother. In 1831, Pace became president of the State of Venezuela, and in 1838 and 1843 he was elected president consecutively. At that time, because Venezuela had only a small military force and had little opportunity to deal with war-related diplomacy between Venezuela and other countries in the face of the large countries surrounding it, he adopted a repressive policy against many military forces in the country. In 1849, he was overthrown by a coup d'état. The following year, he emigrated to the United States.

In 1905, Wang Mingzhang was successfully enrolled in the Xindu County Higher Primary School with excellent grades, and was ranked first. With the support of his uncle and grandfather Wang Xintian, Wang Mingzhang was able to enroll in the school. After graduating in 1909, Wang Mingzhang was enrolled in the 5th class of the Chengdu Sichuan Army Primary School, and chose to join the army. He was also a fellow of the Yangzhou Inner Dangong Hondo Society, along with a generation of priests Liu Qizhou, Guan Rongsan, Liu Beisheng and Zhu De. In the autumn of 1911, the Sichuan Road Patrol Movement broke out, the League organized an armed uprising by air against the Comintern, and immediately besieged Chengdu. Wang Mingzhang, who was only 18 years old and had not graduated yet, joined the Comintern and plunged into the revolution. After the success of the 1912 Revolution in Xinhai, Wang Mingzhang and more than 100 students of the 4th and 5th classes of the Sichuan Army Primary School, opposed the failure of the Sichuan Army Government to reorganize the primary school, and angrily left the school for Nanjing.

Mahabharata (Sanskrit: महाभारतम्, transliterated as Mahabhāratam, pronounced ). Mahabharata is the longest epic in the world with 74,000 stanzas (Shloka, an ancient Indian unit of poetry, 32 syllables per stanza) and a few essays, totalling 1.8 million words. Mahabharata is the third longest epic in the world, four times as long as Romodhana, ten times as long as Iliad and Odyssey combined.

In 1969, Ali Nasser and Abdul Fatah Ismayr overthrew President Khatami al-Shabi. In November 1970, Ali Nasser ordered the renaming of the country to the Democratic People's Republic of Yemen, thereby diminishing the propaganda to promote north-south reunification during the reign of Khatami al-Shabi. Subsequently, he was appointed as South Yemeni Minister of Local Administration, Minister of Agriculture and Land Reform, Minister of Defence, member of the Presidential Committee and Prime Minister of the Government. On 26 June 1978, he participated in the coup d'état that overthrew President Salim al-Ruba'i Ali and became the Chairman and Prime Minister of the Presidential Committee. On 27 December 1978, Abdul Fatah Ismayr became the Chairman of the Supreme People's Committee of South Yemen (i.e. Head of State), and he became the Vice-Chairman and Prime Minister of the Supreme People's Committee. In 1980, Abdul Fatah Ismayr was forced to resign and became the Chairman and Prime Minister of the Supreme People's Committee again.

In the summer of 1931, he enrolled in the Japanese Military Academy, then transferred to the Faculty of Law at Meiji University, where he studied politics, law and military studies. In early 1932, after the "18th Incident" in Shanghai, he left school and returned to his home country. He participated in the formation of the "Ligyosha" as an officer of the Central Commission and Director of the Organization Department. He later became a secretary of the Inspectorate of the Ligyosha and a supervisory commissioner of the Nanjing City Party Department of the Kuomintang. In 1935, he was transferred to the Nanjing City Party Department of the Kuomintang. After the outbreak of the war, he was appointed as a member of the Political Department of the Military Committee, Director of the Political Department of the First War Area Commander's Office. In January 1939, he was appointed as the Director of the Political Department of the Lusu War Area Commander's Office and Director of the Executive Committee of the Kuomintang Special Party Department of the Lusu War Area. He was also a member of the Training Corps for cadres, a member of the Political Committee of the War Area Party Committee of the Military Committee, and a member of the Shandong Provincial Government. In early 1940, he presided over the founding of the Lusu War Area "Front China Daily," and served as the head of the newspaper. Lu Lin (also known as Lu Kyong-jin, Jiangxian) was appointed as the manager, and Zhang Bingzi (Jiangxian) was appointed as the editor-in-chief.

The President of the Republic of China (Chinese: 中華民國大总统) is the head of state of the Republic of China during the founding period, the predecessor of the President of the Republic of China after the promulgation of the Constitution in 1947. The President serves a five-year term, the United Nations will govern the country, and can exercise emergency powers in special circumstances. Political instability in the North Sea period, the warring factions paralyzed the National Assembly, allowing the President to hold considerable power, is able to pass emergency orders to replace laws, and even appoint its own cabinet ministers. On November 24, 1924, the position of the President was replaced by the Provisional Government, then resumed in 1926, but in the manner of the State Council regency, without re-election, was again replaced in 1927 by the Marshal of the Army and Navy. The Constitution stipulates that the President of the Republic of China is directly elected by the National Assembly every five years, and can be re-elected once. The first President Yuan Shikai was indirectly elected by the National Assembly in 1913.

In the spring of 1933, Li Shuqiao, a high school student in Jinan, found Zhang Chunqiao, and together with twenty-three or thirty like-minded people, founded a literary organization, WHAT. Zhang Chunqiao was one of the founders of WHAT and a member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, who had published many articles in WHAT magazine. Li Shuqiao said in 1967 that he was actually a member of the Kuomintang Ba'ath Party, and that the purpose of WHAT (meaning "Chinese Fascism") was to buy up a group of young students and provide information to the Ba'ath Party. Zhang Chunqiao recalled in 1956, "I didn't feel bad about people like Li Shuqiao at the time, thinking that he was also a literary youth. Soon afterwards, I heard rumors that Li Shuqiao was a member of the Blue Coat Society (meaning "Ba'ath Party"), and felt it was appropriate to write to him, so I didn't go with Li Shuqiao. " On May 12, 1935, Zhang Chunqiao arrived in Shanghai, and later joined the Left Alliance, in the activities of the Fiction Research Committee under the Secretariat of the Left Alliance, to discuss the creation of novels.

When pure matter melts, the solid and the liquid are in equilibrium, its temperature remains constant, i.e. the melting point, and when it is heated further, its temperature does not rise, converting it into the latent heat of matter, i.e. the melting heat, so this melting is a first-order phase change. From a thermodynamic point of view, at the melting point, the change in the Gibbs energy of the material ΔG is zero, but the increases in plutonium (H) and entropy (S) (∆H, ∆S > 0). When the Gibbs energy of the liquid is lower than that of the solid, the material melts. This temperature is related to pressure. Low-temperature helium is the only known material that does not absorb heat when melting. Among the most commonly used principles for melting is Lindemann's principle. Lindemann's principle believes that melting is caused by vibrational instability, when the thermal oscillation amplitude of the atoms in the crystal is higher than the distance between the atoms, the crystal melts, i.e. <δu2>1/2 > δLRs:177, where Lindemann's principle is consistent with experimental data on crystal materials, and also with glass transformation data on amorphous materials.

Generally speaking, the Oscars are awarded by a professional committee (e.g., Actors Committee, Directors Committee) and the winners are chosen by a vote of the entire membership. However, foreign language films are awarded by a separate Selection Committee, which is composed of a smaller number of jury members and members who have participated in the screening of foreign language films. Therefore, foreign language films are awarded by a smaller number of jury members than the general selection of other awards. The list of winners Apart from the countries/regions, the winners of the awards are also named the International Film Awards Cup and the Medal. Almost 100 countries submit films to the Academy of Motion Picture Arts each year, and 16 countries/regions have submitted films each year for the past 15 years: Argentina, Belgium, Canada, Croatia, France, Germany, Hungary, Iceland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Norway, Spain, Sweden and Taiwan; at the 92nd Awards Ceremony, directed by Feng Jun Hao, the winner of the 77th Golden Globe Award for Best Foreign Language Film received a total of six nominations, making it the first South Korean film in the Academy's history to be nominated, while South Korea has only been nominated 31 times.

The titles of county kings are usually two-letter, with the names of ancient county districts often seen, such as King Wenan (Qin dynasty) and King Hangcheng (Zhou dynasty). The Ming dynasty also bestowed honors on county kings, many of which were directly conferred during the Ming period, such as King Yanping. In 1654 (August 8 of the Ming Dynasty), Ming Emperor Zhaozong edicted Cheng to succeed as King Yanping, but Cheng declined. In April 1655, Emperor Zhaozong again issued an edict and brought the King Yanping seal to Xiamen, but Cheng no longer refused to be enfeoffed as King Yanping. In 1662 (August 15 of the Ming Dynasty), the exiled Emperor Yanping of Burma was executed, and the Southern Ming power collapsed. Since then, the historical King Yanping was still legally referred to as the Yangshuo of the Ming Dynasty (dates are inherited by the term "Eonpyeong"). In 1664, the second generation of King Yanping Zheng withdrew from Xiamen; after the withdrawal, Zheng Zheng concentrated on consolidating the kingdom and strengthening control over the Greater Yangtze region, before and after armed conflicts with the Dutch East India Company and the Kingdom of Dadu.

The influence of the equatorial precession is represented by the eastward movement of the equinoxes at a rate of about 0.1′′ per year, as well as the slow change of the yellow-red intersection. The equatorial and equatorial precessions are also known as the general precession. The name and meaning of the precession varies with history. Historically, the ancient Greek astronomer Hipparchus first discovered the movement of the equinoxes on the equator, and coined the term the precession of the equinoxes. The precession affects the Earth's axis of rotation, the equinoxes, and the yellow-red intersection, thereby influencing human observations of deep space and near-Earth space, and even the Earth's climate. In geodesy, the precession and the phases, pole shifts, and changes in the length of the day are also known as the Earth's orientation parameters.

On June 4, 1928, after the coup d'état, Tanaka, in order to maintain international credibility, first advocated to the emperor the assassination of the chief of staff of the army, Colonel Kazumasa Kawamoto, but later, because of strong opposition from the chief of staff of the Japanese army, General Kazumasa Ugaki, he accused the emperor of the assassination of the Northern Expeditionary Army, was criticized by the opposition and the Emperor Showa, and was forced to resign to the emperor on July 2, 1929. However, shortly after his resignation, he had a central myocardial infarction at a banquet celebrating his election as a member of the House of Peers, and died on September 29, at the age of 65.

Tainan County (Chinese: 台南縣; Taiwanese: Tâi-lâm-kuān; Hakka: Thòi-nàm-yen; Vietnamese: Tailam king) is an administrative region in southwestern Taiwan that has been abolished by the Republic of China. It is located in the southwestern part of Taiwan and has a tropical monsoon climate. Tainan County is also known as "South Ying" or "South Ying" meaning "the sea, the great water," and is located in the center of Taiwan's largest plain, the Jiangnan Plain. It is a pre-mountainous area on the east side of the Central Mountains, on the west side of the Taiwan Strait, north of Chiayi County, south of Tainan City and Kaohsiung County. Before the 5th conquest, the total area of the county was 2,016 square kilometers, ranked ninth in the country, with an arable land area of more than 90,000 hectares, ranked first in the country, with a population of about 110.4 million, making it the eighth largest in the country. This region is also the earliest place in Taiwan to develop.

In 1918, Liu joined the Liang Keichao Organization's European Visiting Mission, then entered the Faculty of Law of the University of Paris, where he was awarded a Doctor of Laws in 1925. The same year, Liu returned to China and went to Changsha to serve as an adviser to the Hunan Provincial Government. Later, Liu became a professor at Wuchang's private Chinese University, then moved to Guangdong Province, where he joined the Nationalist Party of China through Chiang Kai-shek. In 1926, Liu became a representative of the Eighth Army Party of the National Revolutionary Army and head of the Political Department of the former General Headquarters of the Enemy, and participated in the Northern Expedition. After the Northern Expedition occupied Hankou, Liu served as an executive member of the Hankou Special City Party Department of the Nationalist Party of China, a member of the Hubei Province Provisional Political Committee, and a chairman of the Hankou City Municipal Committee. At the end of 1926, Liu became the mayor of Hankou City. In March 1927, Liu was sacked from the position of mayor of Hankou City because of a conflict with the Chinese Communist Party. Later, Liu was appointed deputy director of the Political Department of the General Headquarters of the National Revolutionary Army, and later, Liu was promoted to head of the Political Department of the General Headquarters of the National Revolutionary Army.

In 1913, Yuan Shikai assassinated Song Kyo Ren, Lin participated in the Second Revolution in Hunan, served as a staff officer of the Yuezhou Fortress Command, after the defeat fled to Japan, joined the Chinese Revolutionary Party, and was admired by Sun Yat-sen. In 1915, Li Dazhao and others organized the Chinese Society of the anti-Yuan group in Japan, Lin Berchuan, Yi Xiang, Yong Beiting and others also organized the anti-Yuan group Yuyu Society. Lin Berchuan, in order to promote the merger of the two groups, visited Li Dazhao and Yi Xiang and others many times, finally merged on January 30, 1916 as the Shenzhou Society, and recommended Li Dazhao as the chief of staff, Lin Berchuan as an officer, and then the two returned home together. In 1916, when the War of National Defense broke out, Lin's cousin Lin Shumei was appointed as the chief of staff of the Hunan National Defense Army, Lin served as a staff officer of the Hunan General Command. After Yuan Shikai resigned, Lin remained as the head of the Hunan Administration Office. On September 13, 1917, Lin Berchuan participated in the operation to launch Hengyang and Zero Ling garrisons in southern Hunan to participate in the War of National Defense, on October 17, Lin was appointed as a labor envoy, and went to the front to encourage morale.

Chiang Kai-shek also attracted the high-ranking generals of the Jin Sui army, who were being trained at Lushan. Yan Xishan was deeply moved by the deepening threat from Chiang, and resentfully called his cousin Lianghua: I will not die in the Communist Party, but I will also die in Chiang. At the same time, the Japanese army intensified its attack on Suiyuan. Faced with the persecution of the Japanese army, the army of the legitimate state and the Red Army, Yan Xishan could not help but defend his territory and examine the situation, and decided to unite the Communist Party and the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army, led by him, on the one hand against Chiang, on the other hand against Japan, in order to defend himself.

The word "French" in Chinese is an abbreviation of "French Country", "French" originated from the Latin word "Francia", meaning "Land of the Franks", and is still called "Francia" in Italian and Spanish today, while the English name "France", the German name "Frankreich" and the Dutch name "Frankrijk" also have the same root as "Francia". "The origin of "French" has a different theory: it refers to the derivation of the original Germanic "free" "frank". In the Chinese character culture, there are two forms of French characters commonly used in Chinese characters: "French" (Vietnamese: Pháp Lan Tây/French), "French" (Vietnamese: Pháp quốc), and "French" in Japanese and Korean (Japanese: French; Korean:불란서/French), "French" (Japanese: French; Korean:불국/French).

The National Heng-Chun Industrial & Commercial Vocational High School (Chinese: 国立恒春高級工商職業学校; pinyin: Zhōng Chūn Shōng Shōng Shōng) is a national high school located in Hengchun Town, Pingtung County, Taiwan. It is the southernmost high school in Taiwan. The school originated in Pingtung County Heng-Chun Secondary School (now Pingtung County Heng-Chun National Secondary School), in September 1955, the Taiwan Provincial Government Education Department ordered Pingtung County Heng-Chun Primary School (now Pingtung County Heng-Chun National Secondary School) to add a high school class to the original school, the first county high school was opened. In 1955, the new high school students were admitted, in 1958, the first graduates were only 24, at that time, the high school students were admitted to the 56th year, and around the thirteenth year there were about six or seven hundred graduates.

In the early days of the Republic of China, there were several national parliamentary elections. The parliamentary system of this period consisted of a bicameral parliament consisting of the Senate and the House of Representatives. The members of the Senate were elected indirectly by the provincial assemblies, and the members of the House of Representatives were directly elected by the people on the basis of the population of each province. At the end of 1928, the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army led by the Kuomintang was completed. After the National Government achieved unification in the name of the whole of China, it promulgated and implemented the "Guiding Principles of Politics" and established the Inspectorate. However, the members of the Inspectorate at that time were not directly elected, but were appointed by the National Government led by one party of the Kuomintang. On January 1, 1947, the Constitution of the Republic of China was promulgated and was scheduled to enter into force on December 25 of the same year. In April 1947, according to the resolution of the Political Consultative Conference, the National Government was reorganized to include minority parties such as the Chinese Youth Party and the Chinese Democratic Social Party, and began to deploy the post-constitutional parliamentary elections.

The data codes of the Household Administration Information System are the unified administrative regions and household information codes issued by the Government of the Republic of China in response to the needs of electronic data processing and statistical investigation and analysis of various institutions, administered by the Department of Household Administration of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The administrative region code part of this code, formerly known as the administrative regions and village codes of the Republic of China, was originally formulated in June 1991, when it was called the codes of the cities, towns, villages and villages of the Tai Min region of the Republic of China, for the supplementary provisions of "the administrative region codes of the provinces and prefectures of the Republic of China and the names of the regions of the world" promulgated by the Chief Accounting Office of the Executive Yuan in 1988. On October 1, 2005, the current name was changed, "the administrative region codes of the provinces and prefectures of the Republic of China" ceased to apply on October 3, the same year by the Executive Yuan.

Political themes The Presidium of the National People's Congress, abbreviated as the Presidium of the National People's Congress, is the "provisional meeting body" that presides over the meetings of the National People's Congress, the supreme organ of the People's Republic of China, during which the National People's Congress holds its sessions. The draft list of officers of the Presidium of the National People's Congress is submitted by the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress before the meeting of the National People's Congress, and after consideration by various delegations, it is submitted to the Preparatory Meeting of the National People's Congress for election. According to the Organization Law of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China and the Rules of Procedure of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China, the Presidium presides over the meetings of the National People's Congress. The Presidium of the National People's Congress is responsible for presiding over the meetings of the National People's Congress.

In 2003, the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia changed its name to "Serbia and Montenegro", a loose federation of states. In 2006, Montenegro achieved independence by referendum. With the independence of Montenegro, Serbia also achieved independence at the same time, and both countries became independent sovereign states. With the independence of the four member states of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, the ethnic composition of the two countries formed the Southern Alliance is more united. Although the main ethnic groups of the two countries are Serbs and Montenegrins respectively, the two countries are very similar in cultural terms. Montenegrin nationalists claim that the Montenegrins are independent ethnic groups different from the Serbs, but there are quite a number of people who believe that the Montenegrins are a branch of the Serbs. The minority ethnic groups of the Southern Alliance include Albanians, Mazarians, Romanians, etc. In the Autonomous Province of Kosovo, the ethnic conflict between the majority Albanians and the minority Serbs is increasing, and the conflict between the two ethnic groups has always been a serious problem during the period of the Southern Alliance.

Fewer than 7% of papers submitted to the journal are accepted and published, and all papers are peer-reviewed before they are formally published. The journal is headquartered in Washington, D.C., and has a second office in Cambridge, England. In 1880, the New York journalist John Michaels founded the journal, which was funded by Thomas Edison and Alexander Graham Bell, but never succeeded because it never had a sufficient readership. The journal ceased publication in March 1882. A year later, the entomologist Samuel Hubbard Scott republished it and achieved some success. By 1894, however, the journal was again in financial crisis, and was subsequently transferred to the psychologist James McKean Carter for $500.

John Fitzgerald Kennedy (May 29, 1917 – November 22, 1963), commonly known as John F. Kennedy, JFK, or Jack Kennedy, was the 35th President of the United States, a member of the influential Kennedy family, considered a representative of American liberalism, and the fourth President of the United States to be assassinated to date. During World War II, he served as an officer in the United States Army, and was awarded the Medal of the Purple Heart for his heroic rescue of a U.S. Navy shipwrecked in the South Pacific. From 1946 to 1960, he was elected to the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate.

All turtles can be eaten except tortoises. Luoyang records that "there were various kinds of god turtles in Luoshui in the ancient times, and negative words were written on their backs to confer on them, and the words were written to cure the water." "Kokushu Shushu" said, "Igi clan came from the heavens." The books such as "Shinto Farmer's Book," "Commentary on Medicine and Forestry," "List of Famous Medicines," "Pharmaceutical Characteristics," "Guidelines for Critical Care," "Traditional Chinese Medicine," and "Traditional Chinese Medicine Ask for Truth" described the medicinal use of turtles in detail, and "Traditional Chinese Medicine" said, "Turtles, deer, and deer all have life. The head of the turtle is often hidden in the abdomen, and it can pass through the veins, so take its turtle for heart, kidney, blood, and yin." During the Qing Dynasty, the goldsmith Wang Yirong accidentally found an ancient text on the Chinese medicine tablet (turtle shell), which is the later turtle shell text. The origin of the turtle shell text, that is, the Chinese ancestors of the Shang Dynasty used turtle shell as a divination tool, first drilled a hole in the turtle shell, then placed a burning grass branch in the hole, the turtle shell produced cracks in the heat, which is a good omen.

Dongse District (Chinese: 東勢區; pinyin: 東勢角; pinyin: Tāng-sì-khu), formerly Dongse Town, is located in the middle east of Taichung City, Taiwan. It is the third-largest district of Taichung City (after the Peace District and Taiping District). It has a subtropical monsoon climate with an average annual temperature of 22 degrees Celsius and more rainfall in the nearby mountainous areas. The residents are mostly Hakka, and the spoken language is mainly Taichung. Important specialties include high-fruit pears, mandarin oranges, giant vines, sweet persimmons, cabbage, etc. It was certified by the World Health Organization (WHO) as a safe community on October 16, 2005, and is also the 92nd safe community in the world, the 6th safe community in Asia, and the first Hakka safe community in Taiwan. However, Dongse safe community was delisted by the WHO CCCSP in 2013 due to its non-permanent development and non-application for recertification.

An orange dwarf, also known as a K-type main sequence star (KV), is a star in the main sequence (fueled by hydrogen) with a spectral type K and a luminosity classified as V. These stars range in size from M-type main sequence stars with a luminosity classified as V to G-type main sequence stars with a luminosity classified as V, a mass of 0.5 to 0.8 times that of the Sun, and a surface temperature of 3,900 to 5,200 K., Tables VII, VIII. These stars are of particular interest to us in our search for extraterrestrial life, as they remain stable in the main sequence for a long period of time (15 to 30 billion years, compared to 10 billion years for the Sun), and thus have the potential to create life on surrounding terrestrial planets.

A point or switch (Japanese: ポイント or転てつ器) is a mechanism used to change the direction of a fork to the road. When a train wishes to change a track into a station or a marshalling yard, a special arrangement must be made on the track to guide the wheel rim through, into the specified track, and this arrangement is called a switch and a fork. or direct fork describes a set of switches usually consisting of two basic tracks, two pointed tracks and a gauge puller, a fastener, a top track and a limiter (intermediate track), a fork pillow and a slide plate. In general terms, the switching machine and the connecting rod and the switch marking are included, and are collectively counted as signalling support equipment. A turner, a crossing or frog, and the guarding and connecting parts are assembled separately during assembly, and are then joined by welding or a fish plate.

In April 2019, the Zhuhai Intercity section of Zhuhai Station was completed. Zhuhai Station is an end-to-end station, with a building area of more than 20,000 square meters. In addition to ticket windows, the ticket office also has a self-service ticket vending machine. There are two waiting areas in the north and south of the station, and the waiting area has more than 500 seats. The platform is on an elevated floor, with two six-line platforms: two platforms in the north and south of the platforms are equipped with side platforms, which can accommodate 16 trains. The Zhuhai Intercity section is located on the south side of the main station building, and is connected to the main station building by a corridor. Zhuhai Station has been the terminus of the Guangzhou-Zhuhai Intercity Train Group since December 31, 2012, and is adjacent to the Arbei Port. The announcement issued by the China Railway Customer Service Center on November 23, 2015, said that the Beijing Railway Bureau will start a D923/924 sleeper carriage train from Beijing West to Zhuhai on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from November 27, 2015, and a D2367/2368 train from Zhuhai to Guilin North will be opened at the same time (with the D923 carriage undercarriage and the implementation of sleeper seats), Zhuhai thus opening the first cross-provincial passenger train.

According to modern sources, the name "Azerbaijan" is derived from the northern region of Iran, centered on the city of Atropates." Later, Atropates established himself as king of the kingdom of Atropati (in today's Iranian Azerbaijan region), "Atropates" is the Greek word for "land protected by fire" or "land of fire." "Azerbaijan" originally referred to Iranian Azerbaijan, and the current name "Azerbaijan" was first used during the period of the Azerbaijani Democratic Republic in 1918, and has been used to this day. At that time, the use of the name was also opposed and protested by the Iranian government. In the late Stone Age, there were signs of the earliest human settlement in Azerbaijan. It is related to the Azykh Cave in Nagorny Karabakh.

Jan Dangzhi (1887 - December 17, 1927), original name Baekhan, one of Baekhan, character survivor, Hubei Springer, Chinese democratic revolutionary martyr. While attending high school in Huangzhou Prefecture, he organized the "Witness Society" to promote the revolution with his classmates Wen Xian and Mei Baoli. From 1908 (Qing Guangxu 34) to Hankou, he was the editor of the Hankou Commercial Gazette. Later, he became the backbone of the Hubei regional revolutionary groups Guangxu Gakusha and Zhen Wu Gakusha. In 1911 (Shen Tong 3) and Chiang Yiwu, among others, organized the Wuchang Literary Society, edited the "Ojiang Gazette," was imprisoned for publishing the "Ojiang Gazette." After the Wuchang Uprising, he presided over the Hankou military government branch office. After the failure of the Second Revolution in 1913, he fled to Japan, joined the Chinese Revolutionary Party. In the winter of 1920, he was a propagandist of the Guangzhou military government headquarters, and in 1924 defended Sun Yat-sen implemented three major policies.

During his tenure as a teacher, Mugabe met his first wife, Sally Mugabe, and they were soon married. During his tenure as secretary, Mugabe and his 41-year-old secretary, Grace, had an affair. Sally died on 27 January 1992. In 1996, Mugabe married Grace as his second wife. In the 1960s, Mugabe returned to Zimbabwe and joined the Zimbabwe People's Union. Afterwards, Mugabe founded the Zimbabwe National Union, which differed from the organization in its ideology, and the civil war broke out between the two sides. Mugabe, as leader of the Zimbabwe African National Union, also led the people many times against British colonial rule. In 1963, Mugabe was arrested by the colonial authorities, imprisoned for 11 years, and subsequently expelled from the country. After his release from prison in 1974, Mugabe went to Mozambique, where he continued his struggle for independence.

Tang Qianyi (1958-), Professor of Information Engineering, Shizuei University Tang Qianyi's research fields include algorithms, computational biology, etc. Tang Qianyi was the first student of the Department of Electrical and Power Engineering, Tsinghua University, and served as the department director from 2000 to 2003. Tang said that the name of the department wanted to avoid institutionalizing the style of the department, and tried to actively cultivate a unique teaching content. However, fearing to hinder the future development of students, it was finally renamed "Department of Electrical Engineering" in his fourth year of college. Because of the department's original creation, Tang Qianyi, while studying in the Department of Electrical Engineering, had made instruments that produced fixed waveforms under the leadership of the professor at the time. Although the final instruments could not continue to be used, but let him understand, move the hand can create many things. Therefore, subsequently teaching at Tsinghua University and Shizuei University, Tang always conveyed the idea of "Doing the right thing right."

Article 3 of the Judicial Police Procurement Ordinance (Judicial Police Officer Grade II) "Everyone on the left shall be a Judicial Police Officer, subject to the direction of the Prosecutor and to the investigation, and shall perform his duties as follows: (1) a Chief of the Police Sub-Directorate or a Chief of the Police Corps; (2) a Chief of the Police Corps Regiment; (3) a Chief of the Police Corps of Railways, Forestry, Fisheries, Quarrying or other various professional police agencies; (4) a Chief of the Customs and Excise Investigation Corps; and (5) the persons referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4 of the preceding paragraph shall be subject to the direction of the Prosecutor and to the investigation, subject to matters relating to their duties." Article 4 of the Judicial Police Procurement Ordinance (Judicial Police) "Everyone on the left shall be a Judicial Police Officer, subject to the direction of the Prosecutor and to the investigation, and shall perform his duties as follows: (1) a Chief of Police, a Constable; (2) a Police Constable.

Between 350 B.C. and 550 B.C., the people of the South Island arrived from Borneo in floating canoes, and Madagascar was settled by humans. Around 1000 B.C., the Bantu migrated across the Strait of Mozambique. Over time, a number of other ethnic groups settled on the island, each with a lasting cultural heritage. The Malagasy people can usually be divided into 18 or more smaller ethnic groups, the largest of which are the Merindians in the central highlands. Madagascar has long been ruled by a patchwork of socio-political unions. Since the 19th century, most of the island has been ruled by a series of tribal leaders united into the Kingdom of Imerina. In 1897, the island became part of the French colonial empire, the monarchy collapsed, and it did not gain independence until 1960.

The Supreme Soviet (1938–1990) The Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic (Russian:Российская Советская Федеративная Социалистическая Республика, Romanized: Rossiyskáya Sovetskáya Federatívnaya Socialistícheskaya Respublika, IPA: ) was the first of the Soviet Union's member republics. The Soviet Russian Federation was the largest first-class administrative region of the Soviet Union, accounting for 75% of the total area of the Soviet Union, and half of the population; as a member republic of the Soviet Union, its capital Moscow was also the capital of the Soviet Union.

Line 15 is planned to pass through Nansha District. There are 59 bus routes in Nansha District (2015), and all villages and villages are served by buses. There are large bus stations near Huanggar Bus City Station and Cheongmen Subway Station, which can be used for subway transfers. Guangzhou Bus has a express line to Nansha, and Panyu Bus Line is also extended to Nansha. Nansha Port Expressway connects Guangzhou City, Guangzhou O Expressway connects to Zhuhai, Guangzhou South Second Ring Expressway west connects Foshan, and Panyu North connects. In addition, the local main roads include Panyu Avenue South, Hong Kong Avenue, Jingang Avenue, Huanggar North Road, etc. The existing Qingsheng station of the Guangdong-Shenzhen Highway Railway is located in the northern part of the district, in Tung Chung Town. It connects with Line 4 of the Guangzhou Subway. The authorities also intend to set up Nansha Station of the Shenzhen-Manchukuo High-Speed Railway in the southern Wanchuan Town, in order to embody Nansha's position as a "core link" in the transportation of the Pearl River Delta. The Tiger Gate Bridge connects to Dongguan Tiger Gate Town on the opposite bank of the Pearl River.

Hydra is a small southern constellation far from the ecliptic. It is one of the twelve constellations that were first delineated by Peter Preuss based on observations by Peter Dexhorn Keiser and Frederick de Houtmann. The Latin name Hydra means "male snake" and corresponds to a much larger constellation, Hydra. In late 1597 or early 1598, Preuss collaborated with Jodocus Claudius in publishing a 35 cm-diameter globe in Amsterdam, on which Hydra was first depicted. In 1603, John Bayer's Astronomical Chart first depicted Hydra. In 1756, the French explorer and astronomer Nicolas Louis Lacaille named the brightest star in the constellation by Bayer's nomenclature. Hydra is close to the southernmost point of the southern sky, and most of the northern hemisphere is unobservable.

The Northwestern Army, commonly referred to as the "Northwestern Border Army", was formed in 1919 from the "Joint Forces" that were originally planned to participate in World War I. For example, Feng Yuxiang commander of the "National Army", Han Fuxiang, Song Zheyuan, and Shi Yu, who were split off from the Feng Yuxiang system after the Sino-Japanese War. In addition, Yang Hucheng's units originated from the Shaanxi Army, also called the Northwestern Army; and Yang Hucheng's units had fiercely attacked Feng Yuxiang's army in the Sino-Japanese War. Compared to the Northeast Army, these are considered to be the Northwestern Army's troops in the process of formation with no stable links to the Northwestern region, many of the generals were directly subordinate, Shandong people, and did not originate in the Northwest (but also some were local forces originating in the Northwest, such as Yang Hucheng, Gao Guizhi).

In 301 AD, San Marino founded an independent monastic community on Mount Titano. San Marino is thus considered to be the oldest sovereign state in existence and the oldest constitutional republic in history. San Marino is governed by the San Marino Constitution, a six-volume set of documents written in Latin and completed in the 16th century, which sets out the country's political system. San Marino considers it to be the oldest government document or constitution still in force. San Marino's economy relies mainly on finance, industry, services and tourism. In terms of GDP per capita at purchasing power parity, San Marino is one of the richest countries in the world, at par with the developed regions of Europe. San Marino is considered to be one of the countries with the highest economic stability and the lowest unemployment rate in Europe, with no national debt or budget surplus.

Due to its low density, high-speed rotation, and fluid variability, Saturn's appearance is an elliptical sphere, with a relatively flat polar axis and a relatively prominent equatorial axis. Its equatorial and polar diameters differ by about 10% (120,536 km for the former and 108,728 km for the latter). Other gaseous planets are also elliptical, but with smaller protrusions. Although the density of Saturn's core is far higher than that of water, due to the existence of a thicker atmosphere, Saturn is the only planet in the Solar System with a density lower than that of water, weighing 0.69 g/cm3. Saturn has a mass 95 times that of Earth. Saturn is called a gaseous planet, but it is not entirely gaseous. The planet consists mainly of hydrogen, which becomes an unideal liquid at a density greater than 0.01 g/cm3. This density is achieved at a radius containing 99.9% of Saturn's mass.

Originally named Linson School District, it was changed to its current name in December 2018 at the suggestion of the alumni and approved by the Board of Directors. Pingtung Commercial School District is located in Pingtung County, Pingtung; the former National Pingtung Commercial Specialized School was founded in 1991, Management College, Information College (except for the Department of Information Science), Humanities and Social Sciences College (Applied English and Applied Japanese) and Dawushan College are located in this school district. Checheng School District is located in Checheng Village, Pingtung County, Pingtung County, this school district is still under planning, it is expected to be used as "Experience Area for Marine Culture Leisure and Natural Eco-Industries". "Taiwan Governor's Pingtung Normal School" was established in April 1940, the campus is now attached to the National Pingtung University Experimental National Primary School. In 1943, it was renamed "Taiwan Governor's Tainan Normal School Preparatory School". In January 1946, it was changed to "Taiwan Provincial Tainan Normal School Pingtung Branch School", in October, it was officially independently named "Taiwan Provincial Pingtung Normal School".

These two men actively taught missionaries to translate the language, since no missionary was familiar with it and it took a great deal of time to learn it. Eventually, the first books were published in the language. Later, the language was designated as "Soggar" in the Constitution of South Africa (Xitsonga, Act 108 of 1996) and became one of its eleven official languages. Thus, the standardization of Soggar made it possible for Soggars to form a common spoken and written language. Soggar is known by the following surnames: 1. Mabunda 2. Maluleke3. Mathevula4. Ngoveni5. Baloyi6. ChaukeSoggar has official status in South Africa and Zimbabwe, is a recognized language in Mozambique, and has no official status in Swaziland.

It is estimated that 25 million meteors, microfluids and other space debris enter Earth's atmosphere every day. In 1961, the International Astronomical Union (IAU) defined meteors as "solid objects moving in interplanetary space, much smaller in size than asteroids and much larger than atoms." In 1995, Beech and Steel proposed a new definition in the British Royal Astronomical Society Quarterly, writing that meteors range in size from 100 micrometres to 10 metres (33 ft). In 2010, following the discovery of asteroids smaller than 10 metres in diameter, Rubin and Grossman proposed revising the previous definition of 100 micrometres to 10 metres to maintain the distinction between the two.

The shipbreaking industry is an industry in which ships are broken up, and most of the ship's waste can be recycled (i.e. steel ships). Archaeological evidence suggests that at least 60,000 years ago, humans used small boats to reach New Guinea from Southeast Asia by sea. This was during the Ice Age, when the ocean was shallower and the distance between islands was shorter.(See Papua New Guinea History) Archaeological findings from ancient Egypt show that around 3000 B.C., the ancient Egyptians knew how to assemble wooden boards into hulls. By the 6th Dynasty, Chinese ships were able to sail across the oceans.

In 1493, Columbus made his second voyage to Fukushima (St. Kitts Island) and named the island after his patron Saint, San Cristóbal. On the same voyage, Columbus also discovered the smaller island of Nieves, named after the Spanish word Nieves, because he believed that the island looked like a mountain top with snow-white peaks. However, although Columbus discovered the two islands, it was not until 1623 to 1624 that the first European settlers arrived. The British first arrived, followed by the French, and after the British occupied Fukushima, they shortened the name to St. Kitts (Kitts is an abbreviation of Christopher), established the first British colony in the Caribbean, and used the island as a springboard to further expand the country's colonial map of the Caribbean.

As the Macao Special Administrative Region implements the "one country, two systems" and the Special Administrative Region has no CCP party affairs organs, there are no CCP members in Macao in Hong Kong. Members of the CCP participating in the 2nd National People's Congress and 2nd National People's Congress do not call non-CCP members of the Hong Kong Region, Macao Region National People's Congress and Macao Region National People's Congress, as well as members of the Political Co-operation Committee, "comrades." Similarly, members of democratic parties in mainland China are not called "comrades" by CCP members. In Malaysia, the Malaysian Chinese Community (Mahua Community) in addition to addressing the General Assembly at all levels calls the General Assembly representative "comrades", in general, the members of the CCP call each other by titles, such as "Na督斯里", "丹斯里" or "总会长". After the establishment of the Communist Party of China, the term "comrade" was widely used within the Party, and gradually became a customary term, widely used in the army, the ruling district (the Communist Party called the liberation district) it established.

Mao Zedong (December 26, 1893 – September 9, 1976), also known as Zhu Ronzhi, is a 3813-year-old Hunan Shotan resident. He was a proletarian politician, theorist, military strategist and poet during the periods of the National Government of the Republic of China and the People's Republic of China. He served as Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China from 1945 and Chairman of the Central Military Committee of the Communist Party of China, becoming the Supreme Leader of the Communist Party of China. He served as the Supreme Leader of the People's Republic of China for life from 1949. He was the core of the first-generation central leadership of the Communist Party of China, the main founder of the People's Liberation Army, and the leader of both the Party and the state. Mao Zedong was born in Shaoshanchuck, Hunan Province. He attended private schools as a child, worked as a farmer, and graduated from the First Normal School in Hunan Province in 1918. Mao Zedong participated in the founding of the Communist Party of China in 1921. From 1927 to 1949, Mao Zedong participated mainly in the First National Civil War, the Second National Co-operation, the Chinese Anti-Japanese War, and the Second National Civil War.

In particular, Chávez participated in the baseball and softball teams of the Little Creole Sports Club, and in 1969 he participated with them in the Venezuelan National Baseball Championship. Chávez also wrote many poems, stories and theoretical articles. Upon completing his studies, Chávez enlisted in the military, serving as a member of the anti-riot battalion stationed in the state of Barinas. Chávez's military career spanned 17 years, during which time he held various positions, command and staff positions, eventually being promoted to middle school. Chávez also served as a teacher and employee at the Venezuelan Military Academy, where he was best known for his flamboyant teaching style, and often made strong criticisms of the Venezuelan government and society at the time.

The French astronomer Nicolas Louis Lacaille spent two years at the Cape of Good Hope, observing and classifying tens of thousands of southern stars, and then in 1756 he classified the constellation of Clovis, choosing the name "l'Horloge à pendule & à secondes", meaning a pendulum. Clovis has an area of 248.9 square degrees, occupies 0.603% of the sky, and ranks 58th out of 88 modern constellations.

The Democratic People's Republic of Korea also claims to be the only legitimate government on the Korean Peninsula, calling itself "Korea" (조선/朝鮮), and calling the Republic of Korea "South Korea" (남조선/南朝鮮):4. The People's Republic of China, prior to the 1992 establishment of diplomatic relations with the Republic of Korea, has always regarded the Democratic People's Republic of Korea as the only legitimate government representing the Korean Peninsula, refused to recognize the Republic of Korea, referred to it as a puppet regime, considered it to be a region of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea awaiting liberation, and referred to it as "South Korea", until it was renamed "Korea" after the 1992 establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries. The Socialist Republic of Vietnam, prior to the 1992 establishment of diplomatic relations with the Republic of Korea, also referred to the Republic of Korea as "South Korea" (Vietnamese: Nam Triều Tiên).

In October 1806, fearing that France's control of Europe would continue to increase, the Kingdom of Prussia and the Russian Empire, Saxony and Sweden formed the Fourth Anti-French Alliance to begin a war against France. Napoleon's army quickly defeated the Prussian army at the Battle of Jena-Orsteit, forcing Prussia to withdraw from the war in just 19 days, followed by several more battles, and finally dissolved the Fourth Anti-French Alliance after the Battle of Friedland. In 1809, inspired by the French's setbacks in the Peninsular War, Austria launched the Fifth Anti-French Alliance to regain much of the territory lost to the previous several alliances, but it was a huge failure, with virtually no French victories except at the Battle of Aspern-Essling, and was finally defeated again by Napoleon at the Battle of Wagram. In order to establish a continental blockade to weaken Britain economically, Napoleon decided to destroy Britain's last ally on the continent, Portugal.

Known horseshoe-shaped objects sometimes transfer to a relatively shorter quasi-satellite orbit, and thus are sometimes confused. Examples include 2002 AA29. As of 2016, there are six known Earth quasi-satellites: (3753) Crutney, 2002 AA29, 2003 YN107, 2004 GU9. Venus has a quasi-satellite, 2002 VE68. This asteroid is also in Mercury's orbit through both asteroids and Gemini; it appears to have been Venus' partner for at least 7,000 years, and it appears to be scheduled to be ejected from its existing orbit in about 500 years. Based on simulations, it is believed that Uranus and Neptune have the capability of capturing quasi-satellites in the Solar System (about 4.5 billion years), but near Jupiter's quasi-satellite orbits can only remain stable for about 10,000,000 years, and Saturn for 100,000 years.

In the autumn of 1965, Mr. Yang Yongkui invited students such as Lu Yongping, Dong Se Tsuen, Lee Kai-lin, and Wong Shao-go to convene a meeting to create a five-year specialized school of industry. At that time, Mr. Yang Yongkui's brother, Mr. Yang Zhen-yi, Chairman of the Tripartite Higher Institute of Technology (then Deputy Director General of the Investigation Bureau of the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of China), submitted a resolution to the Board of Directors to donate the school, and Mr. Yang Yongkui and others raised funds to rebuild and expand the school. In March 1966, the Ministry of Education approved the restructuring of the school to become a specialized school of industry. At the beginning of the restructuring of the specialized school of industry, only four departments such as civil engineering, telecommunication engineering, construction engineering and industrial management were established. In 1994, the departments of international trade, enterprise management, marketing and distribution management, financial finance and other commercial departments were added, and the name of the specialized school of industry and commerce was changed. By 1999, when it was upgraded to a technical college, ten departments had been established, and the department of specialized education was suspended.

The whole city is administered by 10 towns and 5 townships, and the city government is located in the township of Guangdong. During the reign of Emperor Tang Ming, the name "Lingpu" was found in this place, so the name was changed to "Lingpo." Historically, Guangdong County, Guangdong County, Guangdong County and Guanjiao Guan were under the jurisdiction. Lingpo City was formed by the merger of the two counties of Lingpo and Guangxiang. This county was founded in the 3rd year of Han Dynasty (114 B.C.), and later changed its name to Guangdong County in the Han Dynasty, Taolin County in the Sui Dynasty, Lingpo County in the Tang Dynasty; Guangxiang County was historically called Lake County, Beizhou County was renamed Lake City County, Sui was renamed Guangxiang County; in 1954, Guangxiang County was abolished and merged into Lingpo County. On May 12, 1993, with the approval of the State Council, Lingpo County was abolished, and Lingpo City was established at the county level. Lingpo City is administered by the township of Guangdong, Yuling, Guangxiang County, Yunzhuang, Yangping, Zhuyang, Jiao Village, Guanjiao Guan, Dao Village, Yangdian, Kawaguchi, Su Village, Wumu Village, Jiahe Village, Dong Village, Xi Yan, Cheng Village 17 townships (towns), 433 villagers' committees, 11 residents' committees, the administrative area is the same as the pre-existing counties, no adjustments were made.

In April 1912, he joined the newly established Ministry of the Navy of Beijing. In January 1913, he was promoted to lieutenant colonel of the Navy. In May 1914, he was promoted to lieutenant colonel of the Navy. In October, he was appointed commander of the gunboat Yongxiang. In 1915, he was appointed commander of the gunboat Chu Guan and the destroyer Flying Eagle. In 1916, he was appointed commander of the cruiser Zhaohe, in charge of naval training. In December 1920, he was appointed commander of the cruiser Eryu. In November 1921, he was promoted to major general of the Navy. In 1922, Eryu supported the East Road Raiders of Sun Yat-sen, participated in the battle to expel Li Houqi, the Fujian faction of the pro-Beijing government, Eryu was not a member of the Law Enforcement Fleet, although this was tantamount to betraying the North Sea government, but Li Houqi was from the Anhui family background, and was not in harmony with the naval support, so Yang's actions were not punished by the then direct rule of the Beijing government.

In terms of the school system, it is divided into classes A and B. Class A admits undergraduates who have studied at universities on the mainland for one year, and Class B admits high school graduates who have to study for two years. From the second year onwards, when Class A students have finished their studies, it admits two-year-old students from this class, and later, due to the design of some new subject-specific curriculum, it adds a three-year-old class. Its shifting subject-specific category is civil affairs to ordinary administration; accounting to accounting, statistics; land administration to land administration; but finance is still in the old name. Subsequently, the social administration, judicial administration, cooperation, and business administration departments were added. The Taiwan Provincial Administrative Special School was established in June 1950, at the beginning of the government's relocation to Taiwan, the Ministry of Education adopted the policy of "no school, no school" at that time, that is, originally established schools on the mainland, all students temporarily did not return to school, because of the interruption of their studies due to political situation, some entered a small number of universities in Taiwan at that time, the rest entered "classes" set up specifically for these exiled students, although there was no "school" name, but the curriculum was approved by the Ministry of Education, "Taiwan Provincial Administrative Special School" is the product of such a great era.

On 5 June, the Vietnamese army led by Diệm clashed with the Buddhist army led by Lai Guang Yeong at Can Tho. The five Buddhist battalions quickly surrendered; by the end of the month, Lai Guang Yeong and three other leaders had fled to the Cambodian border. The victory over the Pyongyang faction and the Buddhists was the culmination of Diệm's military career. After the victory, Diệm attended a parade ceremony, where his Jeep reached the parade grounds and kissed Diệm on the cheek. In November 1960, an attempted coup d'état against Diệm took place in the Republic of Vietnam. Diệm had no illusions about Diệm at this time, and when the presidential palace was surrounded, he did not participate in the defence, but at his Saigon home. In response, Diệm appointed him as a military adviser to the president, a position in which he had no influence over the army, nor could he command the army if a coup was to be carried out.

On September 2, 1978, Chiang wrote in his diary: "For twenty-three days with the utmost patience, I often listened to Secretary-General Qiu's more than an hour-long internal affairs report, saying everything, and the result was nothing. Generally, senior officials lack new scientific knowledge, so there is no heading, no logic, and no time to think about doing things. Emphasis should be placed on the on-the-job training of senior officials in the future.":167 "Leftists" such as Lee Hwan, Ho Bermuda, Ma Ying-jeou, and others argued for "direct election by appointment" similar to the American electoral system (according to the Constitution, the National Assembly was originally designed to be similar to the American electoral vote system), rather than the "direct election by citizens" advocated by the Nationalists.After the February political dispute, Lee Teng-hui forced Ho Bermuda's cabinet to resign in early 1993 by the results of the second legislative election.:215 On February 11, 2020, due to a lung infection, he was admitted to the Rehabilitation Hospital.

The first two digits are the Taiwanese international code "TW" and the last digit refers to the new currency unit "dollar", which is commonly used in foreign exchange rates and international trade. The new Taiwanese currency was first issued on May 22, 1946, after the Republic of China received Taiwan in 1945, and the next year by the Taiwan Bank authorized by the Executive Council. The new Taiwanese currency was first issued on May 22, 1946, and was initially positioned as a transitional currency, the Taiwanese banknotes of the Governor-General's Office of Taiwan during the Japanese occupation, and was converted into Taiwanese national government coins one by one.

In 214 BC (Qin Shi Huang thirty-three years), the Qin Dynasty conquered hundreds of Vietnamese, Qin Shi Huang completed the unification of China for the first time, established Nanhai County, Guilin County, Xiang County in the Lingnan region, moved 500,000 people to develop Lingnan; at that time, the Hong Kong region belonged to Panyu County, Nanhai County: 2,963 AD, the Southern Han Emperor Liu Xiang in the town of Haimen in Hepu and Dongguan Dabuhai (now the New Territories Tai Po Sea, that is, Tolu Port), recruited thousands of pearl soldiers, Shi Meichuan was responsible for the collection of pearls: 10-11 AD, the Jinshi Deng Fu Kyo (Jiangxi Jisujin) moved to Zentian (Kingtian), became the head of the five clans of the New Territories Deng, Hou, Liao, Wen, Peng: 5,1370 AD, the Ming Dynasty set up a wealth patrol division, roughly equivalent to the present Hong Kong region: 468.1521 AD, the Portuguese forcibly entered Hong Kong, attempted to go to Guangzhou trade, had a fierce confrontation with the Ming Dynasty sailors near Tuen Mun: 468.

Constellation Norma is the southern minor constellation between the constellations of Taurus and Lupus. It is one of the 14 constellations of the 18th century by the French astronomer Nicolas Louis Lacaille and is one of the 88 modern constellations. Most of the constellations of Lacaille are named after scientific instruments. The original name Norma is Latin for "dihedral scale," which also means a rectangle, a curve, a triangle and a horizontal scale. The four bright stars Gamma, Delta, ε and Eta form a square in the faint starry sky. Gamma 2 is the brightest star in the constellation and the only fourth-magnitude star. μ is the most luminous star known to man, up to 25 to 1 million times brighter than the Sun. Four of the constellation's galaxies have planets. The Milky Way passes through the constellation and contains eight open clusters that can be observed with binoculars. The constellation is also known as Abel 3627, which is the largest known cluster in the constellation.

New Zealand (Maori: Aotearoa, English: New Zealand), separated by the Cook Strait, the capital Wellington is located at the southern tip of the North Island, the capital Territory also includes some small islands. New Zealand and Australia apart from the Tasman Sea, about 1500 km away from the east coast of Australia, and about 1,000 km away from the South Pacific islands of New Caledonia, Tonga and Fiji, the special location makes New Zealand one of the last areas inhabited by humans. Wildlife due to long isolation, develops a unique and diverse ecological environment. Due to the rise of land structures and volcanic eruptions, the terrain of New Zealand is varied, the South Alps runs through the mid-west of the South Island. New Zealand landscape is beautiful, the climate is pleasant, a wide range of tourist attractions, and is famous for its pristine natural environment.

Established in 2000, the National Defense University (NDU) is a university dedicated to the comprehensive development of military personnel in the Republic of China. It is composed of seven military academies and colleges, including the War College (formerly known as the Third Military University), the Army College, the Navy College, the Air Force College, the School of Science and Technology, the School of Management, and the School of Political Operations. Its headquarters are located in Taoyuan City, Taoyuan 8 De District. The Director of the War College is also the Deputy Director General of the National Defense University (R.O.C. Army Command & Staff College). The current Director is Major General Lin Zhiying of the Army. The current Director is Major General Zhao Jianguo of the Navy. The current Director is Major General Qiao Zhihong of the Air Force. The current Director is Major General Cui Yifeng of the Navy. The current Director is Major General Lin Zhenyu of the Army. The Department of Chemistry of the Central School of Science and Technology holds 81 years, Master of Applied Chemistry holds 93 years, and Doctor of Science holds 100 years.

According to Diogenes Laërtius, in a reference to Callimaris, Tyler of Miletus "measured the stars of the constellation Phoenicia used by the Phoenicians to navigate". These stars were identified by Diogenes as Phoenicia and, because they were said to be used by the Phoenicians to navigate, were referred to as Phoenicia. Thus, the original "bear" was Phoenicia, and Phoenicia was thought to be the second, or later Ursa Phoenicia (Φοινίκη, Phoenice), which was named by Strabo (I.1.6, C3) at Tyler's suggestion, Tyler suggested to the Greeks the use of Phoenicia as a navigational tool, while at the time the Greeks used Phoenicia.

Its density is 150,000 kg/m3 (150 times the density of water on Earth), and its temperature is 15,000,000 K (approximately 5600 degrees Celsius compared to the temperature of the Sun's surface). The Sun's energy comes mainly from the nuclear fusion reaction when hydrogen is fused into helium. The core is the only place in the Sun that produces energy by nuclear fusion, releasing heat in the form of sunlight, and the energy transferred from the core heats the rest of the Sun. All the energy produced by nuclear fusion must pass through the layers of the Sun many times before it escapes the Sun in the form of sunlight or particles. Approximately 3.6×1038 protons (hydrogen nuclei) are fused into helium nuclei; 4.3 million tons of mass are converted into energy per second; and the energy released per second is 3.87×1026 joules, equivalent to 9.1×1010 million tons of TNT explosive equivalent.

Zhang Jingjiang's father, Zhang Baozhen (1856-1926), was the second son of Zhang Sungxian, because his eldest brother, Zhang Baozhen, was weak and ill, and Zhang Sungxian continued to run a large family business, and took advantage of the family's salt industry to further open numerous soy gardens. Zhang Jingjiang's maternal grandfather, Peng Yunxian (1833-1889), was also one of Nanshu's "four elephants," not only exporting silk, but also engaged in the army fire industry; Zhang Jingjiang's two uncles, Peng Lai-shing and Peng Qingcheng, were both cultural celebrities. Zhang Jingjiang had seven brothers (Zhang Ben-guang, Zhang Jingjiang, Zhang Ya-nyo, Zhang Jie-zhi, Zhang Ku-xiang, Zhang Ji-fu), and he was born on September 19, 1877 (Qing Guangxu 3), in Son De-do Hall (Zhang Sungxian Prefecture) on East Street of Nanshu Town. When Zhang Jingjiang was a boy, "his sex was stubborn, and his mind unusually childish." He loved to play chess and ride horses, often galloping in the narrow streets of his hometown Nanshu.

New Taipei Municipal New Taipei Senior High School (Chinese: 新北市立新北高級中學) is a junior high school in New Taipei City, Taiwan. It was originally known as the "National Triple Senior High School" and has regular classes, music classes and sports classes. It is located in Mole Ozhuang at the intersection of the Triple District and Luzhou District in New Taipei City, Taiwan. Formerly known as the "National Triple Senior High School," the former Taipei Prefecture was reorganized as the "New Taipei City" in 2010, that is, there are two high schools named "Triple": the National Triple High School and the Taipei Prefecture Triple High School. After the five cities were reorganized in 2010, the Prefecture Triple High School was the first to be subordinated to the New Taipei City Triple High School. After negotiations with the Ministry of Education, all the National Senior High Schools (excluding overseas Chinese high schools) in the New Taipei City jurisdiction must be placed under the jurisdiction of the Education Bureau of the New Taipei City Government in January 2013.
