Khalid bin Abdul Aziz (13 February 1913 – 13 June 1982) was the King and Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia. He was the fifth son of the first King. He received Islamic education in the court and higher education in Europe and the United States. He was Deputy Prime Minister from 1962 to 1965. He was made Crown Prince and First Deputy Prime Minister in 1965. He became King and Prime Minister in March 1975. He died on 13 June 1982. He was buried at Al Oud Cemetery in Riyadh after his funeral in Mecca. Khalid was born in Riyadh on 13 February 1913.

Life is a characteristic, an active form of the existence of matter. There is currently no consensus on the definition of life in the academic world. The more popular definition is a system of matter that maintains body balance, has a life cycle and stable metabolic phenomena of matter and energy, can respond to stimuli, can self-replicate or reproduce, and evolves a semi-open material system. It is composed of cells that can grow and adapt to the environment. Other definitions sometimes include non-cellular forms of life, such as viruses and viruses. Life is a basic concept in biology, while biology is the science of studying life. Life distinguishes physical entities with biological processes (such as signaling and self-sufficiency) from entities without biological processes.

New Taipei City Guangfu Senior High School, simply called Guangfu Senior High School, is a public high school in the Itabashi district of New Taipei City, located in the traditional Itabashi inhabitants' commonly called "Pu Pu" area (i.e., Itabashi District Pu Pu Pu Li). It is the nearest Itabashi educational institution in the vicinity of Taipei City (near Taipei City Wanhua District and Delhi), named after Guangfu Bridge. In the 102nd academic year (August 2013), the school was reorganized into a comprehensive high school and a full secondary school, a high school department and a national department; the high school department was separated from the second year, mainly divided into social studies, natural sciences, multimedia design, computer graphic animation, etc. The development of the original Guangfu National High School has been closely related to the three large national schools in the vicinity since its founding. Guangfu National High School is a relatively young national high school in the Itabashi district of New Taipei City.

After the emergence of the Soviet Union, the theoretical development of the planned economy was improved, the Soviet economist Preobrazhensky wrote "The New Economy", a systematically established model of government intervention in the economy of the socialist countries. The Soviet Union experienced certain aspects of development, but then gradually opened up the market level of the planned economy, barely maintained the economic strength of the world's second largest economy until it was surpassed by Japan, the Soviet Union influenced other countries' economies through the medium of the Inter-Parliamentary Union through the planned economy, making the Soviet Union's planned economy model the world's most influential and the main planned economic model, but after 1991, with the dissolution of the Soviet Union, the Inter-Parliamentary Union disbanded, the market of the planned economy group that was unable to compete under internationalization collapsed completely, the pure planned economy failed, the influence gradually diminished.

Song Meiling, who lives on Long Island, New York, receives a telegram, a thousand thoughts, and memories of Shanghai eighty years ago...Charlie Song, who grew up in the United States and received Western education, returned to China with Western ideas and patriotism, secretly supported the revolutionary project of Sun Yat-sen, and the two became lifelong companions.Charlie had three sons and three daughters, all of them received Western education in the United States; later, the three sons of the Song family took up important positions in the state government; the three daughters also became the pioneers of the Chinese women's rights movement.The three daughters of the Song family married three important people in China at the time: the son-in-law of the granddaughter Meiling was Shanxi Dado Confucius Xiangxi, a wealthy enemy country, and the seventy-fifth son of Confucius, the status was superior; the two daughters Qingling insisted on marrying his father's sincere friend Sun Yat-sen, which led to the father-daughter reconciliation, and Charlie also broke up with friends; the three daughters Meiling fell in love with the military officer Chiang Kai-shek who followed Sun Yat-sen.

Wilson's outstanding secondary education earned him a scholarship in 1934 to study history at the Jesuit College of Oxford. He joined the Liberal Party at the university, but later switched to the Labour Party under the influence of G.D.H. Cole. At the end of his first year, Wilson switched to philosophy, politics and economics, graduating with a first-class honours degree, and was immediately hired as one of Oxford's youngest teachers of the 20th century. He became an economics lecturer at the New College of Oxford in 1937, and an economic history lecturer at the University College in 1938 (and researcher at the university from 1938 to 1945). During this period, he was also an assistant to William Beverridge, specializing in the study of unemployment and the trade cycle. After the outbreak of World War II, Wilson volunteered for the army.

In the so-called “dirty elections” of 1949, he was re-elected to the House of Representatives and served as chairman of the House Defense Committee. In early August 1950, Magsaysay submitted a plan to President Elpidio Quirino to suppress the Communist guerrillas, and Quirino appointed Magsaysay as Secretary of Defense. During his tenure, he improved the image of the military, changed the people’s indifference and distrust of the Philippine army, and won their respect and admiration. On February 28, 1953, Magsaysay resigned as Secretary of Defense and became the Nationalist-nominated presidential candidate. On November 10, 1953, the election was strongly influenced by the U.S. government, including the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency.

Early in his life, he studied at Dongyang Huxi Zhongqing College High School and Zhejiang Dongyang County Secondary School. After graduation, he was admitted to the Military Officers School of Baoding in 1918. In 1920, when the Anhui War broke out, Baoding Military School was forced to close, so he left the school and enrolled in the Faculty of Letters of Xiamen University. In 1924, he went to Guangzhou to participate in the establishment of the Huangpu Military School. In June of that year, he served as the captain of the third battalion of the first phase of the military school, and later as an executive member of the special branch of the Communist Party of China's Huangpu Military School.92. After the beginning of the Northern Expeditionary War in July 1926, he served as Deputy Director of the Staff Office of the National Revolutionary Army General Command and also as the Director of the Third Section. The British Virgin Islands (BVI), officially known as the Virgin Islands, is a British Overseas Territory, located in the Caribbean Sea region, east of Puerto Rico. The British Virgin Islands and the adjacent U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico's Virgin Islands are collectively known as the Virgin Islands. The British Virgin Islands consist mainly of the four main islands of Tokelau, Tokelau Goda, Anegada and Yost Van Dyke, but also include more than 50 small islands and reefs, of which about 15 are uninhabited. Tokelau is the largest island in the British Virgin Islands, with a total length of about 20 km and a width of 5 km. The islands have a total population of 28,000 and its capital, Rhode Island, is located on Tokelau.

The Democratic Republic of São Tomé and Príncipe (Portuguese: República Democrática de São Tomé e Príncipe), commonly known as São Tomé and Príncipe (Portuguese: São Tomé e Príncipe), is an island nation in western Central Africa. It consists of São Tomé, Príncipe and a number of nearby reefs and islands. It covers an area of 1,001 square kilometres. About 90% of the population lives on São Tomé and Príncipe. Its inhabitants are mainly Bantu, mixed-blooded Moluccans and Indians. The Portuguese language is the official language. It was originally a Portuguese colony. It became a democratic republic on 12 July 1975. São Tomé and Príncipe is one of the least developed countries in the world. São Tomé and Príncipe was discovered by the Portuguese between 1469 and 1472.

As for the new Fourth Army, according to the agreement between Ye Ting and Chiang Kai-shek when he assumed the post of commander of the new Fourth Army, the monthly fee to be paid to the new Fourth Army was 180,000 yuan, in fact 80,000 yuan per month, and after repeated requests from Ye Ting and Kim Ying, it was increased to 135,000 yuan per month. At the same time, the National Government initially assigned to the new Fourth Army the following defensive areas: the 1st and 2nd Divisions south of the Yangtze River, east of Wuhu Lake, north of Gao Jun, Lishui and Golden Temple Line, west of Danyang Golden Temple Road; the 3rd Divisions east of Wuhu Lake, Xuancheng, west of Tongling, south of Qingyang and north of the Yangtze River; the 4th Divisions along the Huainan Railway in Anhui Central Province. With the defeats of Nanjing in 1937, Wuhan in 1938 and Nanchang in 1939, the main part of the National Army retreated westwards under the attack of the Japanese army.

In June 1914, after his exile to Japan, he joined the People's Revolutionary Party of China (PRC), which was organized by Sun Yat-sen. In the winter of 1915, on Sun Yat-sen's orders, he went to Dalian to secretly carry out anti-Yuan Shikai activities. After the death of Yuan Shikai, he participated in Sun Yat-sen's law-enforcement campaign. On October 10, 1919, the PRC was reorganized into the Nationalist Party of China (NPC), and he was appointed Director of the General Affairs Department and Military Commissioner. In May 1922, he was appointed Minister of Internal Affairs of the Guangzhou Law-enforcement Army Government. In January 1924, he was elected to the Central Executive Committee (later, to the Standing Committee) at the First National Congress of the Nationalist Party of China (NPC).

Antigua and Barbuda is an island nation in Central America, located between the Caribbean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean, south of French Guadeloupe, south of British Montserrat, and west of Saint Kitts and Nevis. Its international code is AG. Antigua and Barbuda has two main islands, Antigua and Barbuda, and a few smaller ones. Antigua and Barbuda is part of the Leeward Islands. Antigua and Barbuda is one of the least populous countries in the world. According to the 2021 census, Antigua and Barbuda has a population of 99,000, the vast majority of whom are African. English is the official language and lingua franca. The majority of its inhabitants are Christian. The first settlers on Antigua and Barbuda were the Ciboney people, who inhabited the islands as early as the 25th century BC.

Yamoussoukro (French: ; French pronunciation: ) is the capital of Ivory Coast, located about 240 km north of Abidjan, and has a population of about 24,2744. Yamoussoukro is geographically located at 6°50′N 5°15′W (6.8333, -5.25). Administratively, it belongs to the Yamoussogo Autonomous Region. Yamousso, the niece and nephew of Kouassi N'Go, was the chief of Yamousso. During the French colonial period, Yamoussoukro, then known as N'Gokro, was administered by the chief of Yamousso. At that time, the village had 475 inhabitants and was one of 129 villages in the Akoué region. Although foreign diplomatic and trade relations had been established, in 1909, under the orders of the chief of Jamlabo, an incident occurred in Akoué that revolted against French rule.

In 1951, Churchill was re-elected Prime Minister, and during his second term focused on international diplomacy, particularly Anglo-American relations; on the other hand, despite the prevailing decolonization and national independence movements, he insisted on preserving the former glory of the British Empire and sending troops to suppress the insurgents. On the domestic front, his government emphasized housing construction and the development of nuclear weapons. During this period, however, Churchill's health deteriorated, and he eventually resigned as Prime Minister for physical reasons in 1955. Subsequently, he served in the House of Commons until 1964. After his death in 1965, the British government offered him a state funeral.

Actinium is a chemical element with the chemical symbol Ac and atomic number 89. It is the first element of the Actinium family. In the elemental table, there are 15 elements starting with and ending with actinium. Actinium is a flexible silver-white metal with strong radioactivity. In air, actinium reacts rapidly with oxygen and hydrogen, forming a protective white oxidation layer on the surface. Like most lanthanum and actinium elements, actinium is generally oxidized to +3. Actinium was discovered in 1899 and was the first non-primordial radioactive element to be separated. Although actinium, radium and radon were discovered earlier than actinium, it was not until 1902 that scientists separated these elements.

Coordinates: 23°28′25′′N 120°27′1′′E / 23.47361°N 120.45028°E / 23.47361; 120.45028 National Chia-Yi Girls' Senior High School (CYGSH) (Chinese: Chia-Yi Girls' Senior High School) is a three-year community high school located in the western part of Chiayi City, Taiwan. As of 2019, it is the only high school in the western part of the city.

On August 5, 1945, he flew to Moscow with Song Zhiwen and Wang Zejie to sign the Treaty of Friendship and Alliance between China and the Soviet Union. On August 21, 1945, he returned to China and organized the Northeast Camp. In September, he was appointed as the Chairman of the Military Committee of the National Government, the Director of the Northeast Camp (renamed the Chairman of the National Government Northeast Camp in June 1946) and the Director of the Political Committee of the Northeast Camp, in charge of all military and political affairs in the Northeast. On October 12, he flew from Chongqing to Changchun. In the afternoon of October 13, he met for the first time with Marshal Malinovsky of the Soviet army, etc.; on October 17, he held the second talks; on October 29, he held the third talks; on November 5, he held the fourth talks. On November 15, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the National Government inquired about the Soviet embassy's statement that the Northeast Camp had been blocked by troops, and the Chinese government decided to move the Northeast Camp from Changchun to Shandong Customs.

The Chinese Revolutionary Party's War of Protecting the State (also known as the War of Protecting the State, the War of Protecting the State, the War of Protecting the State Movement, the War against Yuan, the War against the Emperor, the War against the Emperor) was a coup d'état that took place in the Republic of China. Yuan Shikai declared independence from Yunnan on December 12, 1915 (four years after the founding of the Republic of China), the National Assembly proclaimed him emperor, Cai Zhao, Tang Jiyao, Li Li Lijun, and others took up arms on January 25, and Yuan Shikai sent troops to suppress the rebellion. Subsequently, Guizhou, Guangxi, Guangdong, Zhejiang, Shaanxi and other provinces also gained independence. Yuan Shikai abolished the emperor after internal diplomatic pressure, and died of illness in June 1916, all provinces abolished independence, and Li Yuanhong took over the presidency. In 1913, the assassination of Kuomintang deputy chairman Song Kyoren triggered a second revolution, and before the results of the investigation had been released, Sun Yat-sen and others sought to replace Yuan Shikai by force failed. As a result, Sun Yat-sen and others were pursued and exiled to Japan, and the Kuomintang was dissolved in 1913.

Coordinates: 25°04′N 121°35′E / 25.067°N 121.583°E / 25.067; 121.583 Lai-ôo-khu District (Chinese: 內湖區; pinyin: Lāi-ôo-khu) is located in the northeastern part of Taipei City, Taiwan, because of the many hills in the area, forming many small basin landscape, the locals Minnan people call the mountainous area as "ton", so the meaning of "internal Tonchi". The area with a population of about 273,000 people is the second largest area in Taipei City after Da'an District. Minnan "inner face is Ton" or "ton face is Pinghu"; the area of Tonchi refers to the mountain range from Dai Jinmen Mountain to the small tomb of Bihu, the eastern edge from Green Earth Community, Chengqing Park to Qingbai Xin Village, the southern edge from Bai Sag Mountain to the north slope of the hill of Kukanshan, the west is Jiangnan Street, in between forming a mountainous type of Tonchi.

Antarctica began to be covered by ice and snow around the beginning of the Pleistocene, mid-latitude glaciers also developed before the end of the Pleistocene, and the Arctic Ocean formed ice sheets. Antarctica was covered by ice and snow for the rest of the year at the end of the Pleistocene. The continental plates continued to move towards their present positions at the beginning of the Pleistocene, about 250 km away from their present positions, and about 70 km away from their present positions at the end of the Pleistocene. South America and North America were connected by the Panama Canal, leading to the almost extinction of polar animals in South America. The formation of the Panama Canal had a major impact on the Earth's climate, cutting off warm currents along the equator, causing the Atlantic to become colder, reducing the temperature of the Atlantic and the Arctic Oceans. The collision of the African Plate with the European Plate led to the formation of the Mediterranean. The ancient Mediterranean disappeared. The lowering of the sea level led to the formation of a canyon between Asia and Alaska.

Yang Anfeng (Chinese: 杨杏佛; April 5, 1893 – June 18, 1933) was born in Yushan County, Qingjiang County, Jiangxi Province. He was an economist and social activist. Yang Anfeng was born on April 5, 1893 in Yushan County, Guangxinfu, Jiangxi Province, in the Qing Dynasty. His father, Yang Yongchang, was a jailer, and his mother, Liu, took care of the family. After his birth, his father went to Yangzhou and Hangzhou to work, so he grew up in Jiangsu. In 1899, when he was six years old, he entered a private school. In 1905, his father was appointed to work in Hangzhou, he was dismissed from his job because of the escape of prisoners, and the economy was in short supply. In 1907, he went to Wusong to study at the Chinese Academy, and in September 1908, the tide of Chinese Academy, students formed a new academy. In April 1910, he became acquainted with Lei Tieqiang, Liu Yazi, and joined the League under the introduction of Lei. In August 1911, Yang's parents wanted him to study engineering, so he applied to the Tangshan Road Mining Academy, and Mao Yishan joined the same class.

Thus, the most important element of beauty is that which comes with the object, not that which is subsequently created artificially; and the basis of beauty is a universal, visible truth. There was no concept of "style" in the realm of art until the 16th century, when Vasari's works were translated into Italian, French, Spanish and English. In the early 19th century, in his Contrasts (1836), Puccini contrasted the impression of the modern, industrialized world with the idealized new medieval world. Puccini believed that Gothic architecture was the only "true Christ in architecture." The 19th-century British art critic John Ruskin, in his Seven Lamps of Architecture, placed particular emphasis on the aesthetics of architecture, arguing that a well-decorated house is not necessarily a true architecture, but only an architecture after some arrangement.

Caracas was originally founded by the Spaniards in 1567, in 1561, the Spanish colonists invaded the valley of Caracas, implemented colonial rule, and in 1567, in the middle of the valley, the construction of the city, and named Santiago de La Coruña de Caracas. In 1577, it became the capital of the province of Venezuela, and in 1812 suffered massive earthquake damage. In 1830, it was designated the capital of the Republic of Venezuela. Caracas did not rapidly urbanize and modernize until the 1870s, after the city reconstruction, many Spanish colonial buildings were replaced by French-style architecture. After the 20th century, with the development of the oil industry, the city expanded rapidly, and in 1950, together with the suburbs and five towns of Miranda, formed the Greater Urban Area of Caracas. The economy of Caracas is dominated by service industries, including service companies, banks, shopping malls, etc.

Hailemariam DeSaleni (Amharic pronunciation: ; born 19 July 1965) is an Ethiopian politician. Hailemariam studied civil engineering at an early age and studied in Finland and the United States. Hailemariam served as President of the State of Southern Nationalities, Tribes and Peoples from November 2001 to March 2006. He was appointed Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs in October 2010. Following the death of former Prime Minister Meles Zenawi in August 2012, Hailemariam was appointed Acting Prime Minister under the Constitution. In September 2012, parliament approved Hailemariam's appointment as Prime Minister. Hailemariam is a member of the Ethiopian Apostolic Church (a denomination of Christianity). On 15 February 2018, Hailemariam announced his resignation as Prime Minister and Leader of the ruling party in order to "conduct sustainable peaceful and democratic reforms".

The Sino-Tibetan War (Chinese: 康藏战争; pinyin: Sīnō-Tibetan War), also known as the Sino-Tibetan War (Chinese: 康藏战争; pinyin: Xīnō-Tibetan War), was an international war fought in the early 20th century by the Tibetan government in the Tibetan Autonomous Region of China. The Sino-Tibetan War broke out between the Chinese government and the British and Indian governments. In 1912, the Thirteenth Dalai Lama issued a letter to the Tibetan people declaring complete autonomy for Tibet. The Tibetan government in the Greater Tibet Autonomous Region declared that the whole of the region was under the control of the Tibetan government, but at that time, the Kang District and the Ando District were still under the control of the rebel Kawan Army and the Majia Army, respectively. In 1914, the Republic of China designated the area west of Kangding (including the area west of Jinsha River) as a riverside special zone under the control of Sichuan Province. This caused the discontent of the government. Several years later, in 1917 and from 1920 to 1922, the Tibetan army of the province attacked the riverside special zone, twice exterminating the Kawan Army on a large scale and occupying most of the special zone.

Sai-khu (Chinese: 西區) is located in the center of Taichung City, Taiwan. It was named after the western corner of Taichung City when the city was divided in February 1946. Sai-khu is the seat of Taichung State Hall. After the Taichung City Government was moved to Saitun District, Sai-ku became the seat of some offices of Taichung City Government. After World War II, the Republic of China accepted the area under the jurisdiction of the Japanese Governor-General's Office of Taiwan, merged the former Taichung City, Taichung Prefecture's Suehiro-cho, Asahi-cho, Murakami-cho, Rikuni-cho, Yuki-cho, Meiji-cho, Chitose-cho, Ju-cho, Kawabata-cho, Goko-cho, Toku-cho, Ma-en-tou, and public buildings, to form "West-ku." According to the Statistics Department of Taichung City Government, by the end of 2021, the West-ku had about 4.6 million households, a population of about 11.3 million, of which 53,329 were males, 59,411 were females, and a gender ratio of about 89.76, making it the lowest administrative district in Taichung City.

The Democratic People's Republic of Algeria (Arabic: République Algerienne démocratique populaire ), commonly known as Algeria (Arabic: الجزائر ), is a semi-presidential republic in the Maghreb region of North Africa. Its capital and largest city is Algeria. Its predecessor was the French Algeria Territory, which finally gained independence in 1962 after a long Algerian war. Its indigenous peoples were Berbers, who underwent Islamization and Arabization under the Arab Empire in the 8th century, and under the Ottoman Empire in the 16th century. Algeria today belongs to the major and middle powers in North Africa, and relies on energy exports to build a stronger economy. Its Human Development Index is the highest among the countries of the African continent.

However, when the orbit drifts too far forward or backward, Earth's gravity will reverse the asteroid's orbit so that it will never be more than 100 times more distant from the Earth than it is from the Moon."The same effect also prevents the oscillating planet from being less than 38 times more distant from the Earth than it is from the Moon, i.e., the asteroid is "swinging" with the Earth."The oscillating planet was first discovered on April 27, 2016, in images taken with the Pan-STARRS 1 telescope operated by the University of Hawaii's Office for the Coordination of Planetary Defense and operated by the University of Hawaii's Pan-STARRS 1 telescope on the Haliakara volcano.Its size has not yet been fully confirmed, but it may be 40 to 100 meters.The asteroid 2016 HO3 is a stable companion around the Earth.The asteroid 2016 HO3 orbits the Sun and the Earth (simulation file) Public domain material cited in this article is from websites or documents of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

Hong Kong & Kowloon Ferry Limited is a ferry company operating passenger services between Lamma Island and Hong Kong Island. Established in June 1998, Hong Kong & Kowloon Ferry was formed by the merger of a number of shipping companies and shipyards, including Zainichi Shipyard, Hong Kong & Kowloon Shipping, Union Shipping, Tri Wah Shipping, Yufa Marine Engineering, Daiki Marine Engineering and Luo Yanying. The first routes operated by Hong Kong & Kowloon Ferry were Aberdeen to Lamma Island Banju Bay and Central to Lamma Island North Point Village.

National Torao Senior High School (Chinese: 虎尾高级中学; pinyin: 虎高; pinyin: 虎中) is a national high school located in Torao Town, Yunlin County, Taiwan. The school is headed by the National and Pre-School Education Department of the Ministry of Education. It is a three-year community high school with sports classes, mathematics and science classes, and general subjects. Today's Torao Senior High School was established in 1979 by the merger of Torao Senior High School (male) and the Provincial Torao Girls High School. At that time, the original name of the school was maintained as "Taiwan Provincial Torao Senior High School" (Chinese: 虎中; pinyin: 虎中) and moved to the original site of the Torao Girls High School. Torao Girls High School was famous for its distinctive campus landscape, some of the buildings in the school were planned by Shuzaeran, "Taiwan's first female architect," with the name "Northern beauty, Southern Torao Girls." In 2000, due to the Ministry of Education, the name was changed to the present. Torao Girls High School alumni are from all walks of life, such as the 5th, 6th and 7th Governor of Yunlin County, Xu Wenzhi, Liao Quan Yu, and Su Wenxiang are all Torao Girls High School alumni, and the local reputation is "the 3rd Governor of Yunlin County, the same as the Torao Girls High School."

In September 1997, the 15th Congress of the Communist Party of China first proposed “Promoting Judicial Reform.” In November 2002, the 16th Congress of the Communist Party of China proposed “Promoting Judicial Reform.” In May 2003, the Leading Group for the Reform of the Judicial System was established and the Office of the Leading Group for the Reform of the Judicial System was established. In October 2007, the 17th Congress of the Communist Party of China proposed “Deepening Judicial Reform.” In 2012, the Press Office of the State Council published the White Paper on China’s Judicial Reform. On November 12, 2013, the Third Plenary Session of the 18th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China adopted the Decision of the Leading Group for the Reform of the Judicial System.

Steppe, also known as dry grassland, is a type of grassland ecosystem in which arid herbaceous plants predominate. Annual rainfall is typically between 35 mm and 550 mm. It contains more than 800 species of higher plants and more rainfall and plant species than deserts. It is an area that provides a habitat for wildlife. The main grasslands are found in northern Asia and central and western North America. There are many types of steppe, such as typical dry grasslands, desert grasslands, meadow grasslands, semi-arid grasslands, forest grasslands, and special groups, such as special sagebrush grasslands, which are moist but superficially dry. Note that meadow grasslands are not the same as forest grasslands. Other grasslands may contain shrubs, but the grasslands are not mainly sponges composed of shrubs. Grasslands are formed by the interaction of atmosphere, soil, and living things.

On June 3, 1968, a C-46 transport plane crashed in the present Taikangri farmland, and many years later, the local people erected 72 shrines for worship. According to the statistics of the New Tainan District Office of Household Administration, by the end of 2021, there were about 8,000 households in Tainan District, a population of about 210,000, the largest and smallest villages in the district were Dongseongli and Daanoli, and by the end of 2021, the population of two villages were 3,073 and 710, respectively. The Town Hall of Tainan District is the dispatching agency of the Tainan District Government, the executive agency of the Shuri District Government in the framework of the Government of the Republic of China, and the upper-level supervisory agency of the Tainan District Government. The district governor is appointed by the mayor, whose term is guaranteed for no term. Under the district governor and secretary, there are 7 internal units such as 4 divisions and 3 rooms. On January 29, 2018, due to the adjustment of the district neighbourhood, the district boundary between Guangfuri and Zhongchengli was adjusted.

In the political sphere, the election method of the Chief Executive of Hong Kong failed to pass, the election of the Chief Executive still did not reach the universal suffrage, suppressed the development of Hong Kong's democratization. In addition, his brave and fierce character and his policy of hard-line political struggle were criticized, tensions with the democratic parties, the deterioration of police-to-people relations, and the rise of Hong Kong separatism. There were also social events such as the controversy against moral education and the National Education Department, the controversy over free television licenses in Hong Kong, the occupation of the Central Ring Road and the 2016 Lunar New Year riots in Mong Kok, and he collected about HK$50 million from the Australian company UGL. Some critics referred to him as a member of the underground Communist Party. On December 9, 2016, Leung Zhenying announced that he had given up his candidacy for re-election for family reasons, and the Chief Executive's term ended on June 30, 2017, he became the first Chief Executive who did not seek re-election and did not have a re-election since the transfer of sovereignty to Hong Kong.

The German astrographer Johann Bayer published the first atlas of the constellation in 1603, the Zodiac Atlas. Both Franz and Bayer depicted the constellation as a large-billed bird. The shape of the constellation is irregular, east facing Hydra, north facing Crane and Phoenix, west facing Indian and south facing Antarctica. The constellation covers a night sky of 295 square degrees and ranks 48th out of 88 modern constellations. In 1922, the International Astronomical Union (IAU) determined that the three-letter abbreviation "Tuc" represented the constellation. Bayer depicted the constellation on the Zodiac Atlas, but did not use Bayer's nomenclature for the stars. French explorer and astronomer Nicolas Louis Lacaille assigned the Greek letters "α" to "ρ" in 1756, omitting "ο" and "ξ", denoting the two nearest stars as "λ" and the three stars as "β".

In 1931 (Republic 20), he was impeached for misconduct, so he resigned from all positions and went to Japan. His resignation was firstly to protest against the imprisonment of Chiang Kai-shek and the Hu Han people whom he admired. After returning to China in 1933 (Republic 22), he wrote a book, "The Doctrine of Virtue," advocating that force is morality, and that soldiers should obey God. After the start of the war against Japan in December 1937 (Republic 26), Mu Bin participated in the provisional government of the Japanese pseudo-government of the Republic of China established in Beiping (Beijing). He was the head of the Central Command Department of the New People's Party, and was an assistant to the chairman, Wang Kemin-do. Soon afterwards, he was in close contact with Kaner Ishihara, pushing for the "East Asian Union Movement." In March 1940 (Republic 29), Wang Xiewei's Nanjing National Government was established, Mu was appointed as a member of the Central Political Committee (the second and third sessions were renamed as deferred members).

In the Northern Hemisphere, this constellation lies below the horizon. Many of the brightest stars in the constellation are members of the Scorpio-Half-Man constellation association, including Bees 3, Bees 1, Gamma, Zeta2 Muscae, Eta (possibly), and HD 100546, a blue-white Herbig Ae/Be star that is surrounded by planets, debris disks, debris disks containing planets, brown dwarfs, and possibly protoplanets.

On October 6, 1981, during a military parade in Cairo to celebrate the eighth anniversary of the Victory in the Atonement Day War, Sadat jumped out of a jeep, one of the soldiers threw a grenade at him, and the other opened fire on him. He and several others were shot (including Sadat's private secretary, Christian and Islamic leaders, Egyptian defense and diplomatic officials, three members of the U.S. military delegation, the Belgian ambassador to Egypt, and Chinese aeronautical technology expert Zhang Baoyu), security guards surrounded the scene, rescued Sadat and other wounded, and delivered him to hospital where he was treated by 11 doctors.

Guinea-Bissau declared independence on 24 September 1973. In November of the same year, the United Nations General Assembly approved the independence of Guinea-Bissau by a vote of 93 to 7. September 10, 1974: Portugal officially recognized the independence of Guinea-Bissau. In 1980, then Prime Minister João Bernardo Vieira carried out a coup d'état to overthrow the government. From November 1981 to May 1984, power fell to the Revolutionary Committee led by Vieira. In 1984, the unicameral parliament passed a new constitution, electing Vieira as the next president.

The Web Time Machine is a digital archive on the World Wide Web, created by the Internet Archive, a not-for-profit organization based in San Francisco, California, and one of the organization's most important services. It allows users to "go back in time" and see what the site looked like in the past. Its founders, Bruce Carly and Bruce Gilliat, developed the Web Time Machine with the goal of "universal access to all knowledge" by storing archived copies of outdated web pages. More than 452 billion pages have been added to the archive since its launch in 2001. The Web Time Machine was launched by Internet Archive founders Bruce Carly and Bruce Gilliat in 2001 to solve the problem of websites not being able to view content when maintained or closed.

The Jinxi Incident, also known as the December Incident, the December Coup, and the New Army Incident, refers to the November 28, 1939, Nationalist friction between the Yanxishan II War Zone and the Eighth Route Army, which occurred at the beginning of the Nationalist Government's winter offensive. This incident disrupted the Nationalist Army's plan to attack the Japanese forces in the Jinnan Delta Zone of the Second War Zone. In the 1931 Incident, Japan invaded northeastern China. Subsequently, Japan gradually strengthened its forces in northern China, and Shanxi was in danger of expansion of Japanese forces. At the end of 1935, the North China Incident was shelved by Japan, and the five northern provinces of China were immediately required to exercise "autonomy"; the Communist Party launched the 1921 Student Movement to agitate for the rescue of the Japanese. In February 1936, the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army crossed the Yellow River Eastern Expedition, and Yanxishan's Jinsui Army was badly defeated. Chiang Kai-shek immediately dispatched Guanlin Expeditionary Force commanding five divisions to enter Shanxi. In early May, the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army returned to northern Shanxi, but the Nationalist Government's troops did not withdraw from Shanxi, but were stationed on the eastern route of the Shanxi River. In June, the Jinshan Suining Four Provinces Border Area Fighting Bandit Commander Commander General, commanded by Chen Chengren, posed a threat to Yanxishan's rule in Shanxi.

A look and feel is a term used in product description and in marketing, branding and trademarks to describe the user experience of a product and the appearance of the product and the main characteristics of the interface. In software design, a look is used primarily in contexts related to the graphical user interface (GUI), which covers all aspects of interface design, including the behavior of static elements such as colors, shapes, layouts and fonts (the so-called "look"), and dynamic elements such as buttons, dialog boxes and menus (the so-called "feel"). A look can also be used to describe a website. A look also applies to other products. For example, in a product brochure, it refers to the graphical layout (the size of the brochure, the colors and fonts, etc.) and the writing style. In a device, it refers to the consistency of control and display of the entire product line.

Xi Jinping's first wife was Keiling, and his current wife is Chinese soprano Peng Liyuan. They had one daughter, Xi Minze. June 15, 1953. In 1960 (age 7), he entered Beijing's 81st High School. In 1962 (age 9), Xi Jinping, then Deputy Prime Minister and Secretary-General of the State Council, lost his job because of his involvement in the "anti-Party novel Liu Zhidan." It is also said that Xi Jinping attended Beijing's 101st High School, during which time, he showed an interest in sports, especially football. In early December 1966 (age 13), shortly after the outbreak of the Cultural Revolution, the Joint Action Committee of the Red Guards of the Capital High School (Joint Action) was established. However, because his father Xi Jinping was overthrown at the time, Xi Jinping was classified as a "gangster brother", and did not have much involvement in the Joint Action. Later, Xi Jinping was arrested at the Central Committee's Party School for intensive observation and examination, and was sent to the "gangster" brothers study class at the Major General's Office.

On June 5, 1944, the Second Session of the Sixth Seventh Plenary Session of the Communist Party of China was held in Yan'an, and the meeting decided to form a City Working Committee composed of 14 members including Liu Shaochi, Peng Zhen, Chen Yun, and Peng Zhen as its chairman.In July 1944, the City Working Department was established by the Central Committee.After the victory in the War of Resistance against Japan, the City Working Department ceased to function.On December 16, 1946, the CPC Central Committee decided to resume the City Working Department, with Zhou Enlai as its minister, Li Weihan as its deputy minister, and Pu Xiaopeng as its secretary-general.On April 29, 1947, the CPC Central Committee issued instructions on the guidelines for the work of the City Working Department and the methods of the work of the City Working Department in various places, stipulating that the task of the City Working Department was to supervise all the work of the Chiang Kai-shek District, and specified the scope of functions and operations of the City Working Department in each district.On May 5, 1947, the CPC Central Committee sent a telegram to Ye Jianying and Li Weihan on the work of the White District, instructing the Party organizations to strictly observe the principles of strict secrecy, parallel organization, single-line leadership, non-transferable relations, separation of urban and rural areas, separation of up and down, open and secret, in order to protect the Party and the forces of democratic progress, and to intensify the people's movement.

Wang Boqun (1885-December 20, 1944), a Chinese politician, was elected to the People's Assembly of the People's Republic of China (PRC) in 1885. He studied under Yao Hua, a professor at Penshan College, at the age of 18. He studied Mencius and Left History. Guangxu graduated in 1905 with the support of his uncle Liu Hsin-sei. He was one of the first students of the Communist Party of the People's Republic of China to travel to Eastern Japan. He attended Taitoku Kobun School, then entered the Central University of Japan. He studied political economy, then entered the Central Institute of Advanced Studies. During this time, he joined the League of Nations and participated in revolutionary activities. In 1919, he advocated the defeat of Yuan Shikai and joined the National Defense Movement. He was honored as one of the Seven Princes of the Tianjin Conference. He served as General Counselor of the Guizhou Military Governor's Office, General Commander of the Guizhou Military Command, and other positions in the National Defense Movement.

For example, a member of the Communist Party of China whose father has lived in Shanghai for generations and worked in Beijing since then, and whose father has lived in Beijing for generations, then Beijing is his father's long-term residence. When a member of the Communist Party of China completes his or her citizenship certificate, his or her grandfather's long-term residence is Shanghai, not Beijing. When a member of the Communist Party of China's children completes his or her citizenship certificate again, his or her children's citizenship certificate is Beijing. In addition, changes in administrative divisions also need to be completed according to the new plan.

Beyond this cavity and the boundary of this galaxy are two superclusters, at a distance of about 83 million light-years and one billion light-years, respectively. Capricorn is home to the Cepheid meteor shower, one of the most prolific meteor showers, discovered in January 1853, and named by Alexander Hershell in 1864. On April 28, 1984, the regular visual observer Frank White observed a significant outburst from 00:00 to 2:30 a.m. on a normally calm comet. Through his 6 cm telescope, he observed 433 meteors appearing from nearby comets with a diameter of less than 1°. Peter Jennis commented that the outburst resembled a "typical dust trail crossing". The June Capricorn meteor shower, also known as the ι Tauri meteor shower, is associated with Comet 7P/Ponce-Winnick, first confirmed by William Fdanning on May 27, 1916.

The Battle of Michina was one of the major battles of the Second Sino-Japanese War, which took place between May and August 1944, in Michina, Burma. Michina was a major transportation center in northern Burma, the city from the beginning of Burmese history has been a trading post between China and Burma, the northern terminus of the railway line built in the British Burmese period, and a hub city in northern Burma. From Michina, by train south to places such as Kodamooka, Mandalay and Yangon, the southern highway connects with the Burma-Myanmar Highway, the northern highway connects with the border between China and Burma, and the western highway connects with the radar highway under construction. The city was occupied by the Japanese forces after the Japanese invasion of Burma in 1942, and the Michina airport was built, and fighter planes were deployed to disrupt the Dabong Line. Retrieving Michina was important for the Allied Southeast Asian War.

On 18 February, Jonathan refused to step down, declared a state of emergency, suspended the constitution, dissolved the parliament, arrested the opposition party, and appointed himself as the head of state of Lesotho. In April 1970, Moshe Moshe II was forced into exile in the Netherlands. In June 1970, Moshe Moshe II expressed his willingness to accept a request not to take part in politics in exchange for his return to the country. In December, Moshe Moshe II returned to power, while Jonathan continued to exercise dictatorial rule. In January 1986, a military coup broke out in Lesotho, and Jonathan was forced to step down. The newly formed military government authorized Moshe Moshe II to take direct part in politics. On 21 February 1990, the military government fought with the king, and Moshe Moshe II was deprived of legislative and executive powers. In March, he was again forced into exile. In November, the Military Commission declared him deposed, succeeded by his son, Prince David Mohamed Belin Seiso, as King of Lesotho.

After retiring from the army in 1976, he returned to basic units and became the commander of the 8th company of the 11th regiment of the 40th division of the 14th Army. Because of his distinguished service in the Vietnam War in 1979, he was promoted to the commander of the 8th regiment of the Training Unit and later to the chief of staff of the 8th regiment. In 1981, he was promoted to the deputy commander of the 8th regiment. In 1983, he was transferred to the commander of the 9th regiment. In 1984, he led the 2nd Mountain Campaign. On April 28, 1984, the Laoshan Campaign broke out, Zhang Matang commanded the 9th regiment mainly to attack the 662.6 high ground of the central peak Song Maoling, adopted the tactics of multiple breakthroughs, cut off the retreat of the Vietnamese army, and occupied the 662.6 high ground in just seven minutes. He then commanded the 9th regiment to advance to victory, within two hours, successively attacked 18 high ground in the area of K Song Maoling, the main attack force to capture the Laoshan peak and cleared the obstacles. From April 29 to April 30, Zhang Matang commanded the 9th regiment to continue to develop the offensive, and after the battle, all the key points of the Nara area were captured.

Common barium salts, besides barium trichloride, are barium sulfate and barium nitrate, which can be obtained from the corresponding rare-acid dissolved metals or their oxides. Gd3+, like other barium-containing ions, can form complexes and have high ligand numbers. For example, in the presence of the complexing agent DOTA, compounds with eight ligands can be formed. Salts containing − are used in magnetic resonance imaging. A number of similar ligand compounds have also been developed, such as a compound called Gadodiamide. Low-value barium compounds are also known, especially in the solid state. Barium halide (II) can be obtained by heating barium trichloride and barium metals in barium containers. Gd2Cl3 and GdCl can be recovered at higher temperatures (800 °C). Barium chloride is a flaky solid with a similar layered graphite structure.

During the first five-year plan period, the small docks along the Yangtze River embankment were renovated. In the late 1950s, the construction of the new Xinfeng, Dongfeng loading and unloading area and the Pitkao and Tsuencun docks began; the reconstruction and expansion of the Henan, Fangcun loading and unloading area and Hong Kong and Macau, coastal passenger terminals. Guangzhou was originally divided into inland and outer ports. Before 1986, Guangzhou had the Guangzhou Port Authority (under the jurisdiction of the inland ports) and the Huangpu Port Authority (under the jurisdiction of the outer ports). By December 1987, the Guangzhou Port Authority and the Huangpu Port Authority were merged to form the newly formed Guangzhou Port Authority. Guangzhou Port has become the third largest container port in China after Shanghai Port and Shenzhen Port, with a capacity of over 10 million containers, and has entered the world's top ten container ports. Old Port Docks: Yongyeong, Jiali, Old Port Dock, Wuzhou, Guangyu Dock (Miyao Sha Wai), Shutong, Temple Dock (Pacific, Jianxiang) New Port Docks: Shuji, Dongjiang Warehouse (Dongjiang Outer Port), Hoi Port, Quantong (Provincial Agricultural Warehouse), Hong Kong and Macau (Dongjiangkou), Guangpotong New Port (now mainly used for imports and exports with fewer vessels going east), Jiaoxin Dock, Sutou Tsui Dock, Fangcun Port.

In November 1925, together with Zou Ru and others, he convened the Fourth Central Committee of the Kuomintang in Beijing's Xishan Mountains, known as the Xishan Conference. He served as the "Central Executive Committee and Minister for Overseas Affairs" of the Xishan Conference. After the merger with Ning Han, he became a permanent member of the National Government and deputy chairman of the Legislative Assembly. He served as chairman of the National Government for 12 years from 1931. As Linson had always been at odds with Chiang Kai-shek on political lines, he had in the past, together with Koo Feng, Deng Zhao, Xiao Fengcheng and others, issued the " impeachment of Chiang Kai-shek," saying that "Chiang Kai-shek is fearful of the heart, fearful of success, the prime minister with his long army brigade, the prime minister with training soldiers, the term of office, the prime minister died before the due date, alternate times, theft of military power, submerged and settled in the center, dominating the country, submerging the wings, threatening old age. Comrades, praise the will of the prime minister, the urgent danger of the country, bravery, courage, submission.

Apple trees can grow very tall, up to 15 meters tall, if they start growing from seeds, but cultivated trees are usually only 3-5 meters tall, so varieties of apples are usually propagated by grafting onto rootstocks, which determine the size of the final tree. The trunk is gray-brown and the bark has a degree of peeling. Apple trees and their fruits are prone to many fungal, bacterial and pest problems, which can be controlled by a variety of organic and non-organic means. In 2010, the genome of apples was sequenced as part of research into disease control and breeding selection in apple production. Apple production worldwide in 2017 was 83.1 million tonnes, half of the total production in China.

The main points of this law are: to recover the citizenship of the Republic of China, to acquire the citizenship of the Republic of China through naturalization, to the people of mainland China or to the residents of Hong Kong and Macau who have been permitted to enter the territory of Taiwan, may not register as a presidential or vice presidential candidate.(Article 20) The election of the Legislative Council is the election of the members of the Parliament of Taiwan, and the direct election of the members of the Legislative Council by the citizens.It is the only "central election of public officials" as defined in the "Public Officials Election and Removal Law."The "local public officials" as defined in the "Public Officials Election and Removal Law" include: the mayor of the city, the councillor of the city, the district director of the mountainous indigenous district of the city, the district representative of the mountainous indigenous district of the city, the mayor of the township, the councillor of the township, the mayor of the mountainous indigenous village, the district representative of the village, the village chief.In terms of the election method, Taiwanese elections are generally conducted by ordinary, equal, direct and unrecorded ballot.

The organ newspapers of the Communist Party of China can be traced back to the Red China News and the "Reference News" in the period of the People's Republic of China. The 18 main media established by the Communist Party of China are the People's Daily, Xinhua News Agency, Qiao Hai, the People's Liberation Army Daily, the Guangming Daily, the Economic Daily, the China Daily, the Central People's Radio and Television, the Central Television, the China International Radio and Television, the Science and Technology Daily, the China Investigation and Prosecution Monitoring Daily, the Workers' Daily, the China Youth Daily, the China Women's Daily, the Farmers' Daily, the Legal Daily and the China News Agency. In addition to the central media, each local government has its own newspapers, television stations and Internet news portals. The younger generation is regarded by the Communist Party of China as an important publicity target.

Since 2007, Haida University has been one of the 25 universities participating in the Ministry of Education's "Shining Star Program."In 2005, Haida University was awarded the Ministry of Education's "Reward for University Teaching Excellence Program" and the "Development of International First-Class Universities and Centers of Excellence Program", joined the Taipei United University System in 2014, was awarded the "Development of Higher Education Deep Cultivation Program" in 2018, and then joined the Pan-Pacific University Alliance in 2021.Since the name of some schools after graduation is similar to the name of the National Taiwan University of Marine Science and Technology, since May 3, 2017, the Ministry of Economy's Intellectual Property Bureau has acquired the exclusive trademark rights of the "National Taiwan University of Marine Science and Technology", "Taihai University", "Taihai University", "Haidai University" and "Coat of Arms", limiting the use of abbreviations by other universities in the future.

National Shan-Hua Senior High School (SHSH, 善高) is a national high school located in Shan-Hua District, Tainan. It is only a 4-minute drive from Shan-Hua Transfer Station and Taichung Railway Shan-Hua Station, and is convenient for transportation. It was initially established as a joint branch of Tainan First Secondary School, Tainan Secondary School and Tainan Girls' Secondary School, with a junior high school class, as a preparatory measure for evacuation based on air defense and defense. 1955: Tainan First Secondary School, Tainan Secondary School and Tainan Girls' Secondary School were established as a joint branch. August 1, 1956: The school officially became an independent Taiwan Provincial Shan-Hua Senior High School, with a high school division and a junior high school division. 1968: The junior high school division was closed, and after the junior high school students graduated, it was reorganized as Taiwan Provincial Shan-Hua Senior High School. August 1984: A student counseling center was established.

On July 1, 1929, the Mother House at Yuen Chau Street in Sham Shui Po was established. It was consecrated by Bishop Enlai Kwong. On July 19, the Holy See officially granted permission for the Sisters of the Blood to become a local congregation in the Hong Kong Apostolic Prefecture. The Sisters of the Blood are both missionaries and diocesan congregations. Initially, the missionary work of the Sisters of the Blood was to establish women's schools and seminaries in response to the needs of the society at the time. In 2001, the Department of Education was established to systematically organize the Sisters of the Blood's educational projects. At present, there are three secondary schools, nine primary schools and two kindergartens under the jurisdiction of the Sisters of the Blood: The Sisters of the Blood Women's Secondary School The Sisters of the Blood Women's Secondary School The Sisters of the Blood Thinking School The Sisters of the Blood Hospital on Qing Shan Road in Sham Shui Po was opened in 1937. It was a non-profit medical institution and was taken over by Caritas in 1993.

A seed is defined in botany as the structure of the embryo of a seed plant that is formed by pasteurization and fertilization. It is a naked plant, a propagule, typically composed of a seed coat, an embryo, and an embryonic membrane. The protective function of the seed coat is that the embryo is the most important part of the seed and develops into a new individual after germination. The embryonic membrane contains nutrients. In an imprecise and broad sense (e.g. in agriculture, ecology, or colloquialism), the term "seed" may, in addition to the above definitions, also include legumes, legumes, grains, etc.; they are actually fruits, which should be called seeds or seed pods, belonging to a disseminule; whereas the seed coat cannot be easily separated from the seed coat, it may be called seed coat. A seed coat, also called a seed coat, is formed by the development of a pear, and has the function of protecting the embryo and the embryonic membrane.

The number of blue whales did not rise until 1966, when the international community began to protect them. A 2002 report estimated the number of blue whales in the world at between 5,000 and 12,000. Currently, the number of blue whales in the Northeast Pacific, Antarctica and Indian Oceans is much smaller than before (about 2,000 each). There are two larger groups in the North Atlantic, and at least two groups in the Southern Hemisphere. The blue whale belongs to the beaked whale family, which also includes humpback whales, sperm whales, humpback whales and fin whales. A hybrid species between the blue whale and the big whale is also known. The scientific name musculus comes from Latin, meaning "strong", but can also mean "little mouse". Current authoritative experts classify the blue whale into three or four subspecies: the northern blue whale includes the North Pacific and North Atlantic populations, the southern blue whale that lives in the Antarctic Ocean, and the dwarf blue whale that has been found in the Indian Ocean and South Pacific.

In 1902, the Australian and Portuguese governments again proposed to the Qing government the construction of a railway from Macau to Guangzhou in order to promote commercial relations between Macau and China. In September, the Chinese and Portuguese sides negotiated the establishment of a Sino-Portuguese Railway Company to jointly build the Greater Macau Railway. On October 15, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Qing returned a letter to the Portuguese ambassador, stating that "it is permissible for the Atlantic region (meaning Macau) to establish a Sino-Portuguese Railway Company to build a railway from Macau to the capital of Guangdong Province, but all other methods must be negotiated separately," and agreed to the Portuguese construction of a railway from Macau via Zhongshan to Guangzhou, a total length of 120 km. On November 11, 1904, the Qing government and Portugal signed the "Greater Macau Railway Contract" in Shanghai.

Columbus is said to have landed on the island of San Salvador. The Spaniards were not interested in immigrating to the island, but the raiding of slaves led to a sharp decline in the population. In 1648, a group of British from the Bermuda Islands came to the Bahamas, but did not intend to settle there. It soon became a refuge for pirates, and the Spaniards also occasionally landed and invaded, leading to a prosperous but not particularly prosperous later. After the American Revolution, some people loyal to the United Kingdom fled the United States to the Bahamas, which led to the prosperity of the Bahamas, and the establishment of cotton plantations. During the American Civil War, it became the center of the blockade of smuggling ships. It was not until after World War II that tourism began to develop, and the local prosperity continued. In 1964, the Bahamas gained internal autonomy. In 1973, it became an independent Bahamian state.

At that time, the eight counties of Wu County, Wuxiang County, Yongjia County, Gixi County, Linghai County, Dongyang County and Xin'an County were simultaneously mobilized to respond to Sun Yat-sen, and Sun Yat-sen's forces thus increased to hundreds of thousands. Sun Yat-sen claimed to be the conqueror of Eastern China, forcing people to serve as his officials, calling his group "the Longevity Man," and carried out large-scale killings, burning and looting in all four places. Since the territory of the Three Kingdoms had become the lifeline of the Eastern Jin Dynasty, the Eastern Jin Dynasty ordered Diệm to defeat Sun Yat-sen with his army in Xuzhou, and Liu Rong with his army to attack the Three Kingdoms. Diệm first subdued Gixiang County, Yingdao County and Weiyinhuan County, then defeated Sun Yat-sen's forces in Wuxiang County, and soon joined Liu Rong's two armies in attacking the Chentang River. Sun Yat-sen initially thought that he could take down Jiankang with the support of the eight counties, but when Liu Rong's army crossed the Chentang River, Sun Yat-sen went east with 200,000 troops, and with Liu Rong's army to plunder the population and goods left by his troops to seek time to escape, eventually fleeing to the sea island.

Moldova is an agricultural country, with a weak industrial base, and a national economy dependent on agriculture, brewing and other industries. Moldova is still a relatively poor country, with a per capita GDP of about $4,000 in 2020, surpassing only Ukraine in Europe and Indonesia in Asia. Politically, there is political persecution of the opposition. Moldova also faces a serious problem of human trafficking within the country. After independence in 1991, Moldova joined the United Nations, the World Trade Organization (WTO), the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE), the Commonwealth of Independent States and other international organizations. Moldova is currently a member of the NATO Partnership for Peace Program, and the European Union is an Eastern Partnership. Moldova is seeking accession to the European Union, but the prospects for accession are unfavourable due to the internal political division between the pro-Russian and pro-European parties, and the real division of the German Democratic Republic.

After the dissolution of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia in 1991-1992, the remaining two republics, Serbia and Montenegro, were re-formed into the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (FRY). However, the United Nations, the United States, and others did not recognize the new federal state. Following the establishment of the FRY, Milošević continued to participate in the wars in Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina under the leadership of Western countries. The wars ceased in 1995 after the signing of the Dayton Accords. In 1998, ethnic conflict broke out in the southern part of Serbia, triggering the Kosovo War (March-June 1999) between NATO countries and the FRY. After the war, Kosovo was transferred to NATO and Russian peacekeeping forces.

Under these circumstances, Mao Zedong, the Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, gradually considered exploring other means of peaceful liberation while not abandoning the armed attack on Taiwan and its surrounding islands. The CPC Central Committee and Mao Zedong decided that Zhou Enlai, the Premier of the State Council, would be responsible for this task. In July 1954, Mao Zedong sent a letter to Zhou Enlai instructing him to intensify the work on Taiwan in order to complete the reunification of the motherland. According to Dong Xiaopeng, before 1956, the CPC Central Committee's policy towards Taiwan was mainly to liberate Taiwan by force. In 1956, the People's Republic of China was about to enter a period of comprehensive socialist construction. Under the international and domestic situation at the time, the idea of seeking to liberate Taiwan by peaceful means and cooperating with Chiang Kai-shek for the third time became clear.

Its predecessor, the Ministry of National Defence, dates back to 1912, when the Republic of China was founded, the Ministry of the Army of the Republic of China and the Ministry of the Navy of the Republic of China under the provisional government of Nanjing. In 1925, the National Government was established, and at the same time the Military Commission of the National Government was established as the highest military institution. In October 1928, after the victory in the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army, the Military Commission ceased to function, and the responsibilities were transferred to the Ministry of Military Affairs, the Ministry of the Navy, the Staff Headquarters, the Military Senate and the Directorate of Training under the Executive Yuan, respectively. The Ministry of Military Affairs belonged to the Executive Yuan, and on November 21, 1928, the National Government promulgated the Regulations on the Organization of the Ministry of Military Affairs, which governed the Office of General Affairs, the Army Department, the Navy Department, the Air Department, the Ordnance Department, and the Ordnance Works Department, and was responsible for the administration of the National Army, the Navy, and the Air Force, supervising and directing military affairs in all provinces and regions. The Military Senate is the highest military advisory body of the National Government.
