The Netherlands has five international courts, including the Permanent Court of Arbitration, the International Court of Justice, the International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia, the International Criminal Court, and the Special Tribunal for Lebanon. The former four courts are located in The Hague, and the headquarters of the Europol and the European Public Prosecutor's Office are also located there, giving The Hague the name "capital of international justice". The official name of the Netherlands is Nederland, which literally means "lowland", hence also means "lowland state", or "lowland state".

On January 18, 1909 (December 27, 1934), the Qing government promulgated the "Regulations on the Local Autonomy of Townships and Townships," which stipulated that villages, settlements and townships with a population of more than 50,000 should be built, autonomous organizations should be established, and matters of local autonomy should be decided and handled. This was the first regulation explicitly stipulating the town-building system. On the Chinese mainland, the official terms commonly used in town planning and construction were "small towns" and "settlement towns." Since the 1980s and especially after the 1990s, with the rapid industrialization and urbanization, town construction has been integrated into the unified planning of the county-level and above governments, and corresponding standards have been established for town planning design and construction of a certain scale.

Guozhuang Station is a transfer station of Guangzhou Metro Lines 5 and 6, located at the bottom of Dong Road, Nanlinshita intersection, Wanshi, Yuxiu District, Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province, China. The station was officially opened on December 28, 2009 with the opening of the first phase of Line 5, and on December 28, 2013 with the opening of the second phase of Line 6. The building area of the station is 250,000 square meters, it has six floors, the ground floor is the station entrances, the periphery is Dong Road, Nanlinshita and nearby buildings, the roof of the E entrance station room part has a station cooling tower, the ground floor is the station cold station, the underground floor is the equipment room; the second floor is the North Station Hall; the third floor is the platform level of Line 5; the underground four floors are the North Station Hall and the South Station Hall; the underground five floors are the platform level of Line 6.

Unlike other rare earth elements, beryllium is relatively stable in dry air. However, it can rapidly lose its luster in moist air, forming an easily detachable beryllium oxide film. When it is detached, oxidation proceeds internally. Powdered beryllium is rapidly oxidized to Gd2O3 at 1200°C and sublimated to form a GdO film at 1800°C. Beryllium is a strong reducing agent that can reduce some metal oxides to metal forms. Beryllium is electropositive, reacts slowly with cold water, reacts rapidly with hot water, and produces beryllium hydroxide: Beryllium reacts rapidly with dilute sulfuric acid, produces colorless beryllium and halogens at about 200°C, and produces beryllium trihalide: In most compounds of beryllium, its oxidation state is +3. All beryllium trihalides are known, and are white solids (except beryllium trihalide, which is yellow).

At the time of the 58th school year of the Republic of China, the number of students in Jiping Secondary School was more than 1,500. Jiping Secondary School is located in Ren Mei Li, Yang Mei District, Taoyuan City, Taiwan. To the east of Jiping Secondary School is located between Shimen Daini Township, Xingping District Waterway, Sendanhua Trail and Zhen Xingri Township, Ping Township. Nearby government agencies, schools and libraries are located in the north of the school district, Taoyuan City Government Police Department, Yang Mei Branch Office, Xi Nan Police Station, Tai Po National Primary School, Yang Mei District, Taoyuan City Municipal Library, Pu Xin Branch Office, and in the southwest of the school district. A little further to the northwest and southwest of the school district are Taiwan Railway Administration Station, Pu Xin, and Taoyuan Headquarters of the Agriculture Committee of the Taiwan Executive Council. In addition, to the east of the school district is Hak Kok Tong, the site of the Battle of Anping Township, which took place between June and July 1895 under the leadership of Hu Xiaoyu (Hu Ro Jing).

In cattle, horses, and whales, the mammary glands are located in the groin, and in the breasts of breast-feeding women, the mammary glands form a cone-shaped disk, surrounded by an unequal amount of adipose tissue, which gives them their distinctive shape. The mammary glands are divided into 15-20 leaves by fat and connective tissue, each leaf being subdivided into more small leaves by a thick fibrous ligament that connects the skin to the connective tissue in the muscles that cover the breast. Each of these leaves has a milk-delivery tube, which is used to drain the secreted milk, and the milk-delivery tubes converge on the nipple, but the radius of the tubes near the nipple suddenly expands into the sac, and then constricts sharply into needle-like pores, opening at the top of the nipple. A cow has four breast regions per breast, while a sheep has only two, but a pig has more, distributed on both sides of the midline of its abdomen, usually eight to 16 sacs, each of which has two breast regions.

Copper alloys have excellent mechanical properties and low resistivity, the most important of which are bronze and brass. In addition, copper is a durable metal, which can be recycled many times without compromising its mechanical properties. Copper is one of the metals that can be used directly in nature (natural metals), which made it used by people in many different regions in 8000 B.C., and thousands of years later, copper became the first metal to be mined from sulfide minerals in 5000 B.C.; in 4000 B.C., it became the first plastic metal in molds, and in 3500 B.C., it forged with another metal, tin, the first alloy in human history - bronze. Copper often forms secondary copper salts in nature, which give blue or green minerals such as blue copper ore, peacock stone and green pine, and have historically been widely used as a pigment.

New Caledonia (French: Nouvelle-Calédonie) is a special group of French islands in the southwestern part of the Atlantic Ocean. It consists mainly of the islands of New Caledonia and the Loyalty Islands. As one of the overseas parts of France, Melanesian and Polynesian languages are spoken in addition to the official French language. A leader of Neolithic culture, it is famous for its pottery. The earliest inhabitants came from the islands of Papua and Polynesia. The British explorer James Cook was the first European to discover New Caledonia. On September 4, 1774, he discovered the island on his second expedition. The French explorer Jean-François de Gallo, Count of Lapillouz, had approached the west coast of the main island (Grande Terre) in 1788 before his disappearance.

Dress, also known as a suit, is a Western-style formal attire, modernly referred to as a three-piece suit for men. In a broad sense, a suit refers to clothing, including the entire Western clothing system. Although it originated in Europe, it has now become an internationally accepted formal attire, as a way of showing courtesy and respect. Today, even civilians wear suits to show respect, performers or hosts when attending weddings, funerals, wedding receptions, banquets, enjoying operas, movies or performances, etc. Men's suits are the most standardized. Long-sleeved jackets, matching pants, long-sleeved shirts, and ties, are the basic clothing of men's suits. Women's suits are more diverse, but can basically be classified as jackets, matching skirts or pants, and women's shirts. Old-fashioned suits even have matching hats, men can wear a fedora hat or a rounded hard hat, and women can wear pillbox caps.

In 1827, John Clooney Ross brought his family to settle here, using and improving the natural coconut forest and increasing the harvesting of coconuts by the Malayans to produce coconuts. In 1836, the British biologist Charles Darwin established a coral reef observatory here. In 1857, the British declared the islands their own, and in 1878, the Cocos Islands were placed under the control of the Governor of Ceylon. In 1886, they were incorporated into the Strait Settlement and granted to the Clooney Ross family as permanent possessions. In 1903, they were transferred to British Singapore. During World War I, the German cruiser Emden, which was sent to the Indian Ocean for trade sabotage, was sunk by the Australian cruiser Sydney (1914) off the coast of North Kivu. In 1955, the islands and Christmas Islands were transferred from British Singapore to Australia. In September 1978, the owners of the islands, Clooney Ross, sold the plantations and transferred the property to Australia.

In 1723, as the number of Taiwanese immigrants settled in Taiwan increased, the Minister of the Interior of the Qing Dynasty began to recommend the establishment of county government in Taiwan, Ding Shaoyi, "East Ying Literature" Volume 1, establishment of the territory. Establishment, page 3: "Tsuzhouhuahua is the territory of Zhlo County. In the Yongzheng era, successively re-established in succession, the population grew, the county belongs to the northern half of Tsuzhouhua River, the place of county, the name Changhua." Later, it was decided to establish a new county within Zhlo County, north of Tsuzhouhuahua River (here Tsuzhouhuahua River refers to the present-day old Tsuzhouhuahua River), south of Dajia River, in the sense of "building a school, establishing a school," to take the county name Changhua, and the half-line city (now Changhua City) as the place of county government. Thus, the history of Changhuahua County was opened. In 1731, because the area north of Changhuahua City was too wide for people to negotiate, so the area north of the original Tsuzhouhuahua River, known as the administration of Freshwater Hall; after about 150 years, Changhuahua County was governed by the area south of Dajia River and north of Tsuzhouhuahua River.

In the winter of 1926, the Northern Expeditionary Army of the National Revolutionary Army defeated the forces of Sun Quanfang. On March 24, 1927, the Northern Expeditionary Army was victorious, but after entering Nanjing, the Nanjing Incident, which had a profound impact, became one of the important preludes to the breakup of the Communist Party of China; shortly afterwards, the Shanghai Incident occurred. On April 18, 1927, the National Government was established in Nanjing, the city of Nanjing was designated as the capital, and the Nanjing City Hall was established. On May 25, the National Government appointed Liu Kiwen as the mayor of the special city of Nanjing. On June 1, 1929, Sun Yat-sen was buried in the Mausoleum of Sun Yat-sen. On June 19, 1930, the Republic of China was changed to a city under the direct jurisdiction of the Imperial Court. On June 1, 1931, the Constitution of the Republic of China was promulgated, Article 5 of which stipulated that "the capital of the Republic of China shall be in Nanjing," thereby establishing Nanjing as the legal capital of the Republic of China.

After Brezhnev's death on November 10, 1982, he succeeded him as the Central Secretary of the USSR and became the Supreme Leader of the USSR. During his tenure, he attempted to eliminate corruption and inefficiency in the Soviet system by investigating the behavior of long-serving officials in violation of the Party Charter and criminalizing the misconduct of officials in the workplace. His long-term influence led to the emergence of a new generation of young reformers, including Yegor Likhachev, Nikolai Lezhkov and, most importantly, Mikhail Gorbachev. After suffering a kidney failure in February 1983, his health began to deteriorate rapidly.

On March 20, Chiang Kai-shek returned to Guangzhou halfway to Shantou, ordered martial law throughout the city, prevented the coup d'état by the Communist Party of China and Soviet advisors Jiang Zemin. Eugene and Chen Zhaoqing were ordered by Chiang to occupy the Zhongshan Ship, arrested Li at home, surrounded Soviet advisors and Communist Party institutions, detained members of the First Army and Huangpu Military Academy such as Zhou Enlai, and closely monitored Deng Yanda. The commander of the Zhongshan Ship was replaced by Eugene. Chiang Kai-shek said this was only against individuals, the policy of the Communist League of Russia did not change.

The victory of the Allies in the First World War (French: Première guerre mondiale, German: Erster Weltkrieg, Russian: Первая война) (28 July 1914 – 11 November 1918) was a major war fought in Europe. However, the European powers were drawn together and the fighting eventually spread to the rest of the world, with most of the world's nations involved. A large number of new tactics, technologies and weapons were used for the first time in the war, including newly invented aircraft, trench warfare, chemical weapons, etc., making it the most costly military conflict in human history.

With the launch of the SOHO satellite in 1995, more and more cruisers were discovered, and a number of small comets were destroyed or swallowed by the strong gravitational and tidal forces of the Sun during their perihelion passage. It was later believed that the number of cruisers was greater than estimated. In the future, a large group of cruisers may return. Of the cruisers observed by the SOHO satellite, nearly 90% belong to the cruisers, while the remaining 10% are more sporadic, but they are still divided into four classes, namely Kracht, Kracht2A, Marsden and Meyer. These Marsden and Kracht comets or comets with 96P-period – Meckhaus I have a large relationship, the comet may also be the parent comet of the meteor showers of Cepheus and the meteor showers of Capricorn during the day.

After the start of the Cultural Revolution, Cao’s father was labeled a “money launderer.” Due to his family background, after graduating from high school, Cao entered a state-run restaurant as an apprentice. Between 1975 and 1976, he first participated in the construction of the “Little Three Lines” in Anhui, and then worked on the reconstruction of the city after the Great Tangshan Earthquake. He remained a drifter until the end of the Cultural Revolution. After the resumption of the entrance examination system, he had interrupted his studies for more than six years. Cao decided to enroll in university and chose to register for a law major. In 1979, he stepped on the lowest admission score line of the East China School of Political Law and entered the School of Law. After four years of undergraduate study, he also studied international law. During the seven years of studying at the East China School of Political Law, Cao Jianming was rated as a “Shanghai’s ‘three good’ student” for six years. After graduating from the undergraduate course in 1986, Cao Jianming remained at the school to teach; he was a faculty member of the Department of International Law, vice-dean and director of the Department; and during this time, he also studied at the University of Ghent, Belgium.

The Ministry of Railways was established on May 15, 1920, and was reorganized as the Ministry of Transport and Communications on November 1, 1943. Its functions ranged from the operation of provincial railways (provincial lines and post-war state-owned railways) to the command and control of local railways (private railways). It was the predecessor of the Ministry of Transport and Japan's state-owned railways after World War II. Initially, the railway bureau (later the railway bureau) was established by the Ministry of Industry in 1871 (one year before the opening of the Shinbashi-Yokohama railway). In 1885, the Ministry of Industry was abolished and became the direct responsibility of the Cabinet. In 1890, the railway bureau became the direct responsibility of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. In 1892, the railway bureau became the direct responsibility of the Ministry of Communications, and the following year, the railway bureau became the railway bureau of the Ministry of Communications. In 1897, the railway works bureau was established independently from the railway bureau (reorganized in 1908 by the Imperial Railway Bureau), and the railway bureau was responsible only for supervision and administration.

Qiu Qingquan is also known as the "Chief General Poet" because of his intransigence, his bad relations with his colleagues and superiors, and his aggressive fighting style. His father, Qiu Qingquan (1867-1938), was the mother of Yu. In 1922, he entered the Social Department of Shanghai University. In 1924, he entered the Army Military Academy in Huangpu, Guangzhou, as a second-year student of engineering. During his training period, he participated in the Tianping Rebellion of the Guangzhou Chamber of Commerce, the Battle of Dongjiang, and the Tianping Rebellion of Guangzhou. In 1925, he graduated as a lieutenant colonel, participated in the Battle of Huizhou, and was promoted to lieutenant colonel. In 1926, he returned to Huangpu Military Academy, and was promoted to captain. The Guangzhou National Government launched the Northern Expeditionary War. Qiu Qingquan joined the army as a lieutenant colonel in the 4th Army. He participated in the Battle of Tingsa Bridge, the Siege of Wuchang and the Battle of Nanchang.

Since his discovery of Asteroid 2839 in 1929, he has discovered a total of 14 minor planets in seven years: 2941, 3310, 3583, 3754, 3775, 3824, 4510, 4755, 5701, 6618, 7101, 7150 and 8778. Asteroid 1604 was named after him in 1931. At that time, astronomers Pascal Lowell and William Henry Pickering had predicted the existence of the ninth largest planet in the Solar System, but no one had discovered it. Tombo used a flash comparator to compare photographs of the same-day sky taken on a planned nightly survey to find objects moving in the background stars; on February 18, 1930, he discovered Pluto using two photographs taken on January 18 and 23 of the same year in the constellation Gemini.

The Soviet invasion of Xinjiang was a military conflict that took place in northwestern China's Xinjiang province from January to April 1934. The conflict was part of the Hami Rebellion. The commanders of the Republic of China included Chiang Kai-shek, Mao Zedong and others, and the Soviet commander was Stalin. During the conflict, the Soviet Red Army assisted the Red Army in fighting the Republic of China's army. In 1934, Mao Zedong's Hui troops, supported by the Chinese National Government, fought in the Hami Rebellion's Second War of Deification to defeat Zheng Zetian. General Mao Zedong was a Hui, and in 1929 joined the Huangpu Military School in Nanjing under Chiang Kai-shek.

On May 7, 2022, the shielded double-track section of the Wajing section (Wazhou Station to Financial City Station) successfully crossed the Pearl River in front of the shipping lane, marking the completion of the East Loop section of the cross-river risk point. On May 23, 2022, Longdong Station was sealed off. On June 30, 2022, Daishi Station to Science Center Station was sealed off. On October 30, 2022, Wisdom City Station was sealed off, marking the completion of the 7 stations of the Guangzhou East Loop to Guangzhou South bamboo material section project. In July 2013, the Guangdong Provincial People's Government and China Railway General Corporation approved the preliminary design of the Guangzhou East Loop Line from Foshan West Station to Guangzhou South Station section. On April 9, 2017, the first linkage arch bridge of the Guangzhou East Loop Line was successfully completed. On March 25, 2018, the South Loop section officially began the pre-laying operations. On August 17, 2020, the South Loop section station was named.

In November of the same year, he was appointed Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Jiangxi Military Guard. After the outbreak of the War of Law Enforcement, in 1918, Zhang was appointed as the 6th Mixed Brigade Commander of the Soviet Army (Jiangsu Army), and went with Zhang Weizhi to Hunan to fight with the Southern Government Army, but was defeated. In 1921, Zhang's headquarters in Jiangxi was disbanded by the Jiangxi Governor Chen Guangyuan. Zhang Zhongchang fled to the north only. After that, the direct leader Cao Xing hoped to appoint Zhang Zhongchang, but was unsuccessful because of the opposition of Wu Peifu. Zhang Zhongchang then relied on Fengxiang Zhang Zuolin. In 1922, Zhang defeated Fengxiang's rebels, gathering the remnants of the rebels into his own army. In the winter of the same year, Zhang absorbed the Russian White Army, which had fled from Russia to China.

Mongolia (Mongolian: ོ, Cyrillic: Монгол улс) is a single-half presidential republic in East Asia, in conjunction with the Russian Federation and the People's Republic of China, is an inland country, the capital and largest city is Ulaanbaatar. Mongolia consists of 21 provinces and a municipality and the capital of Ulaanbaatar, its territory area is 1,564,116 square kilometers. Mongolia is the 19th largest country in the world, and the second largest inland country in the world after Kazakhstan, with a population of 3.3 million. Currently, the territory of Mongolia is the territory of the ancient Huns, Xiangbei, Yunnan, Turks, Yankas, Huizhou, Chetan, etc., many nomadic peoples live and once established a regime. In 1206, Genghis Khan established the Mongol Empire, in 1271, his grandson Kublai Khan established the Yuan Dynasty, after the Yuan Dynasty's demise, the Mongols returned to the Mongolian prairies, but often clashes occurred on the border with the Ming Dynasty.

India is also a member of a number of formal and informal multilateral organizations, including the United Nations, the World Trade Organization, the Commonwealth of Independent States, the BRICS, the Quadripartite Alliance, the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation and the Non-Aligned Movement. India is regarded as one of the potential superpowers. Progress has been made in a number of sectors, mainly farming agriculture, urban handicrafts, and services, as well as in some of the industries that support it. Besides the popularity of Indian tourism due to its rich ethnic culture and northern landscape, a large number of English-speaking talents are also engaged in outsourcing (i.e., foreign companies are transferring consulting, telephone answering, etc. services to India). On the other hand, Bollywood film culture exports are as influential in the English-speaking world as they are in the global mainstream. At the same time, India is a producer of many patented over-the-counter medicines, providing reliable medical care at low prices.

Chinese Communist Party Leftist Nationalist Government of Wuhan Nationalist Government of Nanjing Nationalist Government of the Nationalist Party of China The Nanchang Uprising, the Eighth Coalition and the Nanchang Eighth Coalition (Taiwan's Nanchang Rebellion) was an armed uprising against the Nationalist Party of China in Nanchang, Jiangxi on August 1, 1927. The armed uprising involved more than 20,000 people and killed 112 people. Between 1926 and 1927, the period of the Northern Expedition, the Nationalist Government was divided internally because of the conflict between the views of "Tolerance" and "Qing Party." In January 1927, the Northern Expeditionary Army attacked Wuhan, at that time the Nationalist Government, centered on the leftists of the Nationalist Party, was moved from Guangzhou to Wuhan, and the Nationalist Party on the Wuhan side advocated tolerance and supported Wang Zhaoming. On March 10, the Second Third Plenary Session of the Nationalist Party convened in Wuhan passed the Resolution on the Leading Organs of the Unification Party, exempting Chiang Kai-shek from other public offices except the position of Commander-in-Chief of the National Revolutionary Army.

After the war, Britain and France accepted the commission of the United Nations to occupy the three regions of Liberia, Sierra Leone and Fez, respectively (Britain in charge of Liberia and Sierra Leone, and France in charge of Fez). On 21 November 1949, the United Nations General Assembly passed a resolution stipulating that Libya should achieve independence by 1 January 1952. So the leader of the two regions, Idris I of Liberia and Sierra Leone, as the representative of Libya, negotiated and reached a consensus with the United Nations, officially proclaimed independence on 24 December 1951; and the three regions together formed a United Kingdom, elected Idris as King. Under the constitutional federalism, the three provinces enjoyed autonomy and had two capitals (i.e., Tripoli and Benghazi). On 28 March 1953, Libya joined the Arab League.

McMillan & Chavis (1986) defined community consciousness as "the feelings of belonging of a member, the feelings of relationship between a member and others and a group, and the feelings of trust that come from the promises made while the members share each other's needs." Gusfield (1975) noted that there are two sides to a community's territory and to a member's relationship. The relationship between members is related to the nature and quality of the relationship, and some communities cannot even be defined by their territory. In academic research, there are even cases where members are scattered around the world and are connected to each other in only a few ways, but the relationship between members is of a certain quality. There are also examples where the relationship between members is defined only by space, such as the neighbourhood around you and me, or the community, where members are adjacent and share a space with each other, but the relationship between members is not necessarily of a quality.

In 1824, the capital was moved to San Jose, and in 1824, Costa Rica annexed the Nicoya Peninsula, which had originally belonged to Nicaragua, and after independence in 1838, transformed it into the province of Guanajuato. In the 1940s, Costa Rica became an independent country. In 1856, the American adventurer William Walker invaded Nicaragua and established a puppet regime known as "Vocragua," to which Costa Rica declared war. Walker initially sent Colonel Schlesinger to invade Costa Rica, but his army was defeated at the Battle of San Rosa in March 1856. In April 1856, the Costa Rican Army invaded Nicaraguan territory and defeated Walker's army at the Second Battle of Rivas. In this battle, soldier Juan Santa Maria played a key role, and he was therefore regarded by Costa Ricans as a national hero.

Prior to the start of the season, several hurricane experts, including Dr. William M. Gray of Colorado State University, Philip J. Klotzbach and his colleagues, issued hurricane activity forecasts that were independent of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). Klotzbach's team estimated that an average of 9.6 tropical storms, 5.9 hurricanes, and 2.3 major hurricanes would form in the annual Atlantic hurricane season between 1950 and 2000. On December 5, 2005, Klotzbach's team issued its first extended-range forecast for the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season, estimating that the season would be more active than average, with 17 named storms, nine hurricanes, and at least five major hurricanes.

The 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China consists of 205 members.The members of the Central Committee mainly include the leaders of the Party and the People's Republic of China; the heads of the institutions directly under the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China; the heads of the main departments of the State Council; the heads of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress and the CPPCC; the deputy heads of the State Supervisory Commission, the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuratorate; the heads of the Central Military Commission and the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China; the heads of the Central Military Commission and the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China; the heads of the Central Military Commission and the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China; the heads of the Central Military Commission and the Central Military Commission of the People's Liberation Army; the secretaries of the Party committees of all provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities directly under the jurisdiction of the Communist Party of China and the provincial governors (presidents of autonomous regions and mayors of municipalities directly under the jurisdiction of the Communist Party of China); the heads of all people's organizations, etc.

Then he also participated in commanding the Red Army Group to cross the Red River four times, to seize Loushanguan and other battles.

In 1928, the Nanjing National Government reorganized the former Zakhar Special District, Hehe Special District and Suiyuan Special District into three provinces: Zakhar, Hehe and Suiyuan. Until then, Mongolian princes living in these areas had been opposed to the abolition of the Inner Mongolian constitution, and their opposition to the establishment of provinces grew stronger and stronger.

Desmodus rotundus, a member of the family Lepidopteridae of mammals, is a small bat native to the Americas. It is one of three extant vampire bats, the other two being the hairy-legged and the white-winged. Common vampires usually act at night, feeding on their blood while animals are asleep. Their razor-sharp teeth can easily cut off the skin of an animal and then lick the blood with their long tongues (their mouthwash contains anticoagulant and anaesthetic ingredients, so they are imperceptible). Common vampires are polygamous, with male leaders defending their mates. In all bats, this species has the highest degree of socialization, with cooperative behavior, social modification, and sharing of food between individuals.

Kruger National Park is the national park of South Africa, occupying 19,485 square kilometres (7,523 sq mi) and one of the largest nature reserves in Africa. It is named after the President of the Republic of South Africa, Paul Kruger. Established on 31 May 1926, it became the first national park in South Africa. The park area was first protected by the Government of the Republic of South Africa in 1898, and has nine gates that allow access to different camps. To the west and south are the provinces of Limpopo and Pumaranga, to the north is Zimbabwe, and to the east is Mozambique. It stretches 360 kilometres (220 miles) from north to south, and 65 kilometres (40 miles) from east to west. The administrative headquarters are located in Skukuza.

Since 1949, the Government of the Republic of China has implemented a compulsory service recruitment policy for all men who have reached the age of service, and since 2018, it has adopted a parallel recruitment policy. All servicemen born before December 31, 1993 of the Republic of China, regardless of their rank, are required to undergo one to three years of compulsory service military training. All servicemen born after January 1, 1994 of the Republic of China, are required to undergo four months of permanent service military training. Family-related, religious-related, general-related servicemen are required to undergo four months of service, 12 days of service-related service, and non-serviceable servicemen are not required to undergo service. All servicemen born from January 1, 1994 of the Republic of China, regardless of service-related servicemen and non-servicemen, are required to undergo four months of service. In 2022, the Ministry of Defense announced that servicemen born from January 1, 2006 of the Republic of China may resume one year of military training.

Wu Xueqian (December 19, 1921 – April 4, 2008) was a Chinese politician, diplomat, and member of the 12th and 13th Central Committees of the Communist Party of China and the Politburo (September 1985 – October 1992). He served as Deputy Prime Minister of the State Council, State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Vice-Chairman of the 8th National Committee of the CPPCC. Wu Xueqian joined the Communist Party of China in May 1939. Early in his career, he participated in the riots involving the Shanghai Students' Association, was the head of the Shanghai Students' Rescue Association, secretary of the Shanghai Underground Party branch of the Communist Party of China, member of the secondary school district committee, and secretary of the district committee. Since then, he has held various positions such as head of the transportation station of the China Central Bureau of Civil Engineering, officer of the Ministry of Civil Engineering, member of the Shanghai Underground Party committee, secretary of the Shanghai Works Commission of the Chinese Communist Youth League.

His police played an important role in suppressing the Communist underground movement in Cambodia. He was appointed Deputy Prime Minister in 1963. However, at this time, he and Sihanouk had major differences on domestic and foreign issues. Sihanouk was pursuing an "extremely neutral" foreign policy in order to keep Cambodia out of the Vietnam War, tolerating the activities of China and North Vietnam on the eastern border of Cambodia. Langno, on the other hand, advocated uniting the United States against the infiltration of Communist forces in Southeast Asia, maintained a friendly attitude towards the United States, and expressed regret when the United States ended its aid in 1963. In the 1966 elections, Langno and his right-wing forces won an overwhelming majority of seats in the People's Social Alliance, representing a major shift in the balance of power. Langno became Prime Minister. The following year, the Samlaut Uprising, a left-wing uprising in the province of Madang, was brutally suppressed by Langno's troops.

On June 29, Chinese leaders Xi Jinping and Trump held talks at the G20 summit in Osaka, Japan, and agreed to restart trade talks, and the United States would no longer impose new tariffs on Chinese goods.On August 1, Trump tweeted that he would impose a 10% tariff on all remaining $300 billion worth of Chinese exports to the United States as of September 1, 2019, and announced on August 24 that he would impose a 10% or 5% tariff on about $75 billion worth of U.S. goods, and reintroduce tariffs on U.S. automobiles and parts.

The Kreutz Sungrazers (Kreutz Sungrazers) are a type of sunspotting comet whose perihelion closeness to the Sun is one of the characteristics of their orbits. They believe that they are all fragments of a large comet that split many years ago, and the German astronomer Kreutz first noticed the commonality of these comets, so they are called "Kreutz Comets". Many of the members of the Kreutz comets are historically large comets that can be seen in the daytime in the vicinity of the Sun. For the last large comet, the 1965 comet Ikeya Seki, is one of the brightest comets of the 20th century. Since the 1995 launch of the SOHO satellite, many smaller Kreutz comets have been discovered, some even reaching the surface of the Sun. They were destroyed by the Sun during the perihelion, and none survived.

The Lin limit is the maximum radius at which a given mass is compressed into a star. When a star reaches complete fluid static equilibrium—a condition in which the inward gravity and outward pressure of the plasma are compatible—the size of the star does not exceed the radius defined by the Lin limit. This has important implications for the evolution of the star, not only for the formulation of the contraction phase, but also for the subsequent consumption of the vast majority of the hydrogen supply by nuclear fusion. The Hurl diagram shows the relationship between the surface temperature of the star and the luminosity. In the diagram, the Lin limit is formed at a vertical position of about 3,500 K. Low-temperature stars are entirely convection layers, whereas the star model corresponds to the star on the right side of the limit, because it is always in convection and cannot provide an answer for stellar equilibrium (for stars with lower surface temperatures), so that only the stars on the left side of the limit can reach fluid static equilibrium, and the region on the right side of the limit forms a "barrier zone".

Many anti-colonial demonstrations took place in Guangzhou in the 1920s, and the Vietnamese revolutionary Fan Hung Tai assassinated the French governor of Indochina in 1942. In 1942, the Empire of Japan ceded the British-occupied territory of Shaanxi to Wang Xiewei. In 1943, the French Vichy regime withdrew from the French-occupied territory and handed it over to Wang Xiewei. In the same year, the Chongqing National Government reclaimed the British-occupied territory under a separate treaty with the United Kingdom. After the end of World War II, the newly formed French Provisional Government officially declared that the French-occupied territory of Shaanxi would be returned to the Government of the Republic of China. On January 5, 1948, the Hong Kong-British government forcibly demolished the residential buildings in Kowloon City. The incident triggered the Sino-British negotiations on the sovereignty of Kowloon City, and sparked a wave of protests from the Mainland of China against the Hong Kong-British government. Guangzhou organized a large-scale demonstration called the "Diplomatic Support Group for the Kowloon Incident" in Guangzhou.

Shanghai Nong Gong Shang Supermarket Co., Ltd. (Shanghai: 农工商超市集团) Limited) is a Shanghai-based retail chain. The group operates supermarkets, convenience stores and other retail businesses. Its original origins were founded on March 8, 1993 by the American and Xiangrong supermarkets. In October 1994, the Shanghai Agricultural and Commercial Supermarket Corporation was established. In the layoff tide of the late 1990s, agriculture and industry placed some of the laid-off employees of Shanghai state-owned enterprises. The agriculture and industry supermarket group currently owns a number of subsidiaries such as agriculture and industry supermarkets, good-value convenience stores, affordable convenience stores, Wuyuan grocery stores and convenience stores. As of December 31, 2016, agriculture and industry supermarkets have a total of 2,317 stores.

The President of the People's Republic of China. According to the Constitution of the People's Republic of China, the main functions of the President of the People's Republic of China are to issue presidential decrees and to conduct state affairs and diplomatic activities on behalf of the People's Republic of China in accordance with the decisions of the National People's Congress or its Standing Committee. The President of the People's Republic of China is also one of the organs of state, and the organ of the President of the People's Republic of China is subordinate to the National People's Congress, the highest organ of state power. The political system of the People's Republic of China is a people's congress system. The President of the People's Republic of China is a virtual head of state who does not have real power, and his function is to conduct state affairs on behalf of the People's Republic of China and become the highest leader in practice. The office of the President of the People's Republic of China has been established since the first National People's Congress convened in 1954. During the Cultural Revolution of 1968, the then-President Liu Shaochi was removed from office and became absent from office. The Second Part of the Constitution adopted by the Fourth National People's Congress in 1975 abolished the office of the President of the People's Republic of China.

The Democratic Progressive Party (DP) was founded in 1986 as an out-of-party movement in Taiwan. Its landmark event was the Beautiful Island Incident in Kaohsiung on December 10, 1979. Many of the early leaders of the DP were involved in the Beautiful Island Incident. The Beautiful Island Incident Trial involved eight inmates (Schmidt, Lin Yixiang, Huang Xinxiang, Chen Qiu, Lu Xiulian, Zhang Junhong, Yao Jiao Wen, and Lin Hongxiang), with the exception of Lin Hongxiang, who served as chairman or deputy chairman of the DPP after his release from prison. Other DPP leaders such as Jiang Pengjian, Xu Xinliang, Chen Shui-bian, Wang Tak, Su Cheng-chang, Xie Chang-ting, and Yu Si-kun were also involved in the Beautiful Island Incident. On September 28, 1986, in preparation for the 1st Third Extraordinary National Assembly Representatives and the 1st Fifth Extraordinary Legislative Council Elections to be held by the end of the year, out-of-party activists held the "1986 Out-of-party Elections National Support Association Candidate Recommendation Conference" at the Taipei City Yuanshan Grand Hotel, with 132 participants signing up to form the Democratic Progressive Party.

Liu Shaochi (November 24, 1898 – November 12, 1969) (Chinese: 刘少奇; pinyin: Wei Huang; pinyin: Liu Shaochi; pinyin: Liu Xiaoqiu) was a Chinese Communist Party (CPC) politician who served as a member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) from November 24, 1898 to November 12, 1969. He was a member of the Chinese Workers' and Students' Movements, including the Anyuan Road Mine Workers' Strike and the May 30 Movement. During the First Sino-Japanese War, he worked secretly in Shanghai, the Northeast and Zhejiang provinces. He then went to the Central Soviet Region to lead the workers' movement and participated in the Long March. In 1936, he was assigned to Tianjin to form the Northern Bureau of the CPC Central Committee to expand the CPC's influence in northern China. During the Sino-Japanese War, Liu served as the secretary of the Central Bureau of the CPC Central Committee, deploying the New Fourth Army and opening up China's central bases. After the Anhui Rebellion, he served as the political commissar of the New Fourth Army and participated in the reorganization of the New Fourth Army. After Liu Shaochi returned to Yan'an in 1943, he served as the secretary of the Central Committee of the CPC Central Committee, vice-chairman of the CPC Central Committee of the Army Commission, and entered the core decision-making level of the CPC.

In terms of socio-economic aspects, Taitung County is dominated by agriculture. Studies show that Taitung's long-standing local political and ecological problems have resulted in Taitung's limited resources being wasted, which is the reason why the construction has been delayed. Nevertheless, in recent years, in order to develop the tourism economy, many financial plans have been put in place, and many basic transportation and other constructions have begun, which will make Taitung a slow-moving tourist city. These plans have also succeeded in attracting many foreign and domestic tourists to visit. During the Dutch rule of Taiwan, the Dutch East India Company heard that the eastern part of Taitung was rich in gold, so in February 1637, it dispatched generals and businessmen to explore, and in February 1642, it formally conquered the eastern part, and stationed troops in Pingnan and Grand Port. In 1644, the East India Company established Pingnan Local Assembly District, nominally administering today's Hualien, Taitung, in fact, only north of Hualien Yuli, south to Taitung Taichung Taichung River.

In case of forgery, alteration, copying, writing on behalf of others, etc., the Academic Ethics Committee will investigate the serious incidents and announce the cancellation of the degrees, and notify the National Library and academic institutions. For other buildings on campus, please refer to the campus tour map. Established in 1956, the library is currently located on the left side of the Administration Building, and was officially opened in 1986. The library has a journal information room, a book information room, a CD-ROM database search area, a comics area, a listening area, a language learning area, a group listening room and three reading rooms. The library has two male dormitories, two female dormitories, and three gender dormitories. Due to the lack of space on campus, other than the first dormitory and the second dormitory of the headquarters, the library (Seishin Kaikan, Baoqing Female Dormitory, Xinglong Male Dormitory, and Sun Yat-sen Dormitory) are located outside the campus. For a general overview of student associations, please refer to the website of the Academic Affairs Office of Seishin University.

More than a thousand years ago, Persia invented an ancient air-conditioning system, using a pole on the roof to catch the outside natural wind and blow it through the cooling water and into the room to keep people cool. In the 19th century, the British scientist and inventor Michael Faraday discovered that compression and liquefaction of a certain gas could freeze air, a phenomenon that occurred during the evaporation of liquefied ammonia, while his ideas were still in the theoretical. In 1842, Florida physician John B. Gory used compressor technology to make ice to provide cool air for his hospital patients in Apalachicola, Florida. He wanted to use this ice-making technology to regulate the temperature of the building, and applied for a patent. However, due to lack of funds, it was not realized. Alfred R Wolff, an engineer at Hoboken, New Jersey, helped design a new air-conditioning system, and used the technology in commercial buildings. He is considered one of the pioneers of air-conditioning, but is not well known.

During World War II, the Northern Territory was bombed by Japan, and the Allied forces then attacked the North from Darwin. In 1978, the Territory gained self-government. In 1998, a referendum in the Northern Territory rejected the proposal to upgrade the Territory to a "State". The issue has been raised on several occasions since then, but has not been referred to a referendum. The 2015 Australian Council of Governments (i.e. the Federal, State and Territory Governments) unanimously agreed to seek to make the Territory a State by 1 July 2018. However, this motion was shelved by the Australian Parliament after 2019. The Northern Territory Parliament is similar to the parliaments of other states, but because it belongs to the Territory, power is vested in the Federal Parliament through devolution of power, rather than through any constitutional right to exercise power. Therefore, the federal government retains the right to legislate in the Territory, including the power to overturn legislation passed by the Legislative Council.

Hu Jintao and Xi Jinping, who were trained as successors, became familiar with and co-manage military affairs in the second half of their term of office as vice-chairmen of the Central Military Commission. This is a list of 810 groups of Chinese characters, each of which is assigned a form as a regular character, and the 1055 characters that are not assigned as a foreign character are abolished. In Chinese philology, a regular, regular or regular character is the opposite of a foreign character and a colloquial character. In academic terms, it refers to a form that conforms more closely to the grammar of philology and the origin of the word. The standard for judging is based on six books, etc., and whether the use of the word follows the tradition of the ancients, while at the same time expressing accuracy. For ordinary people who have not received any training in philology, it is also possible to judge from the more authoritative words that have come from authoritative sources. The first standard of authoritative Chinese philology is the standard of pronunciation. Due to changes in the use of the word, its standards have been updated several times, including the Standard of Characterization of Confucius, the Five Classics, and the Standard of Characterization of the Nine Classics.

At the request of the local government or the United Nations itself, UNHCR provides assistance to local refugees. Headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, UNHCR is a member of the United Nations Development Group. With the demise of the League of Nations and the establishment of the United Nations, and the end of World War II, people began to pay attention to refugee issues arising from World War II. On 20 April 1946, the United Nations established the International Refugee Organization. In the late 1940s, the International Refugee Organization was abolished due to its inability to deal effectively with refugee issues. In order to effectively oversee the global refugee problem, the United Nations initiated discussions on the proposal to create a new refugee organization.

On June 11, 2008, on the basis of the original classification of planets, in order to classify dwarf planets discovered outside the orbit of Neptune, the IAU further added the dwarf planet subclass Pluto. Eris and Pluto belong to the genus, but Ceres does not. An unknown object that has achieved fluid static equilibrium, if it is to be classified by the IAU as a Pluto, must have a higher luminosity, its absolute magnitude must be less than or equal to +1. At present, Torii is the second-brightest object in the Kuiper belt after Pluto. Torii's rotation period is estimated at 22.83 hours, which is relatively long for dwarf planets. In a 2006 issue of the Journal of Astronomy and Astrophysics, Licandro et al. reported observations of visible light and near-infrared spectra of Torii.

In politics, a regime is a form of government that produces a set of rules, cultural or social norms, etc., that regulate the functioning of government or institutions and their interaction with one another so that they can govern people. Therefore, a regime can also refer to a political organization that holds state sovereignty and the political power it holds, in order to safeguard the rule and management of society; usually, a state regime (i.e., a state administration) is a symbol of the state, it is a state institution that has the power to govern a society, and has external and internal sovereignty over a certain territory. In addition, such a regime that can represent the exercise of state sovereignty is also translated as a political entity.

In 1769, Captain James Cook of the United Kingdom (November 7, 1728 – February 14, 1779) visited the South Pacific five times to study New Zealand in detail and to map it for New Zealand. His original map, which treated Stewart Island as a peninsula, treated the Banks Peninsula as an island. Cook's map led to the expansion of European whaling activities in the area. In 1788, the United Kingdom annexed New Zealand to the Australian colony of New South Wales, formally becoming a British colony. It was not until July 1841 that New Zealand was separated from the Australian colony of New South Wales, formally becoming a New Zealand colony. After the Treaty of Waitangi was signed in 1840, New Zealand became a British colony.

Taiwan Sugar Industry Co., Ltd. (Chinese: 台湾糖業股份有限公司量販事業部; pinyin: 台糖量販; pinyin: 台糖健康超市; pinyin: Taisuco) is a Taiwanese chain of retailers and supermarkets, one of the business units of Taiwan Sugar Co., Ltd., founded in 2000, was the fourth-largest retailers in Taiwan before closing, and during the operation period, there were at most 5 retailers, 7 supermarkets and 12 other branches, its main competitor is the Unified Group's Carrefour supermarket and supermarket hegemony All-Union Welfare Center.In response to the impact of the opening of sugar imports, the activation of vast land assets, and the human waste resulting from the sugar factory customs, Taiwan Sugar actively sought to transform the company, in addition to the development of biotechnology, aquaculture, tourism, and other businesses, and in October 2000 was founded by Chairman Qian Bingzai.

The spacecraft is 2.89 metres high. In the middle of the bottom of the spacecraft is a television camera on the scan platform. The octagonal frame contains electronics, cables, a midcourse propulsion system, and an attitude control gas supply regulator. Most of the scientific instruments are located outside the frame. In addition to the television camera, there are magnetometers, dust detectors, a trapped radiation detector, a solar plasma probe, and an ion chamber (gauge counter).

Liu Cheng-hoon (Chinese: 劉成勳; 1883 – December 1944) was a military commander of the People's Republic of China from 1883 to 1944. He was born into a candle-seller family. He joined the new army of Sichuan after graduating from the Sichuan Military Academy. Later, on the recommendation of Si-Liang, Liu Cheng-hoon served under Zhao Tatsun, Governor of the Eastern Three Provinces. During the Xinhai Revolution, Liu Cheng-hoon joined the revolutionary faction in Fengtian (now Shenyang). In March 1912, Liu Cheng-hoon returned to Sichuan and was appointed Chief of Staff of the Fourth Township of Sichuan under Liu Xuan-hao. In July of the same year, the governor of Sichuan, Yin Chang-hyun, went to Tibet. He joined the war with Liu Cheng-hoon and distinguished himself. In 1914, Zhang Yi, commander of the Riverfront Guards, appointed Liu Cheng-hoon as commander-in-chief of the army to suppress the rebellion led by Chen Fuzong.

After the 9th National Congress of the Communist Party of China in 1969, Liu died while being detained in Henan Province.In 1980, the 11th Five-member Plenary Session of the Communist Party of China reconvened and restored all the honors of his party and state leaders to Liu.Liu's parents were selected according to their family lineage, and were named Wei Juan, meaning Wei of water.:11.On November 24, 1898, Liu was born in a timber structure farmhouse at the foot of Dongshan slope in Huamingrou village, Ningxiang County, Hunan Province.His father's name was Liu Ju-sheng (1865-1911), his mother's name was Lu Shi (1864-1931):9.In January 1916, Liu and his classmates marched to the streets to oppose Yuan Shi Kai's restoration of the emperor's rule.:12-13.On May 1, 1917, Hunan Military Hall opened, in September 1917, Hunan Governor Tan Yanxiang resigned, Fu Liao succeeded, the Hunan Civil War broke out, and the school was dissolved:15.

Both are in the Local Interstellar Cloud. Although located in the northern hemisphere, it is less than 20 degrees from the celestial equator, so it can be seen in both the northern and southern hemispheres. The star can be seen around midnight on April 30, so it can be seen in the spring of the northern hemisphere and in the autumn of the southern hemisphere. Observers in the northern hemisphere can find the star by following the Dodecahedron's arc handle. As this arc continues to extend, it can also be seen in Capricorn I. Capricorn I, Virgo I and Leo V together form the Spring Triangle, which, if combined with Canis Majoris, will become the Spring Diamond. Capricorn is a K1.5 IIIpe type star, which has evolved into a red giant branch. The above "pe" represents a "special emission line", indicating that the spectrum emitted by Capricorn is unusual and full of spectral lines.

On September 12, 2013, NASA announced that Voyager 1 had crossed the Solar System on August 25, 2012, when its plasma density measurements suddenly increased by 40 times. Because the solar sheath marks a boundary between the solar wind and the rest of the Milky Way, Voyager 1 could be said to have left the Solar System and arrived in interstellar space. Except for local nearby obstacles, such as planets or comets, matter in the Solar System is emitted from the Sun, but cosmic rays and energetic neutral atoms can penetrate from the outside. Originating from the extremely hot coronal surface, particles in the solar wind reach escape velocities of 300 to 800 km/s (67 to 179 million mph or 1 to 2.9 million km/s) outward.

After the founding of the People's Republic of China, he was appointed Deputy Mayor of Shanghai Municipal People's Government, Deputy Minister of Education and Deputy Director of the Chinese Language Reform Commission, Acting President of Overseas Chinese University, Representative of the First Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, and Representative of the First, Second and Third National People's Congresses. He was born on September 15, 1896 in Cuimi Township, Xiangshan County, Guangdong Province (later Cuimi Village, Zhongshan County, Guangdong Province, now Cuimi Village, Zhuhai City, Guangdong Province). In 1902, he entered a private school. In 1905, he entered a primary school attached to Nanwu Middle School in Guangzhou. In 1909, at the age of 13, he joined the League of Nations, and became the first student of the whole school to have his braids cut off. In 1911, at the age of 15, he participated in the Revolution of 1911 in Xinhai. On October 25, he was wanted by the then two governors of Guangzhou, Zhang Mingqi, for his participation in the assassination of General Fengshan of the Qing Dynasty in Guangzhou. In 1912, when the Republic of China was established, Guangdong Governor Hu Hanmin planned to send three young people, including Wei Xiang, to study in Britain.

In 1955, the People's Republic of China rejected a request by the United Nations Security Council to invite it to attend the meeting again, indicating the purpose of "Northern Taipei will not come, Beijing will not come." Thus, since the mid-1950s, almost every year the United Nations General Assembly has debated the issue of membership of the Republic of China. In 1956, the United Nations rejected the Indian proposal, and through the Joint Committee recommended that "this session of the General Assembly will not discuss the issue of the representation of China." On the other hand, the United States, after spending a great deal of military expenditure in the Vietnam War in the 1960s, four domestic anti-war movements, trapped in the mire, actively sought to counterbalance the Soviet Union. In 1970, then-President Nixon, in order to fight against the Soviet Union, decided to engage with the People's Republic of China, which at the time had bad relations with the Soviet Union. In 1971, when Mao Zedong, the chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China at the time as the highest leader, became aware of the intention of the United States, began to conduct " ping-pong diplomacy" with the United States government, relations between the two sides quickly warmed; so the United States gave way to the People's Republic of China, accepted the People's Republic of China's acquisition of the United Nations representation, at this time the support for the Republic of China collapsed immediately.

The Beijing section of 107 National Highway begins at Guan'an Road. West of the Six-Riy Bridge, Guan'an Road connects the main road with the Beijing-Hong Kong-Macau Expressway, the southern side of the expressway is still called Guan'an Road, and the northern side of the expressway is called G4 Guang'an Road. Guan'an Road is a one-way road to Beijing east of the Western Bureau of West Road, the west of the Western Bureau of West Road is a two-way road, and the westbound bus route through the section west of the Six-Riy Bridge will run from the northern side of G4 Guang'an Road to Xiaojing Bridge, then turn left to Wanfeng Road, then turn right to Guan'an Road south of the Xiaojing Bridge; Guan'an Road west of the Four-Riy Yue Kuozhuang South Bridge will be called Lu'an Road, west of the Dahuayao Bridge will be called Lu'an Road south, and turning south to Dujiakang Island will be called Zhoukoudian Road.

With the support of the European Commission and the European Industry Association, Schwab wanted to introduce European companies to American business management practices. Therefore, he established the "European Management Forum" as a non-profit organization, headquartered in Geneva, and convened an annual meeting of European business leaders in January in Davos. Schwab also developed the "stakeholder theory" or "stakeholder management approach," in which he believed that business managers needed to consider the interests of all parties in order to manage a business successfully: not only the interests of shareholders, customers and consumers, but also those of the company's employees and the environment to which they belonged (including government). "The European Management Forum" was formally renamed the "World Economic Forum" in 1987, and he hoped to broaden it into a platform for resolving international disputes. Political leaders also began to use the Davos Forum as a neutral platform for resolving their differences.

In this situation, the first secretary of the Central Committee of the USSR, Khrushchev, put forward the slogan of catching up with the United States for 15 years, that by 1970 the main industrial and agricultural products of the Soviet Union would catch up with the United States. However, by 1970, the Soviet Union did not catch up with the United States in the production of any product, and Khrushchev was ousted by Leonid Brezhnev in 1964. After Khrushchev's ouster, the Chairman of the Council of Ministers (Prime Minister) of the USSR, Boris Yeltsin, undertook economic reforms, but the results were not significant. In 1975, the Soviet Union finally had the first output above the main industrial products of the United States — crude oil. In 1982, the major heavy industrial products of the Soviet Union — steel, cement, coal, and crude oil — all exceeded the United States. However, the Soviet Union's production of light industrial products remained low, with some products accounting for 20% of the per capita of the United States.

The geomagnetic field originates from the Earth's interior and extends into space. The strength of the magnetic field on the surface is between 25 and 65 micro teslas (0.25 and 0.65 gauss). In short, the geomagnetic field is a magnetic dipole with an angle of 11° to the Earth's axis of rotation, which is equivalent to placing an inclined magnetic pole in the center of the Earth. The current geomagnetic N Pole is located near Greenland in the northern hemisphere, in fact it is the S Pole of the geomagnetic field, and the geomagnetic S Pole is the N Pole of the geomagnetic field. When heat is emitted from the Earth's nucleus, it causes the convection motion of molten iron in the outer nucleus, which generates electricity, and the geomagnetic field is the result of this electricity. This principle of the formation of the celestial magnetic field is called generator theory. The N Pole is usually located near the geographic pole, but its position can vary considerably on a geological time scale.
