The station was officially opened on December 28, 2009 with the opening of the first phase of Line 5, and became an interchange station on December 28, 2013 with the opening of Line 6. The station has four floors. The three floors above ground are the platform level of Line 5; the two floors above ground are the mezzanine station hall and the street bridge in the non-charging area; the ground floor is the station hall, facilities area, Diqiao Zhong Road, Diqiao Zhong Road and Guangdong Railway; the ground floor is the underground east-west station hall and the platform level of Line 6. The station is divided into four station halls, respectively, the mezzanine station hall on the second floor above ground, the ground floor station hall on the ground, and the two east-west station halls on the ground floor with the same level as the platform level of Line 6. To facilitate pedestrian access and transfer needs, most of the area of the ground station hall, the ground floor station hall located directly below the platform level of Line 5 and the south of each platform of Line 6 are charging areas.

Michael "Mike" E. Brown (born June 5, 1965) is an American astronomer, currently a professor of planetary astronomy at the California Institute of Technology (2003–present), formerly an assistant professor (1997–2002) and associate professor (2002–2003). He has a nickname "Pluto Killer" because his team discovered a dwarf planet in the Solar System similar to Pluto, such as Eris, which caused it to be downgraded to a dwarf planet. Brown, from Huntsville, Alabama, graduated from Grissom High School in 1983 in Virginia; earned a Bachelor of Science degree in physics from Princeton University in 1987, and a Master of Science degree in astronomy from the University of California, Berkeley in 1990, and a Ph.D. in 1994.

This right is known as the right of national self-determination, and the principles on which it is based are known as the principles of national self-determination; but it does not specify the manner in which the right of self-determination is to be realized, or what the result should be after self-determination: independence from the former State, formation of a federation with the former State, becoming a protectorate, some degree of autonomy, or complete assimilation with the former State. The Vienna Declaration and Programme of Action, signed in 1993, stresses that “taking into account the special situation of peoples under colonial or other forms of alien domination or foreign occupation, the World Conference on Human Rights recognizes the right of all peoples to take legal action in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations to achieve their inalienable right to self-determination”, while the Declaration also stipulates that “it shall not be construed as authorizing or encouraging any action to completely or partially dissolve or to violate the territorial integrity or political unity of sovereign and independent States”.

The geographical coordinates of Nanshan District are 22°26'N to 33'N and 113°50'E to 114°E. Nanshan District has a coastline of about 40 km and is a typical coastal city. Nanshan District is situated in a north-east-south lowland area. The northern part of Xili District consists of high and low hills centered on Mt. Yangtai and Mt. Tonglong. The southern part of Nantou, the Overseas Chinese Town and the southern part of Nantou Peninsula (excluding Daejeon and Mt. Xiaonanshan) consists mainly of low-lying plateaus, terraces, plains and beaches. The area from Xili Reservoir to the mouth of Shahe River is a narrow valley with a plateau-plain landscape. The slope of Nanshan District is gentle, the coastline is long and straight, and the mudflats are wide and rapidly expanding. The Neolithic sites of Moon Bay found in Nanshan prove that the ancestors of Moon Bay were already living there as early as the Neolithic period. The site is located at Lai Chi Garden under the Moon Bay Qingqing World, covering an area of 360,000 square meters.

According to the law of the People's Republic of China, marriage is a one-man, one-woman, equal-sex marriage system. There is no explicit provision in the same-sex marriage law, and the law does not take into account the needs and possibilities of same-sex marriage and other forms of civil unions. A 2009 survey showed that more than 30% of Beijingers support "same-sex marriage", while the remainder are uncertain or opposed to it. In Chinese history, several hundred years ago, during the Ming dynasty, male-dominated Hokkien, the custom of two men worshipping each other as parents was heard, at that time this relationship was referred to as "brother-in-law". People's Code of the People's Republic of China Article 141 Professor Li Yinhe, a well-known sociologist in the Chinese gay community, presented the "China Same-sex Marriage Proposal" as an amendment to the Marriage Law to the People's Political Consultative Conference of the People's Republic of China in 2003, 2005, 2006, and 2008, respectively.

In 1916, Hong Zhonglin, on the orders of Deng Gan, again went to Huizhou to plan to overthrow Long's rule, and fought for more than a month to defend Huizhou's Li Jiaqin. However, Long Jiguang's rule was not completely weakened until May 1918 (seven years of the People's Republic) after he was expelled from Guangdong Province, Guangdong Provincial Governor Zhu Qinglan appointed Hong Zhonglin to assist Huizhou. In early 1918, Hong Zhonglin was appointed the Fifth Commander of the Hokkaido army, the Hokkaido army under the orders of Sun Yat-sen entered Fujian Province and Li Houqi fighting, after entering Fujian, he was promoted to the commander of the Fourth Battalion and garrison commander of Ting Zhang Zhen. In August 1920, during the First Guangdong-Guangdong War, Hong Zhonglin's troops under Chen Jiangming's command went back to Guangdong to fight against the old Guangdong troops, he was the first road commander, captured Chao Mei and became the commander of Chao Mei Zhen Hou. In 1921, Hong Zhonglin was appointed the second division commander. In June 1922, Chen Jiangming launched the Sixteenth Incident, Hong Zhonglin and his troops maintained alliance with Chen Jiangming.

Simon Bolivar is widely regarded as a hero, revolutionary and liberator in Spanish-speaking America. During his lifetime, he led the independence of Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Panama, Peru and Venezuela and promoted the development of democratic ideology in those countries. The Bolivarian Republics of Bolivia and Venezuela are named in honour of Simon Bolivar. Simon Bolivar was born into a noble family in Caracas, Venezuela. His surname is from the Spanish Basque region of Ciudad de la Volívar. In addition to his large plantations and more than 1,000 slaves, his family also owned gold mines, sugar factories, real estate and velvet stores. Like other colonial capitalists, his family was both oppressed and oppressed. They lived a life of slavery based on their economic status.

The West African Ebola virus outbreak, which began in West Africa in December 2013, is a major outbreak of the Ebola virus. It is the worst outbreak in the history of Ebola and the first landfall of the disease in West Africa. This outbreak made Ebola the first epidemic. Previous outbreaks were localized and controlled in more than a few weeks. The causes of large-scale outbreaks are many: social poverty, gaps in the health care system, mistrust of the government and delays in reporting the outbreak to the local government are all important factors; in addition, local burial traditions, the density of the outbreak area and international neglect also have some impact. The outbreak became the third international public health emergency on 8 August.

Lufeng City has three subdistrict offices, 17 towns: Donghai Subdistrict, Hexi Subdistrict, Chengdong Subdistrict, Jiangzi Town, Jieshi Town, Wudong Town, Da'an Town, Bomei Town, Inner Lake Town, Nantang Town, Piyang Town, 800,000 Towns, Jinxi Town, Tamxi Town, Jiangdong Town, Hedong Town, Sheungying Town, Qiaochu Town, Jiangxi Town, Southwest Town, Shano City Overseas Chinese Management Area, Causeway Lake Farm, Star City Economic Development Test Area, Da'an Farm, Luoxiang Forest Farm, Wudong Forest Farm, East Coast Forest Farm, Hongling Forest Farm and Livestock and Fruit Forest Farm.

Shaanxi Road was established in the Song Dynasty as a road (equivalent to the present-day provincial system) to the west of Shaanxi Plain. Shaanxi was named after this place. Shaanxi has been abbreviated as "Qin" for a long time in history. Before the Yuan Dynasty, Shaanxi did not include the area south of the Qin Ridge, such as Ankang in the Han Dynasty, but on the other hand, before the Qing Dynasty, Shaanxi generally included the area of present-day Gansu Province. According to Chinese spelling, Shaanxi (shǎnxī) is the same as the neighboring province Shanxi (shānxī) with different consonants, and is easily confused in Western languages. Therefore, specially invoking the rules of the Chinese Romance on "double spelling of upper vowels", "shǎn" is written as "shaan", i.e. Shaanxi is written as "Shaanxi" to distinguish it. Before the use of Chinese spelling, the postal spelling was written as "Shensi" to distinguish it, and the old French spelling was written as "Chengsi".

Coordinates: 23°11′57′′N 120°09′32′′E / 23.199161°N 120.158791°E / 23.199161; 120.158791 Tsiong-kun-khu (Chiong-kun-khu; Western Malay: Auong) is a coastal area in the northwestern part of southern Taiwan. It is bordered by North Gate District, East Neighborhood A District, Jiari District, West Coast Taiwan Strait, and Seven Points District to the south. It is located in the Sea Coastal Zone, Jido Lagoon, and Seaside. Tsiong-kun-khu flows into the sea from the intersection of North Gate District and South Gate District.

Enrico Berlinguer (25 May 1922 – 11 June 1984) was a general secretary of the Communist Party of Italy. Born in Sassari, Sardinia, he joined the Communist Party of Italy in 1943, was elected deputy general secretary at the 12th Congress of the Italian Communist Party in 1969. He was re-elected general secretary at the 13th Congress of the Italian Communist Party in 1972. He was successively elected to the Italian Parliament from 1968. He was elected to the European Parliament in 1979 and 1984. From 1943 to 1957, he was secretary of the Central Committee of the Italian Communist Youth League in Sassari, a member of the National Secretariat of the Communist Youth League. In January 1946, he was elected to the Central Committee of the Italian Communist Party at the 1st Congress of the Italian Communist Party (i.e., the 5th Congress); from 1949 to 1956, he was general secretary of the Italian Communist Youth League.

In 1534, King Henry VIII led the Church of England (today's Anglican Church) out of Catholic independence and began the Protestant Reformation in England. By the middle of the 16th century, the major denominations were in conflict with the Catholic Church. Protestantism was supported and protected by many nation-states or secular monarchs in the course of its formation because of the struggle for religious and royal rights. Following the religious wars, the doctrines established by treaties such as the Treaty of Augsburg in 1555 and the Treaty of Westphalia in 1648 formed the order of Protestantism in Europe, Lutheranism spread to Germany and the Nordic countries, and Orthodoxy to Switzerland, the Netherlands and Scotland. By the end of the 16th and 17th centuries, the major denominations of Protestantism had established basic patterns of church organization and worship rituals.

National Lan-Yang Girls' Senior High School (National Lan-Yang Girls' Senior High School) is an upper secondary school for girls in Yilan, Taiwan, shortened to Lan-Yang Girls' Middle School, Lan-Yang Girls' High School, formerly called Lan-Yang Girls' High School, located on the northeastern side of Yilan City, is the longest-established upper secondary school in Yilan, is one of the high schools with excellent dance talent. In recent years, it is the first school in Yilan to join the community-classified schools, first opened, the representative color is blue, in the county has the name of "Blue shirt girl". Lan-Yang Girls' Middle School, formerly known as "Taipei State Lan-Yang Girls' High School" during the Japanese occupation, was founded on April 20, 1938.

In the Qing Dynasty, Pingjin was a part of the Mokan Fort, and according to the administrative division of the time, it could be divided into Happo-jo, Anping-jo, Doulianpo-jo, Songya-jo, Bei-se-jo, Nan-se-jo, Shanchai-cho-jo, Dong-se-jo, Shachai-jo, etc. The name of Pingjin came from the fact that in order to protect the security of travelers from the mouth of the Great Lake to Zhongli and Taoyuan, Zhang Lu-ryo (present-day Puxin District in Yangmei District) and Wang Lu-ryo (present-day Nan-se-jo District) were established here, and the area between the two places was called Xi-se (present-day Pingjin District in the vicinity of Pingjin, along the Nanping Road of the present-day Momo 72 Line). Later, due to improved security, in order to protect peace, the name was changed to Anping-jo. On September 1, 1920, Japan implemented a local system in Taiwan, all places with more than three characters were changed to two characters, so that Anping-jo became the name of Pingjin, Shiping-jo, under the jurisdiction of Zhongli County in Hsinchu Prefecture.

Deputies to the National People's Congress (NPC) and CPPCC members will be divided into several groups according to regions or industries to discuss and deliberate on the report and make their own comments and suggestions on the report. At subsequent meetings of the NPC, the Bureau of the National People's Congress (NPC) will deliberate on the report and form a deliberative opinion feedback to the government. The work report of the Central People's Government (State Council) is often translated into English, and the Secretariat of the National People's Congress (NPC) also translates the government work report into seven minority language versions, such as Mongolia, Tibet, Uyghur, Kazakh, Korean, Yi, and Tong, for members of minority representative committees to browse. Recently, with China's continuing openness, the increasing number of foreigners living and working in China, and the increasing demand for understanding the work of the Chinese government, local government reports have gradually appeared in English.

The Fox Broadcasting Company and its subsidiaries operate a number of entertainment television channels internationally, but they do not necessarily broadcast the same content as the Fox Broadcasting Company. Most television viewers in Canada can receive or pay for at least one Fox affiliated television channel on free-to-air channels, but are limited by the relevant policies of the Canadian Broadcasting and Communications Commission to protect the interests of domestic television service providers in Canada, so most of the Fox NFL and other Fox channels' prime-time programming needs to be synchronously replaced. The name Fox Broadcasting Company derives from the 20th century Fox Film Company, which means that the name was indirectly created by William Fox.

In 1909, Keelung Hall was annexed to the Taipei Hall, and the district was transferred to the Taipei Hall Water Return Office; on July 19, 1919, the district was transferred to the Taipei Hall Keelung Branch Office. In 1920, the local system was revised, and five districts, Maring Hang, and the district of Keelung were merged into seven villages, under the jurisdiction of Keelung County, Taipei Province. After the war, the National Government changed the villages to villages, and the counties to districts, and the district of Keelung County belonged to seven villages in the district of Keelung County, Taipei County. After the establishment of Keelung City in late 1946, eight villages and eight villages of the local people wished to belong to the city of Keelung. On January 18, 1947, seven villages were transferred to the city of Keelung, and the district was reorganized into seven districts. On February 1, 1949, eight villages and three sections of the seven districts (then divided into seven miles) were separated and the district of Keelung was reorganized to the present day. On September 28, 1974, when Typhoon Fandi struck, a landslide occurred near the eight interchanges of the Zhongshan Expressway, which was still under construction, in the vicinity of the eight interchanges of the Zhongshan Expressway, in the vicinity of the eight-mile-long Shannin Street, resulting in 36 deaths, 30 minor injuries, and the site where the houses were knocked down by the landslide was halfway up the hill next to the eight pumping stations of the Shannin Street Water Company.

Cobalt is mainly used in the manufacture of magnetic, abrasion-resistant and high-strength alloys. The compounds cobalt silicate and cobalt(II) aluminium (CoAl2O4, cobalt blue) provide a unique dark blue color for glass, ceramics, ink, paint and varnish. The only stable isotope of cobalt that exists naturally is cobalt-59. Cobalt-60 is a commercially important radioactive isotope, used as a radioactive tracer, and used to produce high-energy gamma rays. Cobalt is the active center of a group of enzymes called cobaltamines. Vitamin B12 is the most famous example of this type, and is a vitamin essential for all animals. Inorganic cobalt is also a micronutrient for bacteria, algae and fungi. Cobalt's English name "Cobalt" comes from the German Kobold, meaning "bad elf", because cobalt minerals are poisonous, miners and smelters are often infected at work, and cobalt is also a contaminant of other metals.

In 1906, eight-year-old Meir emigrated with her family to the United States to live with her father in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. After settling in the United States, Meir's mother opened a grocery store in northern Milwaukee to support herself. As a child, Meir often helped her mother take care of the store when she was away. From 1906 to 1912, Meir attended the local Fourth Street Grade School (now Golda Meir School). During this time, she organized fundraisers to pay tuition fees for her classmates, spoke on behalf of her students upon graduation, demonstrating her organizational and academic talents. At the age of 14, she attended North Division High School and worked part-time.

In April, he was appointed Minister of Communications, then Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Prime Minister of the Bank of Communications. In January 1917, he borrowed 5 million yuan from banks such as Nippon Xinghai and Nishigen Kaizong, one of the "Nishigen Loans." In July, he was appointed Minister of Communications by Dan Qiri. In March 1918, he was also appointed Minister of Finance, and borrowed money from the Japanese government to pay the rates. In the autumn of 1918, despite losing the sovereignty of the Shandong Railway, he borrowed again from Japan. In early 1919, he was appointed Minister of Communications by Qian Renwu. At the Paris Peace Conference of 1919, because some Western countries had previously signed a secret treaty with Japan, the rights and interests of Shandong Province, which belonged to Germany, were transferred to Japan without the consent of China. The Versailles Treaty triggered internal dissatisfaction in the country, causing a demonstration by Beijing university students at Tiananmen on May 4, 1919. As a result, the May 4th Movement was formally launched, and had a major impact on the national movement, thought and academic development.

In the past, all women near the remote islands of Fujian Province, because they are geographically closest to mainland China, were forced to serve in the armed forces. However, this provision has decreased since the lifting of martial law. However, most of the soldiers of the National Army of the Republic of China are still compulsory servicemen in the majority, and most of the officers are volunteer servicemen. The government intends to gradually expand the recruitment system, with the ultimate goal of forming a fully volunteer national defense army. However, at present, all men under the age of 18 must undergo compulsory basic military training. In recent years, the application for alternative service has also been expanded, to assist servicemen who do not want to serve in the armed forces, and even to carry out specialized duties to supplement the shortage of manpower in government agencies, research units, and corporate units. According to the law, Article 20 of the Constitution of the Republic of China, and the Military Service Law under the responsibility of the Ministry of Internal Affairs.

Curaçao (Dutch pronunciation: ) is an island in the southern Caribbean Sea, close to the Venezuelan coast. Formerly part of the Netherlands Antilles, Curaçao became part of the Kingdom of the Netherlands on 10 October 2010. The capital of Curaçao is the port city of Willemstad, which was also the capital of the Netherlands Antilles in the past. Curaçao is often referred to as the "ABC Islands" together with its neighbours Aruba and Bonaire. Curaçao covers an area of 444 square kilometres and is the largest island in the Netherlands Antilles. According to the 2001 Dutch Antilles Population Census, Curaçao has a population of 130,627, with an average of 294 people per square kilometre. It is estimated that by 2021 it will have a population of 152,369. Curaçao has a semi-arid grassland climate and is located outside the hurricane belt.

Formerly known as a "strong soldier," Hao's military career spanned half a century, and he has a tough temper and a sense of humor. Hao lived as an anti-communist radical, supported the unification of three-party democracy in China, advocated the idea of one China in Taiwan in his later years, and visited mainland China many times to participate in the official activities of the Communist Party of China. He opposed the legality of the People's Republic of China, and called on the Communist Party of China to recognize the main leadership position of the National Government of the Republic of China in the war against Japan. In 2017, Hao converted to Christianity at the age of 98, and was baptized on December 31, the same year. Hao died on the afternoon of March 30, 2020, from multiple organ failure at Taipei Inner Lake General Hospital. Hao is 100 years old. His eldest son is former Taipei Mayor Hao Longbin. Hao was born on August 8, 1919 (July 13, Chinese New Year), in Hao Rong Village, Salt City District, Salt City Prefecture, Jiangsu Province.

Yao with Zhu Zhu Zhen no Certificate of citizenship, misunderstanding, and ordered to create a Certificate of citizenship." In Mainland China, Hong Kong under British rule, Taiwan before the 1980s, the Certificate of citizenship is a field to be filled in many document forms, such as sex, age, education, occupation, etc.

Temperature occurs in a variety of natural sciences, including physics, geology, chemistry, atmospheric science, and biology. For example, in physics, the thermal equilibrium of two objects is determined by their temperature, temperature also causes thermal fluctuations in solids, and temperature is an important parameter in thermodynamics. In geology, molten rock formed after cooling plasma is one of the three sources of rock. In chemistry, temperature affects the rate of reaction and chemical equilibrium. In the atmosphere, the temperature of a gas is the atmospheric temperature, a common term in meteorology. It is directly influenced by sunlight: the more sunlight, the higher the temperature. Temperature also affects many reactions in living organisms, temperature-regulating animals adjust their body temperature, if body temperature rises, it is a medical symptom.

Political themes The Chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (Chinese: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会主席) is one of the important members of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC). The position is held by the leaders of the Party and of the Communist Party of China, and has always been held by important high-level leaders. Since the eighth session of the CPCPC, the Chairman has been held by the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China, and the current Chairman is Wang Yang. Under the CPC Constitution, the Chairman of the CPC is elected by the CPC, is a member of the Standing Committee of the CPC and its meetings of chairmen, and is responsible for chairing and handling the day-to-day work of the Standing Committee, while the Vice-Chairman of the CPC and the Secretary-General assist the Chairman. As of December 2022, three of the Chairmen of the CPC are still alive: the last deceased former Chairman is Deng Xiaoping, who died on February 19, 1997, at the age of 92.

The Air Force Institute of Technology (Air Force Institute of Technology) was established in 2001 by the Ministry of Education of the Republic of China as a technical college, and changed its name to the Air Force Institute of Technology on August 1, 2002.The Air Force Institute of Technology is responsible for training various types of Air Force ground personnel, the main departments include aviation machinery, civil engineering, technical supply, communications electronics, air traffic control and atmospheric measurement, etc., trained two-year technical college officers and two-year technical officers, as a training college for the development of defense technology in the Republic of China and national technical education, and as the only technical college in the Republic of China military academies to train aviation professionals.

An orbital inclination is usually the angle between the reference plane and the direction of another plane or axis. An axial inclination is the angle between the planet's axis of rotation and the line perpendicular to the orbital plane passing through the planet's center. Specifically, an inclination is one of six orbital elements that describe the shape and direction of an object's orbit. It is the angular distance between the planet's orbital plane and the reference plane (usually dominated by the ecliptic or equator) and is described in terms of angles. In the Solar System, the inclination of a planet's orbit (shown as i in Figure 1) is defined as the angle between the planet's orbital plane and the ecliptic—the plane in which the Earth orbits the Sun. It can also be measured in terms of another plane, such as the ecliptic of the Sun or the orbital plane of Jupiter, but for observers on Earth, the ecliptic plane is the most practical.

Houari Mohamed Boumediène (23 August 1932 – 27 December 1978) was the President of the Revolutionary Council of Algeria and the President of the Republic. His original name was Mohamed Boumediène. Born in Heliopolis, Governorate of Gelma. He received Islamic religious education in his youth. After World War II, he joined the anti-French Victory Party for Democracy and Freedom, engaged in the liberation struggle. Afterwards, he travelled to Cairo to study at the University of Algiers, met the leaders of the National Liberation Movement such as Ben Bella, and received armed struggle training. In November 1954, he was dispatched to the province of Oran (now Wahelan Province) to lead the anti-French guerrilla warfare. In 1957, he was appointed commander of the 5th Military District of the National Liberation Army.

The term "Southeast Asia" was popularized by the SEAC, but the concept of the early composition of Southeast Asia was not fixed, e.g. most of the Philippines and Indonesia were excluded by the SEAC. By the late 1970s, the general standard usage of the term "Southeast Asia" and the territory it encompassed had emerged. "Southeast Asia" is now most commonly defined as the regions in which the political entities listed below are located. * The administrative center of Malaysia is located in Bucheng Southeast Asia is naturally divided into two parts, the Central and Malay Peninsula. The maritime part of Southeast Asia is also known as the Malay Archipelago, the term being derived from the European concept of the Malay peoples of the South Islands. See: Oceans Southeast Asia and the two parts of continental Southeast Asia include the following regions, respectively: In addition, in a broad sense, the regions of Hainan, Guangxi, Guangdong, Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan, Fujian, and southern Yunnan in the South China Sea are considered to be Southeast Asian regions, all of which have subtropical climates; and historically and culturally, the languages spoken by minorities in Guangxi and Yunnan are of the same language family as those spoken by the countries of the Central and Southeast Peninsula (Tungdong, South Asian, or Miao).

Beta Canum Venaticorum (Beta Canum Venaticorum, β CVn, β Canum Venaticorum) is a yellow dwarf star in the constellation Canum Venaticorum with an apparent magnitude of 4.26 and a distance of 27.53 light-years (8.44 parsecs) from Earth. Its common name, Beta Canum Venaticorum (Beta Canum Venaticorum, β CVn, β Canum Venaticorum), is derived from the western name Chara, which originally meant "dog of the south", but now refers exclusively to Beta Canum Venaticorum, which means "joy" in Greek (χαρά). In China, the star belongs to the faintly guarded stars of the constellation Canum Venaticorum, meaning "army of the guards". With an apparent magnitude of 4.26, Beta Canum Venaticorum is the second brightest star in the constellation Canum Venaticorum. Its spectral type is G0 V, belonging to the yellow dwarf, and since 1943 it has been the standard spectral type of G0 V. Beta Canum Venaticorum (Beta Canum Venaticorum, β CVn, β Canum Venaticorum) is a yellow dwarf star in the constellation Canum Venaticorum with an apparent magnitude of 4.26 and a distance of 27.53 light-years (8.44 parsecs) from Earth.

Further research was carried out by Juno and other Swiss missionaries, including Henry Berthold and Ernest Crooks, who began to unify their languages in order to have a standard way of writing and reading. "Gumba" is a term used by missionaries to unify their language identity, but many Székely people are not familiar with the name, so it needs to be replaced by "Tungarian" or "Székely". Harris referred to this: Since the word Gumba is unknown outside Spenokan, Henry Berthold suggested abandoning the term and replacing it with a widely accepted Székely or Székely word. Swiss missionaries communicated with Székely people and, with their help, translated the Bible from English and Sesotho into Székely. In 1883, Paul Berthold published his first book, which was translated with the help of Mpapele (Mbizana) or Mandlati (Zambiki).

After the end of World War I in 1918, when the Austro-Hungarian army was disbanded, the regions of Bohemia, Moravia and Slovakia formed an independent state called the Czechoslovak Republic. After independence, the Czechoslovak economy developed rapidly, and by the time of World War II, it was ranked seventh among the top ten industrialized countries in the world (after the United States, Soviet Union, Germany, Britain, France, Italy, ahead of Japan, Poland, Turkey, and the West). In 1938, the United Kingdom and France signed the Munich Agreement with Nazi Germany and the Kingdom of Italy, and without Czechoslovak representatives, decided to cede its western territory of the Sudetenland region to Germany. In March 1939, Nazi Germany invaded the whole of Czechoslovakia on the grounds of accepting the Sudetenland region, Germany established the protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia in the Czech Republic, and Slovakia formed the German-protected Slovak Republic.

"Horror" is the second episode of the fifth season of the American animated sitcom The Simpsons, which premiered on October 7, 1993, on Fox Television Network in the United States and was later released on VHS tape and DVD. Written by John Witty and directed by Ritchie Moore, "Horror" is the sequel to the 1962 horror film "Horror" and its remake. "Horror" is also a cross-cultural reference to several horror films, including The Phantom Menace. One scene in which "Horror" repeatedly steps on a plough and is hit by the plough's handle in the middle of the face is one of the most memorable scenes in the history of The Simpsons. "Horror" is widely considered by critics to be one of the best episodes in The Simpsons, and its music has also been nominated for an Emmy Award.

Hsin Sheng Junior College of Medical Care and Management (Chinese: 新生医護管理专科学校, Hepburn: Hsin Sheng Junior College of Medical Care and Management, abbreviated as HSC) is a private specialty school located in Taoyuan City, Taiwan, and is currently the largest specialty school in Taiwan in the fields of nursing, childcare and ophthalmology.The school's academic system is mainly a five-year specialty in the National Graduation Examination, and a two-year specialty in vocational classes, providing social workers with advanced training.

Emerson Dambudzo Mnangagwa (pronounced ; Zimbabwean pronunciation: ) was the country's first Minister of National Security from 1980 to 1988 and oversaw the Central Intelligence Agency. His role in the Gukurahundi massacre was controversial, during which thousands of Ndebele civilians were killed. He served as Minister of Justice, Law and Parliamentary Affairs from 1989 to 2000, and then as Speaker of the Parliament from 2000 to 2005, when he was demoted as Minister of Rural Housing in an open campaign to replace Anwarul Chowdhury.

The International Astronomical Union does not name stars, nor does it intend to. Although there are very few stars with special names, astronomers do not and do not need to use them. However, some private companies, knowing that they do not have the legal status to name any stars, and that it is impossible to provide guarantees, charge a fee for naming stars for those who need it. Stars named in human names can be roughly divided into two groups. The first group is mainly old ones, or some unique stars, which are named directly by some methods. The second group is more obscure, and although some special stars are also named, they are usually not named directly. This small group of stars is usually important because of their unique characteristics, and is therefore used to honor those who discover their properties. In addition, many stars are named by combining the star table numbers in which they are listed with the name of the author.

The crashed aircraft was a 1997 Boeing 777-2H6ER long-haul twin-engined passenger airliner, registration 9M-MRD, Boeing factory number 28411, operated by Malaysia Airlines, and operated by Royal Dutch Airlines (KLM) as KL4103. The aircraft departed from Amsterdam Schiphol Airport G03 at 12:14 pm Central European Time (UTC+2) on 17 July. Following the crash, the former FSB agent, Russian Kirgin, as the leader of the Donetsk proxy army, reported in VK that he had "killed a Ukrainian An-26 transport aircraft".

Lu Yi (1900-1932), Chinese ancestor of Jiangxi Lichuan, Chinese politician, military figure. Lu Yi studied at Meiji University in Japan. In 1920, he went to France to study hard, but was expelled for his participation in the student movement. Later, he taught at Guangdong Provincial Sixth Normal School (present-day Hainan Qiongshan). In 1922, he joined the Chinese Communist Party. In 1925, he was appointed secretary of the Political Department of Huangpu Military School, promoted to deputy director, and received the rank of major general. In 1926, he studied in Moscow, Soviet Union. In 1928, he returned to China. In 1930, he was appointed chief of the General Political Department of the Military Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. In 1931, he was appointed chief of the Political Department of the Revolutionary Military Committee of the Shooxi Province of the Communist Party of China. In early 1932, he was appointed chief of the Political Department of the Red Army and secretary of the Special Committee of the Communist Party of China.

The 57th Golden Bell Awards (57th GBA) is one of the highlights of the year for Taiwanese media in 2022, to honor outstanding Taiwanese television professionals of the year 2022, this year's television variety show and drama will be held for the first time separately, the award ceremony was held on October 21 and October 22 at the Taipei Fatherland Memorial Hall in Taipei City (111 years of the People's Republic of China).

The National Revolutionary Army (NRA) is an army established by the Nationalist Party of China in 1924. In addition to being the army under the control of the Nationalist Party of China, it is also the national armed forces of China after the Northern Expedition of the NRA and before the promulgation of the Constitution. It was established in July 1925, and was adapted by the Nationalist Government to its armed forces.2 At the beginning of the formation of the NRA, generals and officers were trained by the Huangpu Military School established by the Nationalist Party of China in Guangzhou. The NRA is the main armed force of the Nationalist Government in the Northern Expedition. In 1928, the Northern Expedition of the NRA was completed, formally unifying China, the Nationalist Government was established as one, and the NRA was also called the Nationalist Government Army, shortly "National Army" or "Government Army", during the First Nationalist Civil War, the Sino-Japanese War, the Second Nationalist Civil War and other wars.

Bloemfontein (South African: Bloemfontein, meaning "Spring of Flowers") is a city in South Africa, along with Pretoria and Cape Town, and is known as the three capitals of South Africa, not only as the judicial capital of South Africa, but also as the capital of the Free State Province. In Sesotho, Bloemfontein is called "Mangaung", meaning "the habitat of the leopard". Bloemfontein is located in a dry grassland, at an altitude of 1,395 m. It was originally a fortress, formally founded as a city in 1846. Historically, it is the capital of the Orange Free State. Located in the central plateau, it is the geographical center of the country, surrounded by small hills, hot and frosty in winter. The city is hilly and rolling, beautifully landscaped. It is now an important transportation hub. In the late Qing Dynasty, Keelung was officially established by the Qing Dynasty in 1875, due to its superior shipping location and abundant coal deposits, and changed its original name to "Keelung", which opened the history of urban development. In the days of the Jing Dynasty, the ruling authorities made Keelung the first gateway to the outside world, and vigorously promoted the construction of ports and urban development, making Keelung one of the major cities in Taiwan. The population ranked second only to Taipei, South Taiwan, and Kaohsiung, and was ranked fourth in Taiwan. After that, Keelung was the first shipping hub in Taiwan for a long time. In the middle of the Jing Dynasty, Keelung was officially established as a city in 1924; after entering the era of the Republic of China, it was changed to a provincial city under the jurisdiction of Taiwan Province, and remained the shipping hub in Taiwan. However, after the ten-year construction, the southern migration of Taiwan's shipping center, the limitation of urban and port development hinterland, the obstruction of port expansion projects, and the magnetic absorption effect caused by the nearby Taipei, it has been transformed into an important satellite city in the Taipei metropolitan area since the 1990s.

北31線 保長坑-平溪, is a rural road in New Taipei City, north to Ho Chang Hang, Shioding District, New Taipei City, south to Ping Xi District, Ping Xi, a total length of 18,330 km, and has retained the same number to this day. However, at that time the access road section was limited to the first four kilometers (to Shek Kip Mei), only in 1983 the Shek Kip Mei-Ping Xi Road section was incorporated into the rural road. 北31線 from Ho Chang Hang Platform 5A line along the Keelung River branch Ho Chang Hang Creek Valley to the southeast, after Shek Kip Mei began to appear hairpin bends and gradually increases in height. In 1966, the end point is about the Love Bridge near Shek Kip Mei. At the boundary crossing the Rock Ridge (the highest point), after crossing, there are a lot of hairpin bends, also enabling the elevation of the 北31線 to descend and connect to the San Hang Creek Valley Central Line. After descending the hill to the entrance of Ping Xi Street, you can pass through this street faster to Ping Xi Station and Ping Xi City.

For this reason, Article 130 of the Diet Act (Act No. 79 of 1948), which came into force at the same time as the Constitution of Japan, stipulated that "In order to facilitate the conduct of investigations and research by members of the Diet, the Diet shall, in accordance with the relevant laws, establish a National Library of the Diet." At the same time, the Diet Library Act (Act No. 84 of 1948) was enacted. As a result, the Library of the Diet was established by merging the two subsidiary libraries of the House of Peers and the House of Representatives. However, this library system alone could not satisfy the needs of members of the Diet for investigations and research. Subsequently, Japan invited a visiting mission to the Library of the United States of America and sought its opinion. The National Library of the Diet Act (Act No. 5 of 1948) was enacted in 1948.

In accordance with Article 21 of the Civil Defence Law, "In order to reduce the damage caused by air attacks, the Ministry of National Defence shall conduct air defense exercises, order evacuation and control of traffic, lights, acoustic and other necessary equipment in conjunction with the relevant agencies." Anyone who violates the evacuation order shall be fined NT$30,000 or more and NT$150,000 or less in accordance with Article 25 of the Civil Defence Law. The duration of the air defense evacuation shall be 30 minutes. From the time of issuance of the emergency warning, the persons, vehicles and traffic control shall be evacuated until the issuance of the deactivation warning signal. In 2020 and 2021, due to the outbreak of COVID-19, in accordance with the provisions of the Central Epidemic Control Center, in order to avoid cluster infection, only the air defense warning shall be issued and the telephone alert of the "Airborne Threat Alert System" shall be issued, and the persons, vehicles and evacuation shall not be carried out. On July 25, 2022, from 13:30 to 14:00, due to the international situation such as the war in Ukraine, the "Man On 45" exercise was expanded.

Coordinates: 23°7′28.76′′N 113°21′40.41′′E / 23.1246556°N 113.3612250°E / 23.1246556; 113.3612250 (People's Government of Tianhe District) Tianhe District (Chinese: 天河区人民政府) is a district under the municipal jurisdiction of Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province, China. It is located in the east of the city center. It was established on May 24, 1985. It is the development center of the new urban area of Guangzhou in recent years. Tianhe District, one of the three major shopping districts of Guangzhou, is located here. It is one of the commercial centers of Guangzhou. The district government is located at Tianyuan Street, Tianfu Road No. 1. According to the Yuan Dade Nanhai Zhi, the area in the Northern Song Dynasty had large water ruins, it was a satellite town of Guangzhou at that time. Today, the river district area historically belongs to Panyu County, during the Ming and Qing Dynasties, most of it belongs to the Lu Fu Division of Panyu County.

After his release from prison on 14 March 1990, Mandela led reconciliation and negotiations, and led South Africa through a transition period of multi-ethnic democracy, a term that has become synonymous with Mandela. In June 2013, Mandela was hospitalized for a lung infection and, 86 days later, returned to his home in Johannesburg in September. On his 95th birthday, President Jacob Zuma announced on 5 December 2013 that former President Mandela, who had suffered from a kidney infection for a long time, had died at home on the same day, at the age of 95. Mandela's grandfather was a king, his father was a tribal chief and he himself became the head of state. Mandela was born on 18 July 1918 in Mvezo, then a town of Umtata in the province of Cape Verde. Mandela later recalled that his early life was full of "customs, religious rituals and taboos".

On 26 February 2022, the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) formally joined the East African Community (EAC) at a special summit of the East African Leaders' Online. Since then, the EAC has seven member states. Somalia has also applied to join the EAC. This meeting set the date for the establishment of the East African Monetary Institute as 1 July 2021. Under the Monetary Union Agreement, the EAC is expected to achieve monetary unity by 2024. In June 1967, the three countries of Uganda, Kenya and Tanganyika decided to establish the EAC to replace the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD); to establish the East African Parliament to replace the Central Legislative Assembly. In December 1967, the three countries of Uganda, Kenya and Tanzania signed the East African Community Treaty, with a ten-year period of validity; and to formally establish the EAC, headquartered in Arusha, Tanzania.

Hsinchuan Private Ness Higher Industrial Vocational School (Chinese: Hsinchuan Private Ness Higher Industrial Vocational School) is a private high-level industrial vocational school located in Xinpu Town, Hsinchuan Province, Taiwan. It was founded by the Jesuit priest San Longdo. The name Ness Higher Vocational School is derived from the desire for students to follow the spirit of the Catholic saint, Saint Ness, and for Saint Ness to be the patron saint of the school's youth. The school was founded in 1954. The school has an area of 2.9398 hectares.

Circini is a faint constellation, with only one star brighter than magnitude 4. γ Circini is a binary star 450 light-years away. Eta Circini is a yellow giant of spectral type G8III, with an apparent magnitude of 5.17, located about 276 light-years from Earth. It lies adjacent to Centaurus, flies, swallows, Triangulum Australis, Triangulum Centauri, and Lupus Centauri, and is bordered by two stars, α and β Centauri. Because of its declination of −50° to −70°, the entire constellation can only be seen at latitudes south of the 30th parallel north.

Students can choose freely according to their interests. Those who are smart and quick to learn, can graduate early and have a high degree of merit in teaching. In the area of re-education, the Confucian religious doctrine is applied to cultivate and correct the students' morals and behavior. In addition, the Kokushi-kan also has a fixed vacation, about 120 days a year, for students to rest and relax. Regarding the names of Kokushi-kan and so on, although different from today's universities, it is due to the differences in national conditions, but the essence of their universities cannot be denied. Since the Tang Dynasty, there have been universities. The universities can be divided into university departments, elementary schools, some are not strictly distinguished, there are public institutions, there are private institutions, and many are private institutions. The famous universities are represented by the Bailudong University, Mount Fuji University, Yu Tianfu University, Songyang University, Shiko University, Maoshan University, and so on. Traditional Chinese schools are dominated by civil servants who cultivate public political service and by literati who engage in cultural education, with a focus on Confucian humanities education.

Dwight David Eisenhower (/ˈaɪzənhaʊ.ər/; October 14, 1890 – March 28, 1969) was an American military commander and politician who served as the 34th President of the United States from 1953 to 1961 and was the only President to visit Taiwan. During World War II, he served as the highest Allied commander in Europe and was nicknamed "Ike" by military personnel.

As of October 2022, Taoyuan has a population of 3,839,269 people and a total area of 4,572,9584 square kilometers. Originally, it was the most prosperous area in Hsinchu, but in recent years, Taoyuan has become closer to the Taipei metropolitan area due to its proximity to the Taipei metropolitan area, a large number of urban plans and redevelopment areas, major government construction, and other factors, and the relationship with Miaoli County, Hsinchu County, Hsinchu City, etc. has not been as close as before. In 2016, President Tsai Ing-wen of the Republic of China proposed that Northern Taoyuan belongs to the Greater Taipei Living Circle, Southern Taoyuan belongs to the Taoyuan Living Circle, to be divided into the Southern Taoyuan and implement regional joint governance. In August 2018, the "Taoyuan Taoyuan Regional Governance Platform" jointly launched by the four municipalities of Taoyuan held its first meeting. Taoyuan City has an area of 1,220 square kilometers, the terrain is dominated by plateau, from north to south are: Linkou plateau, Taoyuan plateau, Zhongli plateau and Hukou plateau.

The Nationalist Party of China led the Government of the Republic of China to move to Taiwan, forming the separation of the two sides of the Taiwan Strait. The Constitution of the Republic of China came into force on December 25, 1947, and since then, the Government of the Republic of China has designated December 25 as a "Constitution Commemoration Day." Sun Yat-sen, in his book "The Nationalist Government Constitution," proposed that the Nationalist Government should be implemented in the order of "military, educational, and constitutional government" to ensure the success of the three-party system. The Political Consultative Conference was not originally part of the preparatory steps for the Nationalist Government to implement the Constitution. However, because the Communist Party of China controlled a large area of the liberated areas and had its own armed forces, the Nationalist Party of China decided to convene a political consultation meeting on an equal footing with the two parties of the Communist Party of China to discuss the peaceful establishment of the nation. In January 1946, the CPPCC Conference was held in Chongqing.

liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) is used extensively as a green fuel for internal combustion engines to reduce emissions. liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) has a RON value of 110 and an energy content of 95475 British units of heat per gallon. Toyota manufactured many liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) engines in its M, R and Y engine families in the 1970s. Today, many car manufacturers such as Citroën, Daiyu, Fiat, Ford, Hyundai, Opel, Mark, Renault, Saab and Volvo all manufacture dual-fuel cars on an OEM basis, which can run as well on both liquefied petroleum gas and petroleum fuels. In 2003, Shanghai, mainland China, began to enforce the complete elimination of highly polluting petroleum-powered passenger cars in urban areas.

On December 20, 2005, China's National Bureau of Statistics re-released China's GDP for 2004 as 15.98 trillion yuan, up 16.8% from the forecast, based on data obtained from a major economic statistics program. The World Bank advised the Chinese government on the process. According to the statistics, China's agriculture accounted for 13.1%, industry for 46.2%, and services for 40.7%. The significant growth in China's GDP for 2004 was due to the fact that the third-industry GDP for 2004 was found to be as high as 2.4 trillion yuan in the First National Economic Survey.

If a registered dormitory is expanded or rebuilt without permission, its use is changed, or it is converted into permanent premises under the condition that it was originally registered as temporary premises, the Lands Department will take control of the dormitory in accordance with the dormitory control policy. Residents will not be able to expand the dormitory on their own (unlawfully constructed) or lose their eligibility to live in public housing (commonly referred to as 'upstairs') when the dormitory is demolished. Earlier buildings built under government leases were converted into short-term leases in 1984 as a result of government policy. Since then, tenants have been required to pay the full market value of the rent. The rent is adjusted every three years, and tenants who are not satisfied with the new rent can appeal to the Director of the Lands Department. As of 2009, there are still more than 200,000 dormitories in Hong Kong, with more than 80,000 inhabitants. Taking into account that the dormitory control policy aims to delay the existence of registered dormitories and does not encourage unlawful expansion, the Lands Department tightened the control arrangements on 22 June 2016.

Later, he took part in the war as a commander of the river army under Yang Sen, the following year Yang Sen was defeated and temporarily fled to Hubei Province, Wang Lingqi remained in Sichuan. In July 1923, Liu Xiang was appointed governor of Sichuan, Wang Lingqi became his subordinate. The following year, Wang Lingqi became the commander of the 28th mixed brigade brigade, in 1925 (Republic 14) he was promoted to the commander of the 3rd division of the river army and Jiang Bawei In. In December 1926 (Republic 15), with the progress of the Northern Expedition, Liu Xiang turned to the national government, was appointed as the commander of the 21st army of the National Revolutionary Army, Wang Lingqi was the commander of the 3rd division of the army and Chongqing In. The following year, in Sichuan, the people of Chongqing protested against the Allies due to the Nanjing incident, Wang Lingqi suppressed by force, purged the Communist Party of China that led the demonstration, resulting in the Triumph of the Thirteenth.

Since Taiwanese middle-aged directors at the time had already taken on many projects, unable to prepare for the world's great fortune, Chen Jin-cheng sought out the three young directors Xie Jiebao, Liao Ro-han and Lin Kun-ying to join the team, and asked the international director Hans-Christoph Muecke to cooperate, together with the general producer Wang Yun-yu and the chairman of the board of directors of An Yi International Exhibition Co., Ltd. painted the script of the opening ceremony through discussion and design, over the period of modification more than 50 times. The opening ceremony mobilized 18 art performance professional schools, 42 professional performance teams, the overall performance and staff 3,800 people.

Zhang Fukui (Chinese: 張發奎; September 2, 1896 – March 10, 1980) was a Hakka (Chinese: 客家) general in the Republic of China Army, a former commander-in-chief of the army, a general in the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army, and a member of the army of the Chinese Communist Party during the Nanchang Uprising. During the Sino-Japanese War, he first commanded the Battle of Songhae, the Battle of Wuhan, and later became the commander of the Fourth War Area. After 1949, he lived in Hong Kong, and later formed the third anti-Chinese anti-Communist force. Zhang Fukui attended private school at the age of nine, and in 1907, Zhang entered the Higher Primary School in Songhae County. In 1910, Zhang Fukui took a train to Guangzhou by himself. According to Zhang Fukui's own recollection, at that time, he cooked rice for the students, and did some chores to earn money for the car. After arriving in Guangzhou, Zhang Fukui was recruited as an apprentice at the Advanced Training Institute set up by the provincial government for the promotion of industrial training engineers, Zhang Fukui applied and was successfully accepted.

Due to the high cost of elections and the heavy burden of running as an individual, the number of non-partisans in Taiwanese elections above the county level (e.g., Legislative Councillor, Mayor of Taipei City, Mayor of Taipei City) is decreasing steadily. Most non-partisans are distributed at the grassroots level as mayors, public representatives, such as mayors of townships (districts), village chiefs, and village citizens' representatives, many represent local factions and forces, and are more rare among the Legislative Councillors. As a result of the 2020 Legislative Council election, there are only four non-partisan seats. In the 2014 local elections, the non-partisan candidate who integrated into the opposition line-up and was elected mayor of Taipei City, was the first non-partisan directly elected mayor of the city. In 2018, he succeeded in re-election, but in August 2019, he founded the Taiwan People's Party and became party leader, ending his non-partisan status. In the 2016 presidential election, the former Director of the Department of Health Chen Jianren and the candidate of the Chinese Communist Party Tsai Ing-wen blocked the election, elected the first non-partisan vice president after the enactment of the Constitution.

Zhenjiang City, abbreviated as Zhen, anciently known as Jingkou and Runzhou, is a municipality under the jurisdiction of the People's Republic of China and Jiangsu Province, located in the southern part of Jiangsu Province, on the southern bank of the Yangtze River. It is bordered by Taizhou City to the east, Yangtze City to the north, Nanjing City to the west and Changzhou City to the south. It is located at the eastern end of the Ningzhen Mountains and the western plains of the Yangtze River Delta, and is located in the west, high and low, and in the south belongs to the Maoshan Mountains. The Yangtze River winds around the northern and eastern borders of the city, and the Jinhang Canal runs from south to north. The total area of the city is 3,840 square kilometers, the population is 317.65 million, and the city's people's government is located in Runzhou District. Zhenjiang is a famous historical and cultural city of the country, with a history of more than 3,000 years, and was the provincial capital of Jiangsu Province of the People's Republic of China. Zhenjiang is also an important city of the Yangtze River Delta city group and Nanjing metropolitan area, is a famous port and commercial trade transfer center at the intersection of the Yangtze River and the Jinhang Grand Canal. The indigenous inhabitants of Zhenjiang are Jingban people.

The Zulu (Zulu: amaZulu) are an African people, approximately 11 million inhabitants, mainly living in the KwaZulu-Natal province of South Africa. The language they speak is Zulu, a Bantu language. The Zulu kingdom played an important role in the history of nineteenth-century South Africa. Under apartheid, the Zulu were classified as second-class citizens and were severely discriminated against; today's South Africa, the Zulu are the most populous ethnic group and enjoy the same rights as other South African peoples. About 1709, the Zulu kaNtombhela (Zulu kaNtombhela) established the Zulu tribe in the present-day KwaZulu-Natal province. At that time, the Zulu were only a small tribe, mainly occupied by many small Anguini tribes and clans (also called imzi).
